name: BERSERK HULK 2.0: All Gas, no break! (Update 11.2022)
description_md:
Theme: Hulk is mad... Very mad... ya know he is really more angry than mad... or furious, deranged, BERSERK even! Hulk is on a 1 track mind to smash the villain as hard as he can.

Note: I love the challenge to see if I can defeat a villain on expert, but this deck is top notch verse standard.

Piloting: This deck is solely designed to defeat the villain in as few rounds as possible. Now, some villains are crafty and will easily outwit this Berserk Hulk deck. However, Hulk has some great tools here to overcome a lot of what the villain may throw at him in the first few rounds. Most likely game round 1 flip to hero, round 2 flip to AE (this will often pop the main scheme which usually isn't a big deal. If you are in a 1 scheme scenario, be careful.) round 3 flip to Hero, round 4 finish in Hero, flip to AE if you have threat to spare otherwise stay in Hero until you win (or lose).

Essentially you will want to defeat the villain in around 3-4 rounds or less. If the battle lasts longer the battle last the less likely Hulk will be able to stop the villain.

Main Cards to play: Drop Kick (Stun the villain, less activations the better), Hulk Smash, Hand Cannon.

Early Game Cards: This this deck I don't worry too much with a mulligan. However, if you have these cards and they are easy enough to play great but still damage is priority. Martial Prowess: Cheaper and easier to play than Helicarrier considering the resources in this deck. Jarnbjorn: Great to get that extra damage each round. Counterattack: Great to set-up a villain to for a big blow. Usually, I want this 1 cost = 5+ damage

Dealing with Tough: Marvel Boy, piercing strike, Jarnbjorn, audacity (sneaky way to ping damage before you resolve an event card).

Dealing with Guard minions: Hand Cannon (better than Combat Training for this reason. Use HC each round but always save 1 counter just in case you need it to punch through a minion, Hulk Smash, and lastly Thunderclap if you must.

Allies: Each ally has a role on the team all mainly to deal damage, but they also bring their own unique uses. Blade: Cheap, take some indirect damage, block in a pinch, should be able to trigger every round with all of Hulks physical resources. Marvel Boy: Cheap, deal with tough, and block. Mockingbird: Stun, ping damage, block, got to have 1 thwart. Spider-Man: Burst damage or thwart, damage, block Lockjaw: Play from the discard pile in a resource full hand or got to have thwart.

Utility Events: Clobber can result in an extra resource; Skilled Strike is an easy 0 cost play even with a Hulk Smash. Surprise Attack great value if you get it at the right time.

If you must thwart: You in bad shape but Spider-Man and Lockjaw in a pinch might can do it, but really you just want to attack is at all possible.

Resources: You will notice that I only included the Strength double resource the reason is I always want to hit Hulks triggers and to use for Blade/Jarnbjorn. Power of aggression works as a double resource but can also generate that physical you need. Audacity is to help ping tough. Now this leaves you with very little solutions to attachments which is true so... hopefully the Villain doesn't find the nasty ones that really hurt. However, the 3 wild resources do provide a chance to remove them if you must. The goal is ignore them because Berserk Hulk just smashes.

name: Riri Williams Won't Leave Her Lab
description_md:
Using shield cards to keep threat down indefinitely even while on Alter-Ego side, Riri uses allies to dispatch minions and guard allies if she has them.
Once built up to 12 progress counters, she will reach her final form and only flip back down if she need to recover or use [Stroke of Genius](/card/29009)to get double progress counters.
To keep her allies working hard, she'll use [First Aid](/card/01086) to keep them around as long as possible, especially [Brawn](/card/29004) who is excellent for attacking, thwarting, and generating resources.

Recommended Mulligan: Just get [Ronnie Williams](/card/29010) ASAP.

name: War Machine - Justifying Meditation
description_md:
**Design Notes**

I wanted to create a War Machine deck that made it easy for him to control the main scheme threat to make it easy to get new ammo counters frequently.

[Meditation](/card/26036) was the other focus of this deck. I included a lot of 3-4 cost cards that could be played in alter ego form that can help War Machine build an engine quicker ([Quincarrier](/card/08023), [Helicarrier](/card/01092), [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091), [Beat Cop](/card/10029), [Upgraded Chassis](/card/23004), and multiple 3-4 cost allies are good targets).

name: Nebula - "You will always be my sister."
description_md:
"You were the one who wanted to win. And I just wanted a sister! You were all I had, but you were the one who needed to win. Thanos pulled my eye from my head, and my brain from my skull, and my arm from my body... because of you." - Nebula

This deck is themed around playing 2player with a Gamora player.

Most Nebula / Leadership decks are based around her being in alter ego form until she has played as many techniques as possible.

This deck follows a similar play pattern but does have more "up time" as a hero. ["Welcome Aboard"](/card/20027), [Groot](/card/16047), [Rocket Raccoon](/card/16019), [Drax](/card/18019), [Knowhere](/card/17022) and [Ready for Action](/card/04017) all need Nebula to be in hero form to put into play. 

The deck is built around getting Groot and Yondu into play, supported by Rocket or Star-Lord.

It does have a few upgrades for these allies ([Reinforced Suit](/card/12018) for Groot, #Inspired for Yondu and [Comms Implant](/card/18030) for either Rocket or Star-Lord). The idea being that Groot with [Team Training](/card/04016) and Reinforced Suit will have 9 health and heals 2 every time he defends. Add in [Ready for Action](/card/04017) to give him an occasional breather with a Tough status, Groot should remain in play as a defender for some time. His job is to defend Gamora.

Rocket and/or Star-Lord will be Thwarting while you are in Alter Ego form.

The deck should try and keep the allies in play for as long as possible to gain advantage from [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017). Between Nebula's alter ego ability, Strength In Numbers and [Daughters of Thanos](/card/22022) and Knowhere, this deck can dig through its deck.

Then, when the time is right, the deck can pop off with Nebula's techniques and [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015). That's when [Regroup](/card/19032) really comes into effect.

name: Spider-Woman - Sneaky Discount on Expensive Allies
description_md:
**DESIGN NOTES**

How many of you have always wanted to include several expensive and cool allies in your deck like [Multiple Man](/card/14012), [Captain Marvel](/card/23013), [Captain America](/card/21011), and [Giant-Man](/card/12012), but could never justify the cost? 

Worry no longer! This deck makes expensive allies viable and even efficient to play! You won't find any allies that cost less than 4 in this deck. 

**KEY CARDS**

[Sneak Attack](/card/23017) is the magic piece of this deck. It lets you play a (trait sharing) ally of any price directly from your hand, but they only stay around for the rest of the phase. That means this card can help you cheaply play allies of any cost. 

[Captain Marvel](/card/23013) is great ally to play with [Sneak Attack](/card/23017) in this deck. I tried to include a little extra energy ([Leading Blow](/card/19017), [Energy Barrier](/card/05017)) to help her hit the powerful thresholds when played. 

Before allies are lost at the end of the phase, it's a great idea to play [Save the Day](/card/23018) or [Go Down Swinging](/card/23019) to get an extra 4-6 damage or 4-6 threat removal. 

Here's an example of how playing [Captain Marvel](/card/23013) could go. 
1) Play [Captain Marvel](/card/23013) with [Sneak Attack](/card/23017) discarding the top 4 cards of the deck (let's pretend we are lucky, and 2 of 4 are energy resources). That means she does 3 damage and stuns an enemy. 
2) We can do her basic attack for 3 more damage.
3) Play [Go Down Swinging](/card/23019) to discard Captain Marvel early and do an additional 5 damage. 
We just did 11 damage and stunned the enemy for very low cost.  

Admittedly not every ally in this deck is as good as Captain Marvel. [Protector](/card/26014) is probably the least exciting ally in the deck, but I needed her to make sure the number of Leadership aspect cards and Protection aspect cards were balanced in my deck (a requirement for Spider Woman).

[Multiple Man](/card/14012) can't be targeted by Sneak Attack (doesn't share a trait with Spider-Woman)., but can actually be a very powerful first play. I didn't realize this at first, but playing one multiple man will trigger playing both the second, AND third multiple man immediately, as long as the others are in your deck or hand. This doesn't work if you have 1 or 2 Multiple Man in your discard pile.

It's really fun when timing works out for you to play [Save the Day](/card/23018) or [Go Down Swinging](/card/23019) on [Captain America](/card/21011) for a very cheap 6 damage or 6 thwart. 

[Leading Blow](/card/19017) sometimes does damage, but the bigger reason we want this card is that it will boost Spider-Woman's basic stats +1 for 0 cost. That will often make it really easy to have +1, or +2 to her stats to do some extra thwart of damage.

**OTHER TIPS**

Spider woman is a somewhat fragile hero with only 11 health. Take advantage of her many ways of removing threat (via allies, hero cards, and [Save the Day](/card/23018)) to give her space to take an Alter-Ego turn when needed. [Pheromones](/card/04036) and [Contaminant Immunity](/card/04037) can also buy you some time with status effects. Spider-Woman's only 3 RECOVER means that it is often pretty inefficient to try to heal her back to health directly. [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) can also buy you a little time by protecting your health pool. 

You won't always be able to play allies with [Sneak Attack](/card/23017). I like playing [Iron Fist](/card/09014), [Multiple Man](/card/14012), and [Captain Marvel](/card/04032) with full resource when I don't have [Sneak Attack](/card/23017). 

If you have +2 to Spider-Woman's stats from playing some cheap cards, try to get a couple [Self-Propelled Glide](/card/04039) cards in to multiply it's usefulness. I'm finding that [Finesse](/card/04033) is also key to unlocking more powerful combos with Spider-Woman, so put those early if possible.

name: Powolne ogrywanie S03E09 - Control OTK
description_md:
**Powolne ogrywanie S03E09 - Control OTK (karty do Star-Lord)**

Cześć, jestem casualowym graczem, który lubi sobie dość wolno ogrywać wszystko testując (nawet troszkę na siłę) mając "w poważaniu" tempo wydawania dodatków przez FFG ;) Standardowo testuje na solo na 5 scenariuszach z kampanii grając jednak jako standalone na expercie z losowymi modular setami.

Bardzo mi się podoba koncepcja zbijania w 1 turze ostatniego stagu złola w wykonaniu [Star-Lord](/card/17001a) więc dalej idziemy tą drogą. Tylko, że grając nim coraz bardziej do wniosku... że tak dużo to on do szczęścia nie potrzebuje dmgu. Większym wyzwaniem jest dożycie do momentu gdy to jest możliwe. I taki jest ten deck nastawiony mocno na rzeczy kontrolne, zwłaszcza, że tej kontroli potrzebujemy dużo, bo sami dokładamy do tego pieca ;)

- Pierwszą rzeczą jaką musimy kontrolować to oczywiście kwestia zagrożenia na main i side schemach. Tu sytuacja jest dosyć prosta, bo mamy [Leader of the Guardians](/card/17009), który sam załatwia sprawę. Konstrukcja Star-lorda IMO wymaga prawie, że [Knowhere](/card/17022) oraz sensownej liczbie sojuszników. My mamy 6 nie licząc naszego [Nova Prime](/card/17002). Głównie klasyka gatunku. 
 - Mój ukochany [Spider-Man](/card/13019)
 - nowy lepszy spider-man czyli [Rocket Raccoon](/card/16019). Samo w sobie 2 Thw z 3 HP za 3 zasoby u basic sojusznika jest super. To, że ma 4 atk z overkillem na miniony to już jest jakiś kosmos. Na chwilę obecną nie widzę opcji bym miał go nie wziąć w deckach, gdzie to jest możliwe.
 - stary dobry [Nick Fury](/card/01084) to wiadomo, ale u Petera jest jeszcze lepszy z uwagi na to, że łatwo go dograć za 1 i zagrać dużo bardziej optymalnie całą rudnę.
 - [Groot](/card/16047) trochę jak nick. Sam w sobie jest fajny, ale u Star-lorda lepszy. Znowu za 3 zasoby, co Quill lubi, dwa że mamy [Leader of the Guardians](/card/17009), a z nim możemy THW za 2 aż 6 razy.
 - [Spider-Girl](/card/04040) to prawdziwa królowa kontroli. Za 2 zasoby wyłączenie miniona na 2 tury. Często nie ma potrzeby, bo i tak jesteśmy w stanie minona zabić od razu, ale są momenty gdzie potrafi grę uratować. Naprawdę małym kosztem. A bez efektu dalej jest dobra, zwłaszcza, że mamy [Knowhere](/card/17022).
 - [Wasp](/card/13012) - Jest ok przez swoją elastyczność. Tani sojusznik z 3 atk, jak trzeba to zagramy jako chump blocker z 1 hp, tani trigger do [Knowhere](/card/17022).

- Druga rzecz do kontroli to małe miniony. Tutaj mamy oczywiście naszych sojuszników, mamy [Element Gun](/card/17007) do strzelania i wraca mocno zakurzony [Tac Team](/card/01056). Tac team dołożyłem jako, że jest uniersalny to raz, z 1 zasobem zostawiamy go sobie na finalne otk to dwa, a że 3ki się łatwiej u Star-lorda zagrywa to trzy. 

- Kolejna rzecz to duże miniony. Grałem generalnie na Red Skulla z City Chaos i Wrecking Crew gdzie potworów było jak mrówków i nie ma z nimi większych problemów, pomimo że w innych postaciach bym płakał. Największe miniony mają koło 7-9 hp, więc najłatwiej po prostu walnąć z [Sliding Shot](/card/17005) z zdolnością i dobić czymkolwiek. Oprócz tego mamy znowu zapomniane z podstawki [Relentless Assault](/card/01053), mamy [Rocket Raccoon](/card/16019), możemy zatrzymać z [Spider-Girl](/card/04040) i zabić na raty. Możliwości mamy naprawdę mnóstwo.

- Ostatnia rzecz, to kwestia defensywna. Mamy chump blockerów to raz, mamy świetnego [Bad Boy](/card/17006), do tego [Jet Boots](/card/17008), do tego [Booster Boots](/card/16052) oraz [Endurance](/card/05023) i [Down Time](/card/05033). Strasznie źle mi się grało, z samym 3 Rec dorzucenie down time sporo pomaga moim skromnym zdaniem.

No dobra. Przechodząc do samej rozgrywki jak mówiłem, zapominamy o złolu i skupiamy się na kontroli stołu. Z wyczuciem używamy naszej zdolności, zwłaszcza jak nie mamy jeszcze [Star-Lord's Helmet](/card/17010). Też trzeba uważać i planować zmiany na Alter ego, by się nie zmieniać nie potrzebnie gdy mamy dobrane encounter karty. W między czasie powoli pingujemy złola z [Element Gun](/card/17007), czy to z [Tac Team](/card/01056), czy to z minionów z wolnymi obratami i zostawiamy na ~2 hp. Gdy jesteśmy gotowi, najlepiej w turze po odpaleniu [Bad Boy](/card/17006) - wjeżdżamy. ~5 atk powinniśmy conajmniej mieć z jakiś minionów na stole,  dmg z naszych pistoletów, 4 dmg z tac tam, rzadko kiedy będziemy mieć 3 na stole - to razem nam daje już~ 15 obrażeń od tak, wykorzystując 2 zasoby. 2 dmg z Star-lorda, kolejne 2 jeśli mamy [Daring Escape](/card/17003), [Sliding Shot](/card/17005) z użytą zdolnością bohatera już bije za 11. To już nam razem daje 30, a raczej powinno się udać dobrać i zmieścić albo 2gi Sliding shot, albo [Dive Bomb](/card/17028). Tak czy siak mamy wystarczającą środków, by załatwić każdego. 

I to by było na tyle. Na chwilę obecną Peter Quill staje się zdecydowanie moją ulubioną postacią. Może nie jest to tier S, ale gry nim zawsze cieszą. Polecam każdemu.

name: Binary Unleashed
description_md:
My last attempt at an Aggression Captain Marvel relied too heavily on her needing to turn sideways and swinging. Watching it in play made me realize that won’t work for her and she needs to use events to be effective. Trouble is, it’s expensive needing to play all your events to deal damage so I’ve gotten rid of some of the other upgrade cards and replaced them with resource generation to help cast the events. 

She needs a team to deal with threat and let her blow up the villain and their minions.

name: I Can Punch You All Day
description_md:
This is a semi-stun-lock Captain America deck that seeks to dish out a bunch of damage via Punch resources. Because Cap's hero cards have and/or can make so many Punches, you can maximize [Blade](/card/21019), [Marvel Boy](/card/21041), [Hulk](/card/01050), and [Drop Kick](/card/10014), dishing out a lot of damage and stuns. In quick games, you can run the villain down with ease by attacking, playing events, readying, and playing allies. In longer games, feel free to defend for a couple turns, to get your damage-dealing structure ready to go, and ping the villain a bit with Retaliate.

Some possible upgrades to this deck include:

- [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019)
- [Wolverine](/card/32041)
- [Spider-Man](/card/13019)

name: And You Get Some Tech, And You Get Some Tech, And You Get So
description_md: A Leadership spam deck that seeks to equip Avengers with the latest Tech, so Tony can flip into Iron Man without always needing his own upgrades. Nearly every card also includes either a Energy or Mental resource, to maximize Tony's [Rocket Boots](/card/01039) and [Repulsor Blast](/card/01031). Use [Make the Call](/card/01071) to recur allies and re-tech them with [Stark Tower](/card/01034). Finally, finish things off with a one-of [Avengers Assemble!](/card/03015), if needed.

name: Quicksilver - Repurpose Battering Ram
description_md:
‘Ever been body slammed by a force field at supersonic speed?’

This deck is a lot of fun (all gas - no brakes) and thematically I really enjoy the idea of Pietro grabbbing a forcefield and using it to bodyslam an enemy at supersonic speed. I think Quicksilver is probably the best hero in the game to use [Repurpose](/card/31016) due to his hero ability and 4x [Always Be Running](/card/14003). 

Quicksilver can have absolutely massive turns (30+ damage a turn) and only has 9 hitpoints. He is the definition of a glass cannon, right? What if I told you that you don’t need allies to defend him and you will stay in Hero mode for almost the entire game? I’ve beat Rhino, Claw and Ultron all on Expert.

The deck idea is pretty simple:

1) Defend every turn, dealing about 2 damage a turn through [Electrostatic Armor](/card/10031), [Flow Like Water](/card/26016), and/or [Energy Barrier](/card/05017). You get a free stand after defending so it costs you nothing.

2) Install [Energy Barriers](/card/05017) and [Forcefield Generators](/card/31019) whenever you can to soak up any damage that gets past your DEF (note that [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) has a ‘Forced Interrupt’ so you have to use up your [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) before you can use [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) 

3) Use [Repurpose](/card/31016) on your nearly used up [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) and/or [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) as a mini [Maximum Velocity](/card/14005). 

That’s it. Preventing 5 damage and dealing 6 damage/thwart for 5 effective resources (ER) is the best case scenario and it’s pretty easy to achieve. 

The set-up on this deck is minimal. [Deft Focus](/card/16024) is the only basic economy card to install. [Defiance](/card/26018) and [Expert Defense](/card/03033) were chosen because they are cheap and do the job. With [Friction Resistance](/card/14009) and [Nerves of Steel](/card/14017) (which is an option for 40th card) you could play more expensive defence cards like [Preemptive Strike](/card/05014), but that is more set-up dependant, which I’m not a fan of.

Let’s talk combos:

1) [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) + [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) with [Repurpose](/card/31016): Save that last charge to smash the villain.

2) [Maximum Velocity](/card/14005) + [Always Be Running](/card/14003) - Foundational combo with Quicksilver. Note that [Maximum Velocity](/card/14005) lasts all turn so it helps with defending during the villain phase.

3) Combo 1 + Combo 2: [Repurpose](/card/31016) is 0-cost so it is super easy to bolt on to Combo 2.

4) [Flow Like Water](/card/26016) + [Defiance](/card/26018) + [Expert Defense](/card/03033): I think [Quicksilver](/card/14001a) and [Black Widow](/card/01075) are the two best heroes to run [Flow Like Water](/card/26016) since they both ready after defending so easily.

[Med Team](/card/01080) is the 40th card. It was a [Helicarrier](/card/01092) but this deck doesn’t need the economy. Any suggestions are welcome.

name: Thor Defender of the Nine Realms
description_md:
Thematically, this event-heavy deck will focus on dealing and soaking damage repeatedly even while building up additional offense, defense, and resources.

Basic line of play will stay on in hero form until drawing a [Hammer Throw](/card/06005) and having taken some damage. Then, spending [Mjolnir](/card/06009) from hand, as a resource for an upgrade, reverting to alter-ego form, returning it to hand, and if possible, spending it a second time, and finally taking the recovery action as needed.

Next player phase, returning [Mjolnir](/card/06009) to hand again, taking the basic recover action again if needed, and switching to hero form once more to continue laying the smackdown. 

0-cost defense cards help to trigger abilities of upgrades
0-cost attack cards help to accumulate damage bit by bit.

If you think another hero could do better than Thor at this build, that's cool too.
