name: Thunderstruck!
description_md:
**_Do you know what happens to a toad when it’s struck by lightning?_ ** **[...It gets +1 ATK.](/card/36004)**
[Thunderstorm](/card/36004) + [Boot Camp](/card/13016) = +2 ATK to all allies! Now, with these in play: - [Brawn](/card/10011) deals 15 damage total and removes 5 threat - [Angel](/card/33019) deals 12 damage total - [Angel](/card/33019) with Attack Training deals 25 damage! (5 ATK, 5 HP!) - [Wolverine](/card/32041) with Attack Training deals 6 damage per attack with piercing! Aggression ally Storm does NOT take prisoners.
**If you like this deck, feel free to give it a ❤ ! Thank you!**
I have tested this deck against the following villains with their regular modulars: - Expert Magneto - Expert Klaw - Expert Mysterio - Expert Thanos
### **Thunderstruck**
This deck is built around the simple concept of giving good allies an amazing ATK boost and watching them carve a path of destruction. [Boot Camp](/card/13016) is a +1 to all your allies, while [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) gives every character an additional +1. With +2 ATK, the value you get from your allies increases exponentially. And, as long as you also block with allies, giving the enemy +1 ATK barely matters. Needless to say, this deck brings a lot of allies. Some are excellent damage-dealers. Others are mainly there to block villain attacks - but the blockers can also deal a lot of damage too! In my opinion, your mulligan priorities are (in order of importance): [Storm's Crown](/card/36006), [The X-Jet](/card/32020), [Helicarrier](/card/01092), [Utopia](/card/33020), and [Boot Camp](/card/13016). In subsequent turns, once you have at least one resource generator out, Boot Camp becomes your top priority. Note: [Forge](/card/36022) helps as an additional way to find [The X-Jet](/card/32020) or [Utopia](/card/33020) early - but I only recommend playing him on Turn 1 if you don’t have any of the aforementioned cards in hand! Note: Storm’s base kit comes with excellent threat removal, enough to cover for solo play without adding additional threat removal cards. This is why this deck functions as a solo deck and a multiplayer deck despite being so heavily focused on damage!
#### **Eye of the Storm**
Managing Storm’s weather supports is the most challenging part of playing Storm, but also the most rewarding. Ideally you want to see [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) in play at least once every turn because the deck is based around allies. The more allies you have out and attacking, the more value Storm gets from [Thunderstorm](/card/36004). While [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) also boosts enemies’ ATK, this can largely be mitigated by blocking the villain’s attack with allies. You can also mitigate giving your enemies’ +1 ATK by going alter-ego - which is also the perfect time to make use of [Psylocke](/card/35013) and [Professor X](/card/32019)'s confuses. In multiplayer, you need to coordinate more with your team. In 2-4 player, unless you want to upset the other players, try to avoid ending the turn with [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) up unless everyone agrees to it! With that said, multiple players all benefiting from +1 ATK does tend to outweigh the negatives in most cases - just not if someone is at low hp! In an ideal world, in multiplayer, you will draw [Weather Goddess](/card/36009). In which case, you can call for an action at the start of the first player’s turn, bring [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) into play, then call for an action at the end of the last player’s turn and use [Weather Goddess](/card/36009) to change to a different weather. Doing this gives everyone the benefits of +1 ATK through the entire hero phase - with no downsides!
#### **Thwarting and Other Weathers**
[Hurricane](/card/36003) is your next best weather. With 3x [Torrential Rain](/card/36010), 2 threat removal every other turn from [Hurricane](/card/36003), and the ability to get 2 THW and ready from [Storm's Crown](/card/36006) and [Storm's Cape](/card/36007), you can handle the threat in solo play - all without adding a single card to thwart! It’s very powerful. And the Retaliate is an added bonus. ([Brawn](/card/10011), however, is a valuable addition to keeping the threat under control while pushing the villain toward their doom.) Again, be careful in 2-4 player. There’s nothing worse than multiple players all having to suffer Retaliate damage because you got stuck with the wrong weather out! [Clear Skies](/card/36002) is excellent as stalwart doesn’t only prevent stun/confuse, but removes any stun/confuse tokens already out! Use it to cleanse you or other players - just be careful not to remove stun/confuse from enemies. Aside from that, this weather should mostly be used when you either a) have a bad hand and are fishing for options or, more likely, b) you need just one more resource to make an amazing play with the cards you have in hand! Since this deck mainly blocks with allies, we do not use [Blizzard](/card/36005) very often - but it’s occasionally useful, notably if there’s a minion with a nasty When Defeated effect in play that you can blank with its “Special:”. Hydra Soldier is one of the best use cases, and it’s particularly effective against the entire Acolyte modular set as well!
#### **General Strategy**
Focus on playing allies but be careful! It’s easy to get lost in the amazing value of their ATK stat. Try to make sure you keep at least one ally at 1 hp to block with as Storm's defense is her biggest weakness - until you get [Storm's Cape](/card/36007) in play, she has just 1 DEF and no built-in status cards. Don't forget to keep an eye on the threat too. Just a few allies are often enough to defeat the villain, the most important thing is to survive while they do it. Depending on what upgrades and weathers you have out, your allies’ damage can vary wildly. Here’s an example of the crazy total damage an ally can deal when using all their hp to attack: - [Angel](/card/33019) on his own = 6 damage - [Angel](/card/33019) with Thunderstorm = 9 damage - [Angel](/card/33019) with Boot Camp and Thunderstorm = 12 damage - [Angel](/card/33019) with Attack Training = 15 damage - [Angel](/card/33019) with Attack Training and Thunderstorm = 20 damage - [Angel](/card/33019) with Attack Training, Boot Camp and Thunderstorm = 25 damage For context, Ronan’s final stage on Expert has 25 health per person. While you’ll likely have to slay a few minions with your allies and thus not all of their damage will go onto the villain, the point is that your allies can get a lot of work done very, very efficiently! Rely on them to damage enemies while Storm keeps the rest of the game under control. While [Lightning Bolt](/card/36011) is an excellent card for some additional damage, as a rule of thumb you should try to focus on playing allies - and only start zapping directly when the villain is either near defeat or there is nothing else you could do to strengthen your board state.
#### **Alternative Cards**
First and foremost, [Deft Focus](/card/16024) is a great option that supports all your amazing hero cards. The "downside" is that it doesn't do much for the rest of your deck, but if someone else is bringing [Danger Room Training](/card/33015), playing as Colossus or Wolverine (so you can't take the allies), or someone is playing Protection (and so you no longer need [Endurance](/card/05023)), this should be the first thing you add. Another copy of [Boot Camp](/card/13016) helps for consistency but, with [Thunderstorm](/card/36004), Aggression allies, and a base ATK of 2, you normally have enough damage for the early game when solo - so, as valuable as it is, you can afford not to play [Boot Camp](/card/13016). With that said, I have managed to play it as soon as I find it in almost all of my test games. This is why there is only 1 copy - still, another one is a fine option you might like to pursue. In 3-4 player, when there are more minions in need of clearing and other heroes can cover thwarting and defense, I would then strongly recommend swapping in another copy of [Boot Camp](/card/13016) - you can even play the spare later on your Leadership player! And, if you are playing multiplayer, also consider changing a couple of the non X-Men allies out for [Dust](/card/33012) or [Magik](/card/32042). [Sentry](/card/10012) is another amazing ally who gets huge value out of Boot Camp and Thunderstorm. [Combat Training](/card/01057) is also a great option that, had I more room in the deck, I would definitely include. Especially in multiplayer where, as already mentioned, you can afford to go all-in on the damage.
**Good luck and have fun!**

name: Fluid Adamantium
description_md:
Hey everyone! Now that the database has been updated, and I'm publishing my MojoMania campaign videos this week, I am publishing my Wolverine deck.

I wanted to play Fluid Motion for a long time but never felt like it fit well anywhere, or with any heroes that I wanted to play. I've never been super into Aggression in the first place. But, since Wolverine can always play 1 attack event for free, Fluid works pretty well with him!

Clobber is one of my favorite cards with him, since he can play it for free and get it right back. However that does make it hard to set up on the same turn, so you have to skip a turn not getting a Fluid bonus, if you want to play one.

I love Precision Strike for Wolverine, too. The extra heal is fantastic. Since Fluid can boost his ATK, Smash the Problem was not a bad idea to toss in for the turns when you really need to control some threat, especially a side scheme. You could be thwarting for 4-5 with it.

I've played this deck in 2-player as well and beaten MojoMania twice with it solo.

**You can check out my solo videos here, posting this week!**

- [Magog](https://youtu.be/8wjJXpQWvG8)
- [Spiral](https://youtu.be/O9w3M4_3TOY)
- [Mojo](https://youtu.be/G5fxgZjcys4)

name: Quicksilver Leadership (clone)
description_md: Test for TTS

name: The Bub Club
description_md:
_**“Nature made me a freak. Man made me a weapon.”** - Wolverine, the Logan movie_ _**“Fantasy Flight Games made me a freak. [Rapid Response](/card/08031) made me a weapon.”** - [Jubilee](/card/35003), this deck_
This deck has three key ways to get incredible value: - [Professor X](/card/32019) with [Command Team](/card/23016) - [Beast](/card/33011) with [Rapid Response](/card/08031) - [Jubilee](/card/35003) with [Command Team](/card/23016) and [Rapid Response](/card/08031) And all of these, of course, love [Utopia](/card/33020)! The combo with Jubilee can instantly end a game, with a minimum of 19 damage and - with just a few more cards - upwards of 35+! Better yet, the individual pieces of this combo are still great on their own, making the overall deck very consistent.
**If you like this deck, feel free to give it a ❤ ! Thank you!**
### **The Bub Club**
This deck is built around the concept of getting incredible damage out of recurring [Jubilee](/card/35003). By having her enter play multiple times on a single turn, you can get some crazy damage bonuses. However, other X-Men also benefit from the cards she likes and often, with Wolverine’s crazy damage, you can win before even lining up the full Jubilee combo! Wolverine is already blessed with great threat removal on top of his amazing damage. As a Leadership deck, this deck is - for the most part - an all-rounder that shores up every pillar of the game. This makes it suitable at all player counts. Your mulligan priority is as follows: [Utopia](/card/33020), [The X-Jet](/card/32020), [Helicarrier](/card/01092), [Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029), and [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004). Once you have any of your three consistent resource generators in play (X-Jet, Helicarrier, or Clarity of Purpose), [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004) becomes the next most important upgrade to play. You should also aim to play at least one [Command Team](/card/23016) and [Rapid Response](/card/08031) per deck pass if possible.
#### **[Jubublee ](/card/35003)**
[Jubilee](/card/35003) is the star of the show, the prime bub herself. Her Response can stack multiple times on Wolverine in one turn as you repeatedly bring her into play with the likes of [Rapid Response](/card/08031), [Pixie](/card/36017) and [Make the Call](/card/01071). An ideal setup will include the following 4 upgrades/supports in play: - [Utopia](/card/33020) - [Rapid Response](/card/08031) - [Command Team](/card/23016) - [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004) And the general order of operations is then: 1. Play [Jubilee](/card/35003) (or use [Make the Call](/card/01071) for her) and trigger her response 2. Make a basic ATK with Wolverine (now at 5 ATK) 3. Make a basic ATK with [Jubilee](/card/35003) (now at 3 ATK) 4. Use [Command Team](/card/23016) on [Jubilee](/card/35003) and have her attack again 5. Trigger [Rapid Response](/card/08031) to bring [Jubilee](/card/35003) back and trigger her response again 6. Trigger [Utopia](/card/33020) to ready Wolverine back up 7. Make a basic ATK with Wolverine (now at 7 ATK) 8. Make a basic ATK with Jubilee (now at 3 ATK again) In total, this amounts to 21 damage (5 + 3 + 3 + 7 + 3) which is enough to end many solo games. And, if putting the whole thing together escapes you, even just part of the combo is excellent - even playing [Jubilee](/card/35003) on her own, with no combo pieces, is great! Fortunately, it's not hard to put this combo together. And you can even boost your potential damage on a turn much higher through one or multiple of the following: - Ready Wolverine again by playing/[making the call](/card/01071) for [Professor X](/card/32019) - Play an attack event on the same turn such as [Lunging Strike](/card/35010) - Have Jubilee enter play a 3rd time through [Make the Call](/card/01071) or playing another [Rapid Response](/card/08031) after using the first one but before she's defeated again. - If [Jubilee](/card/35003) is played again, you can have a second [Command Team](/card/23016) in play to ready her yet again.
#### **[Professor Bub](/card/32019)**
A powerful bub in his own right, [Professor X](/card/32019) loves having [Command Team](/card/23016) around. In addition to confusing a villain and blocking a villain attack, using [Command Team](/card/23016) on him sends him from 3 threat removal to 6 threat removal. In solo, that's enough to defeat most of the side schemes in the game and is still considerable in multiplayer! Don't be afraid to use charges of [Command Team](/card/23016) on [Professor X](/card/32019) if you'll get use from his THW. And don't forget that, if the stars align, you can use him to ready you on a [Jubilee](/card/35003) turn for major damage!
#### **[Bubst](/card/33011)**
The blue bub [Beast](/card/33011) brings both excellent value and a balance of great ATK and great THW. He is a fantastic in almost any situation. Although he costs an initial investment of 5 effective resources (4-cost and the card itself), by finding a resource card from your discard pile he effectively refunds a huge chunk of his cost, making him equivalent to a 2-cost instead of a 4-cost in most cases. A "2-cost" ally with 2 THW/2 ATK/3 HP is extraordinarily good already, but [Beast](/card/33011) also loves [Rapid Response](/card/08031). Triggering [Rapid Response](/card/08031) brings him back with 1 less hp, but he still finds you a resource card - making [Rapid Response](/card/08031) effectively cost 1 resource to grant you a 2 THW/2 ATK/2 hp ally. While [Rapid Response](/card/08031) might gain more value when used in the [Jubilee](/card/35003) combo, there's no point in holding onto it to use with her only to be defeated by other means. If you're under pressure and both [Beast](/card/33011) and [Rapid Response](/card/08031) are available, don't hesitate to use Rapid Response on him instead!
#### **General Bubbery**
The aim of the game is to build up all the pieces of the combo while using the inherent power of both Wolverine's kit and the X-Men allies to control the board. [Utopia](/card/33020) in particular shines on any turn you play any X-Men ally, not just [Jubilee](/card/35003), and you should use [Rapid Response](/card/08031) and/or [Command Team](/card/23016) on other allies too if necessary. In addition to [Professor X](/card/32019), [Colossus](/card/32048) is a great target for a use of [Command Team](/card/23016) - whether to gain tempo back after saving his Tough for the villain's attack, or for an immediate burst of 6 damage. There's no point in building up to a combo if you lose before you can pull it off! Solid immediate value is better than incredible later value if it keeps you in the game. Both [Beast](/card/33011) and [Professor X](/card/32019) will do incredible work to keep the board under control and should be your main targets with [Make the Call](/card/01071). If you draw [Make the Call](/card/01071) and one of them is in your discard pile, you should probably use it on one of them! (Unless [Jubilee](/card/35003) is there and you're ready to unleash the combo.)
#### **Alternative Bubs**
If you want to break from the X-Men theme, [Maria Hill](/card/01067) is an easy addition who can replace [Gentle](/card/36016). [Lead from the Front](/card/01070) can increase the [Jubilee](/card/35003) combo even further, though it can have limited value otherwise and clog up the deck. Add this if you want to make big number go bigger, and leave it at home if you want to better your chances of winning. [Cerebro](/card/34022) can help you to find [Jubilee](/card/35003) or any other X-Men ally of your choice. Personally, I don't think this is worth it given its conditions (alter-ego, chance to miss with no psionic) over the many other excellent cards Leadership has available, but it is a strong option that may work for you. [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018) is a very powerful card that does a lot for this deck overall, but makes the [Jubilee](/card/35003) combo harder to pull off as now you need both [Command Team](/card/23016)s in play to spend all her hp in one turn and trigger an immediate [Rapid Response](/card/08031). But it's so good it's still worth considering - I suggest either bringing a third [Command Team](/card/23016) if you go this route or dropping all your Command Teams+the [Jubilee](/card/35003) combo altogether. [Fastball Special](/card/35023) is another good option. Personally I like to prioritize recurring [Professor X](/card/32019), [Beast](/card/33011) and [Jubilee](/card/35003) - but keeping [Colossus](/card/35021) around means [Fastball Special](/card/35023) is always ready as a great attack card.
**Good luck and have fun!** And special thanks go to journeyman2 for his contributions!

name: Storm - Leader of the X-Men
description_md:
# Storm - Leader of the X-Men

## There's A Storm Coming

Hello and welcome to the latest take on a peculiar character! 
Today's piece is about [Storm](/card/36001a).

> What does storm do differently? 

Well, I'm glad you asked. In case you haven't seen it already, Storm has access to her Weather-Deck! (Not an actual deck for rules purposes.) This gives her access to a variety of extremely strong weather-patterns at her disposal! But with great power, comes great responsibility! I'm sure many of you eagle-eyed players have noticed that Storm's weather-abilities are so mighty that they apply to everyone! Including the Villain, Minions, Allies, You & Your Fellow-Players!  

> Wait, that sounds kinda.... bad..? 

It's her blessing and her curse. 
[Hurricane](/card/36003), [Clear Skies](/card/36002), [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) & [Blizzard](/card/36005)! These are the elements you command! Thankfully, her hero-ability, Weather-Control allows you to swap these in and out easier! A simple play is [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) when appropriate for damage; but be careful! Or the Villain might just give you a bigger-smack than you expect to you or your friends! So what do we do with our [Weather Goddess](/card/36009)? Why, we...

## Use [Teamwork](/card/06032)!
Storm's Weather Patterns apply to everyone, so don't be afraid to use [Teamwork](/card/06032) with your allies! Let's take [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) for instance.
You have [Gentle](/card/36016) and you play [Teamwork](/card/06032). Voila! Storm and Gentle Benefit from the +1 to Attack. So now when Storm uses her basic-attack, she will hit for as high as 7! 

> Isn't she kinda squishy? 

She is, but don't worry! Your allies have really toughed up and received some [Danger Room Training](/card/33015) so that they can become [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018)! And if you need a bigger break, why not cosy up when it's a [Blizzard](/card/36005) outside and try not to [Flash Freeze](/card/36012)! 

Rain Or Shine, Don't Forget to Appreciate [Ororo's Garden](/card/36008)! 

Now you can add a true-powerhouse of a character to your Exciting, Uncanny and All-New X-men team! 

> "Do you know what happens to a Villain when it's struck by lightning? The same as everything else."

name: Maria Hill: Stop Calling Me, please?
description_md:
This deck focus on recursing [Maria Hill](/card/01067) for your team. Your second job (apart from giving cards to everyone) is thwarting.

Thanks to his ability —Constant Training— he can choose to pick [Rapid Response](/card/08031) from his deck (sadly, it's only for TACTIC "UPGRADE"). And again, thanks to his 3 copies of [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010) he can pick [Rapid Response](/card/08031) or [Regroup](/card/19032) back from the discard pile. 

Once you get his [Field Commander](/card/33004) out, [Regroup](/card/19032) will prove itself to net your team 1 card each (or even more if your team uses an ally to block an attack which results in getting more card!), every time. Maria provides you with 2 threats removal and 1 block (If not from Rapid Response).  


Or you can trigger Rapid Response in your own turn (suppose you have Field Commander down already) to net 1 more card to each player.


Even if you don't get [Field Commander](/card/33004) out in time, there are [Government Liaison](/card/27054) to get Maria Hill down out of your turn.

Worry not, if you have those necessary cards in hand or deck, his [Priority Target](/card/33007) is a great target to pick for your teammate, attach it to a minion and maybe help your friend by Optic Blast them to weaken them a bit and let your friend finish them off for sweet sweet 2 cards draw.

[Honorary X-Men](/card/33035) is there to make use of [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018) whenever you are in alter-ego

name: Wolverine - Adamantium Assault
description_md:
# Wolverine - Admantium Assault



> I'm the best at what I do...
> An' what I do's not very nice. 

Hello & welcome to Adamantium Assault, an aggression deck that'll make your claws pop, your jaw drop and villains stop! 

Jokes aside, this is a wonderful, easy to use character that doesn't let his straight-forward nature get in the way of what he wants to accomplish in-game.
For starters, let's look at the adamantium-elephant in the room. [Wolverine's Claws](/card/35002). This card is undeniably fantastic, but you have to know when to use it or you might just be the one they bring down! It's more situational than it seems, but that's part of the charm of Wolverine. He can show restraint when he wants to; and he can show his [Berserker Frenzy](/card/35005) when not.   

## Healing Factor?! That's Uncanny! 
What's better than [Regenerative Healing](/card/35012)? Having more of it through [First Aid](/card/12019). Okay, get your chuckles out now. Sure, it seems like it's unnecessary. But with all the damage you take through taking hits on the chin or from your claws, you'll wish you had a bandage for every boo-boo your healing factor doesn't fix! 

### **Important!** 

Don't overlook your cards when it comes to these two! They're both **actions**. This is important because you don't need to be in Hero-Form to use either of them!   

## Wolverine's [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004) Allows Him To Go [Toe to Toe](/card/10015)
You have a healing factor so that means you can stand there with the big-guns, huh? You might want to load up a little on [Endurance](/card/36026). This gives Wolverine a health total of 17! And your Basic attack goes from 2 to 3 due to your [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004), along with some piercing from your sharp claws!  There's a time to stand and fight; and there's a time to [Hit and Run](/card/18020)! This card is HORRIBLE value outside of Gamora. But.. if you're just paying 3 life then... this can be very helpful for some thwart. Speaking of.. if the villain attacks you, don't forget to look back menacingly and yell ["You'll Pay for That!"](/card/10016). Finally, this card can see play now that we have a hero who isn't as easily nuked by some of the later-villains. (Looking at you Avalanche...)  

Use powerful cards like [Berserker Barrage](/card/35008), [Lunging Strike](/card/35010), [Slice and Dice](/card/35009) as you unless your [Battle Fury](/card/35015)! And just maybe, you'll be welcomed into the [Hall of Heroes](/card/06017)!

name: Cyclops - Cyclops Was Right
description_md:
### As the reign of Charles Xavier ends, a new Leader shall take his place. **Cyclops was right.**

Hello & welcome back to another article featuring [Scott Summers](/card/33001b) aka [Cyclops](/card/33001a)!  Prepare to deliver rays that will [Exploit Weakness](/card/33005). Use **Tactics** that will show your [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010). And use your signature battle-cry, ["To Me, My X-Men!"](/card/36020)!  

## Leading the [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018)
No good-leader would ever miss the opportunity for a well-calculated [Sneak Attack](/card/23017)! You may be wondering: "What's with these weird card ratios! I'd run this at X!"  Well, this boils down to the keyword of the day, **Tactics**. These cards represent all of the Constant-Training you and your team go through! [Scott Summers](/card/33001b) allows you to grab **UPGRADES** with this keyword! When in doubt, don't be afraid to go to [Plan B](/card/27024)!  These upgrades also extend to your hero-cards needed for [Cyclops](/card/33001a)' Optic-Blast!  Still not convinced? Well, what if we had a look at his [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010)! This is different to his Alter-Ego ability because it is from the discard pile and **any card with the keyword**.  

As the [Field Commander](/card/33004), you have access to all sorts of X-Men from different aspects! And you'll need some help from [Cerebro](/card/34022) to locate them! [Blindfold](/card/33014) & [Phoenix](/card/33002) are both **Psionic**! So you'll want to keep one of them around to have a better time finding your allies for your [Sneak Attack](/card/23017)! Now that's what I call a [Rapid Response](/card/08031).  [Sunfire](/card/35014) is a great hero to search this way! He's always better when he's needed than when he's not! 

As the leader of the X-Men, it can get very stressful. So don't forget about your [Meditation](/card/26036)!  [Cerebro](/card/34022) & [Meditation](/card/26036) in the same deck?! Is this a crossover?! (Bonus points if you know the reference) 

Under your leadership, you can make the board a real [Utopia](/card/33020) for the X-Men. Take a break at the [X-Mansion](/card/32049) when you, or your allies feel the need, take the [The X-Jet](/card/32020) right back to the fight! If you're struggling to find something, I'm sure [Forge](/card/36022) can help out!

name: Wolverine Fluid Attack
description_md: With [Adamantium Claws](/card/32067), [Wolverine](/card/35001a) is a perfect pair for [Fluid Motion](/card/28016). This deck is built around getting high ATK with 2x [Fluid Motion](/card/28016), [Combat Training](/card/01057), and [Adamantium Claws](/card/32067) which gets him up to 6. [Utopia](/card/33020) + _X-Men_ traited allies can supply some readying to attack more than once a round. [Quick Strike](/card/25018) and [Fastball Special](/card/35023) can be used on his high attack while even being exhausted.

name: Wolverine
description_md:
Wolverine aggression.

Utilizing wolverine’s claws and jarnbjorn to take advantage of mean swing.

name: Wolverine Jubilee Party
description_md:
This deck revolves around trying to cycle [Jubilé](/card/35003) as much as possible to get her +2 ATK for both [Wolverine](/card/35001a) and herself. [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018) makes her cost 1 less as well as [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) can make her free to put in. [Regroup](/card/19032) is used to help recur her back into your hand. as well as [Rapid Response](/card/08031). Unlike other X-Men ally decks, we don't necessarily care if our allies stay in play. [Command Team](/card/23016) helps us use up our allies quickly.

[Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029) leverages Wolverine's healing factor and health pool to eek out some extra resources.

name: Storm Team Strike
description_md:
The deck is built around getting the most value out of [Team Strike](/card/32045):

* [Thunderstorm](/card/36004)'s +1 ATK to all characters (allies and [Storm](/card/36001a))
* [Boot Camp](/card/13016) +1 ATK for every ally
* [Attack Training](/card/32043) for another +1 ATK
* [Combat Training](/card/01057) for +1 ATK for [Storm](/card/36001a)

Use [Assault Training](/card/26033) to recycle [Team Strike](/card/32045) back into your deck.

name: Storm Winds of Justice
description_md: A standard Justice deck that relies heavily on thwart events. Use [One Way or Another](/card/22015) to help draw into cards to play down your key cards like [Deft Focus](/card/16024), [Storm's Cape](/card/36007), and [Storm's Crown](/card/36006). Storm can get up to 3 THW with her [Storm's Crown](/card/36006) and [Heroic Intuition](/card/01065) and 3 ATK with [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) with her built in readying on her [Storm's Cape](/card/36007) or [Utopia](/card/33020), can let her help where needed.

name: Cyclops - Draw Pardner!
description_md: Howdy pardner, and thank ya kindly for checking this little ol’ build out. There’s a new sheriff in town, and his name ain’t Charles… That’s right, Sheriff Summers. [One Way or Another](/card/22015) he gets his man. If he needs to, he can [Assess the Situation](/card/12033) This card is amazing for the dead eye, mainly because it’s a tactic. This gives him the ability to not only be quick on the draw in the early game, but his ability to quick fire it from his side, or discard pile for you city folk, gives you the precious resource needed to do all sorts of trick shots and recruiting deputies to your posse. With a [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010) in hand, your starting hand of 7 cards can easily be a 7 card hero hand the next. [Priority Target](/card/33007) and a minion too? Even one of those [One Way or Another](/card/22015)? I ain’t the sharpest tool but if my math’s right you’re looking at a potential opening 11 card hand fella into that 7 card hero hand, maybe more if you kept assessing that sitcheation. The only issue is it’s not an upgrade so you can’t nab it with your AE action, sadly. Ultron learned that math early on and even on expert it was just like shooting cans at the carnival. Now I don’t think I have to tell you how nice that is for the sheriff but that means at least one of your deputies out, a couple pot shots at the bandits, and quite a bit of your deck gone through. Now a good sheriff knows when to get his hands dirty, and sometimes you just need to take the law in your own hands. [Concussive Blow](/card/05031) is that personal touch to confuse that desperado, giving you a chance to stop by the watering hole and refresh. And even better a chance to keep your drawing hand sharp, since you’re looking at least at a 7 card hand, but probably 8 with that fancy machine [Cerebro](/card/34022). I guess this is more Westchester than the ol’ west with your fancy inventions. Lastly, let’s talk about your posse. Jeanie is of course top priority. However, Pixie should be considered for your Chance Encounter since she’s cheap enough to potentially get her and Jeanie, or another ally. Forge will always make sure you have Cerebro ready to go, and the rest is really preference. Cerebro can always be used as a resource early on and Forge can bring it right on back. With those three allies, and tactical brilliance, your discard pile looks mighty similar to another deck to use. So for you tl:dr folks, what you get here is a deck that is constantly drawing from your deck and discard pile, that can utilize Sheriff Scott’s ability to thwart well and take pot shots all day. Now hurry up, it’s already high noon somewhere…

name: Dive Into The Storm
description_md:
**Up front:**
I've beaten Mansion Attack, Master Mold, Project Wideawake, Sabretooth, Magneto, MaGog, Spiral and Mojo all on Expert I with this deck. Except Mojo all of them with the first try and I have to say, partly without even sweating...

--------------------------------

I am by no means a good deck-builder, but going through Storms Hero cards I realised, that she basically can handle almost everything the game throws at her with just those cards and I could focus on what I would want to do when building a deck.

I decided to use Aggression because:

1- It's one of the weaker aspects and I have had a hard time beating certain villains on Expert I in Aggression. So a hero/deck that helps me enjoy Aggression against those villains was something I was looking for

2 - With the mutants wave Aggression (and Protection btw.) became more interesting in general I think. The scenarios throw lots of "healthy" minions at you and the arch nemesi are all pretty tough as well. Aggression cards with piercing are also very useful because of all the tough status cards you're going to see.

Given the main focus being Aggression and her Hero cards being very strong I also decided:

1 - I need some extra mean to handle the thwarting

2 - I wanted to go with the [Honed Technique](/card/28017)/[Dive Bomb](/card/17028) archetype, so I can finish the game off rather quickly once set up. I just like that!

--------------------------------
**
So here is how I am trying to generally play this deck:** 

At the first run through the deck, I want to mainly get upgrades and supports out. Focus on [Storm's Cape](/card/36007), [Storm's Crown](/card/36006), [The X-Jet](/card/32020), [Honed Technique](/card/28017) and maybe [Martial Prowess](/card/10018)/[Deft Focus](/card/16024). During this phase you should be able to handle  threat and minions already well thanks to her weather environments, events and allies. 

I try to get to alter ego to heal up, when the villain is confused, thanks to [Psylocke](/card/35013) and [Professor X](/card/32019), but typically you can also go to Alter Ego, when the threat on the main scheme is 0 as well, depending on the villain.

Once the upgrades are out, you'll see that you can do everything you want and then some. [Honed Technique](/card/28017) pushes [Dive Bomb](/card/17028), but also makes [Piercing Strike](/card/04044) a force.

--------------------------------

Now some comments to why I chose some of the cards:

[Psylocke](/card/35013) and [Professor X](/card/32019):
they can thwart and confuse. Almost staple cards for Aggression unless the villain is stalwart. You need to time it right though with the weather environment that gives everyone stalwart.

[Forge](/card/36022):
Should actually be [Longshot](/card/35033) for thwarting

[Wolverine](/card/32041):
Great against tough guys, but in this deck I use him mostly for constant threat removal

[Piercing Strike](/card/04044):
Maybe my favorite Agg event in this deck. With [Honed Technique](/card/28017) it deals 5 damage with piercing, which is very much needed in Mutant Genesis scenarios

[Dive Bomb](/card/17028):
that's a common combination with [Honed Technique](/card/28017) dealing 11 + 4 damage. Be careful though, you need [Storm's Cape](/card/36007) out first to be allowed to play [Dive Bomb](/card/17028)

[Into the Fray](/card/13013)/[Chase Them Down](/card/01052):
Well, I guess you could use something else instead. They just give you some extra mean to deal with threat, if necessary. 

[Honed Technique](/card/28017):
To boost [Dive Bomb](/card/17028), [Piercing Strike](/card/04044) and [Into the Fray](/card/13013)

[The X-Jet](/card/32020)/[Martial Prowess](/card/10018)/[Deft Focus](/card/16024):
Together with [Storm's Crown](/card/36006), those cards help you play everything you want, even the expensive stuff, while getting kickers.

[Endurance](/card/05023)/[Down Time](/card/05033):
you want to make it count when healing up in Alter Ego. [Ororo's Garden](/card/36008) helps there as well. But in general: the more upgrades the better, because you will then later on see Storms great hero cards and the attack events to finish the villain more regularily.

--------------------------------
**
Honorable mentions:**
You can also try out additional allies, [Honorary X-Men](/card/33035) for the extra life or Attack events that you like and that work well with Honed Technique. I tried [No Quarter](/card/28013) and have to say, I didn't like it, because it makes you skip your powerful hero cards. 

To conclude:
Storm is insanely strong, so you can really adapt her deck to whatever you like to do ;)

name: 50 Shades of X-Men
description_md:
50 cards! 19 allies! Have you gone crazy Journeyman? Yes, yes I have. Let me explain in the form of 50 Cent songs:
**Candy Shop** ------ The goal here is to maximize the odds of hitting an ally with ["To Me, My X-Men!"](/card/36020). A whiff is quite unfortunate, costing us 2 resources for nothing, making this practically unplayable in a normal deck. Good thing this isn't a normal deck! In a typical 40-card, 6-10 ally deck, the odds of whiffing are quite high: 20-45% miss chance. Meanwhile, this deck sports only a 5-15% miss chance! To exploit TMMX, we want to stock up on allies with 2+ THW, 3+ ATK, and enters play effects. This deck has nine allies at 2+ THW, four allies at 3+ attack, and seven allies with enters play effects (with another 2-3 that have great constant/triggered effects). Since TMMX refunds the ally at the end of the phase, this means we are getting this all for a single resource! Rules note: the ally returns to hand *after* drawing up to hand size at the end of the phase, so this is essentially +1 hand size and a guaranteed ally play for the next turn! Take [Polaris](/card/32012) for example, turn 1 spend 2 resources and get a tough and 1 thwart or 2 damage, turn 2 have a 6 card hero hand or 7 card alter-ego hand, possibly replaying her for another tough! Excellent benefit two turns in a row! Since it is a ***tactic***, [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010) can pull it whenever the odds are highest! So many options it's like being in a candy shop! Just don't look up the lyrics...
**Get Rich or Die Tryin'** ----- - **[Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018)** is the other lynchpin card. This card is quite broken. Giving every X-Men ally +1 hit point is one thing, but then it reduces the cost to play X-Men allies by 1 as long as all of our characters are X-Men! If we play three allies in a turn, this is essentially a triple resource! And let me tell you, we will be dropping 3 or more allies in a turn quite regularly once this is out. We are running three to guarantee seeing it early despite the 50 Cent. In multiplayer, the extras can be played to other players. - **[Cerebro](/card/34022)** adds to our alter-ego economy and ally spam. There are 6 psionic allies to take advantage of this, with [Phoenix](/card/33002) commonly staying out for most of the game. Because of the TMMX numbers, hitting an ally in 5 cards is likely even if no psionic ally is out. Just remember, it is *only* playable in alter-ego, while Cyclops has the Mutant trait. - **[Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024)** combos well with the -1 cost from Uncanny. 21 targets might make this the strongest ever TBE! - **[The X-Jet](/card/32020)** hits kickers for [Magik](/card/32042), [Nightcrawler](/card/32011), and [Sunfire](/card/35014). - **[Honorary X-Men](/card/33035)**, keeps the discounts from Uncanny and [The X-Jet](/card/32020) active in alter-ego. This can lead to plays where [Cerebro](/card/34022) grabs an ally, and it's paid for by Uncanny, [The X-Jet](/card/32020), and a tactic from *Constant Training*. For 0 cards in hand, we can play any 3-cost or lower ally in the deck, of which, there are 14 total! With 1 more resource, any ally can be played for only 1 card in hand! - ***Constant Training*** is a key part of Cyclops' economy; constant flipping grants him +2 cards a turn between this and [Cerebro](/card/34022). Often, the tactic upgrade will be a resource. - **[Priority Target](/card/33007)** is the preferred grab when a minion is out, chaining into more cards. Getting this for free off *Constant Training* or [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010) and then drawing two more cards is a key play! - **[Practiced Defense](/card/33006)** is underrated, giving Cyclops a way to pseudo-defend for 3 (and sometimes blocking more if the villain attacks again). Great to save big allies for future activations and has a place in certain matchups like Sabretooth and Project Wideawake. At 0-cost, it is the best end of turn drop when there is a spare resource. - **[Rapid Response](/card/08031)** is a good grab for when TMMX pulled [Phoenix](/card/33002) or [Beast](/card/33011), setting it up for the next turn when they get played from hand. - **[Exploit Weakness](/card/33005)** is the best tactic upgrade to pull when needing a resource early. Its cost makes it expensive and villain damage isn't a priority yet. But it is also excellent late game to close things out! Be careful not to trigger *Constant Training* on the turn Cyclops flips to Scott Summers if there isn't a way to play or spend the card, there are only 7 targets in deck so they need to be used sparingly! Likewise for [Cerebro](/card/34022) since it will hurt TMMX odds for nothing. The amount of deck thinning we have with the supports and *Constant Training* increases our TMMX chance to infinite. There are times where the entire rest of the deck is allies, giving it a 100% chance!
**In Da Club** ----- Here is the meat of the deck, the 19 allies! They're organized by cost under Uncanny X-Men (Cost/THW/ATK/HP): ## **1-cost x 4** The 1-cost allies are potent as targets for [Cerebro](/card/34022) or [Pixie](/card/36017) when there's a spare resource to play them. Using [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024)+[Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018) to drop one of these creates value and a block for cheap. What other deck has as many 1-cost allies as this?! ^this is a boombox **[Forge](/card/36022) (1/1/1/3)**: Weak statline but amazing effect to tutor [Cerebro](/card/34022), [Utopia](/card/33020), or [The X-Jet](/card/32020) from the deck or discard. Enters play works off TMMX. Getting [Cerebro](/card/34022) when in or planning to be in alter-ego is key since it can only be played while Cyclops has the **Mutant** trait. [Utopia](/card/33020) can be played right away with a double resource and generates momentum if there is a second ally waiting in the wings. Even discarding the support for [Forge](/card/36022)'s cost, just to get it right back is valuable! ^provides the strobe lighting **[Sunfire](/card/35014) (1/1/2/3)**: Can't stress enough how strong this ally is. Hit the kicker with [The X-Jet](/card/32020) and watch problem cards like [Advanced Glider](/card/27136), [We Are One](/card/27120), [Universal Weapon](/card/16109), and [Magneto's Armor](/card/32148) melt away. Won't trigger off TMMX, but it can set him up for the next turn. [Regroup](/card/19032) can help strip a fully kitted out villain! **[Pixie](/card/36017) (1/1/2/3)**: Toolboxing the discard for allies, complements [Cerebro](/card/34022) and TMMX's ability to toolbox the deck; guaranteeing the ability to grab almost any ally at any time! The extra hp means she can attack for 2 without immediately dying. Loops well with [Regroup](/card/19032). ^just happy to be here **[Angel](/card/33019) (1/1/2/4)**: Technically 3-cost, but double discounts make him a 1-drop. Low stats and no effect make him a poor hit for TMMX except to set up a cheap play next turn. Still 1-cost ally is 1-cost ally! ## **2-cost x10** **[Phoenix](/card/33002) (2/2/2/4)**: Grab any Cyclops card, usually [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010), [Priority Target](/card/33007), or [Full Blast](/card/33008). Hitting her with TMMX is resource neutral, while being able to chain into more draw with the aforementioned Cyclops cards. To put this in perspective, there are 10 cards in this deck that draw cards, [Phoenix](/card/33002) is one and she can tutor for 5 of the others. Psionic for [Cerebro](/card/34022) ^overlooking the club like the OG he is **[Professor X](/card/32019) (2/3/0/4)**: Amazing hit with TMMX, basically a 1 ER confuse and 3 THW. When combined with [Psylocke](/card/35013), can overwhelm even the steadiest of villains. The ready option can be useful on the many 3-ATK allies as well. Psionic for [Cerebro](/card/34022) **[Polaris](/card/32012) (2/1/2/4)**: Access to tough and a great recursion target. Give Cyclops tough with TMMX, then play her again for tough the next turn! **[Blindfold](/card/33014) (2/2/0/3)**: 2-cost for 2 THW and 3 HP is valuable. The enters play effect is just a bonus. TMMX into a next-turn play can give some excellent encounter control. Psionic for [Cerebro](/card/34022) **[Mirage](/card/36015) (2/2/1/3)**: 2-cost for 2 THW and 3 HP is still a great benchmark. The stun will rarely go off since we don't have [Danger Room](/card/33021) to give her [Danger Room Training](/card/33015), but still a good TMMX pull against 1-THW minions and villains (like Magog!). Psionic for [Cerebro](/card/34022) **[Marvel Girl](/card/34015) (2/2/1/4)**: 2-cost for 2 THW and 4 HP is excellent. Again the effect is rare to be worthwhile, but some targets are really good, like [Sentinel Mark VIII](/card/32114). Great at popping toughs with tempo. Psionic for [Cerebro](/card/34022) **[Colossus](/card/32048) (2/1/3/4)**: Technically 4-cost, but double discounts make him a 2-drop. Tough makes for a good blocker and 3-ATK is ideal for TMMX. Unfortunately, can't make great use out of the extra hit point, but double consequential can help get him in the reshuffle to keep TMMX numbers high! **[Gentle](/card/36016) (2/1/3/4)**: 12-damage that can split up as 9 to minion and 3 to the villain or 6 to the villain and a quick reshuffle. In multi-villain scenarios like Tower Defense, he will only take an additional consequential damage when attacking the active villain, so he's safe to pound on the non-active villain(s)! Another good 3-ATK ally to pull with TMMX, where the extra consequential means less. Nothing wrong with having a big stick to throw around! **[Nightcrawler](/card/32011) (2/2/2/3)**: 2-cost for 2-THW is still a great stat line. The extra hp gets an extra turn of use out of him while waiting for an opportune time to trigger his ability. Can always bounce to hand to loop with [Utopia](/card/33020). Can hit the kicker with [The X-Jet](/card/32020). Great for countering [Gene Therapy](/card/33030)! [Nightcrawler](/card/32011), [Phoenix](/card/33002), and [Beast](/card/33011) are the cheapest 2/2 allies in the deck, making them very flexible ^Magik is clearly the club bouncer **[Magik](/card/32042) (2/1/2/4)**: Skirts around **When Defeated** effects and can punt guard minions away to open up the villain for big [Exploit Weakness](/card/33005) turns. Same tempo as [Mind Control](/card/34009), but for 1 resource cheaper. Unfortunately, not a great TMMX target and doesn't play well with [Priority Target](/card/33007). Can hit the kicker with [The X-Jet](/card/32020). ## **3-cost x5** **Psylocke (3/2/1/4)**: Amazing stat line and ability. Importantly, her interrupt will ping off toughs before her attack goes through, meaning she is always dealing 1-2 damage regardless of tough. This also works with villain stages if the villain is sitting on 1hp, her interrupt will confuse and defeat the stage, then her attack will continue to go through on the other stage possibly clearing a tough! Hitting her with TMMX is money, totaling 3 straight turns of confuse! The extra hp from [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018) allows her to utilize her good 2 THW stat if the villain isn't burning confuses fast enough. Psionic for [Cerebro](/card/34022) **[Beast](/card/33011) (3/2/2/4)**: Great stats and an enters play ability that turns TMMX resource positive makes [Beast](/card/33011) a keystone of this deck. Typically, he'll grab a double resource from the discard pile, and with [Rapid Response](/card/08031) and TMMX, can give 6 uses of the basic doubles in a deck cycle (TMMX, normal play, [Rapid Response](/card/08031), on top of three regular uses). When just about every ally and support costs 2, this is critical, and a big part of the turns where 3-4 allies get dropped! **[Wolverine](/card/32041) (3/1/3/5)**: [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018) lets Wolverine attack a whole extra time, totaling 12 damage in 4 turns before the consequential catches up to his healing. Hitting him off TMMX gives great access to piercing, making him one of the best minion answers! **[Rockslide](/card/33013) (3/1/3/7)**: Criminally underrated, [Rockslide](/card/33013) is another ally that can swing for 12 on his own when all is said and done. 7 HP makes him a great indirect damage soak in Drang and Sandman, and he can always eat an attack from Sabretooth or Project Wideawake. Hitting him off TMMX usually means 5 straight turns of a 3-ATK ally! **[Storm](/card/34021) (3/2/2/4)**: Technically 5-cost, but double discounts make her a 3-drop. Flexible 2/2/4 stat line is really good before even getting to her ability. [Storm](/card/34021) is amazing in the Venom Goblin and Project Wideawake matches. She also has uses vs Kang stage 2 (moving scheme from 3B to 2B), Wrecking Crew, and Tower Defense. She can accelerate Escape the Museum, the Sinister Six, and Hela's side schemes. Just note that her interrupt is optional, and moving the threat will occur *before* she removes any so double check that the order is actually beneficial! **Out Da Club** ------ **[Banshee](/card/34014) (3/2/2/4)**: Hard to give up because his stat line is so good, but competes with Storm and Rockslide, and ultimately they're better either with good matchups (Storm) or a better pull off TMMX (Rockslide). Banshee can be useful to leave a minion out, flip down, and pull [Priority Target](/card/33007) on the flip up. **[Longshot](/card/35033) (3/2/2/4)**: I really wanted to like him more, theoretically he can insta-defeat a minion off TMMX and still trigger [Priority Target](/card/33007). Just a lot of little things add up to make him too restricted. Non-elite minions only, needs a boost ability and not just a boost icon, wastes his stats to trigger his ability, can't be played from alter-ego unless [Honorary X-Men](/card/33035) has already been played. There are better options for his stat line. **[Havok](/card/36014) (3/1/2/4)**: Another ally I really wanted to like. He can come off a TMMX and deal 5 damage, then not die because Uncanny X-Men gives him an extra HP. The first time I played him, he pulled [Laufey](/card/21156), dealt 6 damage, and then offed himself. Pretty epic, but then a bunch of times he'd come in and deal 2. We don't really need his longevity with the plethora of options we have, and all of the current 3-ATK allies are more reliable. **[Dust](/card/33012) (2/1/1/4)**: Dust has good matchups, like Ultron, but generally she is a weak TMMX pull and dealing 3 damage to a single minion, i.e. with [Gentle](/card/36016), is better than dealing 1 damage to three minions. Can be a good sub for multiplayer games. There's a version of this deck that runs all 23 available allies for insane TMMX odds, but involves sacrificing support options or consistency.
**Utopia 5-0** ---- Get it? Like Hawaii 5-0?? Anyways... [Utopia](/card/33020) and [The Triskelion](/card/01073) are here to increase the ally limit to 5, since this deck churns out allies at an incredible rate. The goal is to always have a spot available for TMMX plays. Going 5 wide makes [Exploit Weakness](/card/33005) very potent. This is the typical finisher: attack with 5 boosted allies and Cyclops, play a bunch more and attack with them, ready Cyclops, [Full Blast](/card/33008). [Utopia](/card/33020)'s ready triggers off of TMMX and [Rapid Response](/card/08031), and with the quantity of 3-stat allies, readying an ally can be more economical than readying Cyclops. For instance, TMMX pulls [Wolverine](/card/32041), he attacks for 3 with piercing; play another ally, ready [Wolverine](/card/32041) and make another attack for 3 with piercing (then he bounces to hand and the same thing happens next turn). Besides just good stats, other allies worth readying include [Psylocke](/card/35013), to instantly confuse a steady villain, [Storm](/card/34021) to move around a lot of threat, and [Marvel Girl](/card/34015) to get some chip on a minion while still removing threat.
**50 First Dates** ---- One advantage of the 50 Cent deck is that cards that toolbox the discard like [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010), [Phoenix](/card/33002), and [Pixie](/card/36017), stay online for longer since the reshuffle is delayed. They have key combo loops with [Rapid Response](/card/08031) and [Regroup](/card/19032) that raise the floor of what this deck is capable of on an average turn. Cycloops! - [Phoenix](/card/33002), [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010), and [Rapid Response](/card/08031) form a perfect loop. When [Phoenix](/card/33002) is is defeated, [Rapid Response](/card/08031) brings her back. Her enters play ability grabs [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010), which then gets back [Rapid Response](/card/08031) to play again. Once set up, this loop is only 4 ER (2 for TB and 2 for RR). All told, this nets 9 THW and a block ([Phoenix](/card/33002) thwarts twice for 4, TB thwarts 3, and [Utopia](/card/33020) will ready any character, but usually a 2 THW Cyclops). - [Pixie](/card/36017) forms another perfect loop with [Regroup](/card/19032). Play [Pixie](/card/36017) to add [Phoenix](/card/33002) to hand. Play [Phoenix](/card/33002) to get [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010). Play [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010) to get [Regroup](/card/19032). Play [Regroup](/card/19032) and do it again next turn after blocking with [Pixie](/card/36017) and/or [Phoenix](/card/33002). Usually this is a 12 ER combo, but it can be done all with just [Pixie](/card/36017) in hand and the relevant cards in the discard: 3 cards get tutored, both allies are discounted by [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018), [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) plays [Pixie](/card/36017). All of a sudden, very affordable with any of the resources and draw effects this deck packs. If not needing a full loop, [Pixie](/card/36017) can grab any ally other than [Phoenix](/card/33002) as well, since at least three times per deck cycle just drawing into [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010) can lead to a [Pixie](/card/36017)-[Regroup](/card/19032). Loop de looping every turn is far from necessary, but recognizing the opportunity to enter into the middle for a partial loop can be important. Passing up a [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010) loop is okay when there are 3 chances per deck cycle, and [Phoenix](/card/33002) (or [Pixie](/card/36017) into [Phoenix](/card/33002)) can start the loop up at any time. Inserting [Beast](/card/33011) into the [Pixie](/card/36017) loop or using [Rapid Response](/card/08031) on him can generate the resources needed to play [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010) for instance. Here are some other interesting, but minor, [Rapid Response](/card/08031) interactions: - [Blindfold](/card/33014) lets you take your pick between three encounter cards. [Blindfold](/card/33014) enters play in the hero phase, looks at the top 5, chumps in the villain phase, comes back in and looks at the top 5 again. Any of the encounter cards from the first viewing in places 2-4 are accessible depending on which two cards she discards. - [Mirage](/card/36015) or [Professor X](/card/32019) can stun a minion before it attacks when they chump the villain and are brought back by [Rapid Response](/card/08031) (though this is niche). Along the same lines, [Polaris](/card/32012) can give Cyclops tough mid-villain phase. - [Magik](/card/32042), [Sunfire](/card/35014), and [Pixie](/card/36017) do not trigger their effects off [Rapid Response](/card/08031) or TMMX unfortunately, but this makes them great candidates for [Regroup](/card/19032). Prioritizing which allies get chumped or overwritten for space based on which effect is most beneficial to duplicate and whether [Regroup](/card/19032) vs [Rapid Response](/card/08031) are in play, is critical to understanding how to cycle the allies around.
Thank you for reading! I hope this has been a good introduction to the new Leadership cards and a brand new 50-card strategy. Leave a comment below if you try out the deck!

name: Team Struck By Lightning
description_md:
Storm makes a great candidate for [Team Strike ](/card/32045) thanks to [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) giving everyone a +1 attack boost. This deck takes a little building up, but Storm's hero kit is versatile and powerful on its own, so she can handle things while you do it.

Key cards to get in play are [Storm's Cape](/card/36007), [Utopia](/card/33020), and ideally [Boot Camp](/card/13016) for best effect. [Forge](/card/36022) is amazing for finding Utopia and [The X-Jet](/card/32020).

Get these on the table along with [Combat Training](/card/01057), get your allies lined up, switch to [Thunderstorm](/card/36004), play [Team Strike](/card/32045) and zap some bad guys!

name: Wolverine - The aggressive protector
description_md: Wolverine might seem like the perfect character for aggression. Even tho he deals insane amounts of damage in aggression it's sometimes risky if you can't finish the villain in the first few turns. This build still deals high amounts of damage while healing up doing so. Give it a try and I would appreciate your feedback :)

name: Storm's Weather Machine of Doom
description_md:
With a little build up, Storm is even better at readying than [Captain America](/card/03001a), thanks to [Storm's Cape](/card/36007) and [Utopia](/card/33020) (not to mention [Professor X](/card/32019)). That makes her a prime candidate for [Repurpose](/card/31016)!

With her versatile hero kit and the damage control provided by [Energy Barrier](/card/05017), [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) and [Electrostatic Armor](/card/10031), you'll find that she can generally hold her own until you're ready to unleash a huge [Repurpose](/card/31016) damage blast- then use her hero ability and Cape to ready, and do it again! Then play an ally to trigger [Utopia](/card/33020), and do it again!

That's essentially it - like a weather machine of doom assembled by a tornado wielding mutant, it's not pretty, but boy does it work!

name: Cyclops- My Entire Personality Is 2-Cost Chump Blockers.
description_md:
https://tinderkit.com/generator/downloads/profile/2022-11-15/63e8720005db9d64fb2d5a8bddf4c437.png

2-Cost chump blockers.

That's all you need to know about me. I play 2-Cost chump blockers. Hobbies? 2-Cost chump blockers. Stance on climate change? 2-Cost chump blockers. Favorite Morgan Freeman movie? The Shawshank Redemption... AND 2-Cost chump blockers. What am I looking for on this app? Who knows, but what we do know is 2-Cost chump blockers.

A little more about me, and by me, I mean 2-Cost chump blockers. Sometimes I play stuff that is effectively a 2-Cost chump blocker if things go right, like [Beast](/card/33011) or [White Tiger](/card/21013). Sometimes I play something cheaper than a 2-Cost chump blocker but has a "drawback" whatever that means, I draw cards not backs. This includes the likes of [Blade](/card/21019) or [Ant-Man](/card/12011). Often times my 2-Cost chump blockers feel like getting me something extra, but [Forge](/card/36022) has to do this in a certain way so I keep things around him so that they get a sense of accomplishment, but these things can also help with 2-Cost chump blockers, which is a interest of mine. I keep Energy Genius and Strength to effectively work with my 2-Cost chump blockers, and often go to the [The Triskelion](/card/01073) , a place often enjoyed by 2-Cost chump blockers.

Anyway, I have a great date idea to Infiltrate a Museum, who wants to tag along?

name: Wolverine - Just a Flesh Wound
description_md: This build has been shredding Expert difficulties, and often times I find myself surprised it was over so quickly. Logan is healing for roughly 4 every turn with this, and I’ve gone from 1 hp to full in one turn that saved a really unlucky game against Magneto. Wolverine is the best there is at what he does, and what he does…is a healing build! This build that looks to show just how good Wolverine’s healing factor is while being able to dish out serious damage and thwart. [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016) feels like a card made for Logan, as he can almost always play it, and it makes those [Jubilé](/card/35003) turns that much more explosive…because…fireworks. [Powerful Punch](/card/32014) is usable for your claws during the villain phase. [Jocasta](/card/26013) will also grab a copy from the discard pile to keep swingin’. Adamantium [Hard Knocks](/card/19016) deserves a special nod as well as this card is often too expensive for other characters, but compliments Wolverine very well. Knocking out a minion on your turn will safeguard those precious hit points with a tough. The boys, aka [Multiple Man](/card/14012) are close buddies with Logan, blocking for the Canuck while he gets up and running and does what he does best. [Iron Fist](/card/09014) is a solid addition as well, but I like the boys turn one reliability. Once he’s up with [Endurance](/card/05023) and [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004) his health is 1 shy of the Hulk’s. [The Night Nurse](/card/09019) is not used for heals. Wolverine existing out heals her. She is used to discard status effects and keep the momentum berserker barraging at all times. Build notes: -[Momentum Shift](/card/09016) is a free 2 damage with claws, but I didn’t find it impactful enough to keep in, and this build has plenty of healing. -[Iron Fist](/card/09014) is a great choice for an ally, but my luck with him always drew multiple attacks and he had to immediately block after one attack. -[Brother Voodoo](/card/09012) is a strong ally to consider, as any attack event he pulls can be used with claws. -You can’t “take” damage while tough, so make sure to use your claws before Polaris or Hard Knocks triggers. If you have to, for whatever reason [The Night Nurse](/card/09019) can strip your tough for you to use it, but it’s less than ideal. Thanks so much for checking this out and be sure to ❤️ To heal my broken heart
reduzir scheme

name: A healthy Wolvie is a happy Wolvie!
description_md:
Wolverine's health is purchasing power, so why not capitalize on that? 

A brief overview:

The allies included are for turns in which you just don't want to take any hits. Rockslide and the simply amazing Nightcrawler perform this function adequately as well as a fair 2 thwart in case you need it from Nightcrawler. 

The events are mostly attacks as that is Wolvie's bread and butter. The clutch is where the other event types come in. [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016) is fantastic, as it heals Wolvie and readies him! [Momentum Shift](/card/09016) is a free 2 damage! Take 2 dmg and exhaust Wolverine's Claws to pay for it, then heal that 2 dmg right back and deal two (as piercing)!! This kit has a little threat management built in with [True Grit](/card/18031). [First Hit](/card/18015) is always good on minions, [Hard Knocks](/card/19016) gives you a tough when defeating an enemy, also good for maintaining that health and help paying for all the carnage Wolvie deals out! Counter punch is there if you get the opportunity in conjunction with [Powerful Punch](/card/32014) which will count as a defense that you can pay for with Wolverine's Claws!  Endurance is there to give you breathing room and is essentially a free 3 cost attack resource as we use health to pay! 

I hope you have as much fun as I did, playing this deck!!

name: Cyclops Seeks Psionics With Cerebro
description_md: Use Psionics and Cerebro to find Phoenix as quickly as possible. Recur Phoenix to bring Full Blast or whatever is needed at the time back from discard pile. Professor X and Psylocke confuse which enables flipping to alter-ego. Best results occurred when I hit Cerebro or Forge in my opener, so I would suggest mulligan for those two. Lightly tested on Mojo scenarios, so I will probably continue to refine. That said, it was very effective solo.

name: Storm - Raining on Spiral's Parade
description_md:
Spiral gives you very few opportunities to damage her or thwart her main scheme, so this deck was designed to maximize Storm's effectiveness when she's cornered.

I've won against Expert Spiral with this deck, but I'm sure it could be refined further.

name: Captain Marvel - Infinity Avengers Allies in play
description_md:
Mazo muy podereso con recursos y aliados vengadores casi infinitos. Para empezar a jugar y poder ganar casi cualquier escenario en normal o experto sin demasiada dificultad.
El plan de este mazo es basicamente ir sacando desde el principio aliados para defenderte de los ataques villanos gracias a los multiples recursos con los que cuenta capitana. Es importante montar en mesa cuanto antes [Poderosos Vengadores](/card/21015) para que todos tus aliados ataquen y intervegan con +1 y [Torre de los Vengadores](/card/03024) para poder juntarte con hasta 5 aliados (incluyendo aguijon). Nick furia es el único aliado no vengador, esta para utilizarlo en momentos puntuales, pero si te apetece puedes cambiarlo por otro vengador que te guste.

name: Phoenix always Unleashed
description_md:
After some setup in restrained mode, go and stay unleashed to crucify the villain, having the S.H.I.E.L.D. as a backup to contain as much as possible a catastrophic situation.

---

**To avoid very bad encounter cards:**
 - Blindfold
 - Global Logistics (thanks to Monica Chang, Surveillance Team, Field Agent, Helicarrier)
 - Spycraft (thanks to Coulson)

**As much threat control as possible to go/stay easily in A.E. form:**
 - Homeland Intervention
 - Surveillance Team

**Combos:**
 - Daredevil + Honorary X-Men + Mission Training + X-Mansion
 - Marvel Girl + Mission Training + X-Mansion
 - Weapon X + White Hot Room

name: Wolver’heal
description_md:
Hello ! 

For my first try with Wolwie, i’ve tried to find the real nature of this hero. 

Well, one thing was obvious : HP are ressources. So, i’ve decided to maximize Wolwerine’s HP. 

Endurance / Honorary x-men / Adamantium skeleton are the key, and up your health to 18.

You don’t have to defend, just heal with your hero hability, first aid, what doesn’t kill me, x-mansion, night nurse, med team, moment up shift and regenerative healing ( master piece, go for it with Weapon X / Logan’d cabin and deft focus ! )  …

Your allies are principally here to help with scheme. Xavier is really good to give you some time in AE, confusing the villain or letting you counter twice. Polaris give you some time with the Tough status, and Diablo is a life savior if necessary. 

Have fun with this deck, i get some myself !! Wolverine just can’t die !

name: Storm-gression
description_md:
# Storm

This is a nice bursty deck which can handle minions, and dole out the damage to take down the villain. Storm does very well at controlling the table through her weather effects. Clear skies will clear negative status effects, keeping everyone at the table in the fight ready to thwart or damage deal as needed. Threat can be handled through Hurricane, and Thunderstorm can boost the attack of everyone at the table. Blizzard is great to mitigate damage taken by one, and blank a minions text box. 

## Learning Curve

Knowing when to use which effect comes with practice, but once you understand it, it is very satisfying. 

### TESTED

This deck was used alongside a player using Colossus in Justice, and we were fully capable of taking on and defeating Expert Ronan. So try it out, and have a blast!

name: Spider-Woman loves Havok
description_md:
the idea is play [Havok](/card/36014) and keep him swinging big with [Inspired](/card/01074) and [Danger Room Training](/card/33015), and reading him with [Command Team](/card/23016), we can control the encounter deck with [Jessica Drew](/card/04031b) action, [Global Logistics](/card/27043), making sure he will get the lowest amount of boost icons ([consequential]) until you are ready to swing big and bring him back with [Rapid Response](/card/08031).
To make sure you will get this combo, [Agent Coulson](/card/08011) can bring [Rapid Response](/card/08031) to the table and [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) will help you drawing lots of cards.

as the majority of the cards are quite cheap, i opted to get the majority of the cards permanently on the table, thinning the deck and finding all of [Spider-Woman](/card/04031a) aspect events. try to not use the allies to chum block will also help on this. =)

Let me know if anything does not make sense and how it can be improved. 
Thanks

description_md: First try at a Wolverine Justice deck (first try at any deck to be transparent ;) ), based on [Wolverine's Claws](/card/35002), and his ability to pay attack events with hit points.
