name: Along Came a Spider (SOLO/EXPERT)
description_md:
Along Came a Spider

Wins (Expert): Rhino / Klaw / Ultron / Crossbones

------------------------------------------------------------------- Spiderwoman has probably the best of each aspect and at the lowest cost in her deck. For DEFENSE she has [Contaminant Immunity](/card/04037), for LEADERSHIP she has perhaps the best card in the game, [Pheromones](/card/04036), for JUSTICE she has [Inconspicuous](/card/04038), and for AGGRESSION she uses [Venom Blast](/card/04035). That is to say, since she has two copies of each of them, eight of his fifteen cards (more than half) are extraordinarily good.

(The best Marvel Champions card. If you get both of them in a row... use one and try to keep the other in hand!)

To top it off, [Jessica's Drew's Apartment](/card/04034) will allow you in your Alter Ego form to easily choose and draw a card, since ¾ parts of this deck are ASPECT cards. And finally, with her two [Finesse](/card/04033) she can generate any two resources each turn.

(Whenever you can, try to start the game with this card in hand.... it's your robbery insurance!)

But her abilities are also impressive. For each ASPECT card of a different type played in her turn, her three BASIC STATISTICS of ATTACK/INTERVENTION/DEFENSE increase by 1 unit. That is, if she plays one card of the four ASPECTS available, this heroine can reach 5/5/5. Although most likely, given that another of Spiderwoman's characteristics is to be able to complete her deck with cards of two different ASPECTS (in the same proportion), is that she usually becomes 3/3/3.

Wait, we're not done yet! Her alter ego is able to see the top card of any deck, so she can predict the value of the next card of the Villain's increase, or know what is the type of resource of the first card of her deck. This makes it the most solid option to have [Hulk](/card/01050) as an ally, since, for a very low cost, it will not only protect you from attacks with its 5 health, but it will also be able to eliminate small minions or damage an enemy by 5 in a safe way.

( Thanks to Spiderwoman... Hulk no longer behaves like an idiot... randomly!)

In short, all of her cards, with the exception of the decent [Self-Propelled Glide](/card/04039), are incredible. Therefore, when it comes to the STARTING HAND we should look to at least have a copy of [Pheromones](/card/04036), [Jessica's Drew's Apartment](/card/04034), or [Finesse](/card/04033). So, how to complement her spectacular deck? Best to start by helping her with a bunch of low-cost allies with a good attack, since, unfortunately, due to its high cost, her ally [Captain Marvel](/card/04032), which can deal 6 damage or remove 6 threat, as well as draw three cards, probably won't see play. For example, [Marvel Boy](/card/21041) (which can avoid TOUGH status and RETALIATE, [Tigra](/card/01051) (which can remove small MINIONS without losing life), [Valkyrie](/card/06012) (which removes a small MINION as soon as it enters) or [Quake](/card/08012) (which can stay on the table to take down small MINIONS).

( It is better to have less famous and less expensive allies than Captain Marvel)

Then providing her with upgrades and supports such as the weapon [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019) so that she can do additional damage after a direct attack/event, or as [Under Surveillance](/card/06031), to keep the Main Scheme under control.

RULE: Can Finesse generate a resource to pay for an aspect card’s ability (such as Jarnbjorn)?

Yes. As long as the resource generated by Finesse is spent on an aspect card (its resource cost or a cost within that aspect card’s ability), Finesse can be used.

https://hallofheroeslcg.com/official-ffg-rulings/#spiderwoman

Therefore, [Finesse](/card/04033) serves to pay the cost of cards such as [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019), [Marvel Boy](/card/21041), [Valkyrie](/card/06012), [Concussive Blow](/card/05031) and [For Justice!](/card/01060).

(Will there be enough Finesse for everyone?)

And finally, filling the deck with ATTACK events for each ASPECT (AGGRESSION and INTERVENTION). Such as [Browbeat](/card/15028), [Piercing Strike](/card/04044), [Stealth Strike](/card/08013) or [Concussive Blow](/card/05031), and such as [For Justice!](/card/01060). Since EVENTS make up half of the deck, it will be easy to get one that fits the circumstances, or serves as a resource, when you make use of [Jessica's Drew's Apartment](/card/04034).

( If you think there are better events than these.... you're right!... please read the section on FINAL THOUGHTS.)

As for what's bad about this character, if you're playing SOLO, when her OBLIGATION appears it will always be much easier to exhaust her Alter Ego than to raise the Main Scheme three points (unless you count on how to deal with it). But the real challenge lies in her ARCHENEMY [The Viper](/card/04054). If it appears, you will only have one turn to deal with it and its 5 life points. Otherwise you can give the game up for lost (staying with only one card in hand in a deck with such a limited draw mechanic is synonymous of sure defeat). The rest of its negative cards are easy to counter unless you find yourself playing against [Legions of Hydra](/card/01180) module, where a card like [Hail Hydra!](/card/04057) can be a real problem at the most inopportune moment.

( With enemies like these... who needs friends!)

In short, if you want to know firsthand what the words versatility and flexibility mean, don't hesitate, Spiderwoman is the perfect girl. FINAL THOUGHTS: I have the bad habit of wanting to have closed decks so I don't swap cards every time I want to play with them. For this reason, having several being part of other heroes, I've included the debatable [Browbeat](/card/15028) for [Press the Advantage](/card/04043), [Piercing Strike](/card/04044) replacing [Drop Kick](/card/10014), and [Valkyrie](/card/06012) for [Spider-Girl](/card/04040).

(I remember them so much... especially when I lose...)

SOLO CONFRONTATIONS IN EXPERT MODE:

RHINO:

1. Make sure you have a copy of [Inconspicuous](/card/04038) or [For Justice!](/card/01060) in your starting hand. Otherwise, you must be able to play two different ASPECTS cards to be able to intervene with Spiderwoman. In either case, the first thing you must do is get rid of the Secondary Scheme [Breakin '& Takin'](/card/04038).

2. The second thing you must do is to play whenever you can a [Pheromones](/card/04036), or a [Contaminant Immunity](/card/04037), or a [Concussive Blow](/card/05031). If not, try to always have an ally on the table, such as [Hulk](/card/01050) or [Tigra](/card/01051). You have to prevent Rhino from attacking you in any way, either with your TOUGH status, leaving him STUNNED, staying in your Alter Ego form while he is CONFUSED, or blocking him with an Ally. Depending on the ENCOUNTER cards he gets, he can attack twice in the same turn, and if you don't protect yourself or don't have full health, it may be the end of the adventure.

3. Use since you can [Under Surveillance](/card/06031) on his Main Scheme.

4. If you change form at the right time, and once you have [Jessica's Drew's Apartment](/card/04034) and the two [Finesse](/card/04033), you should have the game under control.

5. Remember: Use [Jessica's Drew's Apartment](/card/04034) to search for EVENTS or other ASPECT cards that are helpful to you (you can use them as extra resources), attack with [Hulk](/card/01050) after you've checked that the first card in your deck has a fist as a resource, and in case you have to get rid of an UPGRADE or SUPPORT, if possible, do it first with your weapon [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019) and then [Jessica's Drew's Apartment](/card/04034), but try to always keep the [Finesse](/card/04033).

KLAW:

Let's not fool ourselves, Klaw in expert can be a real nightmare if you have not designed a deck to fight specifically against him, and cards in our possession as [Browbeat](/card/15028), are not especially helpful against his multiple minions, but also against the Villain himself if one of these minions plays GUARD. So be prepared to lose on several occasions. However, everything will go better if you follow the following tips as far as possible:

1. Since it starts with two secondary schemes and a minion it is advisable to start with a low cost intervention like [Inconspicuous](/card/04038) and an ally. The most important thing of this first turn is to eliminate the minion and the secondary scheme that accelerates the threat.

2. As Klaw increases in his turn the main scheme by 3 (at least), and because this scheme only has two phases, we must only stay in Alter Ego form when the Villain is confused, or when our health does not allow us to continue as Hero.

3. On the other hand, every time he attacks he discards two cards from his deck, so to avoid this we will have to try to stun him as many times as possible.

4. Klaw has 9 MINIONS in his deck, a third of which has more than 5 life and another third that appears with TOUGH status. This forces us to take all our low cost allies to the table, and to keep them to deal with them. Do not hesitate to use your three copies of [Piercing Strike](/card/04044) against the three [Armored Guard](/card/01120) in order to eliminate them with a single attack.

5. As always, our deck is aggressive, so we will have to continuously attack the Villain. The problem is that Klaw has a lot of life in any of his appearances. If in our second turn we still have not managed to damage him, things are not going very well. Therefore we must try to have the maximum number of cards in hand and play as many of them as possible, so it is almost mandatory to have [Finesse](/card/04033) and [Jessica's Drew's Apartment](/card/04034) on the table. This is even more important than the indispensable [Pheromones](/card/04036).

ULTRON:

1. With this Villain it is convenient to have the table clean of DRONES for several factors that in the long run play in our favor: The damage they cause us is lowered, the ability to advance the plan is reduced, Ultron's ability to heal or to appear as a threat in secondary plans is decreased, and we will know the cards in our deck that we do not have after being discarded because they have been converted into DRONS. In addition, we need to empty the table of DRONES before the Villain appears in his next stage, since in the latter stage the DRONES become much more dangerous (fortunately, when this happens, the DRONES will be generated only by ENCOUNTERS and not when Ultron attacks).

2. To combat the first phase of ULTRON a good option is to have [Hulk](/card/01050) and use it when you make sure, in your Alter Ego form, that you have a lightning bolt or a fist as a resource in the first card of your deck.

3. Without [Hulk](/card/01050) we are condemned to depend on [Pheromones](/card/04036) to defeat Ultron's first stage (his phase II), since while he is stunned he cannot activate his attack, and therefore, he does not execute his Forced Interrupt, having "only" to deal with his ENCOUNTER cards, his high HP, and his considerable basic ATTACK/PLANNING stats. Keep in mind that if he attacks on his first turn because he is not stunned, between him and his drones he can generate up to 9 damage (depending on the value of the INCREASE and whether we have eliminated the first DRON that comes into play due to the PLAN).

4. In the second stage of the Villain (phase III), our allies will be the ones who will help us to get rid of his multitudinous DRONES. Especially [Tigra](/card/01051), which is able to eliminate them and heal itself at the same time. A very good alternative is to use [Self-Propelled Glide](/card/04039) whenever possible to clear DRONES.

CROSSBONES:

1. This combat becomes very complicated, if not impossible, depending on the randomness of the ENCOUNTER cards, especially if the Secondary Scheme [Legions of Hydra](/card/01180) appears. For this reason, the best strategy is to focus on aggression and not on plan intervention. 2. Don't spend resources on eliminating his weapons or removing threats from the main schemes unless you have nothing better to do. Focus on hurting him. However, you should remove secondary schemes that cause you to discard more encounter cards, and remove threats only for the purpose of boosting your basic attack or gaining a turn in time. 3. Try starting with [Jessica's Drew's Apartment](/card/04034), some of the [Pheromones](/card/04036), a low-cost ally like [Hulk](/card/01050) to defend yourself, with [Under Surveillance](/card/06031), or with a [Finesse](/card/04033). The latter is essential to use in some turns to maximize the use of cards. It is almost impossible to beat the game without having used [Finesse](/card/04033) at least once, but it is possible to win without using [Pheromones](/card/04036) or [Jessica's Drew's Apartment](/card/04034). 4. If none of this adds up, then you really need to focus on having the resources that will allow you to take out his experimental weapons. All of them, except for his [Laser Rifle](/card/04072), can cause you problems, but especially the [Power Gauntlets](/card/04074). 5. While you shouldn't spend too much effort keeping his Main Scheme at bay, try to make good use of Under [Under Surveillance](/card/06031) in one of his three phases to give yourself an extra turn of time. 6. With the limited card draw of this deck, you should take advantage of both [Pheromones](/card/04036) to alternate to forms where their activation is useless due to being Confused or Stunned. 7. This is not a game that can be won in the long run. If the turns go by without being able to lower the Villain's life level, you will be sentencing yourself to a sure defeat, so try to risk as much as possible.

name: The Claw that Broke the Camel's Back
description_md: So...it's been a while! I havn't properly played Champs for sometime, had a bit of a hiatus from the game due to over saturation of games but decided to keep collecting everything. What was enough though to bring me back? My beloved X-Men. They were the reason I got into comic books as a kid, so to finally get them in MC, well, it was enough to get me back! I've played the 4 heroes that came out initially with Mutant Genesis but was really excited when Wolverine and Storm came out (I don't know how I'll contain myself when my all-time fave hero, Gambit) is released). That said, Wolverine intrigued me immensely; he's obviously crazy good with Aggression but I'm a big fan of the Protection aspect and wanted to see what he could do. It's probably my favourite of the 4 aspects currently, especially now that it's not just the obvious and original 'defend, ready, defend again'. There's allsorts of cool tricks these days. **Deck basis and Hero cards:** Having played Iron Man Protection for a good while beforehand, I thought it would be cool to utilise Wolverine's natural attacking abilities and add to them. The idea of the deck is for Logan to either deflect villain damage via Tough status cards or take the hits and lean into his naturally high Recovery stat (as well as various healing cards such as [Regenerative Healing](/card/35012)). [Wolverine's Claws](/card/35002) are a fantastic tool that can use his HP to pay for some of the pricier cards in the deck. Between [Endurance](/card/36026) and [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004) he shouldn't be wanting for health at all. **Protection:** I decided to forgo any sort of Defence card. Though the allies can be used to chump block for other players if needs be, this deck is more about using the Aspect cards to boost what Wolverine does best; hit things, and hit them hard. The allies are there mainly to chump for Wolvie, be it havingmultiple chumps on the board via [Multiple Man](/card/14012), or helping to dodge the damage full stop via the effects of [Polaris](/card/32012) or [Nightcrawler](/card/32011)'s cards (though the later I've found occasionally I'm struggling for resources so I'll keep testing him out) . [Brother Voodoo](/card/09012) is there to help us find some of the events which fuel the deck. There are then plenty of events in the deck to take the fight to the enemy; [Tackle](/card/05015) can give us a reprieve from Villain attacks, whilst letting us stay in Hero mode a turn longer. [Powerful Punch](/card/32014) can potentially take out an enemy before they are able to harm Wolverine. [Hard Knocks](/card/19016) might not be able to be used particularly well against certain minion-light Villains and it's pretty expensive to play but it works beautifully in this deck when it can go off, and if all else fails can at least provide resources for [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016). That card is particularly good in Solo, as it can heal Logan up but also give him a chance to a double basic Thwart action (this alongside [Track by Scent](/card/35011) means he isn't too shabby at keeping threat down, especially as the deck gives him more opportunity to stay in Hero mode longer). **Basic:** The deck is pretty light on Basic cards; however both used are really helpful for Wolverine. [Endurance](/card/36026) boosts his HP to a respectable 13 (or 14 with [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004) out), which will help him stay in hero mode longer but also fuel his deck via his Claws. [Professor X](/card/32019) is a great ally, with his 3 Thwart helping deal with any pesky schemes but also Stun/Confuse the Villain to give Logan a chance to flip one turn to Heal up without adding further Threat to the main scheme. Wolverine has only added to the strong core of X-Men heroes so far (the only one I havn't been quite so enthused with is Phoenix, sadly) and he's pretty impressive with any of the 4 aspects. I've only played him against the Core Set and Mutant Genesis Villains but this deck has been very strong against them all. This deck can work well in Solo, and I've played it in both 1P and 2P paired with a Storm Justice deck. It might rush as quickly as Aggression builds but it also has longevity should things not go accordingly to plan. Great to be back, and look forward to trying out some of the heroes from the last couple of Waves I havn't had chance to use yet! Got me some catching up to do.

name: Storm: Calling All X-Men
description_md:
The main crux of this deck is to get [Utopia](/card/33020) out to increase your ally limit so you can always keep [Gentle](/card/36016) , [Havok](/card/36014) , and [Longshot](/card/35033) on the table with training upgrades while constantly cycling through the other allies in the deck in order to use their "when played"/"played from hand" abilities. Between ["To Me, My X-Men!"](/card/36020) and [Cerebro](/card/34022) you should be able to dig out allies to put on the board, [X-Mansion](/card/32049) can help keep the ones you want to stick around healthy, and [Danger Room](/card/33021) can make sure they get [Danger Room Training](/card/33015) when you do put them into play.

If you don't want to run 42 cards (understandable), [Mass Attack](/card/21016) can be dropped. It's in there as a "one of" mostly to take advantage of the combination of Storm's [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) weather support's +1ATK to all characters, and Danger Room Training on the three allies you want to stick around. If everything lines up right, you're looking at a 16 damage play off of just that card. And if you have a [Band Together](/card/21018) in hand, you've basically just spent two cards for it, which feels really good. If you want to get down to a 40 card deck, you could also lose a [Game Time](/card/33022) or possibly even [Mirage](/card/36015).

name: Mixed Precipitation
description_md:
This is a deck I'm really coming to enjoy based on it's balance of threat and damage.

4 of your 5 allies double dip to do damage and remove threat at the same time.  

The plan is to get [Honorary X-Men](/card/33035) and [Mission Training](/card/34016) onto [Daredevil](/card/01058), [Jack Flag](/card/20011), and [Wiccan](/card/15011).  The extra health makes them very efficient investments.  That payoff gets nuts with [Game Time](/card/33022).

[Marvel Girl](/card/34015) has a similar damage/threat thing going but with the innate X-men trait she will provide a ready via [Utopia](/card/33020).  [Forge](/card/36022) also provides that ready, but he'll also accelerate your build up for X-Jet, Utopia, and X-Mansion too.

Furthermore, [Command Center](/card/35032) and [Interrogation Room](/card/01063) also turn your thwarting into damage and vice versa.

Expect to block or tank a lot of hits to keep your ally investments in play.  [Endurance](/card/05023) and [Ororo's Garden](/card/36008) will keep your health up.  You've got plenty of threat removal to go to Alter-ego often.  That will also let you get even more heals for your allies via X-Mansion.

I hope we get another damage/threat combo ally in the Gambit pack.  Till then...Enjoy!

name: Wolverine Clears the Area
description_md:
Inspired by Wolverine's thwart event, "Track by Scent," which has a "Clear the Area" effect ("If this removes the last threat from that scheme"), I thought "What if I built a deck that benefits from keeping the main scheme at 0?"

3x Clear the Area helps keep the main scheme at 0.

3x Turn the Tide and 3x Pivotal Moment benefit from keeping the main scheme at 0. Normally, Pivotal Moment isn't worth it — yes, 5 damage, but it's villain-only and conditional. Well, we're confident on fulfilling the condition, and because of Wolverine's Claws, we can spend most of our hand clearing minions and threat, and still push damage by using Wolverine's Claws to play Pivotal Moment.

Chance Encounter is EXCELLENT for Wolverine, since it allows him to snap back high-value allies like Jubilee or Professor X, or search for Colossus to set up the Fastball Special.

Justice Served is a back-pocket ready, allowing Wolverine to stay loose and potentially thwart again for 2, attack for 2 or 3, or flip down and recover for 6.

Concussive Blow can be replaced with Stealth Strike if you're playing a steady or stalwart villain, but it sort of acts as a back-pocket confuse since Wolverine can play it for "free" with Wolverine's Claws (not getting the 3 damage, but reliably getting the confuse).

Focus on hitting a solid, conservative tempo, until you're ready to burst for the kill.

name: Storm Channels the Weather
description_md:
I designed this with a beginner in mind. maybe they won't play this deck, but if you are playing with them, then this deck should be an easy way to have quick turns without doing anything tricky. 

I like the idea of not having too many allies and sticking with only the hero-card events. This looks like it will play well with others by removing bad status cards, defending basic enemy hits to lower threat off the main, and dish out small damage to remove Tough from Rhino or Sand Man.

I hope this style of deck shiws off the hero deck well, but if it doesn't I will begin to lean into that foundational premise moving forward with deck building beginner-friendly showcase decks.

name: Veneno por Compasión - Venom and Old Lace
description_md:
Veneno por Compasión - Venom and Old Lace

Veneno no se anda por las ramas y hace uso de todos sus recursos para derrotar a los villanos a base de infringirles daño con sus propias manos. Para ello cuenta con tres poderosas ARMAS, el Multicañón/[Multi-Gun](/card/20008) y dos Pistola de Veneno/[Venom's Pistol](/card/20010).

(Sólo se pueden tener en juego dos mejoras restringidas, pero... ¡el simbionte puede tener hasta tres!)

La primera, el Multicañón/[Multi-Gun](/card/20008), es una auténtica navaja suiza capaz tanto de dañar ligeramente a uno o varios enemigos como de eliminar amenaza en cada turno. Por otro lado, las Pistola de Veneno/[Venom's Pistol](/card/20010) le permiten aumentar su más que competentes estadísticas básicas 1/2/2 de Ataque/Intervención/Defensa, pasando a convertirse en cada turno en un formidable 3/4/4 cuando se hace con ambas. Veneno empieza la batalla contando siempre con una de estas ARMAS, pero Armas a Punto/[Locked and Loaded](/card/20004) le permite encontrar a coste 0 otra (preferiblemente el Multicañón/[Multi-Gun](/card/20008)) por lo que no está nada mal disponer de este EVENTO en la mano inicial de cartas.

(¡No te olvides de dejarla en tu mano inicial!)

Pero eso no es todo, porque su ataque básico puede llegar a tener un valor de 5 de daño, ¡en cada turno!, si a todo lo anterior le añadimos el Entrenamiento de Combate/[Combat Training](/card/01057). De esta forma, al usar Disparo en Movimiento[Run and Gun](/card/20005) (también puede usarse para quitar amenaza después de atacar) podría atacar de nuevo por otros 5 de daño, e incluso alcanzar de forma puntual entre 7 y 11 de daño si adjuntamos además varios Golpe Diestro/[Skilled Strike](/card/09037) a coste cero. Es decir, con la combinación adecuada de cartas podría hacer 16 puntos de daño sólo con su ataque básico. Un señor puñetazo en toda regla (en la cara del Villano mejor).

(¡Reúne estas tres cartas y empieza a repartir galletas!)

Y por si todo esto fuera poco, el Proyecto Renacimiento 2.0/[Project Rebirth 2.0](/card/20007) otorga a Veneno un poder de recuperación brutal, ya que durante el turno que pasa a su forma de Alter Ego recupera 3 de vida con el Proyecto y otros 4 usando su estadística básica de recuperación, pero en el siguiente turno, antes de convertirse en Venom, el proyecto le otorga otros 3 puntos de vida. En total, ¡se puede recuperar de 10 puntos de daño cuando su vida es de doce!. Por este motivo cuenta con Aguante/[Endurance](/card/05023), que aumenta en 3 puntos su vida y permite sacar un mayor provecho de esta circunstancia.

(¡Consigue estas dos cartas y tendrás más vidas que un gato!)

¡Pero aún hay más! En vez de lo anterior, el Proyecto Renacimiento 2.0/[Project Rebirth 2.0](/card/20007) permite robar una carta, y esto junto al Sentido Arácnido/[Spider-Sense](/card/20009), que se activa cuando el Villano ataca, son la mejor manera de obtener cartas extra. Esto la convierte en una de las mejores cartas a tener en la mano inicial.

(No es el sentido arácnido de Spiderman pero... ¡tampoco está tan mal!)

Veneno tiene también la ayuda de aliados que utiliza para eliminar amenazas, para lidiar con los esbirros enemigos mientras él se enfoca en provocar al Villano el máximo dolor, e incluso para defenderse de los ataques, eso si, a costa de utilizarlos a modo de escudo. Por este motivo cuenta con la presencia de Martinex/[Martinex](/card/21065), que a Veneno le cuesta muy poco poner en juego, de Vigor/[Brawn](/card/10011), que hace daño y elimina amenazas de forma simultánea (ideal para eliminar estados DURO en los enemigos), de Spiderman/[Spider-Man](/card/13019), que nada más llegar ejecuta un golpe o reduce una amenaza, y de la incombustible Pájaro Burlón/[Mockingbird](/card/01083), que le permite permanecer un turno como héroe sin recibir daño por parte del Villano (pues lo aturde).

(A Veneno le gusta la carnicería, por eso tiene... ¡su propia carne de cañón!)

Veneno puede además aturdir al Villano de otras formas, mediante la Patada Doble Voladora/[Drop Kick](/card/10014) o mediante sus Tentáculos Constrictores/[Gasping Tendrils](/card/20003), que detienen además el ataque del Villano. Por otra parte, también tiene la posibilidad de confundir al Villano (para poder permanecer con tranquilidad en la forma de Alter Ego) estando Tras las Líneas Enemigas/[Behind Enemy Lines](/card/20002).

(Aturde, confunde, quita amenazas, evita ataques y hace daño... ¡no hay otro superhéroe igual!)

Además cuenta con varias formas de hacer 5 puntos de daño, a través de su Ataque Feroz/[Savage Attack](/card/20006), del Gancho/[Uppercut](/card/01054), cuyo recurso en forma de puño puede usarse para potenciar el efecto de otras cartas, y mediante la Lluvia de Balas/[Fusillade](/card/20026), aunque esta última necesita la presencia de un ARMA.

(¡Cuando Veneno se pone al trabajo, reparte más que los de Amazon!)

Pero la principal característica de Veneno es que en su forma de héroe, la habilidad Unión Simbiótica le permite rebajar el coste de cualquier carta en 1 (eso si, recibiendo 1 punto de daño), o sacarle todo el potencial a cartas como Ataque Feroz/[Savage Attack](/card/20006), Tentáculos Constrictores/[Gasping Tendrils](/card/20003), Tras las Líneas Enemigas/[Behind Enemies Lines](/card/20002), y Patada Doble Voladora/[Drop Kick](/card/10014). Para aprovechar al máximo esta última, la Patada Doble Voladora/[Drop Kick](/card/10014), a lo largo de la batalla Veneno puede hacerse con la Destreza Marcial/[Martial Prowess](/card/10018). Además, el Helitransporte/[Helicarrier](/card/01092), le permitirá abaratar los costes de todas estas cartas que requieren un recurso extra para activarse por completo, o de cualquier otra carta del mazo.

(¡Son como la calderilla, no son indispensables pero siempre vienen muy bien!)

NOTA: Helitransporte/[Helicarrier](/card/01092), al ser una acción que sólo puede activarse en la fase del héroe, y Destreza Marcial/[Martial Prowess](/card/10018), al generar un recurso destinado a un evento de ataque, no funcionan para abaratar el coste o pagar el recurso (puño) extra de los Tentáculos Constrictores/[Gasping Tendrils](/card/20003). Así que, visto lo visto, con 8 cartas provocando 5 de daño, otras tres haciendo 4, y varias otras con las que potenciar su ataque básico, déjate atrapar por el simbionte y ¡empieza a dar caza a tus enemigos!. PENSAMIENTOS FINALES: Una alternativa en los aliados puede ser cambiar Martinex/[Martinex](/card/21065), que puede llegar a hacer 4 de daño/intervención con los 2 recursos que cuesta, por Blade/[Blade](/card/21019), que requiere de 3 recursos para hacer 6 de daño o 3 de intervención. Otra opción a tener en cuenta sería usar Golpetazo/[Mean Swing](/card/06015) en vez de Golpe Diestro/[Skilled Strike](/card/09037), ambos con el mismo coste, pero tiene la desventaja de que requiere agotar un arma. Esta carta es más conveniente en mazos donde se usan armas que no requieren ser agotadas para sacar un beneficio de ellas, como Granada de Pulsos/[Pulse Grenade](/card/17023) o Jarnbjorn/[Jarnbjorn](/card/06019), que podrían añadirse en vez del Entrenamiento de Combate/[Combat Training](/card/01057). Esta última, más efectiva, supondría que una de las Pistola de Veneno/[Venom's Pistol](/card/20010) nunca vería juego, ya que Venom puede usar hasta 3 armas restringidas (y habría 4 en el mazo), aunque se puede paliar si se incluye en el mismo una Pistolera de Cinto/[Side Holster](/card/20021) a coste cero.

name: Threat Cleaning Huracan Storm

name: Cyclops - Trained X-Men
description_md:
The core card in this deck is Danger Room. My strategy is to mulligan aggressively for Danger Room and get it onto the field as quickly as possible. I'll typically stay in alter-ego the first round just to get the higher hand size and use Constant Training twice before flipping. Being able to use Danger Room to buff your allies with Danger Room Training is huge, especially with X-Mansion and Game Time that lets you heal your allies. Team Training is also a great buff that keeps your allies on the table throughout the game. I use two copies of Rapid Response in case I need an ally to defend, but I typically use Cyclops to defend. Rapid Response and Game Time are also Tactics cards that can be searched for using Constant Training.

Cerebro is great as I am consistently hitting allies with there being 10 total allies in the deck. However, it gets even better with Phoenix on the field. By far the best ally in this deck is Wolverine. He hits hard, heals himself, and has piercing. He is typically the target for X-Mansion and Game Time, and is responsible for most of the damage output in the deck. Besides him, the other allies I focus on are Beast, Phoenix, Professor X, Angel, Colossus, and Polaris. Banshee, Blindfold, and Nightcrawler will probably be the first to get cut when more X-Men get released.

I have only played this deck in Standard and Solo mode, so it hasn't been tested against more challenging scenarios, but I'd imagine it would hold its own.

This deck will get even better with Forge, as he'll be able to tutor for the key support cards in the deck. Uncanny X-Men will be a great replacement for Team Training, and "To me, My X-Men!" will definitely find a home in here somewhere.

This deck is a blast and it feels more like an X-Men deck than just a Cyclops deck.

name: It's Raining (Multiple) Men!
description_md:
It's raining men. [Multiple Men](/card/14012)! 3x [Multiple Man](/card/14012) + [Iron Fist](/card/09014) + [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) = 14 damage and 6 blocks for 10 total resources. This is _extremely_ good value! This deck started out life as a [Repurpose](/card/31016) deck but, with allies like these and cards like [Lightning Bolt](/card/02044), Storm has all the tools she needs to conquer her enemies. At the time of posting, this deck has defeated annihilated several villains including: - Expert Magneto - Expert Venom Goblin - Expert Loki
**If you like this deck, feel free to give it a ❤ ! Thank you!**
This deck is all about the electrifying damage Storm gets from allies thanks to [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) alongside Protection’s ability to shore up her poor starting defense. While the +1 from [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) might not sound like much, it _really_ adds up across a whole game - especially when it’s raining [Multiple Men](/card/14012)! While Aggression and Leadership can get more damage out of their allies, the Protection allies handle Storm’s defense so efficiently that she’s free to go wild and unleash the full wrath of the elements!
#### **Storm Herself**
Storm fronts the band. And to understand what her bandmates (allies) bring, you have to understand what she already does. [Thunderstorm](/card/36004)'s bonus also applies to Storm, so with [Storm's Cape](/card/36007) she is potentially bringing 6 damage from two basic attacks every turn - plus 2 damage from [Thunderstorm](/card/36004)'s special! [Blast of Wind](/card/36013) decimates minions when you’re swarmed and is still a great play when there’s only one, and [Lightning Bolt](/card/02044) is just overwhelmingly good. When it comes to thwarting, [Hurricane](/card/36003) has you covered. Swap to it, trigger it again with [Torrential Rain](/card/36010) (she has 3 copies!), trigger it again with [Blast of Wind](/card/36013), then her [Crown](/card/36006)/[Cape](/card/36007) combo also opens up a potential of 4 threat removal every turn. With a potential of 5 damage or 3 threat removal on turn 1, and potentially 8 damage and 6 threat removal with her [Crown](/card/36006)/[Cape](/card/36007) with upgrades - all just from her hero card/weathers - you’re ready to deal with almost anything the encounter deck throws at you before playing a single card in your hand. This means her only real weakness is her early defense, starting with just 1 DEF and 10 hp. And that’s why you need to call on Storm's power to make it rain! Not [Torrential Rain](/card/36010), but to make it rain [Multiple Men](/card/14012)!
#### **Thunderstruck Allies**
[Multiple Man](/card/14012) is the reason behind the deck’s name and the optimal Turn 1 play. With [Thunderstorm](/card/36004), he brings 6 damage and blocks 3 villain attacks for the cost of 5 effective resources (4-cost + the card itself). Even if you draw two [Multiple Men](/card/14012) in your opening, it’s hard to beat this kind of value. A Tough/Stun/chump block is usually valued at 2 effective resources. Damage can vary, but ideally 2 damage is worth 1 resource such as [Skilled Strike](/card/09037) or [Swinging Web Kick](/card/01005). In other words, 6 damage and 3 blocks for 5 resources is an insanely good deal - almost half the cost it should be! You only really have one window to play [Multiple Man](/card/14012) per deck pass as, once one is in the discard pile, his worth is drastically reduced. Two Multiple Men are still good, but why put out two when you could have had three? Make! It! Rain! [Iron Fist](/card/09014) comes in next, providing 8 damage and 3 blocks for 5 effective resources. While he provides more total damage than [Multiple Man](/card/14012), his damage is less valuable because - if you want to use his blocks (stuns) efficiently - you have to hit the villain, and thus he doesn’t offer any minion control. Yet, under the pressure of your other [Thunderstorm](/card/36004)-boosted allies, putting 8 damage on the villain really helps push the game to a close. - [Polaris](/card/32012) hits 6 damage and 2 blocks for just 4 effective resources. - [Colossus](/card/35021) hits 8 damage and 1 block OR 4 damage and 2 blocks for 4 resources. - [Angel](/card/33019) hits 6 damage and 1 block for 3 effective resources. [Brother Voodoo](/card/09012) doesn’t bring as much damage, but he does provide efficient thwarting to free you up to focus on damage - and, most importantly, he helps you find the perfect event for whatever situation you’re faced with. [Professor X](/card/32019) doesn’t want to join in with the [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) shenanigans at all but offers so much value by controlling the villain. By blocking, then taking advantage of a confuse, he stops two activations and can thwart for 3 while he’s at it. And even if the villain is steady/stalwart, he can just ready you up for another 3 damage instead. Combining all these allies, you have a potential to block 14 villain activations per deck cycle. While you won’t actually hit that many in a deck pass, the point is you are effectively invincible behind them while they go crazy with boosted damage.
#### **Using your Allies + The Mulligan**
This deck can be a tempo deck or a control/build deck. It largely depends on your play style, but also the scenario and what cards you draw. Sometimes you find key upgrades early but less damage, and other times [Lightning Bolt](/card/02044) whispers sweetly in your ear and suddenly the villain is on their last legs! As mentioned, [Multiple Man](/card/14012) is ideal on Turn 1 against most scenarios. In solo, he provides three villain turns’ worth of blocks while providing great coverage against early minions. Although you won’t set up much during a Multiple Man start, you will have extremely efficient blocks ready to give you more value in your next few turns. Your mulligan priority is to find [Multiple Man](/card/14012). If you start with him, I would advise against a mulligan at all - you increase your chance not only to find another Multiple Man and lower his value, but find a good upgrade/support that you can’t afford to play alongside him. Otherwise, [Storm's Crown](/card/36006) is your most important upgrade followed by [Storm's Cape](/card/36007), [The X-Jet](/card/32020), [Helicarrier](/card/01092), and then [Deft Focus](/card/16024). After [Multiple Man](/card/14012), [Iron Fist](/card/09014) is your next best ally. He’s even good value against steady opponents! And then it’s [Polaris](/card/32012). Focus on playing these “three” allies every deck pass if possible - they give you 20 damage and 8 blocks for 14 effective resources. [Professor X](/card/32019) comes in next as another excellent play, especially on turns with a side scheme or if you’ve accumulated some threat on the main scheme. In the worst case, he’s still good value if you ram him into the villain since [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) gives him +1 ATK! This is by far the worst but most satisfying way to deal the final blow. [Colossus](/card/35021), [Angel](/card/33019), and [Brother Voodoo](/card/09012) are great but I wouldn’t recommend playing them over the others unless you also have a key upgrade/support in hand that you can only afford to play alongside them rather than a more expensive ally. But, in the absence of anything else vital, they are absolutely amazing plays. Allies make this deck what it is.
#### **Events, Upgrades and Supports**
Due to Storm’s high cost curve, you are sometimes inevitably left with a spare card in hand. This is where [Assess the Situation](/card/12033) and [Plan B](/card/27024) shine. If you have to be left with a card in hand, try to make sure it’s [Assess the Situation](/card/12033). [Assess the Situation](/card/12033) has no immediate value but sets you up your following turn nicely (and is also an excellent Turn 1 play alongside [Multiple Man](/card/14012)). I cannot overstate how good [Assess the Situation](/card/12033) is for Storm! [Plan B](/card/27024) speaks for itself - if your spare card isn’t [Assess the Situation](/card/12033), throw it into [Plan B](/card/27024) for bonus damage. This can also help eliminate minions or pop Toughs. While [Plan B](/card/27024) is your least vital upgrade/support, it’s still very good. [The X-Jet](/card/32020), [Helicarrier](/card/01092), and [Deft Focus](/card/16024) speak for themselves. Combined with [Storm's Crown](/card/36006), you can have 4 resource generators in play! While this is often excessive, having this many helps you find at least one early for major value through the rest of the game. And lastly, while these are the least valuable cards in the deck (Storm’s own hero events are just too good), [Hard Knocks](/card/19016) and [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016) provide great coverage. [Hard Knocks](/card/19016) comes in handy when you find yourself overwhelmed by minions and under pressure as an emergency damage option. Also, having another 3-cost attack is excellent against Venom Goblin’s Advanced Glider. And, if you do find yourself with an abundance of blocks when incorporating the Toughs you get from this card, you can start to use your allies’ last hp to attack! [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016) provides 2 healing and 3 damage while you are in the [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) weather. (Or 2 healing and 2 threat removal with [Storm's Crown](/card/36006).) While this value pales compared to your allies, this card is very flexible and offers you your only source of hero-form healing in the deck. It’s also helpful to ensure you can remove those pesky attachments/obligations that require you to exhaust.
#### **Alternative Cards**
As I mentioned at the start, this deck started out life as a [Repurpose](/card/31016) build! You can restore it by replacing 2x [Hard Knocks](/card/19016), 3x [Assess the Situation](/card/12033), 3x [Multiple Man](/card/14012), [Brother Voodoo](/card/09012) and [Plan B](/card/27024) with 3x [Repurpose](/card/31016), 3x [Energy Barrier](/card/05017), 1x [Plasma Pistol](/card/20022), [Utopia](/card/33020), [Nightcrawler](/card/32011) and [Forge](/card/36022). Personally, I found that Storm can do so much damage herself and with allies that it wasn’t necessary to rely on [Repurpose](/card/31016), especially given how little damage she takes with these allies. She just wasn’t triggering Energy Barrier (or, in earlier versions, Forcefield Generator). But it was still a fun and powerful deck! Against Venom Goblin, you can substitute 1x [Assess the Situation](/card/12033) for 1x [Hard Knocks](/card/19016) as extra insurance against that blasted Advanced Glider. Against stalwart enemies, you can replace [Iron Fist](/card/09014) with [Luke Cage](/card/01076).
**Good luck and have fun!** Special thanks to MegiDolaDyne for the initial idea to use [Multiple Man](/card/14012) with Storm, and special thanks to Cast-Iron-Pots for the deck's name!

name: Second Hand Destroyer
description_md:
So yeah how does it work? Why so many Cards?

Well im honest... if you play against an Enemy without Minions you can forget about this Deck.

With [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004) , [Combat Training](/card/01057) and [Hand Cannon](/card/16046) you will have a whooping 6 DMG with overkill... if you did exessive dmg it will be increased by [Follow Through](/card/16045) arround 3 times. 

Simple Maths, 3 HP Minion, 6 DMG with Basic attack, will hit the Villian for 3 + the increased exsessive dmg. Easy as that.

[Fluid Motion](/card/28016) will improve that and [Honed Technique](/card/28017) even more.
(You can use the Joker Ressource of [The X-Jet](/card/32020) to trigger the Blue Ressource)

What [Relentless Assault](/card/01053), [Into the Fray](/card/13013) and [No Quarter](/card/28013) will do and even combined with [Moment of Triumph](/card/12030) would do is something you can figgure out on your own i guess.

[Moment of Triumph](/card/12030) will keep you in Hero Mode longer to use [Berserker Frenzy](/card/35005) to gain even more Cards... and the moment you really need to switch to Alt Ego you [Hall of Heroes](/card/06017) will be filled to the brim.

name: Manic Pixie/Mirage Dream Girls
description_md: ------------------- #### **_Intro:_** ------- Apologies for the movie trope title! **[Star-Lord](/card/17001a)** will not being finding out who he really is through a lazily-written female character here. Instead, they'll all work together to kick the butt of any villain they come across! What this decks offers is the first time a **[Star-Lord](/card/17001a)** Leadership deck can reliably stun and confuse why still thwarting a ton, and dishing out loads of damage. ------ #### **_Card Combos:_** ----------- - When **[Mirage](/card/36015)** was previewed, my immediate thought was that **[Star-Lord](/card/17001a)** + **[Leader of the Guardians](/card/17009)** combo would give a stun on almost any villain not in Stage 3. When you add in **[Effective Leadership](/card/33018)** + **[Danger Room Training](/card/33015)** + **[Make the Call](/card/01071)**, you get your first reliable stun in Leadership no matter what the stage. - **[Pixie](/card/36017)**'s main use is to bring back **[Mirage](/card/36015)** for multiple stunning rounds. Before **[Leader of the Guardians](/card/17009)** is out, use **[Pixie](/card/36017)** to pull **[Forge](/card/36022)**, **[Beast](/card/33011)** or **[Professor X](/card/32019)**. Obviously, use all your **[Regroup](/card/19032)s** on **[Pixie](/card/36017)** whenever they come up. - If you have **[Danger Room](/card/33021)**, you can pull **[Danger Room Training](/card/33015)** to play on an ally. When you're in Hero form, you'll get a card from **[Knowhere](/card/17022)** and **[Guardians of the Galaxy](/card/22033)** if you play an X-Men ally, and an attachment. - **[Make the Call](/card/01071)** + **[Professor X](/card/32019)** means a reliable confuse to allow you to flip to AE to play Danger Room. - Use **[Forge](/card/36022)** to get out **[Danger Room](/card/33021)** then **[Utopia](/card/33020)**. If you have a **[Regroup](/card/19032)** around at the beginning of the game, use it so Forge can get out both in two rounds. - Use **[Beast](/card/33011)** to pull **[Effective Leadership](/card/33018)** any time **[Mirage](/card/36015)**, **[Colossus](/card/35021)**, **[Gentle](/card/36016)** or **[Storm](/card/36001a)** is in your hand. Otherwise, just pull a double resource. --------------------- #### **_Replacement/Additonal Cards:_** ---------------------- - **[Rapid Response](/card/08031)** works wonderfully with **[Mirage](/card/36015)** once you get her thwart up to 3. It's also fantastic for Beast and Forge. - Since you're flipping to AE a good bit, **[Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029)** works great as long as you can exhaust in AE to heal. - **[Band Together](/card/21018)** works amazingly with **[Beast](/card/33011)**, and gives you great late game resources overall. - **[Blaze of Glory](/card/17015)** was a late cut to this deck. The ready from **[Utopia](/card/33020)**, combined with the high damage and thwart of these allies makes it very powerful. I just already had 42 cards, and didn't want the 40 Card Police flashing their lights in the comment section. :) ------------------ #### **_Conclusion:_** -------------------------- **[Star-Lord](/card/17001a)** has always been my favorite hero to play in Leadership, and this X-Men deck shows how much card draw and versatility he can have. I hope you enjoy it as much as I have!

name: Rocket Raccoon Beast gets savage! Er... Salvage
description_md:
This one I've wanted to build for quite some time now!

Simple idea: have [Beast](/card/33011) bring you back [Salvage](/card/16033), much like I did before with Hulk ([Limitless Strength](/card/10007)) and Captain Marvel ([Energy Absorption](/card/01014)).

The usual combo: bring [Beast](/card/33011) into play or [Rapid Response](/card/08031) him back, take [Salvage](/card/16033), use it to put the best TECH on top of your deck.

Then draw it from "Murdered you!" or using [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091), [Nick Fury](/card/01084), [Ironheart](/card/13018), [Maria Hill](/card/01067), [Moon Girl](/card/28018) or [White Tiger](/card/04099). Most of those you can actually trigger from [Make the Call](/card/01071) too.


Stuns and confuses from [Professor X](/card/32019) and [Mockingbird](/card/01083), also prime targets for [Make the Call](/card/01071).

Benefit from the confused villain by returning to AE and use "Tinkering" on empty [Battery Pack](/card/16034)s, which the [Beast](/card/33011) - [Salvage](/card/16033) combo will get you back in no time! Of course refill your [Particle Cannon](/card/16036) like crazy and fire away!

[Flora and Fauna](/card/16020) + [Groot](/card/16047) for some ,more charges too.

Have fun!

name: Colossus (Live Build)
description_md:
Here is the Colossus Justice deck I built on-camera here: https://youtu.be/hCcrv2PYRAg

Watch my first play, vs Magneto, here: https://youtu.be/PuJZ3s-B7iA

Now that we've seen it play one game: if you were continuing to iterate on this deck, what would you change? What cards would you think about taking out, and which cards would you think about adding? What scenario should we take it up against next?

If you don't already own a particular card that's in this list, can you think of one that is in your card pool that might fulfill a similar purpose?

You might notice that this build is rather solo-focused. What would you change if you were playing this with a larger group? Would you find room for more thwart events? Which ones?

Once you've thought about it on your own, compare and contrast with my own thoughts so far: Even though Sonic Rifle didn't perform well in this game, I think it is a solid include (and, by extension, makes PoJ a solid include) because having many redundant sources of confuse is a great safety net for this deck to have. If we hadn't drawn both our Sonic Rifles turn one, and had seen our next copy a turn or two sooner than we drew Steel Fist(s), the game probably would have shaken out in the same general fashion.

After cutting it early, I think we flip enough that Cerebro is definitely worth including! Our training'd allies are pretty sticky. The same may be true of X-Mansion.

You could say that Power in all of Us might be solid because we are playing a bunch of basic cards, and you would be right, but frankly I am just a little bored of playing that card so I won't include it anytime soon XD.

name: Call in the Guardians - Groot Justice
description_md:
Still doing some testing on this deck, but so far it's been a lot of fun to play. It's handled solo Standard/Expert Rhino, and Standard Klaw with no issues, I'm going to keep trying harder villains and scenarios and make more tweaks, but here is how I've been playing it:

I tried to keep it as "Guardians" themed as I could, and with trying to keep growth counters and needing to flip to alter ego often I went with justice.

Key Setup: 
Best to try and get [Lashing Vines](/card/16009) (ready Groot after he uses a basic ability, especially after he defends an attack to limit growth counter removal), [Knowhere](/card/17022) (card draws after playing Allies), [Enhanced Awareness](/card/03034) (mental resources for boosted thwart events), and [Fertile Ground](/card/16007) (growth counter) out early. From there, any upgrades in the deck that can get out will only make things easier. 

Allies:
All Allies are Guardians, so you will get the bonus card draw from Knowhere once it's out. [Cosmo](/card/17020) is in there primarily as a low cost chump blocker, but with 1/2 the deck being made up of Event cards, I just call that when resolving his ability and hope for the best. [C.I.T.T.](/card/17021) is most beneficial for [Drax](/card/18019) and [Rocket Raccoon](/card/16019). If used with Drax, that's a potential 6 damage in one round to the main villain. If minions are out, using it with Rocket will take care of most and gaining overkill is a bonus. [Gamora](/card/19020)'s ability to discard to an event and add it to your hand will only help cycle through your deck and get useful events into your hand. 

Events:
[Crisis Averted](/card/15012) is in there mainly as a way to get yourself out of a pinch should you need it - otherwise, you can use it's mental resource to boost up [Multitasking](/card/15013) or [For Justice!](/card/01060). [Pivotal Moment](/card/18029) is great in early draws when you can get threat on the main scheme to 0. [Haymaker](/card/01087) is an oldie but a goodie, and helpful in this deck if Groot is exhausted. 

Resources:
With all allies, and important upgrades/supports being Basic, a copy of [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024) is included.

Supports:
All have been mentioned already, but [C.I.T.T.](/card/17021) is useful to ready Groot, or allies like Rocket and Drax. [Knowhere](/card/17022) for the card draw when playing any of the allies in the deck.

Upgrades:
[Deft Focus](/card/16024) helps with most of Groot's hero cards, Enhanced Awareness keeps mental resources on hand for boosting Crisis Averted, For Justice!, and Multitasking. [Heroic Intuition](/card/01065) to boost Groot's thwart stat - especially useful when [Entangling Vines](/card/16008) is in play as well.

I hope that helps explain some of the thought process behind the decisions I made.

name: Wolverine - Axe-Men
description_md: Wolverine is easily the best there is at what he does, and his weapon of choice when he’s doing it? [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019). This deck requires little setup and cranks Wolverine’s damage to 10, literally, as [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019) turns both of Logan’s 3 cost events, [Lunging Strike](/card/35010) and [Slice and Dice](/card/35009) into 10 damage events for 1/2 fist resources respectively. Although it costs an extra resource to achieve 10 with [Slice and Dice](/card/35009), it can’t be understated how strong this is, because that could easily clear 2 5 health minions in multiplayer. You could always spend 1 less for 5 damage on one attack, and 3 the next. Klaw learned the math when I OTK his stage 3 with two [Lunging Strike](/card/35010) and a basic attack while swinging the axe. What’s even better and more consistent is Wolverine’s favorite aggression card, [Clobber](/card/18012). For the low cost of 1er (and 2 health) you get 5 damage. That’s 1 cheaper than [Toe to Toe](/card/10015) and you didn’t even have to get punched in the face for it. And for the holy grail scenario*…4 minions on the board with 4 health or less, you with 4 extra fist resources in hand and [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019) out…I hope you kept your health up for this one because it’s time to unleash the real [Berserker Barrage](/card/35008). If you can survive 10 damage that’s 4 minions cleared and 8 damage to go wherever you please. Will this happen often? Absolutely not, but that’s why it’s theorycrafting! Now you may be saying, well that’s just one card…what if it’s on the bottom of your deck? This deck is stacked with fist resources, opening up the option to [Drop Kick](/card/10014). Now, while you can’t use your claws to get the precious kicker, you CAN use it on the event that you may draw from it. All these fist resource cards opens up the playing field for [Hulk](/card/01050). Now be warned, as the current deck does come with 7 mental resources, so you have a base 17.5% chance to just discard him, so you may want to swap him out if you don’t want to take the risk. Between 3 [Drop Kick](/card/10014) and 3 confuses [Psylocke](/card/35013) and [Professor X](/card/32019), you have some solid control at the same time as you are deleting enemies. For the anti hulk fans, you could consider [Weapon X](/card/35022) as you will have to flip down at some point or any ally you prefer, although I would try to lean for a fist resource ally if you can. Notes on the deck: - This deck is very rushdown heavy, but offers a good amount of crowd control with 3 stuns and confuses. [Psylocke](/card/35013) is almost always top priority when she enters your hand. - In multiplayer, pair this with a good thwarter or someone who can run interference for villain attacks to make sure your health is kept up. - playing true solo often, I found [Combat Training](/card/01057) not worth adding, as basic attacks aren’t common. So you may be wondering, why [Skilled Strike](/card/09037) then? It’s a fist resource that can still get it’s value from an axe swing, and also makes a big turn when [Jubilé](/card/35003) lets the sparks fly. - [Martial Prowess](/card/10018) may seem odd for a hero who doesn’t need help playing cards, but it does two things. It ensures [Drop Kick](/card/10014) gets the kicker AND frees up another fist resource when paying for cards outside of claws, boosting each attack by 2. - [Moment of Triumph](/card/12030) health recovery is factored before [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019), sadly. You should be able to to use it in between your [Berserker Barrage](/card/35008) - For scenarios with rough attachments *cough goblin glider* [Sunfire](/card/35014) is subbed in for [Machine Man](/card/26022). - Miles enter play bonus will almost always go to Thwart, giving you 2 allies that enter play with 3 thwart, bursting down side schemes. Since he’ll probably chump block the following villain turn that’s more than worth his inclusion. Plus, this deck can have a Spider-Man, Hulk, and Wolverine on the board! Give us a Ghost Riser ally FFG! (Yes I know it’s the wrong Spider-Man but it’s pretty close to their Fantastic 4) Thanks for checking this out! Leave a ❤️ if you can’t stop the Berserker Barrage!

name: Cyclops - Leader of X-Men
description_md:
This deck is built around using X-Men allies to dominate any encounter.

Uncanny  - 

I included 2 copies of [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018) as it is critical to helping get those allies out and with 1 it took me too long to obtain in a number of games. [Utopia](/card/33020) readying one x-men per turn as needed as the team assembles.

Training the X-Men - 

Included 3x [Danger Room Training](/card/33015) to get the most out of [Danger Room](/card/33021) once in play, and then the training, combined with [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018) make up to 3 allies 2HP stronger, All allies, but [Wolverine](/card/32041) in particular greatly benefits from this and with [X-Mansion](/card/32049) he will live all game smashing for 4 damage if played correctly (Use others to block)

Psionic ally pulling - 

I included 4 psionics (+ Phoenix making 5) and try to keep one of the psionic allies in play once I have [Cerebro](/card/34022) out to make sure I never miss when searching for an ally. I will likely remove 1 or 2 of the psionics once i get a better handle on the allies in play as I think 3-4 in total would be sufficient to keep one in play and encounter them in the deck often enough.

Resources - 

[Honorary X-Men](/card/33035) included so Scott can be considered an x-man when in alter-ego to use [The X-Jet](/card/32020) to help fund the operation.
Resource generation from [The X-Jet](/card/32020) and reduction from [Helicarrier](/card/01092) and [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) when in Hero form are further going to be critical to funding the operation. [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091) included, but hasn't made it on the table yet with Cyclops for me. 

Hope you enjoy as much as I do! I will update this after Rogue and Gambit are released.

name: Star-Lord - Smooth Talker, Hulk and Wolverine As One!
description_md: The idea behind this deck is to buff and abuse [Hulk](/card/01050) and [Wolverine](/card/32041)'s attack power. There are multiple ways to go about it: 1. Buff [Hulk](/card/01050) with [Energy Spear](/card/22032), [Sidearm](/card/23035), [Boot Camp](/card/13016) for a 7 atk ally. Same for [Wolverine](/card/32041), but you can attach him with "attack training", for up to 8 ATK. 2. You can simply use their attack OR use [As One!](/card/23032) to exhaust both for a 15 DMG, overkill attack! 3. If you plan on attacking with the Hulk, revert to AE and use "SMOOTH TALKER" to put a resource from your hand on top of the deck, making hulk a 7 + 2 DMG attacker. With 5 attacks like these (Hulk's HP), the game is pretty much over. Shouldn't be too risky with [Psylocke](/card/35013) and [Professor X](/card/32019) having your back with confuses. 4. You can use [Nick Fury](/card/01084) and [Professor X](/card/32019)'s second HP using C.I.T.T. , since every ally is a GUARDIAN in a Star-Lord deck. You could also double-attack as Hulk, but don't do so if you don't know the top card of your deck! Wouldn't want to lose him ta an untimely discard. Double-attacking with [Wolverine](/card/32041) is safer, if he doesn't end up in the discard from the double consequential (hence the use of [As One!](/card/23032) as much as possible). Have fun!

name: Powolne ogrywanie S03E10 - Dr. Overpowered
description_md:
Powolne ogrywanie S03E10 - Dr. Overpowered (karty do Star-Lord)

Cześć, jestem casualowym graczem, który lubi sobie dość wolno ogrywać wszystko testując (nawet troszkę na siłę) mając "w poważaniu" tempo wydawania dodatków przez FFG ;) Standardowo testuje na solo na 5 scenariuszach z kampanii grając jednak jako standalone na expercie z losowymi modular setami.

No dobra. W pakiecie z [Star-Lord](/card/17001a) znaleźliśmy [Cosmo](/card/17020), więc grzechem nie spróbować tego legendarnego [Doctor Strange](/card/09001a). Po lewej moje podejście do tego tematu. Całość składa się właściwie z 3 zestawów: tanich sojuszników, pakietu dla cosmo oraz mnóstwa kart związanych z ekonomią. No to lecimy

- Najpierw zestaw z [Cosmo](/card/17020), który zaczynamy od... Cosmo. 
 - Cosmo oczywiście ma tą zaletę, że z jego umiejki discardować karty z Invocation decku i zawsze prawidłowo odgadnąć rodzaj karty. 1 free dmg/thw za friko za całą grę? Czemu nie, ale to nie siła Cosmo. Prawdziwa siła Cosmo to ułatwienie doktorkowi kontroli Invocation decku. Co prawda prawie wszystko oprócz [Vapors of Valtorr](/card/09035) jest u Stranga OP, ale niektóre rzeczy są w poszczególnych sytuacjach bardziej OP niż inne jego OP rzeczy ;) Na początku zazwyczaj nie chcemy [Seven Rings of Raggadorr](/card/09034) póki nie mamy tych kilku sojuszników na stole, w kolei w mid gamie robi super value, za to na końcu gry już właściwie szukamy tylko [Winds of Watoomb](/card/09036) i [Crimson Bands of Cyttorak](/card/09032) żeby jak najszybciej skończyć gierkę.
 - [Inspired](/card/01074) najlepszy przyjaciela pieska. Nie potrzebuje dodatkowego traita, podbija też Thw. 2 Thw w każdym momencie gry już jest baaardzo przyjemne. 
 - [Honorary Avenger](/card/03025) potrzebujemy głównie do [Sky Cycle](/card/04015). Nasz motorek biorąc pod uwagę "nieśmiertelność" jest fajny sam w sobie, ale ponownie - 2 użycia Cosmo + Wong + ewentualnie zdolność Alter Ego i właściwie zawsze się dokopiemy do tego co chcemy. Co prawda są sytuacje w której nasza talia inwokacji nas wręcz blokuje, bo nie chcemy odrzucić wierzchniej karty, ale z honorary avenger mamy łącznie 3 hp więc to nie tak, że nie możemy te kilka razy zaryzykować i odrzucić kartę z naszej talii, czy też talii złola. 
 - [Power Gloves](/card/12017) i [Laser Blaster](/card/17019) to już zdecydowanie mniej ważne karty i w wielu grach wcale ich nie zagrywałem. Doktorkiem i tak finalnie wygrywamy dzięki [Crimson Bands of Cyttorak](/card/09032) oraz [Magic Blast](/card/09004), a te zabawki dla pieska są raczej dodatkami, które zagrywamy jak jest okazja. 
 - Na koniec [Rapid Response](/card/08031), który zagrywamy jeszcze rzadziej. Wrzuciłem go do tali jako awaryjny sposób na ratowanie cosmo, ale jak wiemy że gramy na coś co nie ma sposobu na pozbycie się sojuszników to możemy sobie spokojnie odpuścić.

- Dalej mamy zestaw sojuszników, gdzie głównym kryterium wyboru był koszt. Tak więc mamy [Ant-Man](/card/12011), [Stinger](/card/12014), [Squirrel Girl](/card/03013). Tani sojusznicy, to sojusznicy którzy szybko trafią na stół służąc nam jako mur do [Seven Rings of Raggadorr](/card/09034) lub do doboru [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017). Z tego względu też mamy [The Triskelion](/card/01073). Z minimalnie droższych mamy dwóch ulubieńców czyli: [Hawkeye](/card/01066) i [Adam Warlock](/card/17011) - którzy są po prostu za dobrzy żeby ich nie brać.

- na koniec mamy to co tygryski lubią u doktorka najlepiej czyli różnego rodzaju ekonomia. Ekonomia jest o tyle fajna u stranga, że tak naprawdę to co robimy to zamieniamy aspektowe w op karty z inwokacji.
 - podstawą podstaw jest oczywiście [Cloak of Levitation](/card/09009) - najlepsza karta w jego zestawie i nasz największy priorytet. 2ga aktywacja to w naszym przypadku możliwość zagrania 2giego naszego czaru w turze. Wspominałem już że są one op?
 - dalej mamy jego "nie-osobiste osobiste" karty czyli [The Sorcerer Supreme](/card/09026) i [Spiritual Meditation](/card/15019). Mystici ich totalnie nie potrzebowali, ale kto broni OP postacią być jeszcze bardziej OP? 
 - dalej czystą ekonomię, czyli wszelkie generatory i reduktory zasobów jak [The Eye of Agamotto](/card/09011), [Helicarrier](/card/01092), [Quincarrier](/card/08023). Dużo bardziej podobają mi się generatory zasobów zamiast podwójnych zasobów. Z jego drawem nie jest problem zagrać je nawet przy wymagających questach, a potem już lecimy. Milion doboru, milion zasobu zagrywanie po kilka [Magic Blast](/card/09004) i [Crimson Bands of Cyttorak](/card/09032) w 1 turze i stosunkowo nie trudno o OTK całego etapu złola. Jedynie tego [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) nie jestem do końca przekonany. Ułatwia zagrywanie allików i swoje value robi, ale na pewno można wcisnąc w to miejsce coś ciekawego.
 - Na końcu mamy wspomniane wcześniej [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) - świetny dobór kart dla wolniejszych talii, u nas jest ten "problem", że często wygrywamy grę zanim uda nam się rozkręcić stół z sojusznikami. Ale jak gra się przedłuża to robi robotę. Przede wszystkim i tak chcemy mieć jakiś sojuszników na stole pod [Seven Rings of Raggadorr](/card/09034), często nie chcemy ich używać by nie zabierać im Tougha, więc mielimy je z Strength in Numbers - wykorzystujemy sojuszników w sposób który współgra z resztą decku.

I to by było na tyle jeśli chodzi o deck. Deckiem się bardzo fajnie gra, ale troszkę cierpi na "syndrom Hulka", tzn. jest dość specyficzny (tutaj jego specyfika jest w tym, że czujemy się jak czołg nie do zatrzymania, czytaj - jesteśmy OP jak cholera") - co nie powiem bawi, ale na krótką metę i szybko zaczyna się robić dość wtórne. Od musimy wymyślić jak rozkręcić ekonomię, jak już mamy płaszcz, kilka kart pod ekonomię, cosmo + jakiegoś jeszcze sojusznika to w zależności od scenariusza dalej się dozbrajamy (kontrolując już rozgrywcę w 100%), albo po prostu zaczynamy mielić deck spamując naszym [Crimson Bands of Cyttorak](/card/09032) i [Magic Blast](/card/09004) aż przeciwnik padnie.

Od razu mówię, że powinniśmy coś pokombinować, by zwiększyć trudność rozgrywki, bo na zwykłe scenariusze będzie po prostu nudno. Sam poszedłem z nim spróbować swoich sił na GMW w wersji Heroic zobaczyć jak pójdzie
 - [Drang](/card/16059) z [MODOK](/card/01184) w wersji heroic poszedł aż idiotycznie prosto. Dobrałem Modoka w pierwszej turze, olałem go a sam Drang padł w 3-4 turze. Dobre 5 min się śmiałem nad matą ;)
 - [Collector](/card/16071) z Armies of Titan - oj, tu już się trochę napieprzyłem, bo mechanika kolekcji strasznie nie współgra z heroiciem :D Trochę trzeba było zhighrollować ale w końcu za jakimś 4 razem poszedł.

- [Collector](/card/16081a) nr 2 to już poszedł od strzała, że nawet nie wiem z czym grałem ;)
- [Nebula](/card/16089) z Sinister Assault w końcu okazał się zbyt dużym wyzwaniem i przerzuciłem się na expert, a i tak troszkę mi dał popalić.
- [Ronan the Accuser](/card/16104) się rozumie już nawet nie próbowałem na Heroicu, ale z Symbiotic Strength padł za 1wszym razem co i tak już jest niezłym wynikiem. Chyba 1wszy raz przechodziłem go na expercie i nie spodziewałem się, że aż tak gładko pójdzie.

Także, jak chcemy odwrócić rolę i chcemy pognębić trochę złoli dla odmiany, to polecam się pobawić ;)

name: Wolverine Likes Tasty Clobbers

You have multiple ways to heal through the game the bread and butter for your deck is getting out your [Follow Through](/card/16045) with that you get more healing with [Moment of Triumph](/card/12030). Also will make your attacks even more damage as long as you kill. I’d also suggest using your Ally’s as blockers. 

If anyone has any ideas more than happy to try it out I have tried a melee attack build for wolverine which could do up to 9 per hit. I’m having problems with thwarting and good cards to try?

name: The Just Genius
description_md:
Under Surveillance is great in solo and sometimes in two-player, if there is a low threshold main scheme. Otherwise, remove it in multiplayer.

The strategy of the deck is fairly simple. Use your early turns to build in alter ego, keeping the threat down with cheap allies and homeland intervention. If you get a good hand with limitless strength, flip up to put out your expensive supports. Use global logistics on your own deck early to help set up big turns. Late game, use it to protect against unwanted encounter cards. This deck wants to stay in alter ego and abuse Banners genius and resource generation, with close encounter, to keep putting out high impact allies like Monica Chiang, Coulson, Moon Girl, and Nick Fury. Use Homeland Intervention to create high impact turns of thwarting while still in alter ego. Once Banner gets his Shield setup out, it's time to cut loose and let Hulk out of his cage. With most of your supports out, your deck is mostly physical resources. Use One Way or Another to create big handed turns and hit the villain hard with Hulks high damage hero kit.

I generally try to mulligan for a key generator early - Avengers Mansion and Ingenuity are two of your most important and highly valuable on turn one. Ingenuity will help you reliably play Moon Girl. once you have Quincarrier and Banners Lab, you can play her from the board at no hand cost and draw three cards. This deck leans heavily into generating card draw over having an excess of resource generators. prioritize Monica Chiang and Under Surveillance early so the schemes don't get out of control. Keep in mind Homeland Intervention is excellent value and not a thwart action, so you can play it in alter ego and while confused. Sky Destroyer and Helicarrier can help remove thwart in a pinch using Homeland Intervention if you need your Surveillance Teams to remove threat. You'll be moving through your deck fairly quickly, so you'll be getting hands with Limitless Strength fairly regularly. Use them for high impact whenever you can, and as you move into the mid to late game, your board setup will help remove toughs (sky Destroyer), generate plenty of resources and card draw, and keep your deck thinned to your more powerful Hero cards.

name: Ant-vengers Assemble!
description_md: > The deck You would not expect Ant-Man to lead the Avengers (or "Ant-vengers"...) but this deck proves that he can do it very well. I found this deck solid and fun, so try it and have a good time! > Combos - [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) reduces the cost of half of your deck! that is why you have two copies to ensure that you draw it the earliest possible. - [Avengers Tower](/card/03024) reduces the cost of all of your allies and let´s you have four at the same time. So 4 avengers plus [Stinger](/card/12014) = free [Captain America](/card/21011). - [Team Training](/card/04016) makes [Ant-Man](/card/12011) a free blocker, gives [Giant-Man](/card/12012) one extra 4 atk and makes your allies more useful in general. > Strategy Finish your turns in tiny form or alter ego to draw more cards, only go to giant size to use [Giant Stomp](/card/12003) or to attack when you can return to tiny via [Resize](/card/12005). Play [Ant-Man's Helmet](/card/12008) as soon as you can. Priorize set up via your supports, allies and upgrades (except for [Wrist Gauntlets](/card/12010)). Control the board and do not rush damage, always priorize dealing with threat and minions first, you will eventually defeat the villian. Once you are controling the board use [Giant Stomp](/card/12003) to close the games.
