name: What the flark is an X-Man?
description_md: At the bar on Knowhere - "So Groot and I took MY ship, the Milano, out for…let’s just call it a joyride and not knocking over a Sovereign ship carrying a boat load of units…when all of the sudden we get a distress signal out in Shi’ar space. Well, you know my buddy Groot, he can’t stop talking about helping them! I am Groot this and I am Groot that! So, we make a pit stop to pick up these losers. When we get there this bald Terran starts telepathically thanking us. Is that supposed to impress me or something? Moondragon already does that party trick, pal. But his chair…I’m getting that chair. I’m getting off track it was him, a fire guy, this guy with knife hands about my height…hey! Quill’s told this story about a Terran named Fred Krueger! He’s never gonna believe we met him Groot. Oh! And this purple girl that should be thankful Quill wasn’t there or else he wouldn’t leave her alone. Psyduck? What was her name, Groot?" "I am Groot" "[Psylocke](/card/35013)! HA! I was way off. They say they’re the…Ex Men?…whatever the flark that means. My guess is a dumb name for space pirates since “X marks the spot.” That would mean they have units…or know where some are. So, we picked up the hitchhikers, avoided Gladiator and the entire Shi’ar fleet, and headed off. Matchstick the fire guy starts freaking out, asking how I can avoid all these losers, and I tell him the truth, he’s flying with the best pilot of all time, who’s honed his technique for years. Ain’t that right, Groot?" "I, am Groot." "Well, it mostly happened like that!" ——————————————————————— This is a [Honed Technique](/card/28017) deck for Rocket that finally allows him safely to go into AE with 3 confuses, letting him Tinker. Priority upgrades are [Thruster Boots](/card/16039) and of course [Honed Technique](/card/28017). [Warrior Skill](/card/35016) can be used to ensure there is overkill damage, triggering Rocket’s card draw, which is especially useful for [Particle Cannon](/card/16036) or [Rocket's Pistol](/card/16038). Sadly, it can't boost [Rocket Launcher](/card/16037) as it's not an attack. Also, remember that even an empty weapon is useful for [Fusillade](/card/20026). [Clobber](/card/18012) under the right conditions can be a net 1er, or even neutral provided you use it first and it causes overkill. With all this extra damage [Marked](/card/33032) isn't a bad card to add in, but I'd probably only swap that in large multiplayer games where minions are almost guaranteed each turn. Theoretically, in an Ultron game with 3 drones out [Marked](/card/33032), that would be an additional 9 Damage to him. Will that happen in game? Probably not. Thanks for checking this out!

name: Nova - Turbo Draw (Justice)
description_md: Draw. All. The. Cards! The main aim of this deck is to set off combinations of  [Unleash Nova Force](/card/28006) and [One Way or Another](/card/30017) to draw lots of cards. Use [Clear the Area](/card/04049) and [Turn the Tide](/card/15015) to deal with schemes and minions. Use the card draw to pay for Champions (and a couple of SHIELD) allies. Further card draw comes from [Nick Fury](/card/01084) and [Moon Girl](/card/28018). Protect yourself with ["Go for Champions!"](/card/29025) and [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019). Used this deck in the SCL S13 R1 to good effect!

name: Wolverine Justice Served Cold
description_md:
# WOLVERINE

This hero is amazing at what he does. With this deck he can hold his own versus both the schemes, and the villain. I designed it for the purpose of running alongside another player that is using Cyclops, through the Mad Titans Shadow Campaign, on Expert. it’s been tested and proven to be able to do work that is needed. Enjoy!

name: "It's Clawbberin' Time!"
description_md:
**"Wolverine here. You wanna play my deck? Smart move, bub."**
At the time of posting, this deck has defeated several villains including: - Expert Magneto - Expert Thanos - Expert Nebula This is an hybrid between ally swarm, attack events, and basic ATK - with [Fluid Motion](/card/28016) linking attack events to basic ATK, and [Utopia](/card/33020) linking ally swarming with basic ATK.
**If you like this deck, feel free to give it a ❤ ! Thank you!**
#### **It's Clawbberin' Time!**
"First things first, this deck ain't messin' around - these cards are pure adamantium Aggression. We don't [lay down the law](/card/12031) - we lay down the claw. Defending? That's for chumps!" "So your turn starts, you got your five cards. Got an attack card? Run it through my [claws](/card/35002). Yeah, I'll take damage - but pain just makes me feel alive." "[Lunging Strike](/card/35010) and [Clobber](/card/18012) are the real deal. [Into the Fray](/card/13013) ain't bad either if there's threat enough and a minion with a death wish." "Next, better hope you got an ally in hand too - and you oughta, we're packing ten of those chumps. And you remember what I said about chumps? They defend! Each one of our pals here is good for an attack or two, maybe some thwarting, but at the end of the day a chump always defends. Remember that." "Now I know what your thinkin'. _'Ooh Logan, you heal so fast, why not just let your allies live and take the damage?'_ Bah! I've heard it all before. See I've been around a long time, taken plenty o' damage over the years, and died in more comics than most heroes have had comics at all! Trust me. I've had my share o' hurtin'." "Block with your allies. Keep me nice 'n healthy. That's the way I like it." "Now I ain't always seen eye to eye with all the X-Men, but when it comes to triggering [Utopia](/card/33020)? They're the best. But those Asgardians, [Thor](/card/25013) and [Throg](/card/25014)? Complete chumps! But they're such chumps they don't just defend once but twice." "Got all that? One attack, one ally. That's your goal, play 'em every turn, Canadian-style. You play anything extra on top o' that? Well that's just the slicing on the cake." "The plan looks simple but there's more to it than meets the eye - just like me. And that ain't hard when you're my height. Some turns you'll have more allies or attacks, some less - but you're smart. You picked me. So improvise." "You can go easier on the attackin' turn one. Play some upgrades or supports. My fav? [Utopia](/card/33020), there's a reason I already mentioned it. _A double slice is twice as nice._" "[Helicarrier](/card/01092), [The X-Jet](/card/32020) and [Boot Camp](/card/13016)? Any of 'em are good if you get 'em early, just don't go worrying over them later. The way I do things, games won't last long. Patience isn't my strong suit. I'm the best there is at dealing damage- Eh, you know the rest." "...And, uh, this is kinda embarrassing but my skeleton fell out. If you find my [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004), do me a favor and slap it back in, will ya?" "Wolverine out."
**Alternative Cards:** While I had the best results with the deck the way it is, there are several other great cards you can consider. Here are some with the pros/cons: - [Endurance](/card/13016) - More health is great, but [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004) is usually enough - [Hand Cannon](/card/16046) - Good damage, handy overkill, but hard to afford alongside 1x attack + 1x ally every turn - A second [Fluid Motion](/card/28016) - A cheap bonus to your ATK, but we aren't reliably playing 2x attack cards in one turn - [Brawn](/card/10011) - Good threat removal, but he's not a good chump blocker. - [Dust](/card/33012) - She's another [Utopia](/card/33020) ready, but the worst of the Aggression X-Men allies when solo - [Fastball Special](/card/35023) - A great attack but only _if_ Colossus in in play
**Good luck and have fun!** And special thanks to Jimmydm90 for the deck's name.

name: From foes to friends - Strange and Wanda defeat Loki (no dmg
description_md: So I was tired of being defeated by the Nebulas, the Lokis, the Thanos and Venom Goblins of this game. My plan: take the two more overpowered heroes I can found and fight fire with fire, and oh boy... I played Strange for the first time on a normal campaign of "The Mad Titan Shadow", my gf played Wanda for the first time too and we breeze through it. No one, not even Loki, had a chance vs. Strange and Wanda. We don´t even take a single point of damage vs. Loki. > The deck Yes, this is nothing new. It is one of the more popular decks of this site, but with a few changes based on my taste and the idea to utilize new cards (like [Beast](/card/33011)). > Being Strange in multiplayer with Wanda Wanda is strong, but unpredictable and lacks defensive power. That is when you come in play, you are in charge of defend via though cards dealed, via allies to block attacks and via dealing with minions or threat that is urgent. You control the game so the Wanda player can go crazy.

name: From foes to friends - Wanda and Strange defeat Loki (no dmg
description_md: So I was tired of being defeated by the Nebulas, the Lokis, the Thanos and Venom Goblins of this game. My plan: take the two more overpowered heroes I can found and fight fire with fire, and oh boy... I played Strange for the first time on a normal campaign of "The Mad Titan Shadow", my gf played Wanda for the first time too and we breeze through it. No one, not even Loki, had a chance vs. Strange and Wanda. We don´t even take a single point of damage vs. Loki. > The deck Don´t think this is a standard justice deck, you have some cards to deal with threat, but the deck is designed to draw and cycle fast. You can deal a lot of damage, but many of your powers are unpredictable even with your ability and [Scarlet Witch's Crest](/card/15009). So try to use your powers when any result help the game state. > Being Wanda in multiplayer with Strange The [Hex Bolt](/card/15004) are strong but not realiable so don´t think that you can deal the damage needed or clear the threat of a side scheme that is bothering you. Strange is needed for controling the game, you are in charge of dealing all the damage you can, clear some extra threat on the main scheme or deal stun, confuse or extra tough cards. Channel you inner Scarlet Witch and let yourself lose. Any way or another your foes will perish.

The strategy is to play one big ally per turn when you can, then turn Thor loose with heavy-hitting basic attacks/thwarts using [Teamwork](/card/06032). name: Storm - Leader of the X-Men v2.0
description_md:
# Storm - Leader of the X-Men

## There's A Storm Coming

Hello and welcome to the latest take on a peculiar character! 
Today's piece is about [Storm](/card/36001a).

> What does storm do differently? 

Well, I'm glad you asked. In case you haven't seen it already, Storm has access to her Weather-Deck! (Not an actual deck for rules purposes.) This gives her access to a variety of extremely strong weather-patterns at her disposal! But with great power, comes great responsibility! I'm sure many of you eagle-eyed players have noticed that Storm's weather-abilities are so mighty that they apply to everyone! Including the Villain, Minions, Allies, You & Your Fellow-Players!  

> Wait, that sounds kinda.... bad..? 

It's her blessing and her curse. 
[Hurricane](/card/36003), [Clear Skies](/card/36002), [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) & [Blizzard](/card/36005)! These are the elements you command! Thankfully, her hero-ability, Weather-Control allows you to swap these in and out easier! A simple play is [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) when appropriate for damage; but be careful! Or the Villain might just give you a bigger-smack than you expect to you or your friends! So what do we do with our [Weather Goddess](/card/36009)? Why, we...

## Use [Teamwork](/card/06032)!
Storm's Weather Patterns apply to everyone, so don't be afraid to use [Teamwork](/card/06032) with your allies! Let's take [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) for instance.
You have [Gentle](/card/36016) and you play [Teamwork](/card/06032). Voila! Storm and Gentle Benefit from the +1 to Attack. So now when Storm uses her basic-attack, she will hit for as high as 7! 

> Isn't she kinda squishy? 

She is, but don't worry! Your allies have really toughed up and received some [Danger Room Training](/card/33015) so that they can become [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018)! And if you need a bigger break, why not cosy up when it's a [Blizzard](/card/36005) outside and try not to [Flash Freeze](/card/36012)! 

Rain Or Shine, Don't Forget to Appreciate [Ororo's Garden](/card/36008)! 

Now you can add a true-powerhouse of a character to your Exciting, Uncanny and All-New X-men team! 

> "Do you know what happens to a Villain when it's struck by lightning? The same as everything else."

name: Clear Eyes, Full Hearts
description_md: "Alright, team, huddle up! This villain isn't playing around, and neither are we. We stop them here and now! Not another inch! You hear me?! Alright come in close... First things first, WE are the [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018), that should be the first thing you think about when you look around you. I use to think I didn't need anyone. That I could just go [Full Blast](/card/33008) and solve every problem, but I've since found my [Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029). It's you. All of you. Together. Together, we can overcome any challenge. [Forge](/card/36022), I need you to get [Utopia](/card/33020) fully operational as soon as possible, we need to be ready at all times. I can't do it all from just the [Command Center](/card/35032). [Beast](/card/33011)? Do what you do best and keep us energized. This is gonna be a tough one, I won't lie. These guys are Experts, but we are ready. These people, that hate us...that fear us...they need us. They need a [Rapid Response](/card/08031). We are gonna change minds and lives today. [Sunfire](/card/35014), [Pixie](/card/36017), if things get to hot you need to [Regroup](/card/19032). Lives are in your hands. [Pixie](/card/36017) I want you sticking close to [Jean Grey](/card/34001b), fly close to her whenever you can, but if not, find a friend and get them to the battle. Jean? I love you. [Wolverine](/card/32041) I need...where the hell is Logan? Forget it, [Polaris](/card/32012), [Psylocke](/card/35013), you already know what to do. [Blindfold](/card/33014) will let us know what to expect next and we will respond in kind. If I notice a bunch of you still on the sidelines after all this you better believe I will [Make the Call](/card/01071). Not that one. You'll hear ["To Me, My X-Men!"](/card/36020). That's the only call we need. Everyone got that? Good. Now get out there and show them what we can do! What did they say in that show we watched last night...ha...oh yea. Clear eyes! Full Hearts! Santo, hold up. I know what they've been saying about you, [Rockslide](/card/33013). You aren't worth it. That you don't bring enough to the table, but I see something more. You can take a punch, but I don't want you running defense. We have enough people on that. I want you right there with me. I found my [Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029), and we're gonna find yours too. Got it? You can do this. Bring it in. Now let's show them all what we're made of."

name: Tut tut…
description_md: …it looks like rain. No…that looks like Storm… Storm is the second playable Omega Level mutant, and like her [Soul Sisters](/card/34035) Jean, I wanted a deck that had her abilities front and center, showing what she can really do. She does amazing in any aspect, but I wanted the storm clouds to roll in as quick as possible, resulting in Justice as the aspect to choose because of [One Way or Another](/card/22015). “This deck is a little…basic” Justice also has the benefit of having strong, low cost cards, freeing up your resources. Justice Allies, on the other hand, don’t offer much benefit except if you wanted to optimize a deck for thwart in multiplayer. As such, the allies stay pretty grey and [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024) helps get them on the field. The three S.H.I.E.L.D allies are clearly Storm chasers. The goal is to get one of these cards in your hand first thing, and prioritizing [Storm's Crown](/card/36006), [Deft Focus](/card/16024) as cards to play first thing. Your weather deck starter will depend on the scenario…how pressing is it to remove threat/that scheme? If it’s gotta go right away you’ll want to start in Thunderstorm and swap to Hurricane when your damage is done, otherwise it’s to whatever the situation needs (usually whatever into Thunderstorm). An ideal first turn would be getting the aforementioned upgrades out and an ally out to sacrifice to the Goddess, which is possible thanks to the card draw. Once the two upgrades are out, you are in complete control of the battlefield. You can remove up to 9 threat for one card from your hand with [Torrential Rain](/card/36010), up to 15 damage for just 2 with [Lightning Bolt](/card/02044), or any combination of the two, and that’s just the beginning of your hand that turn (numbers will vary depending on what Weather you have out and swap to, numbers given would be the maximum from a single event, after swapping to their respective weather card plus a basic ability) Allies are still important to run interference for the villain’s attacks, especially when [Flash Freeze](/card/36012) isn’t in hand, but just in case you take a surprise attack, this deck packs plenty of thwarting ability to safely swap down, even if Storm’s AE is lackluster. [One Way or Another](/card/22015) into [Nick Fury](/card/01084) is always a great combo, and cycles a ton of the deck, often setting up OTK’s. If you wanted to run [Chance Encounter](/card/26034), he’d be my target almost every time. If I feel the scenario needs it I’ll also toss in [Under Surveillance](/card/06031) in for one of [Turn the Tide](/card/15015). This card has saved me so much in the past so it always gets considered into my deck, especially solo. This deck has been clearing Expert scenarios smoothly. A personal favorite moment was intentionally pulling Doomsday Chair with OWOA, and subsequently deleting Modok (again) and his scheme just for good measure, before finishing off the Villain. Thanks for checking this out!

name: Colossus - Passion for Justice!
description_md: Finally got some time to dive more seriously into Colossus! Really a strong character. This is the list I made to solo the big guy. So far, so good, it defeated every expert encounter I threw it against ( Core Set, Mojomania, a few villain packs... still got a lot of playing to do though). Like the title suggests, i've become a fan of a card that got too little attention so far: [Passion for Justice](/card/34020). ______________________ Solo Colossus So it may come a little late as Mutant Genesis has been around for some time, but in case you need a refresher, Colossus really likes alternating between Alter-Ego and Hero form. That makes up for the ugly 4 hand size of Hero form and allows you to get more tough cards, which you want to keep preciously - do NOT just soak attacks with them, since they are used as payment for your top cards. What are those cards? Well, [Steel Fist](/card/32008) first of all. Stunning AND confusing the villain with ONE card reminds me of [Pheromones](/card/04036) and, sure enough, allows you to return to AE to draw 6 cards, get a tough card when you return, but ALSO shuffle [Steel Fist](/card/32008) back into your deck with your "Aspiring artist" ability. And you can also try your luck with [Piotr's Studio](/card/32003) to get it right back. Second, you really want to have a though card when you draw [Made of Rage](/card/32007), incredible even when a minion blocks your way. Since these two cards are clearly your way to victory, flipping to AE and back again, but also using [Bulletproof Protector](/card/32009), "armor up" and chomp-blocking the villain attacks is a sound plan to make sure you'll be able to pay with a though card as needed. _____________________________ [Passion for Justice](/card/34020) I haven't seen a lot of buzz about this card, but it really is a good one. Use it to pay for [Clear the Area](/card/04049), thwarting 3 threaths for just 1 resource (and then draw a card because obviously you planned things right). Incredible, also, for [Multitasking](/card/15013) as it provides the needed for it to apply to two schemes while boosting its thwart value! Coupled with your allies, you've got a very decent threath removal suite. __________________________ And others [Unshakable](/card/31024) because you don't wanna miss an opportuniy for [Made of Rage](/card/32007) because you're stunned! [Under Surveillance](/card/06031), a solo must; [Limitless Stamina](/card/31023) to ready and thwart or attack some more. Last, and it seems a bit strange: [One Way or Another](/card/22015). Well, it makes up nicely for the 4 cards hand size and with [Passion for Justice](/card/34020) beefing up your thwart events, or your allies completing the thwart, it can be really strong. [Sense of Justice](/card/14030) also helps a lot to pay your thwarts if [Passion for Justice](/card/34020) isn't in your hand. Most allies will serve as blockers, but also add to the draw , stun and confuse. Have fun!

name: Hawkeye - Brute Force Revisited
description_md:
I decided to take a look back at a fun deck idea by teamcanadahockey2002 and see how I could update it. 

While the original Brute Force Arrows deck used [Brute Force](/card/14029) to cover attack, thwart and defense, I chose this time around to try to maximize damage potential. 

The goal here is to get damage upgrades into play and them pound your opponents with [Quick Strike](/card/25018) and arrow cards. [Assault Training](/card/26033) will allow you to cycle quick strikes back into your deck and [Assess the Situation](/card/12033), [The Power of Aggression](/card/01055), and [Aggressive Energy](/card/32047) should keep your hand full of lots of resources to pay for them. 

Other than [Explosive Arrow](/card/04006), this deck only affects single targets, so [Marked](/card/33032) as been included to allow you to take out minions and still keep pouring the damage on the villain. [Fluid Motion](/card/28016), will enhance multiple card plays in a turn. 

By relying on card plays and using your hero card to thwart or defend, all of your Brute Force cards can stay in play, resulting in some potentially huge numbers once you build up. At maximum of Base ATK 2, plus [Hawkeye's Bow](/card/04002), 3 [Brute Force](/card/14029), [Combat Training](/card/01057), [Aggressive Energy](/card/32047)and [Honed Technique](/card/28017), your first Quick Strike would hit for 10 damage and Fluid Energy would allow you a second Quick Strike (or basic power, if you are ready to use up your Brute Forces) at 11 damage. 

The obvious weak point of this deck is that it is pure offense. It would run best with a good team-oriented Protection partner. Hopefully, using your hero card to thwart or defend will buy you some time, but it won't buy much.

name: Phoenix - Perfected
description_md: > **English / Spanish** I appreciate a like! ### **Modifications:** *Except 2 copies of "Attack Training" all cards are BASIC Were **added**: - [The X-Jet](/card/32020) - 1 copy of Attack Training They were **eliminated**: - [Special Fast Ball](/card/35023) - [Wolverine](/card/32041) This deck was tested with The Brotherhood and [Magneto II](/card/32139) on _heroic_ and _expert_ modes, respectively. I'm happy to be able to share it, since from my point of view it presents an original dynamic, especially effective on [Phoenix](/card/34001a), and above all that I consider powerful and versatile. ### **Deck Objectives:** The **main goal** was to include the maximum number of **equipment** cards, especially powerful and easy to play thanks to [Brain](/card/34022), taking advantage of the _**PSSIONIC**_ trait of [ Phoenix](/card/34001a) and perpetuating allies through [X-Mansion](/card/32049). _I think that by making the mistake of adding [Fastball Special](/card/35023) without being able to include it, the truth is that the deck lost much of its charm_. Given the initial cards, the **secondary objectives** were to enhance the _alter-ego_ as the main dynamic of the deck with [Brain](/card/34022) in a _superhero_ who stands out for his INT including, in turn, different possibilities for confuse the enemy. ### **Cards and Combos:** There is nothing better than explaining the deck through its combos: - [Psychic Rapport](/card/34023) and [Soul Sisters](/card/34035), thanks to the _allies_ [Cyclops](/card/34003) and [Storm](/card/34021) easily played through from [Brain](/card/34022) and staying on the board thanks to [X-Mansion](/card/32049) until they form a new deck. - In cooperation with the _alter-ego_ of [Brain](/card/34022) and [X-Mansion](/card/32049) along with the high number of basic cards, [Utopia](/card/33020), [White Hot Room](/card/34004) and [Danger Room](/card/33021). 11 basic cards plus continuous _allies_ that through [Brain](/card/34022) we can use the 2 copies of [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024) whenever we have them in hand. - 3 copies of [Psychic Assault](/card/34032) along with [Professor X](/card/32019) to confuse and take advantage of [Brain](/card/34022) on _alter-ego_. In turn, [Down Time](/card/05033) to stimulate **response** in [Phoenix](/card/34001a)'s _alter-ego_. - [Forge](/card/36022) together with [Brain](/card/34022), [Danger Room](/card/33021), [Utopia](/card/33020), [The X-Jet]( /card/32020) and [X-Mansion](/card/32049). - [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) and 24 cards with trait _**PSIONIC**_ and/or _**PATROL X**_ in the deck. I know there is an anti-synergy between [Brain](/card/34022) and [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024), but I still think there are too many cards. ### **Evolution:** 1. [Psylocke](/card/35013), is an option to confuse and swap our _alter-ego_, however, it wastes [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024) and I don't think it lacks cards that confer confused statuses. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Aprecio un like! ### **Modificaciones:** *Excepto 2 copias de "Entrenamiento de Ataque" todas las cartas son BÁSICAS Fueron **añadidas**: - [El X-Jet](/card/32020) - 1 copia de Entrenamiento de Ataque Fueron **eliminadas**: - [Especial Fastball](/card/35023) - [Lobezno](/tarjeta/32041) Este mazo fue testeado con The Brotherhood y [Magneto II](/card/32139) en modo _heroico_ y _experto_, respectivamente. Estoy contento de poder compartirlo, ya que bajo mi punto de vista presenta una dinámica original, especialmente efectiva en [Phoenix](/card/34001a), y sobre todo que considero potente y versatil. ### **Objetivos del Mazo:** El **objetivo principal** fue incluir el máximo número de cartas **equipo**, especialmente potentes y fáciles de jugar gracias a [Cerebro](/card/34022), aprovechando el rasgo _**PSIÓNICO**_ de [Phoenix](/card/34001a) y perpetuándo los aliados a través de [X-Mansion](/card/32049). _Considero que al cometer el error de añadir [Fastball Special](/card/35023) sin poderse incluir, la verdad que el mazo perdió gran parte de su encanto_. Dadas las cartas iniciales, los **objetivos secundarios** fueron potenciar el _alter-ego_ como dinámica principal del mazo con [Cerebro](/card/34022) en un _superhéroe_ que destaca por su INT incluyendo, a su vez, distintas posibilidades para confundir al enemigo. ### **Cartas y Combos:** No hay nada mejor que explicar el mazo a través de sus combos: - [Psychic Rapport](/card/34023) y [Soul Sisters](/card/34035), gracias a los _aliados_ [Cyclops](/card/34003) y [Storm](/card/34021) fácilmente jugados a través de [Cerebro](/card/34022) y permaneciendo en mesa gracias a [X-Mansion](/card/32049) hasta formar un nuevo mazo. - En cooperación al _alter-ego_ de [Cerebro](/card/34022) y [X-Mansion](/card/32049) junto al elevado número de cartas básicas, [Utopia](/card/33020), [White Hot Room](/card/34004) y [Danger Room](/card/33021). 11 cartas básicas más continuos _aliados_ que a través de [Cerebro](/card/34022) podremos usar las 2 copias de [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024) siempre que las tengamos en mano. - 3 copias de [Psychic Assault](/card/34032) junto al [Professor X](/card/32019) para confundir y aprovechar [Cerebro](/card/34022) en _alter-ego_. A su vez, [Down Time](/card/05033) para estimular la **respuesta** en _alter-ego_ de [Phoenix](/card/34001a). - [Forge](/card/36022) junto a [Cerebro](/card/34022), [Danger Room](/card/33021), [Utopia](/card/33020), [The X-Jet](/card/32020) y [X-Mansion](/card/32049). - [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) y 24 cartas con rasgo _**PSIÓNICO**_ y/o _**PATRULLA X**_ en el mazo. Se que existe la antisinergia entre [Cerebro](/card/34022) y [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024), pero aún así considero que son muchas las cartas. ### **Evolución:** 1. [Psylocke](/card/35013), es una opción para confundir e intercambiarnos a nuestro _alter-ego_, sin embargo, desaprovecha [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024) y no pienso que le falten de cartas que confieran estados confundidos.

name: Wolverine's Justice
description_md:
An attempt to build a Wolverine deck with Justice aspect.

The aim is to control the schemes while constantly attacking the villain (Wolverine's hero cards, [Fastball Special](/card/35023), [Pivotal Moment](/card/18029), [Turn the Tide](/card/15015)).

Control of the schemes is provided by [Beat Cop](/card/10029) and [Surveillance Team](/card/01064), in addition to the fact that you will essentially stay in hero form and be able to use Wolverine's 2 thwarts.

Allies are here to bring their special abilities and allow additional thwarts. Of course you can also use them to provide attacks and block the villain the time Wolverine needs to go back to full HP. [Colossus](/card/32048) is precious with [Fastball Special](/card/35023) and [Monica Chang](/card/27040) is practical to put and enforce [Surveillance Team](/card/01064).

[One Way or Another](/card/22015) accelerate your play, taking advantage of your control of the schemes .

[Skilled Investigator](/card/04047) is just a combo with [One Way or Another](/card/22015) to draw even more cards.

Enjoy and don't hesitate to share feedbacks.

An attempt of leadership engine with Wolverine without [Avengers Assemble!](/card/03015).

The aim is to play allies as quickly as possible and to use [Meditation](/card/26036) and [Band Together](/card/21018) to afford your supports while staying in Alter Ego form as long as possible. All you need is then to manage the schemes and go thru your deck with [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017).

When your board is emplaced, you can then switch to Hero Form and attack as much as you can using Wolverine's Hero cards and [Wolverine's Claws](/card/35002).

Enjoy and as usual feedback is welcome.

Use [Boot Camp](/card/13016) and Attack Training to beef them up, and use [Combat Training](/card/18017) in tandem with [The Best Defense…](/card/25020) to help protect Storm vs. enemy attacks (predominantly due to her low defense ...)

Have fun, and hit hard!!!

name: Quicksilver Strikes Back
description_md:
This deck is based on Quicksilver's Super Speed capability to stay in Hero form almost permanently while defending against villain's attacks and take even benefit of it.

For that purpose, only two allies are sufficient, especially with [Starhawk](/card/16012) who can go back again and again and again.

Quicksilver then uses [Hard to Ignore](/card/16017), [Unflappable](/card/09020), [Bait and Switch](/card/15030), [Counter-Punch](/card/01077), [Never Back Down](/card/14014), [Preemptive Strike](/card/05014), [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) and [Electrostatic Armor](/card/10031) to both protect himself and gain special effects from the villain attacks.

I tested it several times and it is a pleasant deck to play. It takes a first deck for your board to be fully emplaced but Quicksilver has many capabilities to control during the emplacement phase and become more and more efficient to deal damages with time.

I am currently playing it with a Leadership Captain Marvel's deck with a friend in a campaign. I just needed to remove the [Quincarrier](/card/08023) which is not 100% necessary here. It is thus a multiplayer deck too.

Enjoy and don't hesitate to share feedback.

To help pay for the allies I've included 3 copies of [Quinjet](/card/03019), [Avengers Tower](/card/03024), [Helicarrier](/card/01092), and [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024). [Regroup](/card/19032) and [Rapid Response](/card/08031) will also help to keep your allies in play.

Black Panther will be able to take hits to protect his allies and then heal using [Vibranium Suit](/card/01049) or flipping to alter-ego when needed. Also using his own upgrades he will be able to help in any way that is required of him. 

If you find you self with a nice compliment of allies I've also included the 41st card of the deck [Mass Attack](/card/21016) for a devastating blow to the villain.

Avengers Forever!

name: Suit up and have a Blast | Iron Man (Protection)
description_md:
What is the essence of Iron Man? His suit! [Tony Stark](/card/01029b) is just a rich genius who became a super hero with his development of the Mark III suit. That in mind, you will get the best out of the cards of [Iron Man](/card/01029a). Tech-Upgrades & Hit Points
As always, you begin the game in the form of your alter ego. In this case as [Tony Stark](/card/01029b). Use his ability to draw a 7th card and play as much Tech-Upgrades as possible to increase the hand size of [Iron Man](/card/01029a) in the coming rounds, which is your first priority. With a bit of luck, you will get the [Mark V Armor](/card/01036) and the [Arc Reactor](/card/01035), the most important parts of your suit. Your second goal is to increase your hit points. [Mark V Armor](/card/01036) and [Endurance](/card/05023) are your best options. With 15+ hit points and 5+ Tech-Upgrades, you can stay in the form of Iron Man some rounds. Use your [Repulsor Blast](/card/01031)!
This will cause damage between 1 and 13 (mostly 7) and is your strongest attack. Protect yourself!
You need to be [Iron Man](/card/01029a) to control the game. Try no to change back to [Tony Stark](/card/01029b) and use [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) or [Preemptive Strike](/card/05014) to mitigate the attacks of the villain and his monions. Don't underestimate your Head & Feet
Besides your basic thwarting, the [Mark V Helmet](/card/01037) is your only option to remove threat. Use your [Rocket Boots](/card/01039) to go Aerial and double the amount of threat you can remove. This will also make your [Supersonic Punch](/card/01032) to a strong attack with 8 damage. Your [Quincarrier](/card/08023) allows you, to do this every round.

name: Nova: SCL 13:1
description_md:
Built for season 13, round 1 (Standard Klaw with Ransacked Armory modular) of Solo Champions League.

If you watch MST3K at all, you're probably familiar with season 2 episode 8, "Lost Continent". The running joke for that episode was the phrase "rock climbing"; the way they say it is what I think of whenever I think of the gimmick for this deck: card draw. Even with only three side schemes, [One Way or Another](/card/22015) is a crazy good work horse in this deck. Particularly when you can bring in a side scheme, draw three cards, and then thwart it away immediately with [Lightspeed Flight](/card/28004). Then add in a [Turn the Tide](/card/15015). Or two. Start off that turn with an [Unleash Nova Force](/card/28006) and you'll have gone through half of your deck and the first phase of the villain in a round. I love this game.

Ce dernier profite de [Exercice de Cohésion d'Équipe](/card/30022) puisque nous sommes sensés être toujours aérien avec le casque. 11 dégâts au méchant et 5 à tous les autres, ca nettoie souvent la table. name: Vision - Take Your Daughter to Work Day
description_md: Vision has felt like one of Marvel Champion’s best kept secrets. He’s incredibly strong, wildly versatile, and arguably has the best ally in the game. The biggest issue with him in the Aggression aspect, although it’s always been my favorite for Vis, is that it had issues in recurring the incredible [Vivian](/card/26003). Now, Vision can bring his daughter to work. This deck is a Swiss Army knife for scenarios. It comes stacked with 4 stuns, 4 confuses, piercing, ignore Crisis, and 2 Synthezoids. The Villain is Stalwart? You have 3(!) allies who can burst 3 thwart each, keeping the threat in control in addition to Vis’ solid thwart game. That’s not even touching the damage in this deck. There’s a bit of it… [Pitchback](/card/28012) after you [Surprise Attack](/card/13014) are aspect cards together that are on hero card curve (8 damage for 4er), and arguably better since you can split it up between 2 targets. Other heroes can do this, but it might as well be exclusive to Vision as he can do it so easily with his form changing. With just [Martial Prowess](/card/10018) and either [Solar Gem](/card/26005) or [Deft Focus](/card/16024), if you flipped from intangible to dense, you could afford this combo AND [Solar Beam](/card/26008), making a 15 damage turn very likely (17 at least with a basic attack!) OR 8 damage/7 thwart! [Density Control](/card/26007). You ever have that feeling that you love Aggression, but you just need more cards in your hand to do all that fun stuff? At the very least, on a turn you flip to Dense, you are looking at a tasty 7(8 if you use both copies) card Hero hand, either setting up massive damage turns, or maybe just controlling the board and grabbing that needed for [Drop Kick](/card/10014) while still having cards and damage to spare. This can pick up ANY Vision event in the discard, so if you need a clutch defense next turn or piercing to start the assault, as long as it’s in the discard get [Mass Increase](/card/26012) or [Superdense Strike](/card/26009), respectively. [Solar Gem](/card/26005) and [Martial Prowess](/card/10018) together all but guarantee you get [Drop Kick](/card/10014) with its kicker. That’s 1 net er for 4 damage and a stun. You and Your Synthezoid: An Operator's Manual: - It will be rare to not switch forms in a round, the bonus card switching to Dense is too good to pass up. Intangible is deceptively strong for its damage reduction. - The only time I’m not switching is if [Mass Increase](/card/26012) is in hand and needs to shut down 2 villain activations, but that’s very rare. - Order of importance for upgrades are as follows: [Solar Gem](/card/26005) > [Deft Focus](/card/16024) = [616 Hickory Branch Lane](/card/26004) > [Martial Prowess](/card/10018) >[Combat Training](/card/01057) > [Vision's Cape](/card/26006). - It's not a bad idea to hold on to [Surprise Attack](/card/13014) if you're on a turn where you swap to Intangible, particularly if you have either of your resource generators out. Although you can't use it when you flip to Intangible, it’s ready to go when you flip back to dense, and you’re still drawing 5 new cards even when you hold onto it (draw up to hand size + the extra when you flip to dense) - [Vivian](/card/26003), sweet Vivian. What's your current problem on the board? Flip to which side needs to boost your daughter and it's gone. #prouddadmoments. Thanks for checking this out!

name: Powolne ogrywanie S03E11 - Nuke them
description_md:
**Powolne ogrywanie S03E11 - Nuke Them (karty do Star-lorda)**

Cześć, jestem casualowym graczem, który lubi sobie dość wolno ogrywać wszystko testując (nawet troszkę na siłę) mając "w poważaniu" tempo wydawania dodatków przez FFG ;) Standardowo testuje na solo na 5 scenariuszach z kampanii grając jednak jako standalone na expercie z losowymi modular setami.

Podróż z zabawą OTK deckami trwa. Zacząłem się zastanawiać do kogo najbardziej pasuje [Pulse Grenade](/card/17023) i najbardziej oczywistym wyborem wydała mi się oczywiście [Captain Marvel](/card/01010a) z uwagi na jej [Energy Channel](/card/01018), który tak samo sobie leży na stole czekając na właściwy moment. Granaty średnio zadają ~3 dmg, więc załadowany na maxa Energy Channel, 2 granaty + 1 strzał z [Photonic Blast](/card/01013) powinien załatwić sprawę. Na większych złoli musimy się trochę bardziej namęczyć, ale te ~30 obrażeń w 1 turze jak najbardziej możemy wyciągnąć.

Całość połączona z Justice, chociaż większość kart to basic karty. 
- Carol szczyci się posiadaniem jednego z najsłabszych skillów do thwartowania w grze. [Crisis Interdiction](/card/01012) jest strasznie sytuacyjne jako że żeby coś tym zrobić sensownego musimy mieć zarówno jakiś Side scheam na stole jak i Aerial, a zagrywanie [Cosmic Flight](/card/01017) daleko jest do naszych priorytetów. Były gry gdzie niezagrywałem ich ani razu. Z drugiej strony też nie potrzebuje nie wiadomo ile do sczęścia. [Heroic Intuition](/card/01065) (głównie to Thw wykorzystywać będziemy naszą bohaterkę) połączone z [Clear the Area](/card/04049) w większości wypadków wystarczają do szczęścia. Dodatkowo mamy klasyczne, stare dobre [Under Surveillance](/card/06031), by mieć bufor bezpieczeństwa gdy nie wszystko idzie po naszej myśli. Mamy jeszcze zabezpieczenie w postaci [Spider-Woman](/card/01011). Niby tego nie jest dużo, ale w praktyce wystarcza, z uwagi na thw nie powinniśmy gier przegrywać.
- Z pozostałych rzeczy Justicowych mamy [Wiccan](/card/15011), który jakby dopełniał combo, bo działa jak mini-granat. Zazwyczaj używam go 2 razy i sobie leży czekając na finisz, no chyba oczywiście, że gra nas zmusi by go jednak uśmiercić. Mamy jeszcze [Turn the Tide](/card/15015) pomaga też przy combie, ale głównie jest po to by pomagać kontrolować stół, nie jesteśmy jacyś super wybitni w czyszczeniu minionów i Turn the Tide tutaj naprawdę pomaga.
- Całość jak wspominałem połączona z dużą liczbo szarych kart. Chcemy zagrać granaty, które są mocno nie wygodne do grania. [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024) znacznie tu pomaga. Jak już gramy szare zasoby to możemy sobie pozwolić na więcej szarych generatorów zasobów i gramy tu cały zestaw [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091), [Helicarrier](/card/01092), [Quincarrier](/card/08023) co też wspasowuje się do decku. Kontrolne decki bardziej mogą sobie pozwolić na większą ilość kart tego typu - bo czyszczą co potrzebne i reszte zasobów mogą poświęcać na "inwestycje". Druga sprawa, że w przypadku "cięższych przeciwników" ułatwiają dobrania i zagranie choćby 2x [Photonic Blast](/card/01013) by zrobić jednak to OTK na całym etapie.
- Dalej mamy sojuszników, absolutną klasykę szarych przyjaciół czyli [Spider-Man](/card/13019), [Nick Fury](/card/01084) i [Ironheart](/card/13018). Na koniec mniej klasyczny [War Machine](/card/04020), który normalnie nie jest taki super z uwagi na swój koszt, ale przy graniu podwójnych czarych zasobów jak dla mnie jest ok. Generalnie uzupełniają nasze braki czy to w braku Thw, czy to obrażeń do czyszczenia stołu czy to w formie obrońcy.
- Na koniec mamy [Deft Focus](/card/16024). Nie jest jakąś tutaj kluczową kartą, raczej miłym dodatkiem. Działa z [Photonic Blast](/card/01013) co jest super, ale też robi z [Cosmic Flight](/card/01017) sensowną kartę. Bez tej redukcji raczej w ogóle nie agrywam.

I to by było na tyle. Deck jest przeprzyjemny do gry. Mnóstwo drawu jak tu u Kapitanki, a że gramy w grę karcianą to cóż... im więcej kart tym więcej radochy. Podobnie jak "odkrywanie" granatów sprawdzając ile z nich wyjdzie. Radził sobie też super, jedyną chyba słabością jest defensywa. W większości przypadków nie ma problemów, nasze leczenie z zdolności bohaterskiej, możliwość flipowania się dzięki Justice zazwyczaj dają radę, ale kilka kart w stylu [Assault](/card/01187) w niewłaściwym momencie może zrobić robotę. Ogrywałem nim customowe scenariusze z Sinister Six i przegrałem tylko raz, ale czysto przez swój błąd tzn. chciwość. Gdybym poczekał turę dłużej, zamiast się odpalać od razu pewnie by było 5-0 na koncie. Nie mniej pozostaje mi polecić deczek ;) Udanej zabawy ;)

name: Cyclops - They keep going and going...
description_md:
I hope you like effects that occur when a card enters play, because that is what this deck does.

7 of the 8 allies have enter play effects, [Pixie](/card/36017) has an effect when played from hand, but that effect is to fish out one of your allies who does have an enter play effect.

The deck is structured to keep putting these allies into play for their benefits. "To Me, My X-Men", [Regroup](/card/19032), and [Rapid Response](/card/08031) will keep putting them out and bringing them back, each time triggering their enters play effects. [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) and [The X-Jet](/card/32020) will get them out faster, and [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018),[Effective Leadership](/card/33018), [Leadership Skill](/card/36019) and [Utopia](/card/33020) will get greater utility from them while they are out.

name: Nebula - "You will always be my sister."
description_md:
"You were the one who wanted to win. And I just wanted a sister! You were all I had, but you were the one who needed to win. Thanos pulled my eye from my head, and my brain from my skull, and my arm from my body... because of you." - Nebula

This deck is themed around playing 2player with a Gamora player.

Most Nebula / Leadership decks are based around her being in alter ego form until she has played as many techniques as possible.

This deck follows a similar play pattern but does have more "up time" as a hero. ["Welcome Aboard"](/card/20027), [Groot](/card/16047), [Rocket Raccoon](/card/16019), [Drax](/card/18019), [Knowhere](/card/17022) and [Ready for Action](/card/04017) all need Nebula to be in hero form to put into play. 

The deck is built around getting Groot and Yondu into play, supported by Rocket or Star-Lord.

It does have a few upgrades for these allies ([Reinforced Suit](/card/12018) for Groot, #Inspired for Yondu and [Comms Implant](/card/18030) for either Rocket or Star-Lord). The idea being that Groot with [Team Training](/card/04016) and Reinforced Suit will have 9 health and heals 2 every time he defends. Add in [Ready for Action](/card/04017) to give him an occasional breather with a Tough status, Groot should remain in play as a defender for some time. His job is to defend Gamora.

Rocket and/or Star-Lord will be Thwarting while you are in Alter Ego form.

The deck should try and keep the allies in play for as long as possible to gain advantage from [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017). Between Nebula's alter ego ability, Strength In Numbers and [Daughters of Thanos](/card/22022) and Knowhere, this deck can dig through its deck.

Then, when the time is right, the deck can pop off with Nebula's techniques and [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015). 

And good old [Rapid Response](/card/08031) is there for some Ally recursion.

name: Master of Regeneration
description_md:
# Master of Regeneration


> "If you accept the pain, it can not hurt you" - **Wolverine**

So i have been expermimenting with a Wolverine Justice deck, because its my favorite aspect and so far i have not seen an interesting justice deck for him. 

My primary goal was to make it feel as Wolverin-y as possible. So this deck is about dealing damage, taking damage and regenerating in an instant. 

## Concept


**DIRECT REGENERATION (healing damage):**

With 2 x [Regenerative Healing](/card/35012) and 3 x [Making an Entrance](/card/20013) together with the basline healing of 2 from [Wolverine](/card/35001a), there are plenty of ways to heal damage in hero form, making you a great facetank that doesnt need to exaust to defend. If you should take really to much damage in one round, instead of dying simply say: ["I Got Better"](/card/35006), although you wont need this card in most circumstances. 

With Wolverines great baseline stats, with [Heroic Intuition](/card/01065) and [Making an Entrance](/card/20013), you get 5 threat removal and 2 healing, and if you have 2 [Making an Entrance](/card/20013) in your hand, you get up to 7 threat removal (best case scenario, another seven from a different scheme thanks to [Overwatch](/card/30019)) and 4 healing, which can happen in this deck quite often thanks to our secondary concept:

**INDIRECT REGENERATION (getting cards back into our deck):**

Cards like [Professor X](/card/32019), [Concussive Blow](/card/05031), [Sonic Rifle](/card/20015), [Eros](/card/22011) give you ways to prevent threat from beeing placed on the main scheme and are there so we can switch into alter ego from time to time to regenerate even more:

to get our hp back, we can heal without our basline healing 4 hp per switch into alter ego through [Crew Quarters](/card/20029) and [X-Mansion](/card/32049).

with [Vigilante Training](/card/23033), we can get our best thwarting option back ([Making an Entrance](/card/20013)) or get an easy confuse for 3 hp (or if we pay for that card a cofuse and 3 damage) through [Concussive Blow](/card/05031).

The best use for this sequence would be:

1. do your damage /play your cards in hero form and confuse the villain.

2. go into alter ego, trigger [Weapon X](/card/35022) to thin your deck if needed and then use [Vigilante Training](/card/23033) for the cards you want and [Logan's Cabin](/card/35007). 
Use [X-Mansion](/card/32049) and [Crew Quarters](/card/20029). End the round and draw up to your handsize. 

3. trigger [Logan's Cabin](/card/35007) and now trigger [Weapon X](/card/35022) for highest chance to get a card you wanted, then add lost cards you want to keep back to your deck with [Vigilante Training](/card/23033) 

4. go back in hero form and do exactly what you need to do.

If we use [Logan's Cabin](/card/35007) in combination with [Weapon X](/card/35022), we can get, depending how thin our deck is, a certain card back into our hand. 

With [Honorary X-Men](/card/33035) you can use the x-jet in alter ego and you have together with [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047) a great protection against cards like [[Caught Off Guard](/card/01188).

**DAMAGE AND CONCLUSION:**

I never lacked damage with Wolverine at all. With 6 great damage events and 2 x [Concussive Blow](/card/05031) I normaly had each round enough targets for my Claws. It may be slower than a rush deck you could build with aggression, but in at least a 2 player game, this deck will consistantly have the right answer for any situation and made me feel very much like i was playing wolverine, beeing not afraid of facetanking and returning an equal amount of damage!

**MULTIPLAYER CHANGES:**

In a two player game, i would add 1 x [Honorary X-Men](/card/33035) and 1 x [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047), to get the benefits for your teammate aswell. In a 3+ player game, i would add 2 x [Honorary X-Men](/card/33035) and 1 x [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047) to the deck. Especially in multiplayer, where setup is way easier and can take far longer than in a solo game, having more than 40 cards is not that big of a deal imo. 

so far i had great success with this deck and went through expert Mojo Mania together with leadership Captain marvel. 

**tl;dr:**

Nr.1: We do not defend. We take it to the face so we can use our basic thwart.

Nr.2: We heal all the damage up again.

Nr.3: We use our [Wolverine's Claws](/card/35002) to play attack events and deal constant damage.

Nr. 4: We confuse the enemy so we can go into alter ego if needed and regenerate with [Crew Quarters](/card/20029), [X-Mansion](/card/32049), [Vigilante Training](/card/23033), [Weapon X](/card/35022) and [Logan's Cabin](/card/35007)

name: Thor - Re-visiting Asgard
description_md:
It was just a matter of time before i was going to re-visit Thor aggro. It's been quite some time now, and a LOT has been released that benefit the God of Thunder since I last tried an aggro deck. 

The biggest plus is the addition of [Professor X](/card/32019) and [Psylocke](/card/35013), because you now can benefit from confuses. You've got quite a few incentives to go back to AE here: [Hall of Heroes](/card/06017) is probably the most obvious, but [For Asgard!](/card/06004) can also be useful, retrieving ASGARD traited allies / supports from the discard, for instance ([Thor's Helmet](/card/06010), [God of Thunder](/card/06008), [The Bifrost](/card/25023), [Hall of Heroes](/card/06017), [Asgard](/card/06007), [Valkyrie](/card/06012), [Throg](/card/25014), [Lady Sif](/card/06002), [Angela](/card/18011)). 

Returning to AE also means you can use [Mjolnir](/card/06009) to pay for cards when it comes back to your hand after a [Hammer Throw](/card/06005). You'll be able to get it back from "Worthy" anyway.

Other "recent" goodies include [Unshakable](/card/31024), which can be pretty useful if you don't have [Godlike Stamina](/card/25024) in your hand. [Limitless Stamina](/card/31023) is just awesome, if you've got [Combat Training](/card/01057) and [Mjolnir](/card/06009) out, it's basically a second 4 DMG attack. 

In the end, I found that with all of this, aggro Thor played pretty smooth, pretty much what we were all expecting when his hero pack came out.

name: Wolverine Runs Berserk
description_md:
This deck leans into Wolverine throwing around damage but remaining healthy by way of Moment of Triumph and Follow Through. Whenever he can kill a minion, he can use those to heal. This is especially handy if he used his claws to pay for the card that did the killing. If draw multiple Moment of Triumphs, you can get a chain going with Berserker Barrage, killing and healing repeatedly. Clobber works especially well for Wolverine as another attack, as if you play it first using his claws, you get it back to use to pay for other cards in your deck. 

Warrior Skill help you up the damage of your attacks as needed to get a kill. You'll be playing lots of attack events so Fluid Motion will buff Wolverine's attack up. You can gain extra uses out of that buff if he kills a minion and readies with Battle Fury.

He can get up to 5 base attack (if you are playing campaign and choose one of the aggression sets so you can take Combat Training or have a buddy) to deal damage with. His health can get as high as 27 with Symbiote Suit and Wolverine has a real shot at healing back up to that level, unlike most characters. name: Captain Marvel - Justice Energized!
description_md: v0.1 - The primary goal of this deck is to provide enough resource to [Captain Marvel](/card/01010a) to fuel her large attacks and usually game enders, [Photonic Blast](/card/01013) and [Energy Channel](/card/01018). The deck also focuses on ensuring the enemy cannot win via threat by using the Justice aspect. Cards like [Under Surveillance](/card/06031) equipped to the Main Scheme and [Counterintelligence](/card/08017) provides a large buffer on the victory margin for the villain. [Followed](/card/03032) provides extra damage to enemies when Side Schemes are defeated. Our main route to Side Scheme defeat is [For Justice!](/card/01060). Understanding this deck is overloaded on resources, we do have some and resource generation through cards like [Resourceful](/card/10032) and [Quincarrier](/card/08023). One downside this deck has is an overload of minions that have plenty of health points, like [Klaw](/card/01113) and his Masters of Minion modular set. However, this weakness only exists in a solo play environment, in a group setting your teammates would look this specific Captain Marvel/Justice deck to primarily focus on disrupting the villain's schemes and powering up for large attacks against the villain of any large minion threat. This deck will evolve over time as I obtain more hero packs to build and test with.

name: Adam Warlock Broken Godmode Symbiotic Suit
description_md:
Hi, guys! Want to share my favorite deck of all time. Adam Warlock is one of the strongest heroes in the game and in this setup he become absolutely broken. You just can't die lol. Beat nearly all bosses on expert with this.

## Pros:

- Amazing draw
- You're near immortal
- Good Thwarting 

## Cons:

- Kinda slow at killing the boss

## Key cards & Combos:

- [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) that thing is amazing and totally overpowered. Auto-include in any deck. 
- [Soul World](/card/21033) source of our immortality, it really shines when combined with [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191)
- [Nick Fury](/card/01084) + [Rapid Response](/card/08031) + [Summoning Spell](/card/21055) + [Quantum Magic](/card/21040) infinite card draw and [Soul World](/card/21033) counters, thats all. Don't forget to get [Captain Marvel](/card/01010a) and [Pip the Troll](/card/21032) on the table before you run this combo.
- [One Way or Another](/card/22015) + [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047) + [Clear the Area](/card/04049) good old Justice combo to draw many cards.

## How to play:

At the beggining we need to put our key upgrades and allies in play. Just play around it and use [Karmic Blast](/card/21038) and [Cosmic Awareness](/card/21039) when you need it. We need to get 2x [Mystic Senses](/card/21037), [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191), [The Sorcerer Supreme](/card/09026), [Soul World](/card/21033), [Captain Marvel](/card/01010a) and [Pip the Troll](/card/21032) in play as fast as possible. At that moment we have [Nick Fury](/card/01084) combo active. Remember, [Captain Marvel](/card/01010a) and [Pip the Troll](/card/21032) must stay in game for it. Now you just play cards, clear the table and win the game.

name: Wolverine Runs Berserk
description_md:
This deck leans into Wolverine throwing around damage but remaining healthy by way of Moment of Triumph and Follow Through. Whenever he can kill a minion, he can use those to heal. This is especially handy if he used his claws to pay for the card that did the killing. If draw multiple Moment of Triumphs, you can get a chain going with Berserker Barrage, killing and healing repeatedly. Clobber works especially well for Wolverine as another attack, as if you play it first using his claws, you get it back to use to pay for other cards in your deck.

Warrior Skill help you up the damage of your attacks as needed to get a kill. You'll be playing lots of attack events so Fluid Motion will buff Wolverine's attack up. You can gain extra uses out of that buff if he kills a minion and readies with Battle Fury.

This is a good list to include Fastball Special in as you can pump Wolverine's damage up quite high. It's better with Colossus Hero played by someone else but you could include the Ally to try and make it work.

name: Wolverine Does it All
description_md:
This is probably the least iconic Wolverine deck you could build. He's no investigator or careful planner. But he does try to do it all without fear so that kind of fits. The idea here is to chain a lot of things together. He already wants to try to clear the last threat from a scheme with Track by Scent. The rest of his deck leans harder into that. Perfect scenario, you play Making an Entrance to Thwart six off a scheme (2 base + 1 Heroic + 1 Symbiote +2 Making an Entrance). This clears the scheme, triggering the attached Overwatch to remove 6 from another scheme. Doing this basic thwart allows you to use your claws to play Brains Over Brawn to deal piercing damage to an enemy (its at least 4 damage but might be 6 since your thwart was 6 for that thwart). You cleared a scheme, so Making an Entrance heals you for 2, the same damage playing Brains Over Brawn did to yourself. You also get to Ready thanks to Justice Served, then draw a card from Skilled Investigator and then deal three damage to an enemy using Turn the Tide. If your attack killed a minion, you get to thwart one more with Interrogation Room. All told, you're still Ready and have removed 13 threat and done 9 damage at the cost of four cards from hand and two temporary cards already in play.


The final piece of this puzzle is Great Responsibility. I've never used this card because most justice heroes aren't the toughest. But Wolverine has ample opportunity to heal himself. He can afford to soak some damage to avoid threat being placed. He can use this to keep a scheme at a level that will allow him to clear what's left with the cards in his hand.

name: Wolverine Shows Some Leadership
description_md: Wolverine isn't especially suited toward Leadership, however, all X-Men make great Leadership decks. To Me My X-Men, Uncanny X-Men, and Utopia make any hero a great Leadership hero. What works especially well for Wolverine here is the use of Clarity of Purpose and Mass Attack. He can afford to pay for Mass Attack using his claws, still allowing him resources to pay new allies.  He can also afford the damage from Clarity of Purpose to generate a wildcard resource. If he can play Lead From the Front before Mass Attack, that's 4 bonus damage, meaning you could get up to 15 damage out of it (2 Wolverine + 1 Adamantium + 3 Colossus + 3 Gentle + 2 other Ally + 3 Mass Attack).

name: Storm - 4 Mutants, 2 Avengers and a Dog walk into a bar...
description_md:
I was thinking about how I enjoy the [Sentry](/card/10012) as an ally and how much he could benefit from Attack Training. A little fiddling around and this is what ended up with...

This deck's goal is to have some very beefy ATK allies and let them do the heavy lifting on damage. Storm will be playing Defense and managing threat when able. This deck will likely work better as a multiplayer deck than solo, but I'll give it some solo runs anyway to see what works out. 

The stars of the show are [Wolverine](/card/32041), [Sentry](/card/10012), and [She-Hulk](/card/10013) for piling up big damage using [Boot Camp](/card/13016), Attack Training, and Storm's [Thunderstorm](/card/36004). [Cosmo](/card/17020), [Magik](/card/32042), and [Sunfire](/card/35014) can also build up some big hits, but are intended more as blockers. 

Sentry, She-Hulk and Cosmo will have to use [Honorary X-Men](/card/33035) to benefit from Attack training, but get an extra HP in the process. Don't forget that you can play that card on the X-men characters as well for a bonus HP (including Storm, she will likely need it)

With Thunderstorm up, Storm use [The Best Defense…](/card/25020) to get a DEF of 3, but she is giving enemies a +1 as well, so it gets kind of negated, but it does allow her still defend some and give her allies a damage boost at the same time. 

Another option is for her to use Blizzard once she gets some of the ATK upgrades out to mitigate enemy damage while allowing her allies to strike hard.

Passed:

Mutagen Formula - Solo, Standard - Brothers Grimm

description_md:
I tweaked this deck to remove a few cards that were not working as strongly as I'd hoped.

Your goal here is still to build up some powerful allies who will do most of the damage while Storm manages threat and defense. To do so, you will want to get [Storm's Crown](/card/36006) and/or [Storm's Cape](/card/36007) in play. 

[Wolverine](/card/32041), [Sentry](/card/10012) and [She-Hulk](/card/10013) set up with [Honorary X-Men](/card/33035), [Boot Camp](/card/13016) and Attack Training are a force to be reckoned with and her X-Men allies all benefit from them as well in addition to being good blocking cards. [Professor X](/card/32019) can provide some much needed help with threat and provide another block.

Once you have some damage increases on your allies, putting out a [Blizzard](/card/36005) can reduce incoming damage while still hitting hard. When switching to alter-ego, [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) gives your allies a chance to lay out some damage while being safer from enemies attacking with the damage bonus.

Then there is [Spider-Man](/card/27049) with his [Reinforced Suit](/card/12018) + [Command Team](/card/23016) to combo with your hero.

This deck gets stronger in solo, with the ability to get stun and confuse onto the villain and take advantage of [Arachnobatics](/card/27031) and the low villain health pool.

I just started making my own decks and having a blast (had been using decks posted here before this). So maybe try the deck out and let me know what could be improved. 

Thanks!

name: Going outlaw to save the galaxy
description_md:
I was able to use this deck to solo GMW on Expert, I don’t know if it was good draws with Ronan or what because it’s the only time I’ve played him.

**Allies:**
I wanted to make this deck as event heavy as possible so went pretty bare on the allies.

[Groot](/card/16047) is there to keep you alive. He is an overkill shield against Ronan, and for most other villains he is there to block when minions come into play. He can even tank a hit from some of the weaker villains and survive, and if you get a 1-attack minion in play you can leave him on the board a bit and let him heal Groot up.

[Rocket Raccoon](/card/16019) is your minion killer. Just leave him on the board and wait for those minions to keep in.

[Nebula](/card/16088) I like to use Nebula to bring in an event I need, but I try to keep her in play as long as possible. I consider her an emergency chump blocker for when I unexpectedly get attacked twice in a row.

**Support/Upgrades**
This deck has some pretty expensive upgrades, and she is extremely powerful once they are down. I’ll talk more about how we are going to get those down in the strategy section.

Don’t be afraid to discard [Helicarrier](/card/01092) or [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091) to play more important events that will keep you alive or prevent the main scheme from blowing up.

[Gamora's Sword](/card/18010) is probably the least important upgrade to get down until late game.

**Mulligan**
You need to try to get some support/upgrades out on first turn.

[Conditioning Room](/card/18008) is extremely important for this deck to work. As well as [Sonic Rifle](/card/20015).

[Keen Instincts](/card/18009) is also hard to beat.

**Strategy**
The main hinge of this deck is flipping to alter-ego A LOT. Like every other turn when you can. Why?

- Gamora can usually draw two extra resources with [Conditioning Room](/card/18008) and her AE action. That makes it much easier to pay for those 2-4 cost allies/supports/upgrades. You’ll also be able to leverage extra resources when you flip back to hero form on your next turn.
- This deck lacks survivability, but with her flipping to AE to heal this is no longer a problem.
- [Lay Down the Law](/card/12031) and [Surprise Attack](/card/13014) are very powerful cheap cards, and you can make great use of them.

Now how are you going to go AE so often?
- [Sonic Rifle](/card/20015) is extremely important here. You are going to be using this a lot to prevent the scheme. You need to watch your timing with this so you can try to avoid flipping when your deck will run out because you don’t want to run the risk with an additional treachery card that makes the villain scheme. You also need to keep an eye out for when your deck is about to recycle to make sure these get shuffled in again.
- [Under Surveillance](/card/06031) is clutch here too with low threshold schemes. It’s usually pretty important to get out so you can avoid blowing up the scheme by accident. I like to flip to AE with just this or maybe 1 other card and pay for it using what I get from conditioning room and her AE action.
- Massive amounts of thwarting. There are a ton of good thwart cards in this deck that should let you constantly keep threat under control even with flipping to AE so often.

Staying alive? I don’t often use Gamora’s basic thwart or attack outside of the first turn. After that I’m either going to defend if I want to try to stay in Hero form, or I’m going to eat it to the face if I think I’m going to flip and heal. You are going to be doing that a lot, and with [Conditioning Room](/card/18008) and [Crew Quarters](/card/20029) that’s 4 health before you’ve used your own recovery. Also don’t forget to play [Crosscounter](/card/18004) whenever you get the chance. 2 damage/2 thwart/3 damage prevention at a cost of 1 is amazing

The rest of the game is pretty straightforward, just maximize you events to try to keep things under control, and once you’re built up enough you’re unstoppable.

name: Decked Halls 2022: Day 1 - 25¢ Weapons
description_md:
This is the deck 1 of 12 for the 2022 MCM Decked Halls tradition. This year Kennedy is building 12 decks with one collection so you can build these decks and just enjoy some games with family and friends instead of stressing over deck builds this Holiday season. Happy Holidays!

**Premise:** Use a combination of [No Quarter](/card/28013) and other damage boosting cards to draw into several cards and go to face with [Mean Swing](/card/06015) and [Skilled Strike](/card/09037)

**Recommended Heroes:** Black Panther, Thor, Hawkeye, Rocket, Valkyrie, Wolverine

**Notes:** 

- 48 cards is intentional, we are trying to jam the deck with cards to ensure No Quarter hits several cards each swing
- Allies and base attacks should be used to weaken minions, maintain them with [Throg](/card/25014) and [Spider-Girl](/card/04040) in order to hit with a huge No Quarter 
- [Assault Training](/card/26033) is mainly use to recycle No Quarter often, if you get one down you can use both uses in one flip (one the turn you flip and one next turn). Typically I try to play No Quarter 3-4 times per deck pass

name: Poker Night at S.H.I.E.L.D. Headquarters
description_md:
This is just the 'Playing Poker with Natasha Romanoff' deck, but I added a bunch of S.H.I.E.L.D. cards; it is now 50 cards because I am bad at removing things. I noticed the original deck tended to rack up too much threat without strong enough threat removal, so my idea was to fix that by adding more threat removal in the form of powerful allies and Homeland Intervention.

The Field Agents are here to be exhausted for Global Logistics / Dum Dum Dugan / Homeland Intervention. As an added bonus, they can keep your heavy allies alive for a bit longer. Agent 13 can also ready them again.

Meditation seemed like a no-brainer to add, since you are always alter-ego and don't really exhaust Natasha otherwise. It also helps pay for the heavy allies and supports this deck has.

Global Logistics is mostly here to justify the 50 cards; you can use them to mill your own deck searching for setup cards (the Safe House / Black Widow's Gauntlet / Counterintelligence combo specifically). But it's also nice to be able to hit the encounter deck with them.

name: Doctor X
description_md:
In this deck, Doctor Stephen Strange uses the [Seven Rings of Raggadorr](/card/09034) to toughen up his buffed X-Men allies, who come into play with Attack Training since [Danger Room](/card/33021) isn't locked to X-Men heroes.

Wolverine with Attack Training, Enraged, and Boot Camp will attack for 7, and he'll soak the 3 consequential damage on the turns he's tough.

Likewise, Dust with the same setup can attack any number of minions for 5 damage and soak infinite consequential damage if she's tough.

This deck is best paired with an X-Men hero like Storm, who can run Utopia, more Training cards, more X-Men allies, and potentially Uncanny X-Men.

Here's a sample Storm build to partner with:

1x Angel
1x Beast
1x Colossus

The deck obviously has some interesting variations to adapt/improve it for 1-2 players with cards that allow us to Confuse the villain and damage him while he is confused.

However those improvements will be uploaded in the deck notes later on.

Greetings and enjoy the deck

name: The Widow Maker
description_md:
The goal of this deck is to get your set up pieces all out to use your [Dance of Death](/card/08004) for huge hits on the villain. (If*) you got a really lucky card draw with double [Aggressive Energy](/card/32047). You could land a blow of 6, 7, 8 for a total of 21 damage. 

You can also spend time in alter ego building up playing [Covert Ops](/card/08003) and [Agent 13](/card/27046) to keep threat low. The second combo piece is [Agent 13](/card/29022) + your [First Aid](/card/01086) to trigger a ready of [Helicarrier](/card/01092) or in AE ready [Safe House #29](/card/08005) to get two preps back from your discard that you used for resources. This + [Espionage](/card/08033) could having you leaving AE with 10 cards in your hand. 

I still need to do some testing to see if I need to just go heavy on set up pieces to get them down faster.
