name: Spider-Woman Encounter Force
description_md: What do a Energy Converting Mutant, a Psychic Soviet Space dog, and the super-powered son of a Witch and a Android all have in common? Well, S.H.I.E.L.D. feels that you, Jessica Drew, can help gives these individuals the knowledge they need and lead them in a way to handle any situation. Mission, Go! _Thanks to Journeyman2 on the Marvel Champions LCG discord, who pointed out some factors in an early iteration which were holding the deck back_ ### **Vision** This deck originally was conceived as something just to try and find an interesting home for the Havok ally, as it got a good bit of negative press when it was first revealed. However after a surprisingly successful series of early games without much tuning, the skeleton of the deck seemed very competent and so I set out to see where this can be taken to with a little discernment. For Standard II/Expert II games I have felt for a while that [Global Logistics](/card/27043) is among the best solutions in the game to having consistent success for this game mode. The strongest/most powerful solution? No, I do mean the most consistent. It doesn't enable the flashiest plays in the game, but it does let you substantially mitigate the randomness from having to deal with the remarkably more difficult cards in this game mode. It goes a long way in making a unfair game into a manageable one. ### **Results (Over Iterations of refinement)** Two-Handed Expert Zola + Mister Hyde Mod (Aggression Wasp Duo) : Win Two-Handed Standard II/Expert II Taskmaster + Default Mods (Aggression Wasp Duo): Win Two-Handed Standard II/Expert II Tower Defense + Default Mods (Protection Spectrum Duo): Win Two-Handed Standard II/Expert II Thanos + Default Mods (Protection Spectrum Duo): Loss Solo Standard II/Expert II Rhino + Sinister Assault Mod: Loss Solo Standard II/Expert II Venom + Anachronaughts: Loss Solo Expert Venom + Anachronaughts: 1 Loss. 1 Win. (Second Game is when deck reached final listing) Solo Standard II Sandman + Default Mods: Win Solo Standard II Klaw + Default Mods: Win Solo Standard II Crossbones + Hydra Assault, Hydra Patrol, and Legions of Hydra: Win Solo Standard II/Expert II Crossbones + Hydra Assault, Hydra Patrol, and Legions of Hydra: 2 Losses, 1 Win(Win achieved after teching in Under Surveillance) ### **Game Plan** Now, the "Encounter Force" ([Havok](/card/36014), [Cosmo](/card/17020), and [Wiccan](/card/15011)) were brought in as cards that can capitalize on playing Global Logistics, which you are effectively doing as often as possible. You don't need to to just throw away those dangerous cards now, these guys can do it for you instead and let you profit for doing the spywork. Jessica Drew's Alter-Ego ability also works well to know if it's a good time to use any of these allies, though typically is only relavent in the early game. Additionally, [Blindfold](/card/33014) joins the team to provide more intel and ensure particularly egregious cards don't see the table. This is most effective when you have multiple Encounter Force Members on board who can filter cards for each other and use in the best order. Havok can take zero pip cards and turn them into free attacks or thwarts, getting them out of the way for Wiccan to deal more damage. Cosmo is going to be the perfect intermediary here regardless. [Maria Hill](/card/01067) and [Nick Fury](/card/01084) are good cards you'll be happy to see, getting to setup pieces sooner and giving smooth Thwarting (Damage as well for Nick) into chump blocking will be appreciated. [Quake](/card/08012) being a two cost chump blocker that can also hit decently when needed is especially good when this deck has damage issues early into setup. [Monica Chang](/card/27040) gives us a couple more S.H.I.E.L.D. traits to look at for Global Logistics and a chump blocker in herself. The [Surveillance Team](/card/01064) she brings out is also more valuable with the extra deck encounter deck knowledge you have, as it makes setup disruption cards into almost a reprieve instead of a game-killer when they are only taking out a Surveillance Team with 1 use counter. Another important characteristic is that it's 2-cost, and so it will be at least tied for the highest cost support/upgrade we control every time we see Overwhelming Force, which is more relevant then may seem when you can turn a particularly lethal encounter card into a blank. Moving onto events, we have Global Logistics, which I've put more than enough praise on. I however would not count on this as your means to "manage" Standard II / Expert II beyond two players though. It can still setup plays for the Encounter Force, but you won't be able to have control over what 4 different players see. Also be mindful of when NOT to use Encounter Force abilities on a stacked encounter deck. When you flip those cards you get to play GM a bit and assign boosts and encounter cards, so don't throw anything away for a Cosmo activation if you are able to set up a soft villain phase. [United We Stand](/card/14031) is somewhat meh early game, so you likely have an easy mulligan/resource then unless your allies and control tools are falling into place. It has tremendous value though, especially with [Captain Marvel](/card/04032) and Wiccan, but it can stretch the value out of Havok farther than you would expect and is still good on Quake in those tight early games where we still are looking for damage. Both of these are also zero-cost Aspect cards, and because of this we get Spider-Women to 3-value stats early on with little effort and 4-value very frequently after setup. Double resources have plenty of targets here so we play them. Didn't opt for any Power Of cards due to the somewhat inconsistent targets, the deck also has an easy time setting up with no upgrades or supports above 2-cost, so we don't really miss those extra resources. For the Supports, [Command Team](/card/23016) was a late addition that fixes many problems that may show up and is a very versatile solution when trying to solve a board. Allowing you to be more aggressive with your allies early on is a huge boon, especially when multiple minion threats touch the board at once. Additionally we squeeze more value out of Nick Fury before he discards himself, and it also feels great using on a Quake or Blindfold under [Team Training](/card/04016) so that they can use their 2-value stats again before chump blocking. We get better encounter deck manipulation with our Encounter Force cards by letting us discard more known factors in a given turn, which feels particular good on Havok who loves being able to either keep carrying value on zero-pip cards or Maximize damage when the opportunity is lined up. Lastly, its great to use to help fix your hand economy with Captain Marvel, which can come up often with [The Viper](/card/04054). We covered the benefits of Surveillance Team when discussing Monica Chang. I don't feel the need to mention Team Training outside what I have already said, but you do just have a lot of value Ally activations in the deck. Usually after you play this is when you can finally switch from controlling the game to actually looking for ways to end it. [The Triskelion](/card/01073) is great for letting you still get in a reliable stream of allies in to chump block and activate while we keep the Encounter Force and Captain Marvel on the field, while also just being the cost-free target for Global Logistics once it is in play. In the upgrades, [Deft Focus](/card/16024) works with 9 cards in our deck which leaves us with plenty of targets for this cheap piece of setup. Even if we don't count [Pheromones](/card/04036) for how often it can be a hindrance in Standard 2/Expert 2, that is still 7 targets with all really good affects for cost, while also either contributing or capitalizing on the stat gaining for Spider-Women's Hero ability. [Endurance](/card/05023) is an important card for the early game survival to keep us out of Alter-Ego form before we can reliably play Global Logistics and control our flip down. [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047)r pays itself off very quickly, while also being a easy means of early stat boosting with its zero-cost. ### **Performance Review and Potential Changes** Overall I am pretty content with where this list sits. Standard II and Expert II is pretty challenging even with bringing your own level of nonsense into the game. I love how this deck seems very competent at both Solo and Two-Handed, while also sticking mostly to the theme I went in with, and playing a very low to the ground control style. This has honestly become one of my favorite control oriented decks available right now. It's not perfect though and has plenty of room for improvement if you want to shift your goalposts a bit. I had only really tested Standard II/ Expert II solo a few times in the past before testing here, and man was that a bit of a wake-up call. Acceleration icons have always been more dangerous in solo, but combining that Permanent Steady and Crossbones innately having Piercing leaves Spider-Woman's 4 best cards all essentially dead. Definitely switch [Under Surveillance](/card/06031) in for Skilled Investigator in solo. You get enough value out from your in kit upgrades and Deft focus that it's not completely necessary (Especially since I know I didn't resolve it more than three times in any of my solo games). The room that the big green van gives you is too good when you have so many surge strings and incites you have to watch out for in Standard II/Expert II. The deck can be pivoted a couple ways. I wondered how a more control devoted list with Spycraft would look like, or a version that maxes Command Teams with Recursion tools to shove your value into tempo, and many other ideas. The list is tight though, and I feel it is unlikely you would change one card in this list without changing another, especially when having to play with the ratios SW's deck-building requires. I hope anyone that plays this enjoys. I certainly had fun getting things to this point, but am definitely taking a good long break from Standard II/Expert II. Happy playing!

name: Decked Halls 2022: Day 3 - Mission Command
description_md:
This is the deck 3 of 12 for the 2022 MCM Decked Halls tradition. This year Kennedy is building 12 decks with one collection so you can build these decks and just enjoy some games with family and friends instead of stressing over deck builds this Holiday season. Happy Holidays!

**Premise:**  Make use of [Command Center](/card/35032) and [Mission Training](/card/34016) in combination with [Followed](/card/03032) as a side scheme seek and destroy deck.

*Recommended Heroes: *

All the X-Men Ever

Best X-Men: Phoenix, Storm

Cyclops

*Change*
-2 Mutant Peacekeeper
-1 Colossus, -1 Marvel Girl
+1 Mirage, Pixie, Nightcrawler, Psylocke

Captain America

*Change*
-2 Mutant Peacekeeper
+1 Mockingbird, +1 Nick Fury

Notes:

- Embarrassing some of these allies are used later - replace [Angel](/card/33019) with [Storm](/card/34021)
- Your first objective is to get a copy of [Command Center](/card/35032) into play.
- Next, find an X-men ally ideally one with 2 THW and 3 hit points and equip them with [Mission Training](/card/34016)
-Use [One Way or Another](/card/30017) to seek out side schemes and draw into [Chance Encounter](/card/26034) or [Followed](/card/03032)
-Defeat the side scheme and profit

name: Decked Halls 2022: Day 4 - Pump It Up Redo
description_md:
This is the deck 4 of 12 for the 2022 MCM Decked Halls tradition. This year Kennedy is building 12 decks with one collection so you can build these decks and just enjoy some games with family and friends instead of stressing over deck builds this Holiday season. Happy Holidays!

**Premise:**  Let's revisit a Decked Halls classic from 2019 - the Captain America Stat Pumping Leadership deck. How much has the card pool changed this archetype. You can check out the original in the Derived from section on this deck (to the bottom left).

*Recommended Heroes: *

Captain Amerika
Quicksilver
Hulk?
Iron Man?
Dr. Strange

Notes:

- Your 2 card combo is [Morale Boost](/card/05032) and [Go All Out](/card/29017) with your shield down you can swing for 10, re-ready and swing for 3 more. That's enough to take down [MaGog (A)](/card/39001a) in solo and punch a little bit on his next respawn.

- The cost curve here is super lean with 25 cards costing 0-1 resources (some of those could cost more like [Shield Toss](/card/03006) and Ant-Man (Ally). It lets us squeek by without basic resources. [The Power of Leadership](/card/01072) helps us trigger Go All Out's requirement.

- You mainly want 4 allies to sit on the board for [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) but ocassiaonlly they will have to thwart. [Innovation](/card/21058) helps keep them able any typically targets Ant-Man or Agent 13 for the 2 THW.

- We've changed the cardpool a lot in the past 3 years! The image below shows the cost curve change by adjusting the deck with modern cards (and deck building). It's super fun to revisit old *classic* decks and see what they have become!

![name](https://mcm-podcast.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/Slide4-e1670124494214.jpg)

name: Ms. Marvel

name: Poker Night at S.H.I.E.L.D. Headquarters
description_md:
This is just the 'Playing Poker with Natasha Romanoff' deck, but I added a bunch of S.H.I.E.L.D. cards; it is now 50 cards because I am bad at removing things. The gimmick of the original is that you never leave alter ego throughout the entire game. I noticed the original deck tended to rack up too much threat without strong enough threat removal (at least in multiplayer), so my idea was to fix that by adding more threat removal in the form of powerful allies and Homeland Intervention.

The Field Agents are here to be exhausted for Global Logistics / Dum Dum Dugan / Homeland Intervention. As an added bonus, they can keep your heavy allies alive for a bit longer. Agent 13 can also ready them again.

Meditation seemed like a no-brainer to add, since you are always alter-ego and don't really exhaust Natasha otherwise. It also helps pay for the heavy allies and supports this deck has.

Global Logistics is mostly here to justify the 50 cards; you can use them to mill your own deck searching for setup cards (the Safe House / Black Widow's Gauntlet / Counterintelligence combo specifically). But it's also nice to be able to hit the encounter deck with them.

Edit 1: I replaced Beat Cops with Surveillance Team for more S.H.I.E.L.D. combos. I also dropped 1 copy of spycraft / counterintelligence and the Foiled! Event x3, so I could pick up Vigilante Training x2(to recycle Homeland Intervention), Team-Building Exercise (because Natasha has S.H.I.E.L.D. keyword), Monica Chang, and Sky-Destroyer.

name: Hulk Smashes SOLO
description_md:
# HULK

Hulk can be difficult to build for SOLO play basically because he only has that 4 hand size, and so you are stuck with needing a low cost curve or else risk being unable to play a card due to it being too many resources that Hulk does not have available. For this reason cards like Nick Fury, Helicarrier, and others are not included. 

What we do have here is Hulk able to hold down the Schemes that are out through the use of [Sense of Justice](https://marvelcdb.com/card/14030) to pay for [Clear the Area](https://marvelcdb.com/card/04049) or [Multitasking](https://marvelcdb.com/card/15013) and get the threat under control or eliminated allowing him to deliver his heavy hits provided within his kit and his hero. If an Advance is drawn at an inopportune time, there is also [Great Responsibility](https://marvelcdb.com/card/01061) provided within this deck to keep that excess threat from even being placed by taking with hulks massive hit point pool. 

The rest of the deck is fully explained on my channel: https://www.youtube.com/@latenightgaming5134

Have a great day and enjoy the deck!

description_md:
An initial attempt at a deck to take on the Sinister Six in Solo Champions League, Season 13, Round 2:
* Round 2 - The Sinister Six + Down to Earth (12/04/22-12/17/22)
* Difficulty: Standard
* Hero: Ghost-Spider
* Aspect: Aggression, Justice, Leadership, Protection, or All Basic
* Reputation: 11
 + 1x S.H.I.E.L.D. Tech Upgrade [Propulsion Gauntlet, Shock Knuckles, or Wave Bracers]
 + 1x Additional Mulligan
 + Choose any Aspect card and add maximum number of copies to deck
 + Add Ionic Boots to Encounter Deck
 + Place +1 Threat on Main Scheme
 + Search Encounter Deck for a Minion, put into play engaged with you.
Starting Villains
* Attempt 1 - Hobgoblin + Vulture
* Attempt 2 - Kraven the Hunter + Electro
* Attempt 3 - Scorpion + Doctor Octopus

Playing the deck

* In the general flow of the game, you can do your basic thwart and then [Turn the Tide](/card/15015) so for one effective resource you get to basic thwart, do 3 damage, ready yourself and likely draw a card from your [Web-Bracelet](/card/27009).
* Otto [Spider-Man](/card/31022) is also ridiculous value, allowing you to ready a [Web-Bracelet](/card/27009) and get an extra card for a net of two extra cards.

name: Decked Halls 2022: Day 5 - X-Men: The Last Stand
description_md:
This is the deck 5 of 12 for the 2022 MCM Decked Halls tradition. This year Kennedy is building 12 decks with one collection so you can build these decks and just enjoy some games with family and friends instead of stressing over deck builds this Holiday season. Happy Holidays!

**Premise:**  Meme deck [Last Stand](/card/15029) X-Men style, no - not that cruddy movie. Make use of great X-Men economy using [Uncanny X-Men](/card/36018) or ["To Me, My X-Men!"](/card/36020) to spam X-Men allies - then combo with [Thunderstorm](/card/36004), [Get Ready](/card/01069) and [Last Stand](/card/15029).

*Recommended Heroes: *

Storm
Wolverine
Colossus (you'll need to cut the Colossus ally)
Phoenix

Notes:

- Embarrassing some of these allies are used later - replace [Professor X](/card/32019) with [Longshot](/card/35033) at least until we get something better.
- This deck is insanely fast. Storm has so many ways to just crush enemies quickly. 
- Within her kit you can use your hero ability to swap to [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) to deal **2** damage, then play [Lightning Bolt](/card/36011) for another **8** + **2**. 12 Villain damage just by drawing into [Lightning Bolt](/card/02044)! Oh and Storm can attack for **3** so **15 total**.
- The deck adds more double digit turn, damage combos. With even [Forge](/card/36022) in play you can swap to Thunderstorm, for **2** + **2** from Forge's attack + **3** from Storm's attack. Now if you have [Get Ready](/card/01069) and [Last Stand](/card/15029) you can add **5** more hitting 12 damage really quickly.

name: Black Panther - Allies are Resources
description_md:
This is a standard Black Panther Leadership deck that makes use of the 3x Vibranium combined with all the draw power in leadership to do all the busted leadership things. 

Early on, you'll be building your engine as best as you can prioritizing allies so your Band Togethers and Strength in Numbers are online ASAP. Don't worry about your Black Panther upgrades or Wakanda Forevers at all until endgame. Damage / Thwart wherever you see fit to stay alive with your allies. You've got an even split generally, so do what you can where it is needed and makes sense. 

The name of the game is churning through your deck to do as many things as possible. Eventually, you'll end your turn playing a couple allies and upgrades then say go. Afterwards, you can chump all day with your allies, so you can reuse them later. Also, don't be afraid to cast allies even though your at the limit. Annihilate your friends after you don't have a use for them. Chances are you'll see them in a turn or two with all the cards your drawing or even Make the Call. 

It's got the obvious obnoxious Leadership engine (Beast, Maria, Nick Fury, Make the Call, Strength in Numbers, Rapid Response). However, we really abuse Beast here by playing a total of 9 resources it can retrieve, including Band Together which will pretty much consistently always generate 3 resources. You can technically go further with Strength, Energy, or even the Power in All of Us, but you probably don't need it and the deck is already tight enough. Moon Girl is SO easy to draw 3 cards as well because 6 double / triple resources this deck has access to. Kaluu gets you Make the Call or Strength in Numbers most of the time. This allows you to continue your draw engine as much as possible. Stinger is just there for Strength in Numbers and Band Together to be as consistent as possible. Ironheart is probably the worst ally, but hey it draws a card. 

Eventually, you'll get all of your upgrades together and be able to Wakanda Forever multiple times per turn for huge damage. 

Per Wakanda Forever, you'll get,
2 damage to an enemy
1 damage to a the villain + each enemy target player is engaged with
1 thwart
1 damage moved from your hero to an enemy. 

To maximize damage to the villain, double Panther Claws, resulting in 6 damage to the villain per WF. If you have the health available (for Vibranium suit) and your deck is running at max capacity, you can possibly play 5 WFs in one turn, resulting in up to 30 damage.

This is the deck 6 of 12 for the 2022 MCM Decked Halls tradition. This year Kennedy is building 12 decks with one collection so you can build these decks and just enjoy some games with family and friends instead of stressing over deck builds this Holiday season. Happy Holidays!

**Premise:**  Build a justice deck that prevents, mitigates, and removes threat without thwarting. Confused yet? Who care's about being confused - not you!

*Recommended Heroes: *

Colossus

All the X-Men Ever

*Change*
-1 Concussive Blow
+1 Weapon X

Ms. Marvel, Miles, Wasp - Optimal use of [Global Logistics](/card/27043) on player decks as you shuffle cards back in and seed your deck.

Notes:

- Use combinations of [Surveillance Team](/card/01064), [Homeland Intervention](/card/27042) to remove threat without thwarting
- Avoid thwart by avoiding schemes using [Steel Fist](/card/32008), [Concussive Blow](/card/05031), [Foiled!](/card/09038), [Great Responsibility](/card/01061), and Armor Up.
- Don't forget [Surveillance Team](/card/01064) and [Under Surveillance](/card/06031)
-Note, [Great Responsibility](/card/01061) is a hero ability so you can soak advances into a tough card for card draw with [Iron Will](/card/32004) or let other players flip with ease in multiplayer (I didn't catch this until far into testing :p)

description_md: This deck isn't anything too complicated, it's just what I consider to be the best way to run the Spider-verse characters/Web-Warriors. Miles is the best for the job thematically, but also because you get to have all the best Web Warriors in your deck, and you don't have to have the Miles Morales ally since he's kinda trash, but the hero is good so it all works out. Mechanically the deck works best if you focus playing your allies and your 1-cost cards. You won't really need your 2-cost events, relying on Double Life and the 1-cost upgrades offer plenty of power alonside your allies. You should get to use Miles' basic powers a ton, for whatever you need. Otto can ready a web-shooter, Gwen can get a Double Life in your hand, Billy can do big damage for you, Peter gives you another hero ready.. all of the Web-Warrior traited cards synergize very well with Miles and this themed deck is the only way I like to play him.

name: Spider-Man+S.H.I.E.L.D.=Match Made in Heaven
description_md: I call this a theme deck because it's the only deck I've ever put together for Spider-Man that made me feel a bit like I'm actually playing as him. The usual setup for Spider-Man is to defend allies, which to me always feels like your allies are the ones doing all the actual work while you simply protect their hp with an identity-less block bot. He works really well with SHIELD for a few reasons. First, many of the SHIELD cards are supports and therefore have no hp and do not need you to defend for them. Spider-Man fights the villain while they set up and start chipping in more and more over time. Second, since the SHIELD cards sit on the table, your deck gets much thinner, allowing for far more draws of Backflip and Swinging Web Kick, which are what makes Spider-Man fun, and the added uses of these cards makes Spider-Man feel more active in the fight and thus more engaging to play. Third, Spider-Man has excellent economy, so he is very capable of affording the SHIELD build. And last, the SHIELD cards offer constant readily available thwarting capabilities, which not only covers for Spider-Man's weak thwarting capabilities, but makes it a strength. By the time you need to flip to alter-ego, the SHIELD cards will have you covered. You are never stuck in hero form, and stun and confuse hurt you very little as well. This build makes games with Spider-Man actually fun for me, I think it really feels like you are in a 1v1 with the villain while SHIELD does its work around you, taking care of threat and minions while you spider-sense, flip, and kick your way to victory. And maybe even dig out the old black suit.

name: This oughta Even the Odds - Multitasking (multiplayer) Ms Ma
description_md:
Multiplayer magician, Ms Marvel, pulls a side scheme to draw three cards with [One Way or Another](/card/22015), then removes six threat from all side schemes with [Even the Odds](/card/30014) (buffed by [Shrink](/card/05011)), triggering [Overwatch](/card/30019)to remove six more from the main, pinging one damage as a result of [Even the Odds](/card/30014)kicker, then hits for five damage with [Turn the Tide](/card/15015) (buffed by [Embiggen!](/card/05010)), and you and the two people to your left each draw a card with their own personal copy of [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047). Side schemes especially tough this turn? No sweat. Exhaust ms Marvel, pick up that card and remove four more threat all around.

All this paid for with [Biokinetic Polymer Suit](/card/05009), [Sense of Justice](/card/14030), and 0 cost cards.

While working on a multiplayer Ms Marvel deck, I looked at an interesting deck using [Problem Solvers](/card/25033)to take advantage of [Shrink](/card/05011) to crush all threat in multiplayer games. It’s good, but is held back by all the obstacles to playing that card, since you needed a guardian and an avenger and Ms Marvel is neither. Not to mention the 4-cost.

So what about [Even the Odds](/card/30014)? Still works with [Shrink](/card/05011) but for two cost and doesn’t require anyone to exhaust. Big issue is that it scales per player and doesn’t remove threat from the main scheme. [Overwatch](/card/30019)fixes the latter, since I can remove the same amount of thwart from another scheme. For the former, as player count and potential number of side schemes goes down, [For Justice!](/card/01060) starts to look like the better card. 

But, at four player, I’m thwarting 6 from every scheme out, for one less card cost as [Problem Solvers](/card/25033)(including the cost of [Overwatch](/card/30019)) which, at best, was only clearing 5 threat per scheme.

I built this for multiplayer, and when I play it that way, I throw in all three copies of [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047), putting me at 42 cards.

In testing I was surprised that this ended up working pretty well in true solo as well. I swapped in For Justice or [Clear the Area](/card/04049) for [Even the Odds](/card/30014) and probably a two-cost ally instead of Justice [Spider-Man](/card/04045). Ran my card draw engine, clearing any minions with [Turn the Tide](/card/15015), until my board was set up and all threat was clear, flipping every turn to heal and generate cards with my Personas. Then late game I hit hard with [Big Hands](/card/05003), usually playing it twice for at least ten damage a turn. Ended up crushing expert Klaw.

Mulligan hard for [Shrink](/card/05011). Then Personas and resource generators. Particularly [Biokinetic Polymer Suit](/card/05009), which helps you always satisfy the energy requirement on [Even the Odds](/card/30014).

name: Cyclops Assesses, Then Assembles
description_md:
![Cyclops Assesses!](https://1.bp.blogspot.com/_upF4Etvqv9Y/R_2HXmPnjLI/AAAAAAAAAeg/Afs6P7D6GqU/s320/CykeThinking.gif)

Hi, Nonprophet here, with a Cyclops deck featuring what I personally feel is an underrated card, a card I'm honestly surprised to not have seen in any popular Cyclops deck yet, that I've made great use of - Assess the Situation!

First, why do I like this card, that doesn't see much play? It's not often I get a chance to use it, but, when you have a deck you'd like to be thinner and get through more quickly, it can sometimes be a decent fit. It's a great filler card - use the resource if you need it, and if you don't, you're setting yourself up for a stronger next turn. If you have a hero with a smaller hand size, it can also be helpful for bigger next turns, often flipping out of alter-ego, for a nice burst of cards that would be otherwise tough to get for a smaller hand size hero. Is it a meta card? Eh, you don't see it often in published deck lists - but I like it, and if I find an excuse to throw it in a deck, I will.

Why is Assess the Situation good for Cyclops? It's a tactic, and that means you can pull it at will from your deck with Constant Training, or, tutor it up from the discard after playing Tactical Brilliance. So, what exactly does this do for Cyclops in particular, and how does it combo into the bigger picture goal of getting to the point of quickly getting set up, bringing massively buffed allies out at will? The answer lies in the supports - the entire deck revolves around getting the supports out as quickly as possible, and Assess the Situation does that in spades for Cyclops. I've personally found Assess the Situation to be a very reliable replacement for something like Make the Call or Sneak Attack etc - getting the support suite out more quickly allows you to reliably bring out cheap, strong allies, and often have resources to spare.

Now, does that mean we want to pull Assess the Situation every Constant Training or Tactical Brilliance? Certainly not! Often, you know you just need another resource, card in hard to spend this round, so you'll be looking for a more useless tactic to pull for that purpose. If you have a reason to attach a tactic to a minion or whatever, pull for that instead! If neither of those are a present need, or if you just flipped down and you're going for a big hand next turn, Assess the Situation is a VERY strong choice that gets you to your support and ally goals faster.

Speaking of flipping down to alter-ego, you will probably want to do so as often as possible - Professor X and Pyslocke are your sources of confusion, both are very helpful for this. You have some good support options in hero form, but a wide array of powerful options are available in alter-ego with a full support suite, and your hand count and ability to play allies cheaper can get pretty strong. Since you'll be spending time in alter-ego, and often won't be exhausting to recover, Meditation was added to assist in getting some of the expensive supports, or allies out. Consider starting a turn in alter-ego, after having played an Assess the Situation or, let's say two, in the previous turn. Not too uncommon - 8 cards in hand to start. Fire off Cerebro - 9 cards in hand. A solid hand count for sure, easily attainable. Now, Constant Training - 10 cards. It's possible to have an 11 card hand count on turn 2! Now, you have at least one ally in hand (almost certainly), a ton of resources to play them with, and a ton of options - and the more supports you get out, the more options you have. Let's explore them!

Cerebro - FANTASTIC card for Cyclops, is probably highest priority support to get out. I find that I most often use this to pull, quite frankly, an extra card to load my hand with for more options while in alter-ego. This is more useful when you have a psionic ally in play, of course, but when you do, you can often pull a clutch Prof X or Psylocke to get some confuse action on the boss, saving you a lot of alter-ego grief. Have your other buff support cards out? Pull a Wolverine, or a Rockslide, buff them to space, and have them go to town. Quite a versatile support indeed.

Danger Room - Having the ability to get an automatic Danger Room Training on a new ally is another wonderful benefit of being in alter-ego mode. Usually, I want to have at least Cerebro and Danger Room down before my first flip back down to alter-ego. Danger Room Training is one hell of a buff to apply for free!

Team Training - Now, we're looking at allies buffed with +2HP, +1ATK, +1THW.

Uncanny X-Men - Alongside Team and Danger Room Training, now we're looking at, for example, a 7HP, 4ATK, 2THW Wolverine. A 9HP, 4ATK, 2THW Rockslide. A 6HP, 3ATK, 3THW Jean. Boom. Additionally, you may have noticed the inclusion of Honorary X-Men - this is to be used on Cyclops himself, to be able to take advantage of cheaper allies in alter-ego form.

X-Mansion - Yet another benefit of being in alter-ego, now all of these massively buffed allies are staying alive FAR longer. Wolverine is an amazing target for this, as are any psionic characters, which you want to keep at least one on the field for Cerebro purposes.

Utopia - You know what's fun? Smacking some bad guy with a beefed up Wolverine. You know what's more fun? Smacking some bad guy with a beefed up Wolverine, then, bringing out a beefed up Rockslide to smack the bad guy, and then, smacking some bad guy with a beefed up Wolverine again. Utopia + Danger Room + Cerebro makes it possible! Add Exploit Weakness for even more fun.

Team Building Exercise - We need some options to be able to help bring out allies and supports while in hero form as well, and Team Building Exercise does the trick, helping to bring out any support or ally outside of Uncanny X-Men (oddly enough), Team Training or Team-Building Exercise. Honorary X-Men makes this usable in alter-ego as well!

The X-Jet - Solid card, Honorary X-Men makes the resource usable by yourself in alter-ego.

As you can see, you have a LOT of options to get set up quickly, with buffed allies out. But is that the whole picture for Cyclops? Nope, there's a bit of nuance as far as the tactical selection when you get an opportunity to Constant Train or Tactical Brilliance. Knowing which tactics (and allies!) are still in your deck, and which are in your discard pile, is critical for a successful player of this deck. Luckily, chances to take a peek at what is left, via tutoring, are frequent.

Assess the Situation - Again, I just like this card. As mentioned above, if you don't have a pressing need for another tactic, it's a great way to speed into your support suite more quickly, or just give yourself more options on the next turn. Try to avoid pulling for just a resource.

Exploit Weakness - Your win condition will often be a few allies lined up, maybe with some Utopia ready action, ready to smack the bad guy as a team - this is exactly when you want Exploit Weakness on the villain. 3, 4 ally hits, plus your basic attack, maybe an optic blast, it adds up. In multiplayer, with Field Commander down, it gets even better! However, outside of these situations, it's not fantastically useful - maybe for an optical blast but is pretty expensive for that purpose. Outside of going for the kill, when it's amazing, it makes a great target for a resource card you may need this turn instead.

Priority Target - Depends. No minions? It's a decent pick for an optic blast enabler, being 0 cost and all, and it's a great pick for a resource card you may need this turn. Obviously, when you can put it on a minion, it's quite a bit stronger and can contribute to the high hand count of options this deck is capable of. Even if you don't get the two cards out of it, pulling it for a resource isn't too shabby.

Practiced Defense - Great optic blast enabler to have on harder hitting villains, it's value skyrockets in multiplayer. For the most part, it's just a solid target for another resource or option in hand this turn.

So what about these allies? Really, pick your favorite 10 x-men, and it'll work. The cheaper, smaller allies get buffed just as well as the bigger expensive ones! About the only ally I would not consider is Beast - I love Beast, but without any resource cards in deck, Beast obviously isn't all that great. However, there are some allies you probably will want in your deck for sure - specifically, Professor X and Psylocke - you need that confusion to be able to safely flip down into alter-ego, which is always a goal of this deck. Professor X, Psylocke, and Pheonix will turbo charge Cerebro for you, try to have a psionic ally in play as much as possible for this reason. Other assorted psionic x-men allies like Marvel Girl or Blindfold can fit this role as well. I would also advise having some big, chonky targets like say, Colossus, Wolverine, Rockslide, etc, as they make great targets for Danger Room Training - keeping them in the fight longer and making them hit harder is quite beneficial.

Hey, anyways, this is Cyclops we're talking about here. What's the deal with Optic Blast / Full Blast / Ricochet Beam? Pew pew pew pew, right? Well.... not really while setting up. Before your supports are all out, it almost always makes sense to play with the goal of getting those out instead of using tactics and resources for the purpose of Optic Blast. Yeah, even a Full Blast, as much damage as it does, might be better spent getting supports out if you don't have enough out. However, once you do have those supports out and a few allies out, the lasers start, and you will often find an excuse or opportunity to throw some Optic Blasts, or Ricochet Beams if minions are around, and more often than not, you will be building towards one huge win turn, dropping an Exploit Weakness, optimizing your total number of ally attacks, and then, Full Blasting for the win. It's some serious style points, and it will impress your group.

Other random Cyclops items of note that aren't really deck specific - Field Commander is AMAZING in multiplayer, obviously, because you want every player to be able to Exploit Weakness when you drop one on the villain, allowing some really big, stompy damage turns. However, in solo, it's almost always just a resource card. It's probably not worth bringing out for the buff, at least in this deck. There's some shenanigans with Pinned Down that make sense to bring Field Commander out in solo, but that's for those Green players (also a fun Cyclops style - see the popular Cyclops Perfected deck for a guide on that)!

Mulligan - Mulligan tactics with a vengeance! They can be easily tutored at will. Just try not to load your hand up with all supports and no resources to pay for them, that's not a great start at all. You're mainly looking for Cerebro, Danger Room Training, X-Jet, or Team Building Exercise. The other supports are decent, but can often be tutured up by Forge later if you discard them now.

Lastly, the obligation - quite possibly one of the tamest in the game, can actually be beneficial to Cyclops, if you have not played Ruby Quartz Visor yet. Now, remember that you usually don't need to start with the lasers until you are fully set up. With this in mind, I often will hold off on playing Ruby Quartz Visor until I have enough supports on the board to bring out buffed allies at will. It's pretty frustrating to lose 2 resources because you wanted to Optic Blast for free early :) Ask me how I know. However, once you reach that saturation point, there will probably only be a turn or two left, and enough of your deck will be filtered so that it's usually possible to get these equipped just before you need them if your obligation never fires, and if it does fire, you can reliably do so.

Anyways, if you made it this far, thanks! I appreciate you taking the time to read this rambling wall of text - it's my first deck I've ever published but I felt strongly enough about giving Assess the Situation it's due in a Cyclops deck that I'm going to go hit that publish button right now. Thanks again!

-Nonprophet

name: Phoenix the headhunting fitness instructor
description_md:
She will look for you, she will find you, and she will train you. 

Mulligan target is [Danger Room](/card/33021), [Forge](/card/36022) or [Cerebro](/card/34022). I feel that having these 3 cards giving you access to get the main combo rolling brings a lot of consistency to the deck.

Get  [Danger Room](/card/33021) in play ASAP. [Cerebro](/card/34022) will be helpful, but there are so many allies in the deck that you should naturally draw into a few, but definitely play it if you draw it. I'll add [White Hot Room](/card/34004) as a card you really should not discard. 

Swap every turn between alter-ego and hero form, making sure to use [Cerebro](/card/34022) and playing your allies while in alter-ego to trigger [Danger Room](/card/33021) which makes you look for a [Danger Room Training](/card/33015). Try spending Phoenix's counters while in hero form for non-ally cards.

Your hero needs to tank the villain attacks ideally, to keep your allies alive. [Rise from the Ashes](/card/34006), [White Hot Room](/card/34004), [Telekinetic Shield](/card/34007) and the fact you are in alter ego every turn allows you to survive and recover well. You end up having a total of 23hp and recover 5 per turn with the previously mentioned cards all in play. 

Your allies can generally last a while thanks to the +1 hp from [Danger Room Training](/card/33015), [X-Mansion](/card/32049) and [Game Time](/card/33022). I put so many allies in the deck to provide options between attacking and thwarting, but also because [Cerebro](/card/34022) gives you an extra resource per turn in the form of an ally card once you are satisfied with your board. 

Due to the nature of [Dark Phoenix](/card/34029) as a Nemesis, you want to stay in restrained form as much as possible, maybe flipping to unleashed towards the end. I am not a big fan of most of her hero cards so I end up using them as resources to play allies or the stronger hero cards, like [Rise from the Ashes](/card/34006), [Phoenix Firebird](/card/34013), [Telekinetic Shield](/card/34007), [Mind Control](/card/34009) situationally, [White Hot Room](/card/34004).

[Angel](/card/33019) is minimum 12 damage for 2 resources. 

[Beast](/card/33011) is also 12 damage or 12 thwart for 2 resources. 

[Colossus](/card/32048) is 12 damage for 3 resources, or 1 block 8 damage, or 16 damage if you can heal him once. 

[Cyclops](/card/34003) is 12 damage or 12 thwart for 3 resources. 

[Gentle](/card/36016) is 8 to 16 damage for 3 resources

[Mirage](/card/36015) is 9 thwart and generally 1 villain stun for 3 resources.

[Pixie](/card/36017) is 9 damage and 1 ally back to you for 2 resources. 

[Storm](/card/34021) is 12 attack or thwart for 4 resources, but her effect and potentially soul sisters bring her value up a bit. 

All this damage/thwart per resource is further improved by [Game Time](/card/33022), [Psychic Kicker](/card/34034) and [X-Mansion](/card/32049). 

I don't include [Professor X](/card/32019) because this deck aims to have long lasting allies. You can include him if you want and take out 1 [Danger Room Training](/card/33015).

name: Decked Halls 2022: Day 8 - Inconsequential
description_md:
This is the deck 8 of 12 for the 2022 MCM Decked Halls tradition. This year Kennedy is building 12 decks with one collection so you can build these decks and just enjoy some games with family and friends instead of stressing over deck builds this Holiday season. Happy Holidays!

**Premise:**  Create an ally aggression deck like that of the great @dr00 which uses cheap efficient aggression allies and avoids the downside of consequential damage.

*Recommended Heroes: *

Dr. Strange

*maybe* Spider-Woman with Muster Courage?

Notes:

- This deck is all about taking advantage of tough from [Seven Rings of Raggadorr](/card/09034) we can pump allies up with [Enraged](/card/03031) and not worry about the excess consequential damage.
- Some key combos: [Dust](/card/33012) + Attack Training + [Boot Camp](/card/13016) leads to a 5 damage minion AOE hit.
- [Marvel Boy](/card/21041) + [Energy Spear](/card/22032) + [Enraged](/card/03031) +[Boot Camp](/card/13016) is a 7 damage basic attack with piercing
- But both of these attacks are only one shot without that tough card.
-Typically you'll be counting on invocations to keep you afloat while you build up these mega allies, and then using [Master of the Mystic Arts](/card/09005) to keep the [Seven Rings of Raggadorr](/card/09034) on top of your invocation deck and using shenanigans like [As One!](/card/23032) on off turns to avoid consequential in a different way.
- [Brute Force](/card/14029) is surely an odd duck but works well here because typically Dr. Strange is used to play invocations and only attacks occasionally to heal [Bug](/card/16040)

name: Gwen Counter-Purpose v0.3
description_md:
This is my take on journeyman2's wonderful "Gwen Hits the Griddy".

I dropped both [Plasma Pistol](/card/20022) (I never once played them, between [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) and [Web-Bracelet](/card/27009) I already had enough targets for [Repurpose](/card/31016)).

I dropped all three [True Grit](/card/18031) (wasn't in Alter Ego much and didn't need the extra thwart since the villain wasn't scheming a lot).  Also, to make True Grit effective, you need to use [Repurpose](/card/31016), which just undermines your big end-game finishing move.

I dropped the [Electrostatic Armor](/card/10031) (didn't need the retaliate, and I wanted more go-faster cards).

I added two [The Power of Protection](/card/01079) to help with the 2+ cost Protection cards.

I added one [The Night Nurse](/card/09019) (just in case I got a stun at the wrong time).

Finally I added three more Web-Warrior & Protection Allies -- [Silk](/card/27010) and [Spider-Man: Miles Morales](/card/02701) and [Spider-Man Noir](/card/31015).

The reason for the extra allies is that (a) I had been getting very poor value out of [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023), (b) I wanted more targets for [The Power of Protection](/card/01079) especially once the [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) were already in play.  

[Spider-Man: Miles Morales](/card/02701) is great value, IMHO.  You don't get his Stun/Confuse if you play him via [Across the Spider-Verse](/card/27018), but if you have a [The Power of Protection](/card/01079) in hand, then he can give you a nice breathing-space to set-up or recover.

name: Marvel Medley Colossus Aggression
description_md:
Similarly to KennedyHawk from MCM, I've taken it upon myself to make 12 decks because its a festive number and it's the 12th month of the year. I used the Marvel Champions deck randomiser (https://krasstek.shinyapps.io/marvelchampioner/) to output 12 random Villain and Modular combinations, and then give me 12 random Hero and Aspect pairings. I had to fiddle with the latter a bit so I had 3 of each aspect.

I then paired up Heroes to take down each of the Villain / Modular pairings and built a loosely tribal deck to take down each.

On the first day of Christmas, Rhino, the Frost Giants and Armies of Titan were dismantled pretty easily by Colossus and his Aggression.

Signature card: Attack Training

Play amazing allies. Put Attack Training on those allies. Wreck things.

name: Decked Halls 2022: Day 9 - Repurpose Your Life
description_md:
This is the deck 9 of 12 for the 2022 MCM Decked Halls tradition. This year Kennedy is building 12 decks with one collection so you can build these decks and just enjoy some games with family and friends instead of stressing over deck builds this Holiday season. Happy Holidays!

**Premise:**  Help the Guardians find a new purpose in life with [Repurpose](/card/31016) and [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) from SP//dr's pack.

*Recommended Heroes: *

Star-Lord- Focus on burst damage and [Daring Escape](/card/17003)

Rocket - Focus on Tech Upgrades and [I've Got a Plan](/card/16030)

Groot - Focus on [Lashing Vines](/card/16009)

Drax - Focus on quick vengeance setup and ["Fight Me, Coward!"](/card/19003)

You can even find similar builds with Venom, Nebula and with some work even Adam Warlock (grab each aspects readying and stat boosting cards).

Notes:

- You can burst has high as 23 damage in an opening turn with Star-Lord.
- Mulligan into, [The Power of Protection](/card/01079), [Repurpose](/card/31016), [Repurpose](/card/31016), [Daring Escape](/card/17003), [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019), any last card. Grab a [Element Gun](/card/17007) from your deck.
 - Play [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) with Power of Protection and Random card. 
 - Use Star-Lord's ability to play [Element Gun](/card/17007)
 - Attack for 2.
 - [Repurpose](/card/31016) your [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) and attack for 5.
 - Play [Daring Escape](/card/17003) and attack for 5, draw any card.
 - Use drawn card for [Element Gun](/card/17007) to deal 3.
 - [Repurpose](/card/31016) [Element Gun](/card/17007) to attack for 8.
 - 2 + 5 + 5 + 3 + 8 = 23!!!?@!#

- You may die the next turn but at least it was a blast.

name: Spider-UK is (Hangar) Bae
description_md: ### **First Love** [Spider-UK](/card/27012) is one of the communities most loved allies of the year. And some people REALLY love him, so much so as to call him their (Hangar) Bae. Alright we're gonna drop the bit there. When [Hangar Bay](/card/36035) was revealed it was met by the Marvel Champions community with resounding neutral note of recognition. The card is not necessarily bad, you have probably noticed interesting decks already implementing it, but it does feel under supported at the moment. Spider-UK was one of the allies I saw mentioned a lot that could potentially unlock something special from the new support card. So I was surprised to see no decks posted to MCDB that put the two together! So, here is my early submission for the paring. ### **Match Made In Heaven** I had the idea to run these cards with the Peter Parker Spider-Man hero, despite the slower Web-Warrior setup he has compared to others, for two big reasons. First, of all the potential heroes that can get the Web-Warrior trait, Peter felt like he needed the most help with minion control, which is what UK's ability excels at managing. The three [Swinging Web Kick](/card/01005) cards are a good source of damage, but they are often a bit overkill for minions and are better to throw against your villain. Second, not starting with the Web-Warrior trait lets Peter have the Avenger trait. This is nice as it lets us run [Muster Courage](/card/12032). Our end goal here is obviously to set up Spider-UK with Hangar Bay, and then we keep playing Muster Courage to give him a tough status. This will let him defend against Villain attacks without worrying about being defeated, while also squeezing in 5 damage when we are fully setup on Web-Warriors. Hangar Bay will then give him the ready so he can defend again against a minion and often defeat them before they can damage him. And that's it! A very solid repeatable play providing you Villain Damage, defense, and minion control. On top of all this you're still playing a competent Web-Warrior deck with the added boon of Muster Courage! ### **What Is Love?** Going to try and give a non over-bearing breakdown. Allies are all the generically good and playable Web-Warriors, with some others. [Silk](/card/27010) is still cheap enough to be good before you have the Web-Warrior trait and can give it to you when you don't yet have WotW or WoLD, [Miles](/card/27011) procs often since we are keeping the board full for UK, and [Hobie](/card/27017) is nice to get our numbers up and 2-THW can be more valuable then you think early on. [Across the Spider-Verse](/card/27018) lets us recur UK if something went wrong to discard him or another component had to be put in play first when drawn together. [Endurance](/card/05023) gives us extra health to stretch the time before we go down and patch up with [Aunt May](/card/01006), and lets us push with Spider-Tingle more. Speaking of, [Spider-Tingle](/card/31020) protects UK from surprise disruption, helps protect important cards from setup disruption, and can leave the villain with some very dead turns once are defenses are setup. It being a Genius trait to proc Black Cat more is also nice. [Ingenuity](/card/29027) is an awesome resource generator. Went with two [Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029) for consistency purposes, as well as UK not being a bad target for your second, letting you wrap up your final damage against the villain sooner. ### **Ain't No Heartbreak** Took a fair win Expert Sinister Six, which is actually fairly vulnerable to UK, but they were paired with the nasty Inheritor mod set. That being said, there were still some excellent turns. With some help from other Web-Warriors softening up the enemies, UK had a couple of moments where he would defeat a Villain AND a Inheritor Minion within the same villain phase. This deck should scale to Multiplayer well with Muster Courage and WoLD, though in Solo I might recommend [Bait and Switch](/card/15030) to go in for the Spider-Tingles to better manage threat early on and cash in on your ample defensive options. I also think [Target Acquired](/card/08024) can be a good tech choice for any card you aren't sold on here, as managing boost affects with ally/setup hate can be super solid with your gameplan. That's about all I have here. If you like Web-Warrior decks and want to try something with a fun combo option, or just have been waiting for a deck with Hangar Bay that seems interesting, I recommend you give this a go!

name: SCL1302 - Gwen gets her thwart on, a little V2
description_md:
An initial attempt at a deck to take on the Sinister Six in Solo Champions League, Season 13, Round 2:
* Round 2 - The Sinister Six + Down to Earth (12/04/22-12/17/22)
* Difficulty: Standard
* Hero: Ghost-Spider
* Aspect: Aggression, Justice, Leadership, Protection, or All Basic
* Reputation: 11
 + 1x S.H.I.E.L.D. Tech Upgrade [Propulsion Gauntlet, Shock Knuckles, or Wave Bracers]
 + 1x Additional Mulligan
 + Choose any Aspect card and add maximum number of copies to deck
 + Add Ionic Boots to Encounter Deck
 + Place +1 Threat on Main Scheme
 + Search Encounter Deck for a Minion, put into play engaged with you.
Starting Villains
* Attempt 1 - Hobgoblin + Vulture
* Attempt 2 - Kraven the Hunter + Electro
* Attempt 3 - Scorpion + Doctor Octopus

Playing the deck

* In the general flow of the game, you can do your basic thwart and then [Turn the Tide](/card/15015) so for one effective resource you get to basic thwart, do 3 damage, ready yourself and likely draw a card from your [Web-Bracelet](/card/27009).
* Otto [Spider-Man](/card/31022) is also ridiculous value, allowing you to ready a [Web-Bracelet](/card/27009) and get an extra card for a net of two extra cards.

name: Hawkeye(Liderazgo/Protegido por los vengadores)
description_md:
Mazo de Clint que trata de cubrirlo continuamente con los aliados para evitar sufrir grandes ataques ya que el punto mas débil de ojo de Halcon es su vida y escasa capacidad de defenderse hasta que consigue a [Pájaro Burlón](/card/04004) mientras va montando su motor para buscar y lanzar sus flechas y los recursos para jugar aliados mas potentes

Nuestro principal objetivo es tener siempre algun aliado que nos cubra de los ataques, que gracias a [Listo para la acción](/card/04017) vamos a darles cartas de estado duro por lo que nos van a poder defender varias veces

Los mejores aliados para defendernos son nuestra aliada propia [Pájaro Burlón](/card/04004) gracias a su habilidad o [USAgente](/card/04014) que al tenerlo con cartas de estado duro va a ir activando su represalia, ademas de [Blade](/card/21019) o [Aguijón](/card/12014) por su bajo coste

Por otro lado aprovechando que tenemos muchos eventos en el mazo (incluidas todas nuestras flechas) [Kaluu](/card/21014) prácticamente siempre nos va a encontrar algo util con su habilidad 

[Pantera Negra](/card/23012) nos da la oportunidad de recuperar [Listo para la acción](/card/04017) y aumentar nuestras posibilidades de "endurecer" nuestros aliados

[Halcón](/card/03011) nos ayuda principalmente con la amenaza, ya que es otro punto débil a cubrir;

Otro punto a tener en cuenta es la carta [Los héroes más poderosos](/card/04022), que puede aprovechar aliados como [Blade](/card/21019) o [Hombre Maravilla](/card/03014) para volver a preparar a nuestro heroe y lanzar mas flechas en un solo turno, o preparar a [Power Man](/card/21012) para aprovechar mas cuando gastemos sus contadores de chi

En cuanto a recursos tenemos nuestros dos [Tirador experto](/card/04010) para ir lanzando nuestras flechas que almacenaremos en el [Carcaj de Ojo de Halcón](/card/04003) sin gastar nuestra mano además del [Espíritu de equipo](/card/12024) y la [Torre de los Vengadores](/card/03024) que nos van a reducir el coste de nuestros aliados ya que todos son "vengador" además de la clásica [Mansión de los Vengadores](/card/01091)

Para solucionar nuestros problemas de vida un [Aguante](/card/05023) es indispensable además del [Camarote de tripulante](/card/20029) y [Unidos resistimos](/card/14031) que nos van curando poco a poco y pueden ser la diferencia entre la vida o la muerte

name: Marvel Medley Scarlet Witch Protection
description_md:
Similarly to KennedyHawk from MCM, I've taken it upon myself to make 12 decks because its a festive number and it's the 12th month of the year. I used the Marvel Champions deck randomiser (https://krasstek.shinyapps.io/marvelchampioner/) to output 12 random Villain and Modular combinations, and then give me 12 random Hero and Aspect pairings. I had to fiddle with the latter a bit so I had 3 of each aspect.

I then paired up Heroes to take down each of the Villain / Modular pairings and built a loosely tribal deck to take down each.

On the second day of Christmas, Scarlet Witch took it upon herself to Protect the world from Mysterio, his Personal Nightmare and a Bomb Scare.

Signature card: Defiance

Theres something extremely satisfying about throwing a Deja Vu into the discard pile instead of having to shuffle that evilness into your deck.

name: Guardians of Knowhere
description_md: This deck is all about Knowhere and other benfits of playing allies over and over. The biggest value to you is playing the allies, which all are considered Guardians with Star-Lord, whether they are drawn into your hand or Regrouped or if you Make the Call for them. To give yourself more opportunities to play your allies, they are burned through as quickly as possible with Command Team and Blaze of Glory, which additionally give the benefits of better burst damage and thwarting. Leader of the Guardians is incredibly strong with all of the allies you'll be playing, along with the readies available to you. Your "What Could Go Wrong?" ability is always useful if there's an ally you really want to get out but cant quite afford, but it isn't generally needed until the late game when it's at its strongest. For once, your helmet isn't a necessary piece unless you choose to be especially aggressive.

name: Captain Marvel Earths Strongest Defender
description_md:
CAPTAIN MARVEL
     
A very strong hero right out of the Coreset, Captain Marvel is fully capable of running with any of the aspects to optimal ability. To make the most of what she has to offer, I find that running with mostly Energy resource cards will enable the player to fully charge [Energy Channel ](https://marvelcdb.com/card/01018).
 
To ensure this can happen in a timely manner, we utilize [Enhanced Reflexes](https://marvelcdb.com/card/05024). The Shield suite of cards are present to let [Agent 13](https://marvelcdb.com/card/27046) ready [Alpha Flight Station](https://marvelcdb.com/card/01015) letting Captain Marvel to cycle through her deck to ensure she has exactly what she needs when she needs it. 

The rest of the deck focuses on thwarting the schemes to allow for the team to do any of the actions they need to during the round. 

Check out my other decks here and on my Channel: [LateNightGaming](https://www.youtube.com/@latenightgaming5134/featured)

name: Decked Halls 2022: Day 10 - Do It All!
description_md:
This is the deck 10 of 12 for the 2022 MCM Decked Halls tradition. This year Kennedy is building 12 decks with one collection so you can build these decks and just enjoy some games with family and friends instead of stressing over deck builds this Holiday season. Happy Holidays!

**Premise:**  Build a deck that can do it all, thwart, damage, ally spam. This is a round house kick of everything.

*Recommended Heroes: *

Nova

Ms. Marvel

Ironheart

Venom

Notes:

- This deck has the levers to do it all.
- Card draw with [Clear the Area](/card/04049), [Unleash Nova Force](/card/28006), [One Way or Another](/card/30017), maybe a [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047)
- Ally spam with cheap allies and [Supernova Helmet](/card/28009)
- Damage spam with [Pot Shot](/card/28005) and [Turn the Tide](/card/15015)
- Thwart with [Lightspeed Flight](/card/28004), [Yaw and Roll](/card/28026), and [Clear the Area](/card/04049)
- Similar to a great journeyman2 deck (See derived from) you can spam 1-2 allies a turn and often still get off an event. The cost curve for this deck is deceiving as almost half of the 2+ cost cards really cost 1 when played with a wild resource.
- I've found [Unleash Nova Force](/card/28006) to be quite reliable with [One Way or Another](/card/22015) and [Clear the Area](/card/04049) you end up with some bursty turns where you may play even more allies or run out of things to play with your helmet.

name: SP//dr Suit: Battle Nurse
description_md:
Need medical attention?



Welcome to the battlefield, and deploy the battle nurse SP//dr!

I haven't played SP//dr much, but man does she deliver! The concept of this deck is super simple, but so far very satisfying: SP//dr and her [Med Team](/card/01080) will serve as the battle nurse to keep Spider man (Peter Parker), VEN#m in play for some huge combos and ass-kicking! Indeed VEN#m, when played with your INTERFACES, becomes a powerhouse; let's keep that in play, shall we? Peter Parker will alow some crazy combos by readying other WEB WARRIORS, yourself included.

The other WEB WARRIORS come in, do their thing, leave as they block the villain attacks, giving you a precious extra card from [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023). [Assess the Situation](/card/12033) also serves to make up for the very low hand size you have. Use [Silk](/card/27010) to get rid of [Shadow of the Past](/card/01190) (damn MORBIUS is horrible!). [Spider-UK](/card/27012) can be amazing at defeating minions if you've got a board full of WEB WARRIORS.

Stun the villain with [Thwip! Thwip!](/card/31017), [Web-Trap](/card/31006) or Miles Morales. [Return the Favor](/card/27015) is so much fun in the end game, especially since you can have [Spider-Tingle](/card/31020) into play to negate the treachery if you feel like it might cause a problem.

You may want to consider some other WEB WARRIORS too, [Spider-Man Noir](/card/31015), if you're patient, can also be healed to provide 3 THW or ATK all game long (but needs time to get there). Otto Octavius (sry can't find how to implement all the spider man names, list too short. Tip anyone?) can ready your techs, giving you extra cards too.

Have fun!

name: Tutor de IronMan para Luis
description_md:
Tutor de IronMan hecho para Luis

 --> buscar con [Iron Man](/card/23002) [Shoulder Cannon](/card/23007) y [Upgraded Chassis](/card/23004) ASAP.

A [Iron Man](/card/23002) lo podemos encontrar con un mullingan agresivo para sacarlo a él mismo, y con [Call for Aid](/card/12015), porque es el único aliado vengador. También nos vale empezar en mano con una de las piezas de armadura clave.
Hay que suicidarlo cuanto antes, para volver a buscarlos con [Rapid Response](/card/08031), [Make the Call](/card/01071) o [Call for Aid](/card/12015) y armar la siguiente pieza de nuestra armadura hasta estar bien montado cuanto antes.

Tanta recursividad de [Iron Man](/card/23002) hace que valga la pena incluir [Two Against the World](/card/23024), porque estará mucho tiempo en mesa y se puede activar con facilidad el team up.

El [Reinforced Suit](/card/12018) le dará más durabilidad a [Agent 13](/card/27046) y el [Sky Cycle](/card/04015) le dará 2 activaciones por turno. Usar prioritariamente su habilidad para rellenar varias veces el [Munitions Bunker](/card/23003) y traernos una tonelada de contadores de munición.

La intervención es un problema si jugamos solos. Tenemos varios aliados con buena intervención: [Nick Fury](/card/01084), [Agent 13](/card/27046), [Iron Man](/card/23002), [Maria Hill](/card/01067) y [Lockjaw](/card/05018) todos tienen intervención 2. Podemos usar nuestras cartas de liderazgo para volverlos a traer y siempre podemos contar con [Lockjaw](/card/05018) desde el descarte.
Tenemos daño de sobra, así que priorizaremos la habilidad de alterego de [James Rhodes](/card/23001b) para volver a meter al mazo nuestro evento de intervención [Targeted Strike](/card/23009), que agotando un [Gauntlet Gun](/card/23005) podemos jugar sin gastar nada.

Primero usa liderazgo para fundir a IronMan hasta tener todo montado. Una vez montado, utilízalo para traer una y otra vez a Agente 13 y prepararla para cargar hasta 12 de munición cada vez que pases por alter ego. Vuelve a héroe y descarga mecha sobre el villano hasta que lo arrases.

name: Decked Halls 2022: Day 11 - Bird Strike
description_md:
This is the deck 11 of 12 for the 2022 MCM Decked Halls tradition. This year Kennedy is building 12 decks with one collection so you can build these decks and just enjoy some games with family and friends instead of stressing over deck builds this Holiday season. Happy Holidays!

**Premise:**  Make use of attack boosters like [Honed Technique](/card/28017), [Aggressive Energy](/card/32047), and [Warrior Skill](/card/35016) to pump out area of effect attacks like [Dive Bomb](/card/17028), [Melee](/card/05030), and [One by One](/card/28014).

*Recommended Heroes: *

The Best: Spectrum, Phoenix

B-Tier: Iron Man, Captain Marvel, Rocket.

The Rest: Wasp, Thor, Nova, all other Aerial heroes :p

Notes:

- You want to get down a Honed Technique and Warrior skill as soon as possible.
- If you have them both down, you could pay for [One by One](/card/28014) with an [Aggressive Energy](/card/32047) trigger your upgrades and deal 10 damage for 1 resource!
- Note [Aggressive Energy](/card/35020) and [Warrior Skill](/card/35016) both can impact hero attack events as well - but [Honed Technique](/card/28017) is only for your aggression ones.
- You want to spend most of your game in [Photon](/card/21003) form - this lets you scoop a nice base 3 THW each turn, but also provides you with mental resources for Honed Technique using [Energy Duplication](/card/21006).

name: S01E02 - grajcie na czas
description_md:
**Powolne ogrywanie S01E02 - Grajcie na czas (karty do Kapitana Ameryki )**

Cześć, jestem casualowym graczem, który lubi sobie dość wolno ogrywać wszystko testując (nawet troszkę na siłę) mając "w poważaniu" tempo wydawania dodatków przez FFG ;) Standardowo testuje na solo na 5 scenariuszach z kampanii grając jednak jako standalone na expercie z losowymi modular setami.

Lecimy z [Iron Man](/card/01029a) wzbogaconym o karty z pakietu kapitana. Nie ukrywam, że mam duży sentyment decku - właśnie nim jako pierwszym pokonałem wszystkie scenariusze z core setup i 1 fali grając na Heroicu 1. Deck więc jak na ten moment w grze bardzo mocny, jedyne co potrzebujemy to brak skrajnego pecha w 1wszych turach kiedy to się dopiero rozbudowujemy. Leadership wybrany z 3 powodów:

  - Tony jest jednym z naprawdę nielicznych herosów, którzy zostają przez pierwsze 1-2 tury na Alter-ego. Wszystkie karty z hero-action stają się przez to dużo słabsze. Najmniej to boli właśnie przywództwo. Sojusznicy są od razu w pełni swojej mocy.

- [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) to najlepszy draw w grze z pośród aspektowych kart w tym momencie. A my chcemy jak najbardziej mielić deck by dobrać się do naszych tech kart. Sytuacja wygląda tak - albo dobieramy tech karty i jesteśmy szczęśliwi, jak nie to dobieramy sojuszników i dzięki [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) dobieramy tech karty.

- jak się rozkręcimy, to jedyne w czym Iron Man nie jest dobry do defensywa, ale przy naszym hand size 7 to możemy śmiało poświęcać sojusznika raz na turę.

Deck na papierze jest mocno podobny do tego wcześniejszego Ameryki, ale w praktyce się mocno różni. Tam chcieliśmy wygrać sojusznikami, tutaj pakiet leadership pełni rolę czysto wspomagającą. To zbroja i sam Iron Man mają być gwiazdami. Deck składa się tak naprawdę z 2 pakietów kart:

 - 1wszy pakiet to sojusznicy wraz z [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) - czyli zestaw dający czas Tonemu na przygotowanie zbroi. Szczególnie fajna jest [Maria Hill](/card/01067), która jest najfajniejszą kartą na startowej ręce nie licząc naszych tech kart i zasobów. Nie dość, nie dość że daje kartę to te 2 thw dla postaci która chce 1wszą turę skończyć na Alter-Ego daje bardzo dużo. Generalnie kontrolujemy stół za pomocą sojuszników, jak mamy już nawet tych 2 na stole możemy pokusić się o użycie [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) w nadziei na dobranie kolejnej części zbroi, które ostro nas pcha do przodu. W późniejszych etapach natomiast możemy w ten sposób użyć towarzyszy do dobrania [Repulsor Blast](/card/01031) czy znanego z wcześniej [Avengers Assemble!](/card/03015) i przyśpieszyć kończenie gry. 

- 2gi pakiet to po prostu karty z piorunkami do wzmocnienia [Repulsor Blast](/card/01031). Póki co mamy mocno ograniczoną kolekcje, więc granie wokół ikonek zasobów jest dość mocno problematyczne i nie tak fajne jak już po kilku cyklach, więc musimy pójść na kompromisy. 
 - [Avengers Assemble!](/card/03015) - Nie jest, aż tak fajny jak w poprzednim decku - nie mamy [Avengers Tower](/card/03024) więc i mamy potencjalnie sojusznika mniej na stole i mniej ekonomii na nich więc troszkę wolniej nam idzie ich ładowanie, no i nie wszyscy u nas są avengerami. Sama w sobie w tym decku jest mocno średnia, jedyne co to fajnie się combi z [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017).

 - [Lead from the Front](/card/01070) - podobna historia co do zbiórki mścicielowatych. Gramy głównie dla piorunka, ale karta to też to typowy finisher. Fajniejszy od [Avengers Assemble!](/card/03015) bo tańszy i działa na wszystkich. [Iron Man](/card/01029a) atakujemy za 2, używamy [Arc Reactor](/card/01035) znowu atak za 2, 2x wzmocniony atak ze zwmocnionych [Powered Gauntlets](/card/01038), z 3 sojusznikami nawet z 1 atk to już mamy łącznie kolejne 6 atk to już jest~ 12 dmg. Jakiś [Repulsor Blast](/card/01031) do tego i już mamy 3ci stage większości złoli na raz.

 - [Quinjet](/card/03019) - nieeee... wsadziłem gdzieś quinjet do decku ;) Raczej większość czasu nie gramy i używamy tylko w charakterze zasobu, bo i tak mamy co grać - czyli Techy i Sojuszników. Ale jako, że kosztuje tylko 1 czasami są sytuacje na początku gry, gdzie warto go wcisnąć bo tak nam wychodzi po prostu że mamy puste zasoby. W późniejszej części rozgrywki nie dajcie się nabrać, jak mamy mental zasób to raczej wolimy go użyć jako odpałkę do [Rocket Boots](/card/01039) niż do opłacenia quinjeta.

I tak by wyglądał nasz deck. Rozgrywka wygląda trochę inaczej niż pozostałymi bohaterami głównie z uwagi na naszą pasywkę regulującą hand size. Mając do wyboru zakończyć 1wszą turę na Alter Ego z 6 hand size, a zmienić się na stronę bohatera mając zazwyczaj ~ 3 hand size to zazwyczaj słaby deal. Często przez to tracimy 1wszy etap scenariusza i musimy ostro gonić. Ale bez obaw - Tony w swojej zbroi potrafi gonić jak nikt inny. 

I to by było na tyle.

name: Weapon X Go Brrrrrrrr
description_md:
I love this deck for multiplayer. 

Obviously, in single player, Wolverine's events and claws cut through any villain quickly. In Multiplayer, the higher health pools make it a little harder. This deck makes a health pool of 30+ feel like 12.

Here's the goal:

- Build up Wolverine's attack stat with Adamantium Skeleton, Combat Training, Godslayer (specifically for attacking the villain or elite minions) and Fluid Motion. Symbiote Suit is optional, but the game ends so quick that the extra encounter card doesn't really matter.
- Use Adamantium Skeleton, Endurance and Symbiote Suit to make a huge HP pool for Wolverine, meaning a huge resource generator.
- Use allies to defend to keep Wolverine up. Utopia is included with exclusively X-Men allies to keep Wolverine readied or add a second attack. Look for Collossus for the 3-cost ally that comes out with tough and can defend twice.
- Use Wolverine's claws to pay for attack events and exhaust your first fluid motion and take off a tough status. Pay for your next attack event to exhaust your second fluid motion.
- Swing for 8-10 on your basic attack, include a Skilled Strike for +2 to make it 10-12. I've taken out all of a villain's phase one HP with one attack event, a basic attack, Utopia to ready and Jubilee. 

After a two-three round setup, I've found myself taking two to three turns to annihilate villains with this build. 



NOTE: I've seen a lot of people use Mean Strike for the +3 attack but in this build you need to use your claws to activate Fluid Motion for the boon to your attack. With Skilled Strike and Fluid Motion the math works out like 2+1+Attack event. Much more beneficial to tearing the villain apart.

description_md:
This is the deck 12 of 12 for the 2022 MCM Decked Halls tradition. This year Kennedy is building 12 decks with one collection so you can build these decks and just enjoy some games with family and friends instead of stressing over deck builds this Holiday season. Happy Holidays!

**Premise:**  Use [George Stacy](/card/27007) to set up big swing combos with [Lead from the Front](/card/01070) and [Teamwork](/card/06032).

*Recommended Heroes: *

Ghost-Spider
IF you have to... Captain America, Spectrum, Maybe Ms. Marvel for the [Bruno Carrelli](/card/05007) bragging rights (totally Kamala).

Notes:

- You ideally want to get 2 copies of [Lead from the Front](/card/01070) and 1 or [Teamwork](/card/06032) under George Stacey. 
- You can use your [Ticket to the Multiverse](/card/27008) to maximize how many [Lead from the Front](/card/01070)s you play in a round (playing them and then shuffling back in).
- If you have  a 4 ATK ally and play your 2 [Lead from the Front](/card/01070) you can now [Teamwork](/card/06032) for 10, then ready Ghost-Spider and swing for 4 more - the ceiling is even higher with [R&D Facility](/card/29020) and [Inspired](/card/01074).

name: Marvel Medley Vision Justice
description_md:
Similarly to KennedyHawk from MCM, I've taken it upon myself to make 12 decks because its a festive number and it's the 12th month of the year. I used the Marvel Champions deck randomiser (https://krasstek.shinyapps.io/marvelchampioner/) to output 12 random Villain and Modular combinations, and then give me 12 random Hero and Aspect pairings. I had to fiddle with the latter a bit so I had 3 of each aspect.

I then paired up Heroes to take down each of the Villain / Modular pairings and built a loosely tribal deck to take down each.

On the fifth day of Christmas, Ebony Maw arrived on Earth with the Power Stone, Sentinels and the Hydra Assault team. Vision (and his daughter) dispensed their own version of Android Justice in return.

Signature card: [616 Hickory Branch Lane](/card/26004)
Being able to recur Vivian every turn is actually absurdly powerful. She is 3ER for 6ATK or 6THW. Or any combination of that you would like.
