name: "Hit the Tree not the Guardian" - Groot / Aggression
description_md:
*"They're The Only Friends We've Ever Had."*


---

[Groot](/card/16001a) is not really strong, but he has a bunch of good qualities that make him be playable at the highest level (Expert / Heroic), the **Aggression** aspect by itself is not really strong and even less for Groot.

Then what's the point of playing Groot?
It's simple, as it's themed and fun.


This deck has been tested solo most of the time, even though it runs best in multiplayer, because you don't need to worry about thwarting that will be the reason you will lose most of the time.

----

**Overview**

 - **[Groot](/card/16001a)** is a strong defender thanks to his very high **3 DEF** and the tools in his kit, this allows the team to survive while the allies THW and DMG the villain.

- Once you set up you can consistently deal 12+ DMG every single turn while dealing with threat / minions and getting a new ally every turn as well.

----

**Strategy:**

*Mulligan*
- Your best chance is to get something that helps you pay off the other cards. [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024), [Deft Focus](/card/16024) for [Groot](/card/16001a) events, or [Knowhere](/card/17022) to draw for free.
 When you get any of those, your options and posibilities will grow exponentialy.
 -  [Fertile Ground](/card/16007) is good as well because it almost pays for itself and will help you on the long run.
- Resource cards will help you pay, you should keep them as the deck doesn't have too many 0-1 cost cards.
- You should also consider allies like [Rocket Raccoon](/card/16019),[Gamora](/card/19020) to keep the *Scheme* in check, or [Bug](/card/16040) and [Drax](/card/18019) + [Energy Spear](/card/22032) to get some damage early
- [Angela](/card/18011) and [Throg](/card/25014) is really good if you get both together, because you can clear the minion and get 2 meatshields easily.
- Any 2 cost ally is fine because you will get some cheap damage on the villain as well as defend the next turn.

*Defense*

 - [Groot](/card/16001a) defense and his *Flora Colossus* and [Vine Shield](/card/16010), boost his defense, making [Groot](/card/16001a) an impenetrable wall.
- The **2 cost** allies are a big part of this: **Allies** like [Marvel Boy](/card/21041), [Cosmo](/card/17020), [Throg](/card/25014), [Martinex](/card/21065) and [Star-Lord](/card/20016). They give Groot some breath on harder stages, so you can get some play for [Vine Spikes](/card/16011),[Lashing Vines](/card/16009) and [Entangling Vines](/card/16008)
 
 Because of this, Groot can shut down the villain activation every single turn, with some cards like ["We Are Groot"](/card/16006) you can defend for your partners on multiplayer even if you don't go with **Protection**.

*Damage*

You're on **Aggression**, so this is when the fun starts:
- The ***Guardians*** can hit hard too, [Boot Camp](/card/13016), and [Energy Spear](/card/22032) make [Bug](/card/16040), [Drax](/card/18019), [Martinex](/card/21065) and even [Cosmo](/card/17020) into ferocius beast that will hit every turn for **5+ DMG!!!**
- You can keep your allies alive with ["We Are Groot"](/card/16006), or gain some tempo with [C.I.T.T.](/card/17021) and [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024)
- If you pay [Deft Focus](/card/16024), [Root Stomp](/card/16005) is a really strong event, if you have more than 3 counters ["I. AM. GROOT!"](/card/16004) is another one that can deal some serius damage.

*Thwart*

- [Cosmo](/card/17020), [Gamora](/card/18001a), [Rocket Raccoon](/card/16019) and [Star-Lord](/card/20016) are the main tools to deal with threat. 

- If you have [Deft Focus](/card/16024) and 4+ counters and although is kind of unreliable, it feels good to clear 7+ in one go.
 - You can still go to Alter-Ego, get 4 counters (6 with [Fertile Ground](/card/16007)) get into Hero form and play it, giving you a "free switch" into alter ego, (watch out in solo as you can complete a scheme on low threshold stages).

----

**Other Card Considerations:**

1. [Professor X](/card/32019) / [Psylocke](/card/35013) are super strong if the villain doesn't have Steady or Stalwart, you can change them for [Star-Lord](/card/20016) and [Martinex](/card/21065).
2. [Wolverine](/card/32041) + [Attack Training](/card/32043) you can change both of them with [Marvel Boy](/card/21041) to get a 2nd [Drax](/card/18019).
3. ["Bring It!"](/card/19030) + (Optional) [Looking for Trouble](/card/16043) for minion heavy scenarios, [Throg](/card/25014) and [Rocket Raccoon](/card/16019) want minions and [Bug](/card/16040) + [Energy Spear](/card/22032) can clear them consistently as well.

---

![write anything you want here](https://hips.hearstapps.com/digitalspyuk.cdnds.net/14/16/comics-guardians-of-galaxy-1.jpg?resize=480:*)

---


*Any feedback is welcome, thanks!*

Consider giving me a **Like** if you liked the concept so more people can see this deck!

name: Hang Up Your Christmas Banners, We're Calling for a Carol
description_md:
Sometimes I feel like Spider-Woman's Alter-Ego ability doesn't get enough use. This deck looks to take advantage of it to swing big with Hulk, as well as ensuring the he stays on the table with Call for Aid and Team Training. Call for Aid additionally only hits Captain Marvel, who is good for 3 cards, 6 atk/thw, and a block once team training is out. Inspired is for Hulk and Wolverine as they will stay out the longest.

Cheap physical-resource cards are added to:

*Fuel Spider-Woman's SuperHuman agility

*Be spent for 2 damage on Jarnbjorn

*Remove 3 threat with Adam Warlock

*Meet the requirements of Drop Kick 

*Increase chances of Hulk success when Alter-ego is inaccessible

This deck is very safe with the added status control, and a rampaging Hulk can close out games, even on expert mode, quite fast!

name: Wolverine - One Tough Canucklehead
description_md:
I built this deck based on the excellent Claw that Broke the Camel's Back https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/24209/the-claw-that-broke-the-camel-s-back-1.0

While I found Wolverine's AE healing impressive, it was apparent that you were giving up a lot of hero actions in order to heal (including the free 2 points of healing in hero form).  Plus, 6 healing isn't all that great if you flip and take 3 damage to do an attack event.  So my goal was to keep Wolverine from flipping as long as possible while mitigating the 2 or 3 damage you may take for doing an attack move. 

I try to time my flips for when I have [Perseverance](/card/32016) in my hand as it serves two purposes for the next turn. I can 1) heal in AE form, flip, and keep my tough status or 2) heal, flip, get status and then use [Wolverine's Claws](/card/35002) to execute an attack event and not take the 2 or 3 points of damage. I have had situations where I would use [Hard Knocks](/card/19016) after flipping and using [Perseverance](/card/32016) to get my tough status back after taking out a minion.  

I found that doing this keeps me above the 10 printed HPs after you play either [Endurance](/card/36026) or [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004) which makes [Dauntless](/card/16016) incredible useful to keep the pressure on the villain - especially if you are playing multi-player with [Storm](/card/36001a) and her weather condition that gives you Retaliate 1.

Allies like [Polaris](/card/32012) and [Colossus](/card/35021) give you more opportunity for tough status which means Wolverine can have a Tough status for multiple consecutive rounds which allows you to take advantage of Wolverine's native 2 points of healing per turn and hold your HP to trigger [Dauntless](/card/16016)

Thwarting: [Homeland Intervention](/card/27042), [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010), [Surveillance Team](/card/01064), [Overwatch](/card/30019), [Agent 13](/card/29022)

Damage: [Rocket Beam](/card/33009) (AKA: Ricochet Beam), [Dum Dum Dugan](/card/27047), [Full Blast](/card/33008), [Quake](/card/08012), [Exploit Weakness](/card/33005), [Sky-Destroyer](/card/27055)

Use cards like [Government Liaison](/card/27054), [Helicarrier](/card/01092) to aid you in using [Homeland Intervention](/card/27042), [Global Logistics](/card/27043), or help to play out those SHIELD cards you have in hand, which will trigger [Sky-Destroyer](/card/27055).

It is really quite fun to play, can be used Solo, and provides adequate coverage in Multiplayer games. A Similar strategy can be used with Aggression if you so choose. You can utilize [Tac Team](/card/01056) in such a deck.

HAPPY HOLIDAYS!!! Enjoy the Deck!

name: Doctor Dive Bomb
description_md:
The entire point behind this deck is to create agency for the player. Instead of always playing the top card of the Invocation deck, you have the option to do really impressive damage with your aspect cards.

Your most impressive play is playing Dive Bomb with Honed Technique in play. This will hit the Villain for 11 damage and every Minion for 5 damage. To do this you need to have the Cloak of Levitation in play, it grants Dr. Strange Aerial. You can raw draw into it or search it up with Mystical Studies. 

If you are lacking Aerial, then Honed Technique and Into the Fray (9 damage) or Melee (6 damage & 6 damage) will still do a great amount of damage. If you do not care for them you can switch them out for other Aggression Events. I would recommend playing as many 3+ cost events as possible to  maintain high damage output. I would not go below a 9 count for the Aggression Attack Events as it will interfere with you consistency in using Honed Technique every turn.

Spiritual Meditation and Assess the Situation will dig through your deck to get to the cards you want to play. They are also Mental Resource cards, so they will let you play Honed Technique and trigger it when you play an Attack Event.

If all of that fails, then you can still just play the Invocation game and win.

Enjoy!

name: Rocket Raccoon Leadership of Draw
description_md:
The Galaxy's Most Wanted Racoon will murder minions all day long while drawing all the cards. Just be aware of timing. The sequencing for this deck is paramount. There are many actions that depend on what face Rocket is on.

As with every Rocket deck, his Restricted cards are fun to play. Shoot everything and draw all the cards. Depending on what Villain you are facing your priorities will change between Particle Cannon and Rocket Launcher. Keep on recovering the one that will control the board state the best with Salvage. Timing a Salvage before draw will help you be more proficient with the Upgrades. Rocket's Pistols are great in the off hand, and I would recommend playing one as your secondary Restricted card instead of a second 3 drop. 

The Leadership Aspect works wonders. You use Guardians of the Galaxy to draw so many cards with all the Upgrades. You use Knowhere to draw when you play a Guardian Ally. Both known constants. GotG is excellent. The trick is the Laser Blasters, they are a Tech Upgrade. That means Alter-Ego mode can sacrifice one to draw 2 cards a turn. They are a 1 drop, so it is easy to pay (Helicarrier/Ingenuity) for it.  In conjunction with GotG you are drawing 3 CARDS from this interaction a turn! (Salvage) That is sweet spot for the deck.

As a reminder, Allies DON'T fulfill the "you" requirement for  Rocket's Hero ability. So annoying.

Your early game is to start decking out any ally with Upgrades. Using the Teck Upgrades to draw more cards as you need. Once you get Yondu and Gamora you want to switch all you upgrades to them through attrition. 

Yondu does NOT take Consequential Damage, so you want to prioritize the Side Arm for bonus attack and Inspired eventually. With 

Gamora allows you to "draw" an event card every Attack/Thwart she does. You need to be in Hero mode for this trigger. You have a 30% chance of getting a First Aid to heal her and let her continue being useful. I like to focus her on Thwarting most games, but she is an excellent attacker. I prioritize Comms Implant and Inspired for her.

Star lord is the next best Ally to suit up because of his stats. He is an excellent first or second turn Ally play if you don't have Yondu 
or Gamora. with a steady stream of First Aid he will do everything you need him to do.

Everyone else is here to take hits for you.

name: Marvel Medley Ghost-Spider Protection
description_md:
Similarly to KennedyHawk from MCM, I've taken it upon myself to make 12 decks because its a festive number and it's the 12th month of the year. I used the Marvel Champions deck randomiser (https://krasstek.shinyapps.io/marvelchampioner/) to output 12 random Villain and Modular combinations, and then give me 12 random Hero and Aspect pairings. I had to fiddle with the latter a bit so I had 3 of each aspect.

I then paired up Heroes to take down each of the Villain / Modular pairings and built a loosely tribal deck to take down each.

On the seventh day of Christmas, Project Wideawake commenced (supported by Kree Militants) but Ghost Spider Protected the Mutants and took down all the Sentinels.

Signature card: Unflappable
An essential card in any deck you're going to be defending for 3+ every round. You want to see it early. 3x has never been a bad thing for this card.

name: Wolverine "Knock Them Down" (X-Men Team Up)
description_md:
This is the second part of my X-men team-up decks.  

The strength of these decks is more in their synergy than their individual pieces.  The Cyclops leadership deck is key for the building, while the Colossus Justice deck is a key player dealing with threat.  You can find these decks here:

**The Other Decks**

[Cyclops Leadership](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/24851/cyclops-set-them-up-x-men-team-up-1.0)

[Colossus Justice](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25321/colossus-4-or-5-moments-team-up-1.0) 

You may want to refer to the Cyclops deck first, just to see the way these decks synergize together in a general write-up.

**Other Heroes You Can Use**

We made this deck with Wolverine, but it can be ported over to almost any other X-men character, unlike the Cyclops deck which is pretty hero dependent for its function.  Storm would be high on my list to pick, being able to give all characters +1 attack will make some insane Team Strike Damages.  She also just has an overall amazing kit.  After Storm, it'd be a toss-up between Colossus and Jean Grey for me.  Jean can get some fantastic damage and can help keep Thwarting in check early on.  Colossus wants to constantly flip down which is great for this team-up.  Shadowcat is my favorite X-men right now, but I probably wouldn't use her for this deck, personally.

**General Strategy**

You are the aggression arm of this team-up.  It's your job to whittle the Villain down for OTKs and take care of the pesky minions that will be popping up.  You'll find yourself hitting for 30-plus damage with Team Strike pretty consistently, to tear down multiple minions in a round after a rough drop, and you can use Wolverines Claws to gain piercing.  You'll flip down to benefit from team pieces less than Colossus as Wolverine, but still enough to throw out a couple of tanky allies to assist you on the way.

**Wolverine**

As Wolverine, you'll be taking advantage of your healing factor and trying to set up while dealing at all the minion problems the game throws at you.  Due to Brute Force, you'll be doing a little thwarting, or maybe even defending, rather than activating a basic attack.  You want to keep your attack in that 6-7 range to maximize Smash The Problem, Team Strike, The Best Defense and the awesome Fastball Special.  You'll tend to have a solid set-up pretty fast and then just strike round after round.

Unlike the other two characters, you'll likely be flipping more out of necessity than taking advantage of awesome Alter-Ego abilities.  Once you get Logan's Cabin and Weapon X it makes it less painful to flip down.  Try and time it on a round the other two can stay in Hero form, so you take less threat.

It's usually hard for you to get all 3 allies down, as you actually chump a lot more.  Try and keep at least 2 on the board however, this would be even more true if playing as Storm.  You won't be triggering Danger Room as often, but try and time your alters with allies.

**Allies**

So, unfortunately, you can't use probably the best X-men aggression ally for this build, Wolverine.  Having that massive 4 attacks while buffed, and being used for non-consequential damage attacks and thwarts on the regular, he'd be quite easy to utilize every round.  If you are playing the aggression deck with another hero, I'd definitely throw in a Wolverine.

Dust is our worst ally, but is situationally useful.  And we don't have a ton to work with in aggression and Colossus needed the basic allies.  2 damage on 2+ minions is worth it, and she still fuels the X-men synergies.  Jubilee is not great for our build but makes a solid closer at the end of the game.  Magik is fine, but you probably won't be using her kicker too often.  Remember you can utilize the X-Jet to play it as long as you are an X-men.

Our last two allies really shine through.  Psylocke is great, She has a good thwart to feed Mutant Protectors, and 2 confuses, or even 1 with Steady, is well worth it.  Sunfire is one of my favorite allies now.  With the number of 3 cost or shuffle back into the deck attachments, Sunfire can be an effective ER0, ER-1 if you have Uncanny X-men played on you.  If you can time it with Cyclops and regroup, you can peel an enemy clean in a couple of rounds.  With no recursion mechanism, you definitely want him in the discard pile at the reshuffle.



**Events**

I'll just open with the amazing Fastball Special.  Very quickly this will be hitting for at least 6, and maxs out at 9 - 10 if you can hit Fluid Motion prior to.  With Overkill and Piercing for 2ER, you can eliminate most problems with this one card.  Quickstrike is a cheap 6-7 damage when online.  I'd probably remove Smash the Problem, but my wife wanted to keep 1 in there.  She does get one really good use off it a game. Don't be afraid to use The Best Defense if you have another exhaust card if you have a good Cyclops player.  He can ready with Utopia if any player is playing an ally, so he can trigger this pretty easily, especially if he is first in cue already.  If there are no better targets, You and Colossus are the obvious targets, and Colossus won't be exhausted too often.  This card can allow you to stay in hero form much longer.

Initially, this card and Mutant Protector made me think of this combo.  Your money ability is Team Strike.  The important text of the card for our purpose is "and any number of **X-Men** allies".  This means you can use the allies of your other two players, for some insane damages, with piercing if you want to pay for it with Wolverine's Claws.  Picture this, you have 4 attacks from Colossus's allies, 18 from Cyclops, 3 from your own, and 6-7 from yourself.  You're looking at up to 30 damage a round pretty consistently, a little more sometimes.  And you can split it up, and even give it a piercing if you need to.  We've had rounds of multiple scary minions that just melted away after this card was played.  And all that while preserving your allies.  It's not the closer you want for an OTK, but still great.  And if you were Storm, you could have an extra 9-11 damage in that final number.

All the normal stuff applies to Wolverine events, and they can easily fill any gaps.  Try and set up Track by Scent plays if you can coordinate it with the team.  And Regenerative Healing is an obvious play with Deft Focus.  You'll usually hopefully be able to use it for health, but both uses will find a use.

**Support**

So Boot Camp looks like a not-great card for this deck, and I'd have to agree with you.  However, this may be the most powerful card in the combo decks, as you are playing it on the Cyclops player, who will consistently have 4-5 allies down.  This card is easily worth 20 damage a game, often 30+, making it the second most cost-effective card for the decks. Try and play it the first time it comes through, though that can be complicated to do sometimes.

Helicarrier is useful and stays in the theme of helping others.  While you'll often need someone else's resources, just as often you'll have 1 to spare.  Logan's Cabin is nice because Wolverine's cards are so strong.  Weapon X can help recur those as well, and you are the only deck that can really benefit from it.  Colossus won't want to ping off toughness for no gain, and Cyclops doesn't usually want to mill his deck like that, as he often isn't looking for Cyclops cards.  If you are trying to cut the deck down, this is a pretty safe cut.

**Upgrades**  

Adamantium Skeleton is your most immediate concern.  You need the extra health, and the boost to attack top is icing.  After that, you are looking for Deft Focus.  I know, crazy with only 4 target cards, but my wife insists on not cutting it because you really do want to play Regenerative Healing for free every time it enters your hand.  Endurance and Brute Forces come next.  Fit in the rest when you can.  Fill in the rest when you can.  Due to the nature of the deck, Berserker Frenzy is less valuable than in other Wolverine decks.

Try and get Attack Training on fresh allies when able.  While not as much damage immediately, it'll be easy to net 5-10 extra damage off an Attack Training.  Due to your nature, you'll need allies more for chumps than the other players, so pay attention to that while you are deciding to play it or not.  You may also find, you can drop an attack training on someone else's allies, especially Cyclops with an additional +2 HP per ally, for great long-term value.  Scope the board, 2 ER for an extra 10 damage is very doable and well worth it.

**OTK**

While these decks were made to mitigate all threats as a group, they are also synergized together to perform a one-turn kill at the end of the game.  This has been very effective so far and is well worth setting up once the team has the board set and secure.  

Optimally, for this to work, the team has to build up a solid board state.  Hopefully, you have all the Brute Forces and Fluid Motion out.  Cyclops will have out Exploit Weakness, so you should be getting +1 per attack.  Any toughness and the form change will have been picked off by Cyclops, and the Villian should be half dead at least.  You will have wanted to hold or draw into a fastball special.  Most likely you'll have 2 allies on the board, hopefully, both with Attack Training.  If you have 3, even better.

You can start off attacking with your allies, for about 7 damage.  Next, you'd use a drawn-into Lunging Strike or Slice and Dice with Wolverines Claws for 9 or 8 damage respectively, putting you up to 15.  This will allow you to activate Fluid Motion.  Throw a Fastball Special for 11 damage getting you to 26.  Hopefully, you can throw a Quickstrike or another attack card for 7-9 damage, getting you to 32.  Then use your basic exhaust for 8 for 39.  With the damage already delivered by Cyclops, you should be in the 75+ range, being able to OTK any Villian stage 3, but you'll still have Colossus if you need a little more.

**Alternate Cards**

My wife has liked this deck where it's at, so its stays slotted at 44 cards.  Cut's I'd make in the following order would be: Weapon X, 1 Attack Training, Smash The Problem, Fluid Motion, The Best Defense.  Cards I may add would be a 3rd Best Defense and Combat Training.  I probably wouldn't try this set-up eithout the justice counterpart, but if I did I'd definetely throw in some more Smash the Problem.

**tl;dr**  Get a few upgrades out and keep the board clear of minions while whittling down the Villian.  When you and Cyclops are ready do a quick stage three where you OTK the Villian.

All that's left is Colossus.  I'll post that in the next week or so.

name: Hawkeye never misses
description_md:
A simple deck to keep Hawkeye focused on what he does best.

Use [Avengers Tower](https://marvelcdb.com/card/03024) to help call in some allies and use [Ready for Action](https://marvelcdb.com/card/04017) to toughen them up a bit. They will be your shield, I like using [U.S Agent](https://marvelcdb.com/card/04014) for the retaliate he has.

You will mostly use them to help thwart and let them take the hits to keep your small health pool full while you shoot the villain with a fun variety of arrows.

When they fall, [make the call](https://marvelcdb.com/card/01071). Need more arrows? draw more cards with [Strength in numbers](https://marvelcdb.com/card/03017).

Build yourself up with [Hawkeye's Quiver](https://marvelcdb.com/card/04003) and his [Expert Marksman](https://marvelcdb.com/card/04010) and you are good to go.

[Lead from the front](https://marvelcdb.com/card/01070) is rarely used but can come in clutch for a good rush.

I have used this deck for a while and really enjoy running it.

name: Marvel Medley SP//dr Leadership
description_md:
Similarly to KennedyHawk from MCM, I've taken it upon myself to make 12 decks because its a festive number and it's the 12th month of the year. I used the Marvel Champions deck randomiser (https://krasstek.shinyapps.io/marvelchampioner/) to output 12 random Villain and Modular combinations, and then give me 12 random Hero and Aspect pairings. I had to fiddle with the latter a bit so I had 3 of each aspect.

I then paired up Heroes to take down each of the Villain / Modular pairings and built a loosely tribal deck to take down each.

On the eighth day of Christmas, Green Goblin's Mutagen Formula scheme was brought back Down to Earth by SP//dr's Leadership.

Signature card: Make the Call

In a deck running limited Allies, Make the Call turns your discard pile into a menu of options. How many of SP//dr's Interface Upgrades do you want to exhaust to bring an ally back in? Your choice.

name: No Presents, Only Coal - Marvel Champions Secret Santa
description_md:
Hello everyone! This decklist was made for the Marvel Champions Holiday Deck Exchange. For this list, the person who's Secret Santa I was assigned (Nelson All Over) had a simple request on their wish-list, wanting the "The Worst Deck You Can Make". Now as easy as it would be to put in a pile of cardboard that is literally unusable by the selected hero, I thought adding in a couple restrictions to keep deck-building more interesting would be fun.

That criteria is as follows:

1. Every card in the deck must be playable within the confines of the decklist(Can't give a non-mystic Sorcerer Supreme for example.).
2. Every card has to technically be able to do something when played (Though anyone can play Champions Mobile Bunker, you cannot actually do anything with the ability in a solo game unless you have the Champion trait).

With that out of the way, we start with Valkyrie! Though many would probably push for Hulk to take this spot, I felt Valkyrie has more "synergy" for this play style, with many conditional cards, many abilities straining your Alter-Ego/Threat management, and a very lethal nemesis minion. Some people might also find it suspect that any allies with flexible activations and valuable chump blocks would be included, but their traits let us run against our rules and include some rather suspect cards!

Moondragon has low stats for cost and an ability that takes away any usage they have for chump blocking. She also lets us play Shake it Off, which though tough statuses are good, having to have both the ally on board and event in hand for when a 1-ATK minion would hit our ally is a little situational. We can also exhaust her and Valkyrie to play Stand Together, which will prevent some damage and deal it back to the Villain, at the cost of having anything resembling a turn during the Hero Phase. C.I.T.T. will also ready Moondragon so we can capitalize on her valuable activations for Tempo.

Multiple Man is in here as he has been de-powered, and is looking for a place to belong.

The Basic Miles Morales ally is almost certainly the highest quality card in this list. However, playing with our self-imposed restrictions he lets us play several other... less exciting, pieces. The Three copies of Warrior of the Great Web won't provide Miles with any stat boosts, but it gives him the Web-Warrior trait. This is important as we can now use Web of Life and Destiny to draw a card every time a upgraded Miles leaves play. With Spider-Tingle we can even gamble Spider-Man's health even faster to hopefully, maybe, cancel the affects of a treachery card.

The deck still has some potent plays without these allies though. 3x Government Liaison is great, as once we play one, we can use it to reduce the cost of another. And that's it. Hangar Bay lets us reset any allies which somehow survive an enemy attack so we can go back to getting them to fight. Height Advantage can come into play after we find our trustful Aragorn, and can keep reducing damage to us the whole game. Sorry, I meant the whole turn.

For our Events we have True Grit, utilizing Valkyrie's potent 1-THW to help keep threat low after we defend. Valkyrie's never been the best at handling minions right? We'll give her Beat 'Em Up in case she finds herself surrounded. The Gardener is our crown jewel, the community knows how effective all the Cosmic Entity Cards are, and the Protection variant is no different. Warning is much less a card and more of a message to anyone who's gotten this far in the deck profile.

I played Absorbing Man and Rhino with this list in Solo-Standard, almost flipping a stage 1 Absorbing man and never having a shadow of a chance against Rhino after Enchantress showed up. I hope this idea gets a chuckle or some enjoyment out there, Happy Holidays Everyone!

[Dust](/card/33012) is crowd control if you are facing a villian that brings a lot of minions. (Ex. [Ultron](/card/01134))  [Forge](/card/36022) helps bring your X-Men support cards to your hand. [Cerebro](/card/34022), the "To Me, My X-Men!" card, [Make the Call](/card/01071), and [Pixie](/card/36017) will help bring your X-Men allies to your hand.   [Rapid Response](/card/08031) allows you to keep a useful X-Men Ally in play and reuse the [Utopia](/card/33020) ability to help you or your fellow X-Men players/allies. name: Ghost-Spider - Avenger? - MCM Secret Santa 2022 Deck 1 of 2
description_md:
Happy Holidays, on the Marvel Champions discord this year we did a secret Santa deck exchange and this is the first of two decks I'm sending to my secret exchanger! I was given a few bits of criteria:

- My secret draw wanted a leadership deck not revolving around chump blocking
- They often played 2 handed or with a play partner so two decks that intertwine work out fine
- They do not own [Spider-Ham](/card/30001a), [Cyclops](/card/33001a) or [Phoenix](/card/34001a) so we are avoiding cards from those packs. 

Here's what I came up with! I hope they enjoy it and have a great time playing this over the Holidays. This deck goes along with, https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/24972/captain-america-hidden-leadership-mcm-secret-santa-2022-1.0 , a Captain America Aggression deck all about leading a team of allies!

___

In an alternate universe there is no [Peter Parker](/card/01001b) and [Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a) has taken the role of the Spider-totem. Unlike the MCU where [Tony Stark](/card/01029b) guides a young [Spider-Man](/card/01001a) in this universe, [Steve Rogers](/card/03001b) works in tandem with the young [Gwen Stacy](/card/27001b) as he recruits her into the Avengers. For now she is an [Honorary Avenger](/card/03025) but after this mission that's sure to change. Steve has forgotten all about the [The Power of Leadership](/card/01072) and has been throwing *chump* allies under the bus. Can [Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a) show him the fun in leading a team again? Can Cap and Ghostie save Christmas and bring back the [The Power of Leadership](/card/01072)? Find out!

This deck is all about stacking events under [George Stacy](/card/27007) and using them for an explosive 2 player tun. All six of your allies have the **Avengers** trait and can get benefit from [Avengers Assemble!](/card/03015) and [Avengers Tower](/card/03024). You'll be stacking copies of [Avengers Assemble!](/card/03015), [Lead from the Front](/card/01070), and [Teamwork](/card/06032) under George and [Black Panther](/card/23012) for combo use.

Once the [Captain America](/card/03001a) player has thrown an [Honorary Avenger](/card/03025) onto you you'll be able to use all your allies once, then ready them all and [Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a) playing [Avengers Assemble!](/card/03015) - you can even possibly sneak in a [Lead from the Front](/card/01070) if you draw your cards right giving the entire team a +2 ATK +2 DEF! On top of this all the allies in your [Captain America](/card/03001a) partner deck also have the **Avenger** trait and will gain the stat buff as well.

You may get a few other gifts from [Captain America](/card/03001a) like a [Boot Camp](/card/13016) or [Enraged](/card/03031) be sure to mainly use allies for thwarting until your big blow out turn! You'll want to time things just right to have all the friendly characters hit the villain at the same time.

[Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a) is the right hero for this deck because...
 - She can stack the event combos for the right time under George.
 - She can use Ticket to the Multiverse and really make your combo explosive
 - With 3 DEF and a on hero Ready she is able to defend for herself and Cap if needed meaning you shouldn't **need** to chump with any allies (that's the goal, don't lose a single ally to chumping)

I tested this deck pairing out against: Rhino, Crossbones, and Sandman to great fun! Hope you enjoy!

name: Captain America - Hidden Leadership? - MCM Secret Santa 2022
description_md:
Happy Holidays, on the Marvel Champions discord this year we did a secret Santa deck exchange and this is the first of two decks I'm sending to my secret exchanger! I was given a few bits of criteria:

- My secret draw wanted a leadership deck not revolving around chump blocking
- They often played 2 handed or with a play partner so two decks that intertwine work out fine
- They do not own [Spider-Ham](/card/30001a), [Cyclops](/card/33001a) or [Phoenix](/card/34001a) so we are avoiding cards from those packs. 

Here's what I came up with! I hope they enjoy it and have a great time playing this over the Holidays. This deck goes along with, https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/24971/ghost-spider-avenger-mcm-secret-santa-2022-deck-1-of-2-1.0 , a Ghost Spider Leadership deck all about board wide and player wide stat buffs!

___

In an alternate universe there is no [Peter Parker](/card/01001b) and [Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a) has taken the role of the Spider-totem. Unlike the MCU where [Tony Stark](/card/01029b) guides a young [Spider-Man](/card/01001a) in this universe, [Steve Rogers](/card/03001b) works in tandem with the young [Gwen Stacy](/card/27001b) as he recruits her into the Avengers. For now she is an [Honorary Avenger](/card/03025) but after this mission that's sure to change. Steve has forgotten all about the [The Power of Leadership](/card/01072) and has been throwing *chump* allies under the bus. Can [Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a) show him the fun in leading a team again? Can Cap and Ghostie save Christmas and bring back the [The Power of Leadership](/card/01072)? Find out!

This deck is all creating a wide board of high ATK allies. The allies should only be used to clear minions and saved for a final big swing against the villain.

You need to target getting an [Honorary Avenger](/card/03025) onto [Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a) as soon as possible so she can get full use of [Avengers Assemble!](/card/03015). Slowly build a board using 4 allies ideally containing [She-Hulk](/card/10013), [Wasp](/card/13012), and [Hulk](/card/01050). You want to optimize [She-Hulk](/card/10013)'s attack using an [Honorary Avenger](/card/03025) and a [Reinforced Suit](/card/12018) from Gwen. 

You may get a few other gifts from [Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a) like a timely [Inspired](/card/01074) to help with thwarting or a clutch [Lead from the Front](/card/01070). You can use [Press the Advantage](/card/04043) with your [Heroic Strike](/card/03004) to draw through your deck fast and set up your board

[Captain America](/card/03001a) is the right hero for this deck because...
- He can double tap to keep threat under control and defend in a pinch meaning we won't have to  **chump** any allies.
- Flipping down will give the entire table the ally economy we need to fill both heroes boards with 4 avengers for the ultimate [Avengers Assemble!](/card/03015)

I tested this deck pairing out against: Rhino, Crossbones, and Sandman to great fun! Hope you enjoy!

name: Symbiotic Fluid (MCM Secret Santa 2022)
description_md:
This deck is a part of KennedyHawk and MCM's 2022 Secret Santa deck exchange. The task was simple enough: create a fun Venom Aggression deck for solo with a limited collection. Most notably, I didn't have access to Galaxy's Most Wanted or Nebula so my usual go-to for Venom Aggression, [Energy Spear](/card/22032) Guardians, wouldn't work here. So instead I looked towards one of my favorite underrated cards, [Fluid Motion](/card/28016).

The idea here is to use Fluid Motion with the readies from [C.I.T.T.](/card/17021) and [Run and Gun](/card/20005) to make some big attacks. The most important card in this build, next to [Multi-Gun](/card/20008), is [Helicarrier](/card/01092), which is why we run two even though we can only play one. Venom's resource requirements can be surprisingly strict, and Helicarrier helps him pay for both [Drop Kick](/card/10014) and [Behind Enemy Lines](/card/20002). And [Savage Attack](/card/20006) if that matters. We even have [Agent 13](/card/27046) in the deck to ready the carrier. The [Enhanced Physiques](/card/06034) will also help with Drop Kick, but most importantly they make [Grasping Tendrils](/card/20003) more consistent.

This deck is unlikely to use all three of its copies of Fluid Motion, but it really wants to get at least one or two into play. Once you do, you can reasonably expect to deal 20+ damage in a turn with a sequence like "play an attack card, attack for 6, Multi-Gun for 2, play Run and Gun, do it again, pay for CITT, attack for another 4." Or "play Drop Kick and another event, attack for 7, Multi-Gun for 2, ready with CITT, attack for another 5" for 20+ and a stun in case the villain is still alive.

The deck's not perfect, we don't have a lot of room for allies and we definitely struggle with Stalwart, but at least Venom's status cards are so efficient he still has a shot against Steady. If you have a full collection, here's some swaps I'd make:

[Spider-Man](/card/13019) ---> [Rocket Raccoon](/card/16019)

[One by One](/card/28014) ---> [Clobber](/card/18012)

[Press the Advantage](/card/04043) ---> [Precision Strike](/card/35018)

[Avengers Mansion](/card/01091) ---> [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191)

Overall, I'm pretty proud of how this list turned out, and I'd like to give thanks to KennedyHawk for this deck exchange, it's been a lot of fun.

name: Fully Energized (MCM Secret Santa 2022)
description_md:
This was a deck I built for KennedyHawk and MCM's Secret Santa deck exchange. I was asked to make a fun multiplayer deck for Iron Man, and I couldn't decide what to build for him so I made two different lists, one Repurpose list and one Justice list.

[Repurpose](/card/31016) with Iron Man is almost self-explanatory. He loves tech and he has a free ready every turn with [Arc Reactor](/card/01035), so he can get extra mileage out of the stat boost. Beyond that, almost every card in this deck has an energy resource to help ensure high damage [Repulsor Blast](/card/01031). The only cards we've added without energy are our resource cards, which help us set up faster, plus [Quincarrier](/card/08023) and [Ingenuity](/card/29027) which allow us to consistently go Aerial every turn without having to draw into a mental resource, of which we have very few. In addition, we also have the Med-Team and Martyr combo which can provide a lot of defense, even if it's maybe a bit slow. We're also pretty happy to use [Med Team](/card/01080) with the powerful [Snowguard](/card/29023), or to heal other players' allies.

Once again, thanks to KennedyHawk for running this event.

name: Condition Yellow (MCM Secret Santa 2022)
description_md:
This was a deck I built for KennedyHawk and MCM's Secret Santa deck exchange. I was asked to make a fun multiplayer deck for Iron Man, and I couldn't decide what to build for him so I made two different lists, one Repurpose list and one Justice list.

The deck enables Iron Man to deal with most of the threat in a multiplayer game. With a [Heroic Intuition](/card/01065) and his [Helmet](/card/01037) in play he can thwart for at least 7 every turn, and in case that's not enough he also has some solid thwart cards. [Yaw and Roll](/card/28026) is a card I haven't had much success in the past, but it actually works like a dream here: with either [Quincarrier](/card/08023) or [Ingenuity](/card/29027) in play you should have no trouble going Aerial every turn, and you're basically guaranteed to use your Helmet every turn so the requirement of using a thwart action is easily met.

We do have a few non-energy cards, and that can potentially hurt our [Repulsor Blasts](/card/01031), but most of them are inexpensive upgrades that will allow us to thin our deck down to a point where the deck is mostly energy. And we do kind of need [Down Time](/card/05033) because recovering in Alter-Ego is going to be our main form of defense. You'll be thwarting so much that you can easily keep up with the added threat from all that flipping, anyhow.

Thanks once again to KennedyHawk for running this event.

name: SP//dr Suit- Master Mech with the Tech

A little sprinkle of Spider allies with Web of Life and Destiny to get some card draw along with the Avengers Masion. And I included Power in all if us instead of the double resources just in case I need certain resources for a scenario and to hit Spider Man (peter parker) requirement a little easier.

name: It's Not Regifting, It's Repurposing!
description_md:
Happy Holidays! This deck was created for the Marvel Champions Secret Santa deck exchange that KennedyHawk from Marvel Champions Monthly organized. My giftee was up for anything, so based on their collection, I built an Ant-Man Protection deck.

As a note, this deck was built without using Thor, Hulk, Quicksilver, Gamora, Drax, Nebula, War Machine, Valkyrie, Vision, or Storm.

**It's Not Regifting, It's Repurposing!**

Ant-Man is good at only two things. Doing everything and healing. [Repurpose](/card/31016) leverages those strengths by letting him do more of everything, while also readying often to take advantage of stat boosts.

***First, the tech.*** [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) and [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) are the main targets for Repurpose. The Power of Protection is in there to help pay for them. [Plasma Pistol](/card/20022) is backup tech, but it could be dropped if you felt you had enough. [Wrist Gauntlets](/card/12010) and [Ant-Man's Helmet](/card/12008) are also tech, so both can be used in case of emergency or as closers (it better be a massive emergency if you're ditching his helmet, though).

***Next, the readies.*** [Repurpose](/card/31016), [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016), and [Ready to Rumble](/card/21022) are your primary readies. Then you also have [Swarm Tactics](/card/12020) and [Earth's Mightiest Heroes](/card/04022) as situational readies. Earth's Mightiest Heroes will work with [Blade](/card/21019), [Brother Voodoo](/card/09012), or [Wasp](/card/12002) on the board.

***Keeping healthy.*** [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016) requires healing to function, so you are face tanking a lot of hits here. These are first mitigated by [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) and [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019), and then healed with [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016), [Pym Particles](/card/12006), and [Ant-Man's Helmet](/card/12008). 

**Final Notes**

If you're looking at modifying this deck using a full collection, some notable cards to consider would be [Leading Blow](/card/19017) from Drax (take advantage of the [Repurpose](/card/31016) and [Giant Strength](/card/12009) stat boosts for extra readies), [Victor Mancha](/card/26015) from Vision (another [Earth's Mightiest Heroes](/card/04022) target), and [Electrostatic Armor](/card/10031) from Hulk (1 cost tech).

I've had a lot of fun playing around with this deck. Ant-Man is a top hero for me, and Protection is my favorite aspect. I hope you enjoy it as much as I have!

name: The Best Defense is a Good Offense
description_md:
Who embodies the saying "the best defense is a good offense" better than Wolverine? If you're looking for a deck that rushes  for damage, while capitalizing on Wolverine's strengths, look no further.

**The Logic behind the deck**

The goal here is to maximize the use of two of Wolverine's most busted cards - his claws and [Berserker Frenzy](/card/35005). The first one allows you to pay for Attack events with your health, and the second will allow you to draw cards like crazy, as long as you can sustain the incoming damage. These two cards turn your health pool into a resource to gain ways of paying for cards, as well as card draw.

Your regeneration helps you fuel these, but you won't last long if you rely solely on it. This means we're looking for ways to soak up the damage you'd normally take, or heal up that damage. That's where Protection shines.

[Med Team](/card/01080) and [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016) both help with the healing, and the latter even allows you to ready. [The Power of Protection](/card/01079) helps you pay for it while meeting the ressource requirement. The deck is also full of Physical resources to that effect.

[The Night Nurse](/card/09019) also brings healing, but her true purpose is to get rid of the stuns that would prevent you from enacting your full offense strategy.

Other ways to last longer are bonuses to your health pool, like [Endurance](/card/05023) and [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004). Put these in play whenever you can, they'll work wonders.

If you want to take full advantage of [Berserker Frenzy](/card/35005), you also want to take the least possible amount of damage while not reducing it completely. Two cards will help you with that, [Defiance](/card/26018) and [Energy Barrier](/card/05017). By using those, you'll ensure your card draw while making sure you'll survive. 

The deck also includes several ways of getting a Tough status card or stunning the villain, which may seem counter-productive when you look at [Berserker Frenzy](/card/35005). The reality is that you won't be able to sustain all the incoming damage, but to choose which damage you take. This goes with one important piece of strategy: **For this deck to work, you'll want to leave the non-Guard minions alive, especially if their attack is low.** Every attack means one card for you as long as you take at least one point of damage. So using stuns and Tough status cards to prolong your life by preventing the villain to harm you does help you on the long run.

**Mulligan strategy**

With your mulligan, you'll want to look for the only two cards that will benefit you on the long run: [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004) and [Berserker Frenzy](/card/35005). As soon as you have these two in play, unleash the hells! Use your claws to pay for events (one exception might be [Tackle](/card/05015), since you'll miss out on the kicker effect, but there are plenty of Physical resources in the deck to help you with that, as well as [The Power of Protection](/card/01079).

**Going Alter Ego**

Of course, you'll want to go back to Alter Ego as infrequently as possible, since doing that will discard [Berserker Frenzy](/card/35005). If you need to do it to survive, though, you can use [Professor X](/card/32019) to confuse the villain pre-emptively. 

**Final words**

I hope you'll have as much fun playing Wolverine as I have - he's a true beast!

Let me know what you think about this deck in the comments below.

name: Captain America 'Leadership' Avengers Symbiote Assemble!
description_md: *“Compromise where you can. Where you can’t, don’t. Even if everyone is telling you that something wrong is something right. Even if the whole world is telling you to move, it is your duty to plant yourself like a tree, look them in the eye, and say, ‘No, you move.'” – Captain America: Civil War* The Captain needs his crew!!! This is an updated version of my "Captain America 'Leadership' Avengers Assemble!" deck https://marvelcdb.com/deck/view/232510?deck_name=Captain%20America%20%27Leadership%27%20Avengers%20Assemble%21%20by%20Methos **I had to** do this deck to include [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191). [Captain America](/card/03001a) symbiote just sounds cool. And the benefits of [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) outweigh the drawbacks by a significant margin in this desk. Yes, you will get an extra encounter card each turn, but with all the allies you have at your disposal, and the amount of damage output the deck provides, this is a small price to pay. Just one note: do not be in a rush to place [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191). If you'd raw it from the beginning, use it as a resource and prepare at least half of your set-up before you play it. I know 50 cards is a lot for a deck, but keep in mind you are aiming to have 11 support, 8 upgrade, and 5 ally cards on the table at any given time (6 allies if you get [Stinger](/card/12014) out), which will reduce the size of your deck significantly. The resource-generating and draw-power of the deck are amazing! **The allies -** [Hawkeye](/card/03012) simply stays there to take care of minions. [White Tiger](/card/21013) will help you draw more cards. [Black Knight](/card/04012) will get rid of any tough status without losing any benefits of the attack. [Squirrel Girl](/card/03013) will do the same, or will finish the minion shot by [Hawkeye](/card/03012). [Kaluu](/card/21014) will help you find the event you need. [Giant-Man](/card/12012) is there for the damage and the Thwart once the HP Is below 3. [Stinger](/card/12014) can join the fun anytime and help you with the card draw power when using [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017). [Goliath](/card/04013) will do a lot of damage, especially when combined with [Command Team](/card/23016). [Ant-Man](/card/12011) is easy to get out and has great stats. [Agent 13](/card/03002)... she has great ability, but unfortunately, she is not an avenger... I use her as a resource unless I really need her on the board for one round. The setup takes a few rounds so be sure to play the correct cards or you will lose the game. **Casual dmg output of over 10 per turn** with my best maximum of 39 damage in one turn (let me know if you managed to beat it). Combining the high base stats of [Captain America](/card/03001a) with [Captain America's Shield](/card/03009), [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) allows you to output 10 damage using [Go All Out](/card/29017), and you have 2 ways to re-ready yourself using [Captain America](/card/03001a)'s heroes ability "I Can Do This All Day" or [Earth's Mightiest Heroes](/card/04022). The damage output of the deck is ridiculous, and for the Thwart in single-player, you can use your allies. Plus, you will rarely need to switch to Alter-Ego so the Villain will not Scheme a lot. If you have to switch so you can heal, base recover of 3, plus one from [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191), plus [Steve's Apartment](/card/03007), plus [Crew Quarters](/card/20029) will heal you for 6. I have tested the deck and I find it very fun to play solo and multiplayer. In multiplayer, don't forget that the allies you play also depend on what hero deck the rest of the gang will play, so always have a few spare avengers with this deck in case you need to change some of them.

name: Board cleaner or villain crusher? Why not both?
description_md: ------------- #### **Intro:** ---------------- One of my favorite things about **[Spider-Woman](/card/04031a)** is her duality. She's a double agent. She gets two aspects instead of one. She has two traits on AE and Hero side. Her hero events count as hero cards and an aspect card. So, why not make a deck for a dual purpose? First, in multiplayer this is a deck made to pair with heroes Like **[Phoenix](/card/33002) (especially)**,**[Valkyrie](/card/25001a)**, **[Hulk](/card/10001a)**, **[Drax](/card/18019)** and **[Wolverine](/card/32041)** that either have crushing nemesis minions (Do you ever win when **[Dark Phoenix](/card/34029)** comes out?), or it really hurts them to get their obligation. For poor Phoenix, it's both. You can use **[Spider-Tingle](/card/31020)** and **[Spycraft](/card/08018)** combined with **[Silk](/card/27010)** and **[Spider-Man Noir](/card/31015)** to keep **Shadow of the Past** in the discard pile and expert cards under Noir's control, All while doing some crazy good thwarting and chump blocking. Second, in solo, it's fantastic for doing sneaky good damage and a lot of hidden thwarting. Betweem Hobie Brown, **[Spider-UK](/card/27012)**, **[Return the Favor](/card/27015)** and **[Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029)** combined with **[Self-Propelled Glide](/card/04039)** you're gonna do a good bit of damage. ------------------ #### **Multiplayer:** ------------------ **_Priority_**: 1) Get out **[Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029)** or **[Spider-Man Noir](/card/31015)** as soon as you can. Both will stay on your board the whole game. If **Shadow of the Past** sneaks past you, put it under Noir and forget about it. The Key to Noir's ability is that the treachery must resolve. If you use **[Spider-Tingle](/card/31020)**, the Treachery must have another action like Surge before the "When Revealed" otherwise it doesn't count as resolved. 2 of the Expert cards have Surge and would go under Noir's control even after using **[Spider-Tingle](/card/31020)**. You'll have plenty of Treacheries to go under Noir by the end of the game. 2) Once Spider-Woman is a Web-Warrior or Noir is on the board, you can start playing **[Silk](/card/27010)** from your hand, and recurring her with **[Chance Encounter](/card/26034)**. **[Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a)** can pull **[Pheromones](/card/04036)**. 3) **[Finesse](/card/04033)** and **[Deft Focus](/card/16024)** help with card economy. They'll make it so a **[Spycraft](/card/08018)**, **[Spider-Tingle](/card/31020)**, **[Self-Propelled Glide](/card/04039)** combo is free. That's 3 damage and 3 thwart. 4) **[Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023)** makes **[Spider-Tingle](/card/31020)** worth it to use almost every villain turn. Your allies on the board can take the damage, it's worth the risk to get rid of treacheries. If it doesn't work, they'll either draw you a card or stay on the board. **_Gameplay and Key Combos:_:** Your job here is to clear the board. You want to keep **Shadow of the Past** in the discard pile. You want to discard obligations and other bad encounter deck cards with **[Spycraft](/card/08018)** (No thank you, Fanatacism!) - **[One Way or Another](/card/22015)** then attaching **[Chance Encounter](/card/26034)** is fantastic for recurring **[Silk](/card/27010)**, Miles for the stun/confuse, Pavitr to remove tons of threat, and **[Spider-UK](/card/27012)** to do damage to the villain. - Remember that each time a Web-Warrior leaves play, you gain a card and gain +1 attack. Do a lot of putting in allies, only to use Spider-Tingle to take them out. - Once fully set up, with one Web-Warrior ally already out, Pavitr will remove 4 threat immediately, **[Spider-UK](/card/27012)** will do 4 damage when defending, **[Lady Spider](/card/30012)** with thwart as much as Speed, and Miles will stun and confuse. They're fantastic allies to play from your hand. - **[Return the Favor](/card/27015)** works perfectly with **[Spider-Tingle](/card/31020)** since you discards encounter cards until you reveal a treachery. Then you Spider-Tingle, do one damage to a Web-Warrior, and ignore the When Revealed effects, and do 5 damage to the villain. Imo, it's what the card was made for. Only do this in the final phase for multiplayer, you'll need those STs for other reasons before then. - Keep track of how many treacheries are left in the deck, and what's in the discard pile. Since you confuse a lot with this deck, flip to AE, and use Jessica's ability to look at the top card of the villain deck. If it's a treachery, go you can use **[Return the Favor](/card/27015)** without any worries of decking out. - End game, start using Noir's 3 thwart or attack. **[Return the Favor](/card/27015)** a lot.**[Venom Blast](/card/04035)**! Recur Hobie Brown. Turn into a damage dealer. ------------------------- #### **Solo:** ------------------ This is much more straight forward. Still get out **[Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029)** and **[Spider-Man Noir](/card/31015)**. Once you have a **[Spider-Tingle](/card/31020)** on the board, use **[Return the Favor](/card/27015)**. Get out **[Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023)** as soon as you can. You won't need to thwart as much as in multiplayer, so your allies can do damage. They can also die for you to trigger +1 attack from **[Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029)**. You can still control the board and keep it clean, but if an obligation comes out, it's not the end of the world. Play **[Spider-Tingle](/card/31020)** and **[Spycraft](/card/08018)** early and often, but they can be used as soon as they come on the board rather than waiting for the perfect play in multiplayer. Be a damage dealing Spider with all of your Spider friends while also controlling the board with the many ways above. ------------------ Either way you choose to play this deck, you should have new ways to play old cards, do damage in inventive ways and keep that awful Dark Phoenix off the board! Have fun and Merry Christmas!

name: Marvel Medley Rocket Raccoon Aggression
description_md:
Similarly to KennedyHawk from MCM, I've taken it upon myself to make 12 decks because its a festive number and it's the 12th month of the year. I used the Marvel Champions deck randomiser (https://krasstek.shinyapps.io/marvelchampioner/) to output 12 random Villain and Modular combinations, and then give me 12 random Hero and Aspect pairings. I had to fiddle with the latter a bit so I had 3 of each aspect.

I then paired up Heroes to take down each of the Villain / Modular pairings and built a loosely tribal deck to take down each.

On the tenth day of Christmas, Rocket took out his pent-up Aggression on Zola and his Whispers of Paranoia.

Signature card: Bug

After a few losses, I eventually got Bug out turn 1 to repeatedly ping tough and a few threat here and there to keep on top of the early game.

name: Colossal Justice
description_md:
Very strong deck offering good damage, strong control and resource efficiency from Colossus cards and excellent thwart management from Justice cards.  It is intended as a solo one-deck-fits-all.

So far I've beaten on Expert: Rhino, Klaw, Magneto, Sabretooth, Absorbing Man, Ultron, Project Wideawake.  I added in Beat 'Em Up for Ultron specifically.  You may find that more than one works better if facing Ultron as those drones can build up quite fast.  Cosmo is also in there to deal with Ultron II drones and you can hopefully keep calling Events to keep him alive.

Obvious weaknesses are villains with Pierce.  Try to remove upgrades that give pierce asap.

Strategy
- Control the villain.  This is really a control deck.  [Steel Fist](/card/32008), [Professor X](/card/32019), [Mockingbird](/card/01083), [Concussive Blow](/card/05031) will all help you keep the villain from doing much on their turn.  When flipping to alter-ego, strongly consider cycling a [Steel Fist](/card/32008) back into your deck if you don't need an [Organic Steel](/card/32006) or [Bulletproof Protector](/card/32009). I like the cheaper meat shield allies in case you get into trouble with a couple of very bad draws.
- Pump out [Organic Steel](/card/32006) and multiple [Beat Cop](/card/10029)s as soon as possible.  [Organic Steel](/card/32006) will keep Colossus tough to fuel [Steel Fist](/card/32008) and [Made of Rage](/card/32007).  [Beat Cop](/card/10029) is a key support that automatically removes 1-3 threat (one per Beat Cop) from any scheme free of resources (once played).  It's also not dependent on Hero or Alter-Ego forms.  Do NOT use the Beat Cops to kill minions!  Colossus can handle the punishment and you can keep the Beat Cops around indefinitely to deal with threat removal.  With the Beat Cops automatically handling your threat removal, you can focus on pumping out damage and ramping resources from [The X-Jet](/card/32020), [Piotr's Studio](/card/32003), [Iron Will](/card/32004) and [Titanium Muscles](/card/32005).
- If you get bad draws and don't come across any Beat Cops or they can't handle the threat accumulating, use [Clear the Area](/card/04049), [Multitasking](/card/15013), [Under Surveillance](/card/06031) or allies to compensate.  Also, if in dire straits, consider thwarting with Colossus (+1 with Iron Will in play).
- [Limitless Stamina](/card/31023) are in to pump out more damage and to really do some huge burst damage if you find your hand with 2 x Made of Rage.
- [Enhanced Awareness](/card/03034) is in to fuel the mental condition for [Multitasking](/card/15013).
- [Unshakable](/card/31024) is a questionable card.  I haven't found much use for it so far and it may be replaced in the near future.

name: Weather Control
description_md:
Interrested by a deck allowing you to control the schemes while attacking the villain with all your wonderfull super powers? Storm can easily provide you this opportunity with an additional Weather deck for bonuses.

This deck is a little bit tricky to manage because the permanent Weather deck cards applies to all characters in play. Also it is not straightforward to stay as much as possible in alter ego form, but after two to three plays it becomes pleasant and definitively efficient.

[Beat Cop](/card/10029) and the [Monica Chang](/card/27040) / [Surveillance Team](/card/01064) combo helps controling the schemes while you can stay in alter ego form. [Meditation](/card/26036) and [The Power of Justice](/card/01062) are here to afford these expensive cards.

Allies are also here for additional control if you are not lucky with your first hands and in the worse case scenario, you can even use your hero form once in a while to stand and face the schemes.

After standing still for one of your deck cycle, your board will be set and you will be able to unleash the natural disasters to your villain opponent and the unfortunate sbires. You will see that you will even send [Lightning Bolt](/card/02044) when forced to turn to your hero form so that your powerfull vengeance will directly impact the final stage of the villain.

Suspicious about having fun playing this deck, please give it a try and don't hesitate to share feedbacks.
Enjoy!

Sharon Carter can ready the Alpha Flight Station every round. Pretty incredible when you can flip to Alter Ego with a nice big Main Scheme.

name: Spider-Woman joins the Midnight Suns
description_md:
What is this nonsense you ask? It is just the best way I have found to include as many of the characters from the Midnight Suns video game into one deck that maybe/kinda-sorta works if you squint a bit.

What do you do here? Well, this is an ally deck, you will want to get allies out and use upgrades to improve them. Nothing too complicated. There are some tricky spots to use though.
[Magik](/card/32042)'s ability only will trigger if [Wolverine](/card/32041) is in play and you are engaged with a minion. Spider-Man's ability will only trigger if you get [Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029) on [Spider-Woman](/card/01011). 

Several cards take advantage of having Avengers deployed, so there are a couple of [Honorary Avenger](/card/03025) cards to help you get better use out of the non-Avengers in the deck and one Attack Training you can put on Magik or Wolverine. 

Now all you need is for the Hunter to go bird watching and meditating with Jessica Drew and give her some scented candles.

Passed:

Crossbones - Standard, Solo - State of Emergency, Legions of Hydra, Weapon Master

Failed:

Venom - Standard, Solo - Legions of Hydra

description_md:
Similarly to KennedyHawk from MCM, I've taken it upon myself to make 12 decks because its a festive number and it's the 12th month of the year. I used the Marvel Champions deck randomiser (https://krasstek.shinyapps.io/marvelchampioner/) to output 12 random Villain and Modular combinations, and then give me 12 random Hero and Aspect pairings. I had to fiddle with the latter a bit so I had 3 of each aspect.

Any deck that has a lot of threat removal will benefit from Turn the Tide. It turns any Justice build into a damage powerhouse.

name: S.H.I.E.L.D.’s Justice Machine
description_md: I’m about 3 weeks into my honeymoon with the game and so far I have had a lot of fun with a deck like this one, in both in solo and group play. When he has his shoulder cannon WM is a great team player, able to clear out lots of minions, plink away tough or stunned cards, and when called for, unload major damage. Paired with efficient Justice cards he’s an all around threat and probably my favorite hero so far. Just added the Sinister motives expansion to my collection and can’t wait to see how these new justice cards improve his effectiveness even more!

name: Spectrum - Me and My Symbiote
description_md:
Spectrum has gotten a symbiote suit and has decided that the two of them can handle most of this by themselves.

Mulligan to get the [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) out as early as possible as everything else in this deck gets way more powerful once you have it in play. use [Morale Boost](/card/05032) to bump up stats, and then jump back and forth between forms to ready using [Ready to Rumble](/card/21022). Go all Out and [Push Ahead](/card/29018) become powerhouses when paired with the suit and Morale Boost.

Her allies exist to power [Earth's Mightiest Heroes](/card/04022). [Blade](/card/21019) can attack or thwart when you have a spare physical resource to keep him in play, otherwise he is just a battery for readying using EMH. Kate Bishop Hawkeye can plink the occasional arrow when you have a card to spare but also serves the main purpose of fueling EMH. [Blue Marvel](/card/21005) can let himself get used up if Blade or Hawkeye are in play. (You could also switch her out for Clint Barton Hawkeye and just let him sit and arrow minions as they come into play and still fuel EMH. Or go to a 41 card deck with him added)

Everything else is resource generation and survivability to keep the hits coming.

name: Venom w/ SuperBug
description_md: I played this deck a lot. It doesn't win every time, but I like it. If you are able to get Bug down with energy spear and boot camp he hits like a truck. Then you attack with Venom, and  Bug becomes damage free. There are a few pulse granades to make sure you can  exhaust them instaed of your pistols. side holster so you can swing Godslayer too. Multi-Gun for threat removal...

name: Spider-Man - One Deck to Win Them All!
description_md:
I recently wanted to build a deck and take it through all scenarios... I have a tendency to build a deck, play 4-5 scenarios and move on and as a result, I playtest decks more than I play them!  

And so, I wanted to build a deck to tackle it all, solo. That' s still unfinished (but I will!). Still, so far this deck, simple as it is, has won every encounter I put it against hands down, it may just be the One Deck to Win Them All! 

I noticed other players offering lists for Christmas and I thought, why not? Want a deck that prooved itself, sit and play? Here's one.

For those curious, it beat expert scenarios (with recommended modules):

- Rhino

- Klaw

- Ultron

- Risky Business

- Mutagen Formula

- Wrecking Crew

- The Hood

- Kang

- Mad Titan's shadow campaign

My next undertaking will be Sinister Motives / Mutant Genesis. Keeping GMW for last LOL.

____________________________

Playing the deck

Well, I think it's pretty obvious, but play [Sense of Justice](/card/14030) to pay for your [Clear the Area](/card/04049) and [Multitasking](/card/15013). Those, plus the allies you put in play, make up nicely for Spidey's lack of THW. 

Don't be afraid to block, Spidey can take a lot of hits and your basic 2 atk isn't wht you want to take down the villain. Holding on to [Backflip](/card/01003) to avoid serious blows or [Enhanced Spider-Sense](/card/01004) to negate encounters is still a sound move.

[Professor X](/card/32019) or [Sonic Rifle](/card/20015) the villain for a confuse when you need to revert to AE and let [Aunt May](/card/01006) heal you.

That's also a good moment to use your "scientist"  and GENIUS features to play [Ingenuity](/card/29027) / [Moon Girl](/card/28018). Put the main scheme [Under Surveillance](/card/06031).

Put as many upgrades / supports in play as possible, thining your deck. And then... [Swinging Web Kick](/card/01005)s are coming more frequently into your hand, kick the villain down!

Fun thing, Spidey can also negate a stalwart villain's activation with [Webbed Up](/card/01009) (although it is costly, it's sometimes nice to just stop Thanos like no one else can!)


Have fun everyone and Merry Christmas!

name: Doctor Strange - Leader of the Midnight Suns
description_md:
Hello ! 

I just wanted to publish a thematic deck with the new ( really fun ) Marvel game : Midnight Suns

Build your allies, and keep kel strong and alive with your upgrades and first aids. 

If you want to be more agressive, you can replace First Aid with Press The Advantage ( Strange uses a lot of status cards ) 

Have fun !!

name: All I Want Thor Christmas
description_md:
<hr>
**♪ ♪ ♪ _...On the first day of Christmas, [The Bifrost](/card/25023) gave to me: A [Throg](/card/25014) and a [Valkyrie](/card/06012)..._ ♪ ♪ ♪**
<hr>

Is Thor actually Santa Claus? Probably not - and yet [The Bifrost](/card/25023) would be a great way to deliver presents! And this year Santa's bringing [Energy Spear](/card/22032)s!

This deck revolves around using [The Bifrost](/card/25023) to deliver in [Angela](/card/18011) and [Throg](/card/25014) whenever you have [Energy Spear](/card/22032) in hand to gift to them. Choose Angela when there is no minion and Throg when there is. 

But why stop there? Tis' the season of giving! Give them [Honorary Avenger](/card/03025) to grant them another swing - and [Boot Camp](/card/13016) makes an excellent group gift to make all your allies hit harder.

Using Throg's Tough to take the consequential damage from him attacking, either him or Angela can potentially deal 20 damage each with all this! While you will rarely reach that full amount, it goes to show the insane potential you can get from them through [The Bifrost](/card/25023).

[The Power of Aggression](/card/01055) is also best used to bring in one of your Aggression Asgardians through [The Bifrost](/card/25023).

[Bug](/card/16040) would love an [Energy Spear](/card/22032) for Christmas too - but he's also a great help by removing 1 threat per turn. Speaking of threat removal, [Lady Sif](/card/06002) and, in a pinch, [Psylocke](/card/35013) are both great at it - both of them can convert an [Honorary Avenger](/card/03025) into 2 threat removed as well!

[Smash the Problem](/card/25019) can help you remove nasty side schemes in a hurry or wrestle back control of the main scheme - though it should immediately be replaced if you're using this deck in 2-4 player and have solid threat control already on your team. 

[Limitless Stamina](/card/31023) keeps you ready to revel in the festive spirit and brings your total of Superpower-traited cards to 8 - making [Deft Focus](/card/16024) a great present to yourself!

Alternative cards you could consider among others are: ["Bring It!"](/card/19030), [Godlike Stamina](/card/25024), [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024), [Marvel Boy](/card/21041), [Cosmo](/card/17020), [Mean Swing](/card/06015), [Sunfire](/card/35014) and [Professor X](/card/32019).

Happy Holidays!

name: Storm Leads from the Front
description_md: This deck is a quick attempt to combine leadership allies with a few alter ego heal upgrades to help reduce the number of chump blocking needed.

The harder he tries to do right by those he has betrayed, the harder it becomes to overcome the darkness and undo the damage he has caused to himself and his team. Can he finish what he started and make it out alive or will he just prove he is unworthy of the title "Hero"?

name: Lt. Col. James Rhodes, Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D.
description_md: Summary and Theme Lt. Col. James Rhodes shows off his S.H.I.E.L.D. connections to manage threat while using his own hero/identity cards to deal damage. Mulligan and "Engine" Since this deck makes use of 13 S.H.I.E.L.D. trait cards to manage threat, it will be important to get those out as soon as possible. [Helicarrier](/card/01092), and two [Government Liaison](/card/27054) cards will help reduce the cost. [Munitions Bunker](/card/23003) will help generate ammo. [Upgraded Chassis](/card/23004) will provide a tough status card every time you flip from alter-ego form to hero form. [Gauntlet Gun](/card/23005) will help generate resources and ammo for a hero-specific event (such as [Full Auto](/card/23011), [Repulsor Beam](/card/23008), [Scorched Earth](/card/23010), or [Targeted Strike](/card/23009)). Strategy War Machine's kit encourages you to flip often. Don't be afraid to flip to alter-ego. You'll need it to replenish ammo, especially if you have [Munitions Bunker](/card/23003) and/or [Upgraded Chassis](/card/23004) in play. Note also that [Homeland Intervention](/card/27042) can be played in alter-ego form. S.H.I.E.L.D. cards make up one-third of this deck. If threat begins to build, using [Homeland Intervention](/card/27042) can remove up to 6 threat from a single scheme (this is a great use for [Field Agent](/card/27044) and [Surveillance Team](/card/01064)) cards.

name: Logan
description_md: Simple defensive Wolverine deck designed to defend most rounds to stay in hero form, use the Claws to save resources and optimize turns, and use allies for damage.

name: Solo Wolverine Aggression
description_md:
Pretty typical Wolverine Aggression build but tweaked a bit to have a little more thwarting power for solo play.

One of the issues I've had with solo aggression Wolverine is in side schemes heavy scenarios. I could play justice but aggression Wolverine just feels too right.

Also I love getting to use cards that normally don't get a lot of love/play. [Hit and Run](/card/18020) is that card in this deck. Being able to use your claws to pay for some thwarting felt like a real game changer. I know this card is generally considered over costed but I feel like this is one of the niche uses where it works. You play it for "free" and get to tack on piercing to the 2 damage. 

The rest of the deck is filled with easy to play deck thinners that you should be able to get out first deck pass and so you get all the Wolverine goodness it your second pass and should be able to finish off the villian.

I like [Down Time](/card/05033) with him cause it makes flipping down feel a little less bad missing out on the 2 free healing. [Endurance](/card/05023) is a no brainer. Allies are a mix of cheap chump blocks and confuses to further give him the ability to flip down/manage threat.

I'm already a [Clobber](/card/18012) Stan and it feels even better with Wolverine. A truly free 3 damage with piercing (not even costing 1 ER since it bounces back (assuming you play it first)). [Chase Them Down](/card/01052) rounds out the events to help a bit more with thwarting if needed since this is a solo deck.

name: Honed Phoenix
description_md:
This deck brings a lot of villain control with [Drop Kic](https://marvelcdb.com/card/10014)k and [Psychic Assault](https://marvelcdb.com/card/34032) and the good old [Professor X](https://marvelcdb.com/card/32019).

With so many cards having either the Psionic or X-Men traits, [Team-Building Exercise](https://marvelcdb.com/card/12024) is a must.

The deck has a lot of punch thanks to [Honed Technique](https://marvelcdb.com/card/28017), which it can be easily triggered thanks to The [X-Jet](https://marvelcdb.com/card/32020) or the [Psionic Bond Phoenix ability](https://marvelcdb.com/card/34001a). Your [Clobber](https://marvelcdb.com/card/18012) will hit for 5 damage potentially for only 1 resource. For 2 resources [Psychic Assault](https://marvelcdb.com/card/34032) will deal 5 damage and confuse the enemy; and for 1 resource [Press the Advantage](https://marvelcdb.com/card/04043) will deal 3 damage and draw a card.

To play in solo, it is better to play in [Restrained](https://marvelcdb.com/card/34002a) form and use Phoenix amazing 3 Thwart, which thanks to [Utopia](https://marvelcdb.com/card/33020) allows you to remove 6 threat in one round.

In your starting hand you want to see [White Hot Room](https://marvelcdb.com/card/34004), since you want to flip often between alter-ego and hero, which you can easily do thanks to the 3 copies of [Psychic Assault](/card/34032), and the [Professor X](/card/32019) and [Psylocke](https://marvelcdb.com/card/35013) allies. Nevertheless, other equally good cards to have in your starting hand are [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) or [The X-Jet](/card/32020).

In multiplayer you may want to swap a couple of cards (1 [Drop Kick](/card/10014) and 1 [Clobber](/card/18012) may be) for two copies of [Dive Bomb](/card/17028), which you can play once you have [Phoenix Suit](/card/34005) for 3 resources thanks to [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024). Dive bomb with Honed is insane, you will deal 11 damge to the Villain and 5 damage to each other minion in play...

Enjoy and happy gaming!

name: Gamora - Solo Champions League Season 13/3
description_md:
What is my plan for Ronan/Under Attack?

I intend for Gamora to use her Event cards to actually damage Ronan, while using the [Milano](/card/16142) to manage threat and Armor Plating and her DEF to mitigate damage coming in. [Momentum Shift](/card/09016) can be used to both attack and recover lost hit points and [Powerful Punch](/card/32014) can provide some punishment when Ronan attacks.

[Sunfire](/card/35014) can knock off [Universal Weapon](/card/16109), [Concussion Blasters](/card/01153), or [Adamantium Upgrades](/card/35036) when he comes out, [Marvel Boy](/card/21041) can ping off tough or avoid retaliate if it is in play, and [Brawn](/card/10011) will also help keep a lid on threat. 

Two [Pulse Grenade](/card/17023) cards exist to fuel [Fusillade](/card/20026) until it comes time to go for the kill.
