name: Colossus "4 or 5 moments" (Team Up)
description_md:
Alright, finally time to release the third part of my Team-Up series. Better late than never....

This is the third and final part of the deck in the series, and for our purpose went with Colossus. While Colossus isn't the only deck that could thwart this build successfully, he is one of the best.  He wants to flip down every other round often anyway, allowing him to take advantage of the synergy pieces provided by Cyclops. His ability to mostly always defend for himself means he's not sacrificing his X-men allies as chump blockers, so he can keep a pretty solid presence for Mutant Protectors and even helps feed Team Strike.

In case you missed the first two parts in my series you can find the accompanying aggression amd leadership decks needed to make this deck work here. I'd recommend checking out the Cyclops deck for the write-up on how these decks synergize.

**The Other Decks**

[Cyclops Leadership ](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/24851/cyclops-set-them-up-x-men-team-up-1.0)

[Wolverine Aggression ](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/24948/wolverine-knock-them-down-x-men-team-up-1.0)

 
**Other Heroes You Can Use**


Other strong contenders to fulfill the justice aspect of this deck are Phoenix, who can have a strong base thwart and has some desires to flip down.  If we were ever to run these decks again, however, I personally think I'd pick the upcoming Gambit character, as he has some great synergies here. Obviously, if I were to use another hero I'd drop Fastball Special and both Great Responsibilities. I'd also add Colossus to either this deck or the aggression one for his great ATK and chump potential. Any other X-men could do as well, but as of now, these would be my top picks.

**General Strategy**

Your job is to control the board until the Team is ready for an OTK.  You won't be getting as much thwart as the aggression deck can pump out in damage, but you should be hitting mid-teens to high 20's in thwart pretty consistently.  Try and stay up an additional round, so Cyclops can be flipping down every even round, and you flip down on odd rounds, moving it around as Wolverine needs to or wants to go down.

**Colossus**

As Colossus, you'll be taking full advantage of your tough, and hoping the villain doesn't have a piercing or secondary damage.  You don't have great thwart, but Mutant Peacekeepers should be hitting for about 8-10 almost out the gate, and can pump up huge thwarts for turns when the Villian and schemes really start to pump out.

You'll be taking huge advantage of Cyclops Set-Up cards.  Danger Room Training can ping your Mission Trainings, for larger Mutant Peacekeepers, use X-Mansion to help keep Wolverine or yourself healed up, and Cyclops can hit your ping damage with Crew Quarters.

You'll usually be able to keep a full roster of allies to fuel your Mutant Peacekeepers, and can help fuel the Wolverine player's Team Strike, though a lot of your allies suck for that card.

**Allies**

So, until Gambit drops next month we are pretty limited on allies.  After that releases, I'd likely move Angel to the Aggression deck and add in Bishop.  I'd likely remove Banshee and add Dazzler as well.

Angel is nice, having 2 attack and 2 thwart if upgraded.  And he'd only cost 1 if Cyclops has Uncanny X-men on you already.  Banshee's ability isn't overly useful, as Wolverine will be doing a great job at controlling the board for you, but being a 2/2 or 2/3 is solid for us.  Blindfold has an excellent on-play to help give you a little control and is a very strong character for Mutant Peacekeepers.  Marvel Girl has a nice situationally useful ability and is another strong thwart feeder.

Professor X does not synergize great with the goal of these three decks, as he leaves play in one round.  Still, he has a strong on play ability and is excellent for 3 thwart for turns you aren't playing Mutant Peacekeepers.  Shadowcat has solid stats, but I don't think we needed her special ability even one time with these decks.

**Events**

Since you'll be flipped down a lot, Armor Up is there to avoid a scheme, if desired.  Usually, your main scheme will be around 0 and you'll have Under Surveillance, so you may want to stay in Alter-Ego for the extra card draw and resources.  Bulletproof Protector is best used for an extra tough and card draw.  We rarely saw use for Made of Rage in our group, but when we needed the hit, it was very nice to have.  Steel Fist is simply amazing as long as the villian isn't stalwart.  Even if they have steady, its well worth adding half a stun and confuse on the villian.  You'll get to ping both cards every round.

For the non-Colossus cards, Fastball Special is amazing.  With the Brute force Wolverine you'll be hitting for 6-10 for 1 cost.  It's even better for you than Wolverine, as your more likely to be in Alter-Ego when Wolverine needed you in Colossus form.  This will rarely be an issue for you.

I usually hate Great Responsibility, but its a pretty solid card for Colossus and Tough.  With these deck set-ups you should have 1 Hero in alter-Ego each round, so you'll have a lot of chances to use it.  If I was using a different hero for this part of the deck, I'd drop Great Responsibility for sure.

Mutant Peacekeepers and Team Strike are what made me think of this Team-Up combo.  The important text of the card for our purpose is "and any number of X-Men allies". This means you can use the allies of your other two players, for some insane thwarts.  For some simple math that you can easily hit, 2 thwart from Colossus, 7-9 from his allies, 2-3 from Wolverine's allies, and 7-13 from Cyclops allies.  This means you can pretty reliably hit between 18-27 threat, and you can increase this by a lot if you have Overwatch down.  Even by round 2 or 3 round, you should be hitting for at least 8.

**Support**

Command Center can be useful, but if I rebuilt this deck, I may well drop it.  See the list of replacements.  

Piotr's Studio is one of the best alter-ego cards and should be played if at all possible when drawn.  Colossus has excellent cards and since he can reshuffle back into his deck, you can set-up what you need, especially as the deck thins.  

**Upgrade**

Colossus has a ton of upgrades in this deck.  Chance Encounter can help you find the exact ally you need.  Try and use before you flip down to draw a nice 2/2 ally and slap Mission Training on them.  Counter Intelligence is there for an emergency, and will likely sit on the board, for most of the game, but it can save your life when needed.

Deft Focus is so good for Colossus.  It hits 7 of his cards, 5 of which you can continually mill back into the deck.

I've covered Honorary X-Men in detail under Cyclops, but it's needed for some of the synergies.  Throw it on Cyclops if he doesn't have it yet, and Colossus should probably get the second one.  This allows you to use Uncanny X-men when flipped down.

Iron Will and Titanium Muscles maybe your two best cards, and you should prioritize them. above all others.  Drawing a card every time you discard a tough is huge! 

Mission Training is there for pumped-up stats.  Remember, you can play these on other players' allies when it's desirable.  When using Danger Room, it's better to pull them from your deck than discard pile.

Organic Steel is fantastic, but not a high priority.  You'll usually want it as a resource early on, and then use aspiring artist to put it back in and play it later.

Overwatch is so good for this deck.  We were consistently hitting 10 threat removal when we used it.  Throw it on the main scheme and save it for when you really need a big hit for some side schemes and the villain added a ton of threat on the main.

Skilled Investigator thins your deck, gives you solid card draw, and is a good target when you are forced to discard an upgrade.

Under Surveillance is one of my favorite cards in solo play, and is pretty good for 2 players.  At 3, its less useful, but it did save us in a few games where we were waiting for Colossus to draw into Mutant Peacekeepers to get the threat level manageable.   

**OTK**

You roll in the OTK is smaller than Wolverines and Cyclops.  Cyclops will have Exploit Weakness down already, so you'll get +1 to each attack.  If they've both already gone you should be at at least 75 damage already, so really you can do almost anything and finish off the villian, even if playing a 4-player game.  The only card you'd really need to hold would be Fastball Special.  If you went before Wolverine, it should hit for 10 or 11, if after it should be 7 or 8.  Your basic attack will be 4.  If you have 3 allies you can hit for 4-9.  A Steel Fist or Made of Rage will add 6.  So you should be hitting for somewhere between 20 - 30.  Not as strong as Cyclops or Wolverine, but still a respectable hit to push the damage to at least 95, and potentially over 100, enough to eliminate any Villians we currently have.

**Alternate Cards**

So, as I've alluded to, there are some cards I may cut, and others I'd definitely cut if not playing Colossus.  These are Great Responsibility, Fastball Special and Command Center.  One's I wouldn't cut but an argument could be made are Chance Encounter, Counter Intelligence, and Under Surveillance.

Some alternate cards I'd be thinking of would be Weapon X, if not playing Colossus.  A great card and for most characters Identity cards are their best cards.  I think you could easily add 2 more Skilled Investigator's to help out your allies with card draw as well, though the Cyclops player would have a hard time pinging it at a time that's useful for him.  

One Way or Another is one of my favorite cards in solo play, but I rarely include it in multiplayer decks.  However, with the very high thwart potential of Mutant Peacekeepers, I think it could be an excellent addition.  You can use it to remove schemes whose timing could be very pesky if drawn at the wrong time and eliminate them.  Plus, awesome card draw.  I probably would only use it when I could reliably eliminate what I pulled, so would likely only have in 1-2 copies, but it could be great.

A Helicarrier would keep with the theme nicely, as your allies could take advantage of it if you don't need it.

Downtime or Crew Quarters would make strong additions.  I really like Downtime in these set-ups because you will be flipping down often for its benefits, more so than for healing, and if it sets up correctly, you can hit another player with it.

**tl;dr** Help keep the board state in check while Cyclops gets set-up and Wolverine keeps the minions in check.  Use Mutant Peacekeepers for massive thwarts and help set-up for an OTK.

Sorry for the long delay between postings.  Hopefully you can have some fun with the amazing X-Men synergy between decks as we had.

name: Venom - Fight my allies
description_md:
I was trying to think of a new type of deck I had not made yet and decided to try an Ally-based Protection deck. 

The plan is to let Venom use his own cards to deal damage while his allies defend. However his allies are well equipped to provide additional damage when defending. 

[Charlie-27](/card/21059), [Rockslide](/card/33013), and [Daredevil](/card/31014) all can return damage when attacked, and are much more survivable when paired with [Defiance](/card/26018) and [Preemptive Strike](/card/05014). [Groot](/card/16047) doesn't deal damage back, but can hold off a lot of damage, and [Martinex](/card/21065) is cheap and good for soaking up multiple weak hits.[Iron Fist](/card/09014) can use his stuns to buy you some set-up time for your Venom cards.

[Nova](/card/05012) is the card you  want to keep in play. With half the deck full of energy resources, he has plenty of chances to dole out damage to attackers. 

3 [Med Team](/card/01080) cards should keep you and your more important allies in the fight and [Knowhere](/card/17022) can provide more depth to your active ally roster and the occasional bonus card. 

There are a lot of expensive allies, so get [Helicarrier](/card/01092) into play early if you can and use Venom's resource generation ability to help out as well as trying to build up both his Weapons and allies at the same time will gobble up resources.

name: Iron Man Energy-Energy-Energy
description_md:
*"Without my other identity, I'm just an ordinary human... More vulnerable than most because my heart would stop without my chest plate… What's the matter with me? I'm still not helpless! I've still got the greatest weapon in the world... a human brain!" - Tony Start: Tales of Suspense Vol 1 #47*

Iron Man, a fan favourite in movies, video games and board games. In Marvel Champions his only weakness is set-up.

Having to stay in *Alter-Ego* for a few turns so you can get on the board with a few tech upgrades could mean you will lose the first main scheme before you even start dealing damage to the *Villain* (especially if you play solo). [Foiled!](/card/09038) and [Counterintelligence](/card/08017) will help you to prevent this. These cards will not only help you keep the main scheme low but also will be helpful when you are playing [Repulsor Blast](/card/01031). You can also consider swapping 1 copy of [Counterintelligence](/card/08017) for one copy of [Under Surveillance](/card/06031) in solo games. In multiplayer, Foiled! and Counterintelligence will mitigate the harm you do to the team while staying in *Alter-Ego*.

[Wraith](/card/22012) is another important card, which I am treating as a support card with 3 counters to get rid of any nasty boost effects during the *Villain* activation phase.

For the set-up, [Stark Tower](/card/01034) is crucial as it will allow you to use one of your tech upgrades as a resource and then bring it back to your hand.

With [Quincarrier](/card/08023) you will always have the required resource to gain the *Aerial* trait. [Pepper Potts](/card/01033) and [Helicarrier](/card/01092) will allow you to play [Supersonic Punch](/card/01032) and deal 8 to an enemy. [Deft Focus](/card/16024) will allow you to play [Repulsor Blast](/card/01031) for free, and more often than not, I am hitting for 9 damage with this card. This way your attack events are taken care of.

[Beat Cop](/card/10029) is an expensive card, but it serves two purposes, so having two of them on the board will keep any *Scheme* under control, and will help you get rid of minions so you don't have to waste your attack events on them. Combined with [Interrogation Room](/card/01063), this provides you with even more threat control on the board.

[Plan B](/card/27024) will make use cards in your hand you would otherwise discard to get a bigger hand draw.

I'm multiplayer, after set-up, you will be drawing to the big damage-dealing *event* cards all the time, providing both damage output and scheme control. And you will still be able to flip to *Alter-Ego* as often as you like to use *Recovery*, [Crew Quarters](/card/20029), [Stark Tower](/card/01034) and *Futurist* without worries about the main scheme getting out of control.

The deck is very versatile and can handle anything the bad guys throw your way. One of the most important decisions you will have to make while playing is, whether will you keep your starting hand or will you try to get [Stark Tower](/card/01034) as soon as possible. Have fun people ( :

name: Powolne ogrywanie S03E13 - Siostra którą nienawidzę
description_md:
**Powolne ogrywanie S03E13 - Siostra której nienawidzę (karty do Gamory )**

Cześć, jestem casualowym graczem, który lubi sobie dość wolno ogrywać wszystko testując (nawet troszkę na siłę) mając "w poważaniu" tempo wydawania dodatków przez FFG ;) Standardowo testuje na solo na 5 scenariuszach z kampanii grając jednak jako standalone na expercie z losowymi modular setami.

W sumie to ciężko coś ciekawego pod Gamorę wymyśleć co nie będzie po prostu deckiem opartym o Thw/Atk eventy... W końcu mamy 10 eventów i 5 kart z synergią pod eventy... Jedyną kartą która wygląda dość fajnie (pomijając synergie z eventami) jest nasza siostrzyczka [Nebula](/card/18002), która oprócz tego, że ma... synergie z atk/thw eventami jest po prostu świetną kartą od strony ekonomii. 2 zasoby + dobrana karta, więc tak jakby kosztowała 1 zasób. Dobre staty 2/2. I dobieramy kartę, którą akurat potrzebujemy, więc ograniczamy losowość. Czyli razem mamy za 2 zasoby: dobranie wybraego eventu, scheme lub atak za 2 + blok złola. 

Po tytule warto się domyślić co planujemy... Z naszą siostrzyczką mamy burzliwe relacje, więc będziemy ją mordować. W kółko. Bez końca. Jej agonia będzie trwać wieki. I w sumie bardzo klimatyczny deczek nam wyszedł, bo sam znienawidziłem [Nebula](/card/18026). Nie wiem co tu się zadziało, ale na jakieś 15 gier Gamorą aż 4 razy dobierałem [Shadow of the Past](/card/01190) w 1wszej turze co jest wynikiem delikatnie mówiąc absurdalnym.

- Podstawą są stare, oklepane [Make the Call](/card/01071) i [Rapid Response](/card/08031) które niemal nam gwarantują Nebulę w każdej turze. Tym samym łatamy sobie największą dziurę Gamorki - czyli jej defensywę. Siostra zbiera cały oklep, a my możemy spokojnie zająć się ofensywą z naszych eventów. A Eventy z kolei zawsze mamy dzięki Nebuli. No i się kręci.

- Z eventów mamy dość mało w stosunku do piewotnego decku: 9 kart aspektowych, z czego 6 z naszych bonusowych kart z nie-naszego aspektu.
 - [Clear the Area](/card/04049) dalej IMO jest najlepszym skilem Thwartującym w grze. Setowanie jej zdolności z naszym 2 Sch + bonusowym 1 pkcikiem z umiejętności Hero jest banalnie proste. A jeszcze może nam pomóc w tym siostra. Mamy też [Keen Instincts](/card/18009) więc to właściwie darmowy dobór. Świetna karciocha 10/10. Aczkolwiek coraz mniej ją lubię, bo ciężko ją przebić... Większość nowych Thw eventów z ostatnich pakietów wydaje się meh przy nim.

 - Więcej wydarzeń to zbijania zagrożenia nie czułem potrzeby, więc resztę możemy przeznaczyć na to co tygryski lubią najbardziej - czyli ofensywę. Jak wspominałem z setowaniem [Clear the Area](/card/04049) nie ma problemu, więc śmiało możemy dodać do pary [Turn the Tide](/card/15015). 3 dmg za 0 to coś co ciężko przebić nawet agresji. Bierzemy bez zastanowienia.

 - No i tu pojawia się problem... Bo Liderka eventów atakujących na ten moment ma 1... właśnie [All for One](/card/13032). 3 dmg za 2 many to właściwie [Haymaker](/card/01087). Dość łatwo podbijemy go do 4 dmg, maksymalnie zadamy 5 dmg. Dalej jest ok, bo mamy [Gamora's Sword](/card/18010) to raz, a dwa, że reszta eventów mamy dość tanich i dość często mamy wolne [Keen Instincts](/card/18009). Więc dalej wolę grać dodatkowy nawet nie tak silny event niż dodatkowy jakiś pakiet Lidershipowy. Alternatywą jest znany z pakietu najniebezpiecznej kobiety [Hit and Run](/card/18020), ale All for one ładniej zmieścić, więc minimalnie bardziej mi się podoba.

- Sojuszników mamy dość mało jak na Liderkę, tzn. tak jakby, bo Nebulę wracająca co chwile działa jak 7 sojuszników w decku. Tak jakby oczywiście. Problem taki jak wszystkie schowają się na spodzie talie, ale w moich grach ani razu nie miałem takiego problemu.
 - Gramy mojego ukochanego [Hawkeye](/card/01066). Bo to Hawkeye. Mamy dużo wszelkiego rodzaju pingów, małych eventów, więc kontrola stołu z strzałami clinta staje się banalnie prosta. No i jako mały bonus jest avengerem, który długo stoi na stole i często jest wolny pod dodatkowy dmg z [All for One](/card/13032). Niby nic, a cieszy.

 - [Ant-Man](/card/12011) to taki mały zapychacz. Jest mocno elastyczny, czasami mamy na ręku same tanie eventy więc łatwo go puścić z większą liczbą HPków, jak nie to wchodzi z 2 HPkami i też jest ok. Prawdopodobnie lepszy by był w tym miejscu [Adam Warlock](/card/17011), no ale zostawiłem mrówę z uwagi na minimalną synergię z [All for One](/card/13032).

 - [Squirrel Girl](/card/03013) jest fajnym uzupełnieniem. Raz, że jest avengerem więc minimalna synergia jest. Dwa, że jej obszarowy atak potrafi fajnie się łączyć z naszymi eventami i strzałami za 1 obrażeń. Trzy, że zawsze to tani stronnik, który może się podłożyć, w przypadku gdy Nebula i jej wskrzeszajki nie podejdą.

 - "Last but not least" stara dobra maryśka, czyli [Maria Hill](/card/01067). Synergii z avengerami się nie przejmujemy, bo mamy jej tyle co nic. Generalnie pomaga nam w sytuacjach, jak Nebula jest gdzieś na dnie. Dobieramy karciochę, czyli przybliżamy się do tej siostrzyczki nieszczęsnej, no i mamy te zastępcze 2 Thw, przez co łatwiej nam setować [Clear the Area](/card/04049).

- ostatnią karciochą są [Booster Boots](/card/16052) i tu już trochę bardziej "last but least". Większość ataków ma iść na wiadomo kogo, więc siłą rzeczy my tych obrażeń przyjmujemy mniej. Tu raczej bardziej jako tech na niektórych przeciwników, którzy lubią zadawać dodatkowe obrażenia. Nie zawsze jest potrzeba grania.

I to tyle jeśli chodzi o deck. Jeśli chodzi o sam plan na rozgrywkę - robimy hard mulligan pod [Nebula](/card/18002). Jeśli ją dobieramy w miarę szybko to zagrywamy, pilnujemy żeby utrzymać przy życiu (przez życie mam tu na myśli, żeby zawsze mieć sposób na przywrócenie jej do gry). Pozostałych sojuszników raczej zagrywamy i utrzymujemy przy życiu, by nam coś tam dobierali z [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) i coś tam dodawali do [All for One](/card/13032). No i próbujemy wciskać obrażeń ile wlezie. Gamora to generalnie postać która jest silna na początku, ale mało się rozkręca, więc lubi agresywny styl gry. Jak nie dobieramy siostry w miarę szybko to trzeba trochę więcej pokombinować, ale z [Squirrel Girl](/card/03013) czy [Maria Hill](/card/01067) powinniśmy dać radę przetrzymać do tego czasu.

I to by było na tyle.

name: Jean Grey takes it easy
description_md: This is my first deck I’m publishing. This deck is all about flipping to alt to not unleash the Phoenix. I’ve tried it against several expert villains.

name: SCL 1304 - Spider-Rush vs Expert Sandman
description_md:
Gameplay: https://youtu.be/vpcj3rrpdKY

Deck for Season 13 Solo Champions League, Round 4
- Round 4 - Sandman + Sinister Assault + City in Chaos (01/08/23-01/21/23)
- Difficulty: Expert
- Hero: Spider-Man [Miles Morales]
- Aspect: Aggression, Justice, Leadership, Protection, or All Basic

Playing the deck and scenario
* The aggression allies, due to their high attack values, are for keeping the sand counters under control since the deck otherwise has tons of damage. Toughness on Thor (and Throg) can come in handy to help with some of the indirect damage when needed
* [Toe to Toe](/card/10015) is there for those situations where you have already stunned Sandman but still have [Power Within](/card/27037) or [Web-Shot](/card/27034) so can trigger [Toe to Toe](/card/10015) and then re-stun him.
* The mix of Aggression attack events could certainly use some refinement. They're all situational, so I tried to keep the count to two for most of them to help avoid getting more than one copy at a time in a situation where it wasn't useful.

name: Gambit Theory Craft: Violet Violence
description_md:
I’m quite excited for Gambit to come out. <3

Gambit comes with a lot of good Justice cards, but I’m choosing to build my boy a red list instead.

I’ll try to be as vague as I can, but there will be some spoilers for Gambit here.

In hero form, Gambit has a very consistent way of giving attack cards extra damage. So he benefits quite a bit from attack cards that deal multiple instances of damage. That’s why you see cards like [Melee](/card/05030) and [Beat 'Em Up](/card/14032)

The other card that shapes my list a lot is [No Quarter](/card/28013) . Gambit can increase its strength and thus draw extra cards with it, but I do need to run more Red cards than usual, because No Quarter can’t draw basic or hero cards.

That’s basically it. I only play multiplayer so I’m not sure how good this would be in solo.

name: Professor Hulk Smashes Science
description_md:
Welcome to Science Class - Professor Hulk is in session!

This Hulk deck is easy to pilot. The whole plan is to build up allies as Bruce Banner to thwart and then switch to Hulk to smash villains. Don't be afraid to take a hit, Hulk wants to protect his allies and this deck draws a lot of cards once it gets going.

**Allies**
Hulk's research team includes many different allies, and they will be doing all of the thwarting as almost every ally can be used with Rapid Response. Ironheart, Kaluu, Maria Hill, Nick Fury, and White Tiger are all played to build up your ally pool to draw you cards, thwart, and create a wild resource pool for Band Together to play the Strength requirements for some of Hulk's cards. Beast will fetch your Limitess Strength, while Squirrel Girl will dispatch minions, and knock of Tough Cards at just the right time. Lastly - Stinger will provide extra support with her ability to not count against your ally limit as a great blocker. Something to also consider if you find an ally isn't working against a specific villain, is to sideboard. For example, Rhino is a low SCH villain... so swapping in Mirage for a recurring Stun Lock with Rapid Response is great!

**Events**
Make the Call is for bringing back strong allies like Beast and Nick Fury, or anyone you need to help your situation. And you don't want your low health allies to die off asap, so tapping them down to draw more cards while attacking or thwarting with healthly ones keeps the heat down. Don't worry if you lose one to a block. Sometimes dropping science is just like that. 

**Resources**
We're playing all three basic resources and Band Together for a mega burst of wild resources which will pay for your Strength requirment 3 cost cards when allies are in play. Band Together represents everyone putting everyones minds together and weathering the villains onslaught to produce results. It is just a great card and is key to keep your resource genration high and wild so you can play specific cards. 

**Support**
Professor Hulk is going to be doing a lot of heavy lifting - so it does require a few supports for everything to flow according to research. Avengers Mansion is a great early game as it draws you a card. Quincarrier will help fuel your Strength requirement for cards, and Triskelion will increase your allies on the board to make sure you will have a chump blocker while keeping your ally count high. If you find that some games you can't keep your allies in play, swap the Triskelion out for a Make The Call. Or if you need them to stay longer Team Training also does work. If you find yourself overwhelmed with resources, swap out Quincarrier for an ally who is good against the villain.

**Upgrades**
Doctor Bruce Banner being a Genius lets him have access to Ingenuity which will help you out early game, at least til you can acquire a Quincarrier to help Strength resources. Since you're Professor Hulk, you can use Ingenuity in hero mode too. Rapid Response is a back bone of helping your allies come back when all seems lost. It lets you recur your specific enter play effects.

Notes: White Tiger cannot use Make The Call or Rapid Response to draw cards when she re-enters play. As the card must be played from hand to gain that effect. Also thanks to Mag  for some inspiration, and shoutout to Marvel122215 for also using Big Brain Band Together plays. Any suggestions are welcomed. Enjoy the deck.

name: Thor = Asgardian HP Sauce [Leadership]
description_md:
Really just wanted to exploit the Symbiote Suit, Go All Out, and Limitless Stamina.
Can fairly consistently get his HP up to 33, and his stats to 2 THW - 4 ATK - 3 DEF, with an Adrenaline Rush + Morale Boost of 4-6 more Attack. On a good day, that's a Go All Out for 15 Attack, multiple times in a turn.

name: Wolverine the Butcher / Lobezno el Carnicero
description_md:
## Wolverine just doing what he does best


**Mulligan:** You have to go for [Endurance](/card/05023), [Adamantium Skeleton](/card/35004) and [Combat training](/card/01057)

**Deck Basis:** I use to stay in alter ego at the end of the first turn to start the secod round with 6 cards in hand and to try to have played at least 2 of the cards above when changing to hero side.

The goal is to increase Wolverine's basic attack to the max, to be able to do 2 or 3 powerful attacks per turn, one basic and two events. Weapons will help in this task. Play them as soon as you draw them.

And last but not least, Wolverine is the one that can play 2 cost 3 events from the very beginnig of the play, without playing any card before. So, we have to take profit of that with events.

Withoud doing anything special, you'll find Wolverine dealing 14-20 damage per turn from the 3rd or 4th round.

## Lobezno haciendo lo que mejor sabe hacer


**Mulligan:** Tienes que ir a por [Aguante](/card/05023), [Esqueleto de adamántium](/card/35004) and [Entrenamiento de combate](/card/01057)

**Fundamentos del mazo:** Suelo jugarlo manteniéndome en alter ego en el primer turno, para poder empezar el segundo con 6 cartas en la mano y haber podido jugar al menos dos cartas de las indicadas arriba al cambiar al lado de héroe.

El objetivo es potenciar al máximo el ataque básico de Lobezno para poder hacer 2 o 3 ataques brutales por turno, uno básico y 2 con eventos. Las armas nos servirán para incrementar el ataque básico, así que hay que jugarlas en cuanto las robemos.

Por último, pero no menos importante, Lobezno es el único que puede jugar 2 eventos de coste 3 por turno desde el principio de la partida, sin tener que haber bajado nada antes. Debemos aprovechar eso al máximo.

Sin hacer nada especial, te sorprenderás haciendo entre 14 y 20 de daño por turno con Lobezno desde el tercer o cuarto turno.

name: Nebula Confuse Lock Solo

A Justice's deck for Nebula with numerous ways to confuse the vilain.

 I made it with spare cards i don't use on my main decks, and has been surprisingly effective in Solo Expert Scenarios.

 Currently have dealt with the whole Core (Expert), Green Goblin (Expert) and Kang (Expert).

name: Civil war bros
description_md: The idea is to make cap and iron man powerful and swing big as much as possible. By attaching free upgrades to iron man and using events to increase health and attack. Good luck.

name: Adam Warlock "What Now?"
description_md: *I am HIM... not born of man and woman! I was created to be invincible! And those who made me... made me well! - Adam Warlock: Thor Vol 1 #166* **What now?** Well, now we have **fun!** The deck is the odd number of 41 cards. I know that's uncommon in Marvel Champions, but the deck trims to 24 cards (26 with [Cosmic Ward](/card/21036)). **Let's break it down** - **3 Allies** - [Kaluu](/card/21014) will help you to find the event you need. [Jocasta](/card/26013) will hold your [Shield Spell](/card/21061) for when you need it, and [Pip the Troll](/card/21032) will protect you. - **17 Events** - using [Eternity](/card/21054), [In-Betweener](/card/21042), [Living Tribunal](/card/21048) and [The Gardener](/card/21060) will reduce your events number to 13 cards. All other events, with the exception of [Quantum Magic](/card/21040) and [Go All Out](/card/29017) are there to help you cycle through your deck (I will explain the inclusion of [Go All Out](/card/29017) later). - **4 Resources** - one for each aspect, maximising your ways of triggering Battle Mage. - **3 Supports** - [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091) helps you cycle through the deck faster. [Helicarrier](/card/01092) allows you to play cards cheaply. [Soul World](/card/21033) is simply broken, even more broken in this deck... As a bonus, you will trim another 3 cards from your deck. - **14 Upgrades** - I know... **A LOT** of upgrades. And all of them, with the exception of 2x [Cosmic Ward](/card/21036), are permanent. [Deft Focus](/card/16024), [Karmic Staff](/card/21034), [Martial Prowess](/card/10018), and [Sense of Justice](/card/14030) are resource-generating/cost-reducing, so you can play multiple events each round. [Armored Vest](/card/01081), [Combat Training](/card/01057) and [Heroic Intuition](/card/01065) will boost your base Def, Att and Thw by one (very important in this deck). [The Sorcerer Supreme](/card/09026) will expand your hand size in Hero form to 6 and [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) will boost all your basic powers by 1, increase your hand size by 1 regardless if you are in Hero or Alter-Ego form, and it will give you 10 extra Hit Points (the extra encounter card each turn is a small price to pay for all this). **Why is [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) included in the deck** [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) not simply gives you +1 to all of your basic stats, but also it gives you +10 Hit Points. Combine this with [Soul World](/card/21033), and you have a healing power of 21 Hit Points. **Why is [Go All Out](/card/29017) included in the deck** After you use one of [Adam Warlock](/card/21031a)'s basic powers to Attack, Thwart, or Defense, you use Battle Mage - Leadership, giving additional +1 Def, Att and Thw (on top of all +1s from the upgrades) and ready [Adam Warlock](/card/21031a) using [Warlock's Cape](/card/21035), use [Go All Out](/card/29017) (don't forget the 1 resource requirement), Exhaust [Adam Warlock](/card/21031a) and deal 13 damage. Combine this with all the events you can play each turn, this deck has a lot of punch balanced with enough Thwart power to win you any game. Epilogue: **41 cards deck irritates me** If you find it irritating playing a deck with 41 cards, remove [Spiritual Meditation](/card/15019) from the deck to round it down to 40 cards (23 after set-up is completed (25 with [Cosmic Ward](/card/21036))).

name: VK Pro V1.0
description_md: Valkyrie Decides to defend but also slaps

name: "Whosoever holds this hammer, if he be worthy..."
description_md:
I. Summary and Theme This deck was meant to be viable for Thor [Aggression] playing solo, particularly against a villain with many minions (which Thor excels against due to his "Have at thee!" printed hero ability). II. Mulligan and Building the "Engine" Thor's poor hand-size is his biggest weakness; you need to play [Asgard](/card/06007) just to reach an average hand size. Therefore, getting the supports and upgrades that generate resources and increase card draw is high priority.
  • As mentioned, [Asgard](/card/06007) allows Thor to add +1 to his hand size. This is the highest priority. If you draw [For Asgard!](/card/06004), use it to find [Asgard](/card/06007).
  • [Quincarrier](/card/08023) generates a wild resource.
  • [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) reduces the cost of a shared trait card, which includes all allies, [Asgard](/card/06007), [Hall of Heroes](/card/06017), [Quincarrier](/card/08023), [God of Thunder](/card/06008), [Mjolnir](/card/06009), and [Thor's Helmet](/card/06010).
  • [Deft Focus](/card/16024) will decrease cost for events with the superpower trait: [Hammer Throw](/card/06005), [Lightning Strike](/card/06006), and [Limitless Stamina](/card/31023).
  • [God of Thunder](/card/06008) (of which there are two), generates an energy resource.
  • Although it is an event (not support or upgrade), ["Bring It!"](/card/19030) allows Thor to draw additional cards for each minion that he is engaged with.
III. Allies Thor's allies are a combination of Asgardians and Avengers so that he can pay for them using [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024). All allies are fairly low cost; aside from [Lady Sif](/card/06002), no ally cost more than 2 resources:
  • [Angela](/card/18011) is "free," costing a minion. She should only be played if Thor's printed hero ability ("Have at thee!") hasn't been used during the herp phase, so that Thor can draw 2 cards.
  • [Hulk](/card/01050) is a great "chump blocker" that usually lasts two rounds due to his 5 health.
  • [Lady Sif](/card/06002) is best played after Thor takes a basic action, since Thor readies when she enters play.
  • [Spider-Girl](/card/04040) neutralizes a minion by stunning and confusing them.
  • [Throg](/card/25014) is best played when there is at least one minion engaged with Thor. He is a great "chump blocker," since he will likely enter with a tough status card.
  • [Wasp](/card/13012)'s cost and health are determined by energy resources, which shouldn't be an issue since energy resources are abundant in this deck. Energy resources can also be generated by [Quincarrier](/card/08023) and the two [God of Thunder](/card/06008) cards in Thor's hero cards.
IV. Thwart Strategy Thor's basic THW ability is only 1, so he will need some serious help to not allow the villain to win via scheming.
  • If a low-health minion is in play (either because the minion has naturally low health or because the minion has been attacked), use [Into the Fray](/card/13013). The damage overflow reduces threat from the main scheme.
  • [Smash the Problem](/card/25019) can be used for any scheme, not just the main scheme. Assuming Thor has [Mjolnir](/card/06009), he will exhaust and remove 3 threat.
  • [Defender of the Nine Realms](/card/06003) also allows for 3 threat removal, and is not bound to the main scheme only.
  • You may have to rely on allies for thwarting, although most allies have weak thwart.
V. Attack/Damage Strategy Thor's attack/damage strategy is not complex, but can still lead to some fun combos.
  • [Limitless Stamina](/card/31023) allows Thor to ready, then use a basic ability such as ATK. This can be helpful to attack multiple times in one phase, or to defend during the villain phase, ready, then attack again.
  • There are 3 copies of [Hammer Throw](/card/06005) in Thor's deck. If an enemy has low health, this will do decent damage to the villain.
  • If [Deft Focus](/card/16024) and both copies of [God of Thunder](/card/06008) are in play/ready, you can play [Lightning Strike](/card/06006) with 2 damage for free.
VI. From Solo --> Multiplayer This deck was largely created for solo play. However, if you are playing in multiplayer, and the hero team possesses a lot of thwarting power, consider trading out [Into the Fray](/card/13013) and/or [Smash the Problem](/card/25019) for any of the following:
  • [Pitchback](/card/28012) (cost 1) - since Thor has the aerial trait with [Mjolnir](/card/06009).
  • [Melee](/card/05030) (cost 3) - for taking out multiple minions.
  • [Drop Kick](/card/10014) (cost 3) - to damage and stun the villain.
Additionally, if you are playing multiplayer, consider taking up to three copies of [Get Over Here!](/card/06014) to take minions from other players (I add these for a 43-card deck). They cost nothing, do 1 damage, and activate Thor's "Have at thee!" printed hero ability.

name: Spider-Man and S.H.I.E.L.D (needs trimming)
description_md: Solo build up threat removal

name: Banner's Band of Scientists and Spies
description_md:
Overview and Intro:

This deck requires some building and should be played with a focus on control in the early rounds. It's not a deck that stays in alter-ego, but it will want to flip to AE every other turn or so. I've played it through the whole Mad Titan's Shadow on Expert Campaign and it consistently defeated the villains on the first try. This deck has a lot of tools and a number of ways to play to its outs. The general idea is to use and abuse Banners genius and resource generation ([Banner's Laboratory](/card/10008), while using [Chance Encounter](/card/26034) to recycle high impact allies like [Monica Chang](/card/27040), [Agent Coulson](/card/08011), [Moon Girl](/card/28018), and [Nick Fury](/card/01084). Rely on Homeland Intervention to create high impact turns of threat removal while still in alter ego (even when confused, as its not a thwart action). Once Banner gets his Shield setup out, it's time to cut loose and let Hulk out of his cage. With most of your supports out, your deck is mostly physical resources. Use One Way or Another to create big handed turns and hit the villain hard with Hulks high damage hero kit.

In Depth Strategy:

Hulk can be incredibly straightforward and also incredibly nuanced to play. He has a small hand size, both in Hero and in Alter-Ego, but his Genius lets him cycle through his deck to set up big turns and he has two Triple-Resources in his [Limitless Strength](/card/10007) to fuel those monster turns. Hulk wants to play high cost cards, and he often has the resources to do it. This means that card draw generally provides you a bigger bang for your buck and when playing him I recommend prioritizing the big cards and big plays where you can. That being said, this deck wants to build early. One of the best ways to build early is to stall the villain and stay in Hero mode - because it limits the amount of threat the Villain will put out. This is where Hulk's truly unique characteristic - his enormous health pool - is also a big strength. You can use that giant health pool and Hulk's high defense stat to soak a lot of blows without risking losing the game. If you're struggling to find threat removal and threat management, stay in hero form and prioritize getting out the cards you need to control the threat. If you get the threat management out early, you have more freedom to flip to alter ego and prioritize your card draw and resource generation supports and upgrades. 

Once you move into the Mid-Game focus on getting the entire S.H.I.E.L.D. build on the table. You need to be able to put your [Surveillance Team](/card/01064) set out, keep them out, and use them and your other supports to fuel your threat mitigation. Use your allies to thwart as often as you can. I almost never use them for damage, unless I need to remove a tough to land a big hit with [Hulk Smash](/card/10003). There are several resource generators in the deck - you don't need all of them. [Ingenuity](/card/29027) is one of the most important, along with [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091), [Banner's Laboratory](/card/10008) probably comes next, then also [Quincarrier](/card/08023). [Helicarrier](/card/01092) is the least important. 

Late Game: Use the machine you've built up to fuel big turns as often as you can. Once built, the engine can give you a huge output about every other turn. Usually it comes from flipping down, digging for key cards, then flipping up to push damage. I find I focus on playing allies and managing threat in Alter Ego and pushing damage in Hero Form. I find this deck really gives Hulk space to shine in the late game.

Key Cards:

[Banner's Laboratory](/card/10008) and [Ingenuity](/card/29027) are really important to this deck. These two plus the [Quincarrier](/card/08023) give you three mental resources for playing Moon Girl when in alter ego to draw three more cards. On top of that, [Banner's Laboratory](/card/10008) improves your recovery, and since you will want to be using your health to stall the villain, you'll use the boost to your recovery fairly often.

[Avengers Mansion](/card/01091) is almost always a huge benefit. As I noted in the overview, card draw is huge for Hulk. It helps overcome his limited hand size, but he also just has some really high value cards (in the right situations) and can often do more with the cards he draws than other heroes. 

[One Way or Another](/card/22015) - I've only included one copy because the deck doesn't have an enormous amount of threat removal, and if you include numerous copies, I found I either whiffed on having a target for it, or drew it on turns when I needed to be in Alter-Ego. I find that having a single copy means I want to play it when I draw it and I usually can find a good target for it when I want to play it.

[Helicarrier](/card/01092) - This is not a super high priority early game, unless you don't draw any of your other resource generators. Mid to late game, I often find myself using it just to trigger [Global Logistics](/card/27043) or [Homeland Intervention](/card/27042). 

[Global Logistics](/card/27043) is often used to counter the Villain, but in this deck its HUGELY valuable for finding cards from your own deck. Use it to help set up your big turns or to find your key build cards early in the game.

[Espionage](/card/08033) is included because you will be in Alter Ego fairly often which gives the Villain several ways to surge. Drawing 2 cards is better for Hulk than just about any other hero, and the deck runs plenty of spies to enable playing it, plus it gives [Agent Coulson](/card/08011) a target for his Response.

Key Omissions:

The Deck doesn't run [Agent 13](/card/27046). She's expensive and more often than not, I don't actually have a S.H.I.E.L.D. support that I want to ready. I just don't find that she's worth the cost. As a result, the deck is a little light on the traditional S.H.I.E.L.D. cards.

Physical Resources - This deck does not run a plethora of physical resources. You are going to need to thin the deck a bit before you can reliably trigger his Hero cards. It's OK to play them and not get their full effect. Late-game you'll be better set to trigger their full effect and push a lot of damage through his ready effects, his [Crushing Blow](/card/10002), his high base attack, and his [Hulk Smash](/card/10003)!

Hope you try the deck - let me know how it works for you and if you encounter any problems with it!

name: Jank Adam Warlock
description_md:
Mackenzie Franklin from SideGame LLC is at it again with a terrible deck for you all to play while having such a fun time doing so! Pilot Adam alongside some of the worst cards in the game! This deck is a blast as you'll play with cards you almost never use and still can achieve minor greatness and breathtaking moments. I strongly recommend you play on standard difficulty as the deck really is meant to lean into playing terrible cards and seeing what you can do with them. You get bonus points if you do the following things:

1. Play all 4 "Shuffle into the Encounter Deck cards" E.G. [In-Betweener](/card/21042)
2. Resolve those cards.
3. Activate a "Training" card to shuffle back in an event. E.G. [Leadership Training](/card/25034)
4. Attack with [Brute Force](/card/14029) twice.
5. Defeat the Villain with a [Pulse Grenade](/card/17023).
6. Hit your [Genius](/card/01089) with [Hulk](/card/01050).

name: Gamora the Healer
description_md:
__

Gamora the Healer

__ __

Healing

__ Gamora wants to eat the villain attack each turn with this deck because of the healing options she has available: * [Momentum Shift](/card/09016): Healing is a cost to deal damage with this card, so you need to take damage to use this! * [Precision Strike](/card/35018): Only heals when it defeats an enemy, but it's not too difficult to make that happen a lot of the time (but I didn't mind just dealing two damage with it either, because of Gamora's "ping" synergies) * [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016): Healing is a cost to ready with this card, so you need to take damage to use this! * [Conditioning Room](/card/18008): Alter-Ego Action, but I like flipping down to take advantage of the first part of this card and her Alter-Ego action (flipping up with 7 or 8 cards is nice) * [Med Team](/card/01080): Also heals allies... * [Endurance](/card/05023): Not true healing, but she does "heal" 3 when you put it into play __

Allies

__ I didn't chump-block with this deck unless it was absolutely necessary because I _needed_ to take damage to use some of the cards. Sometimes I'd chump the Villain and take a little Minion damage to "turn on" her healing events. [Med Team](/card/01080) healing let me use my allies many times before needing to chump with them. You have to keep an eye on the damage you're taking though. If a BIG attack is coming and/or you have no healing in hand for the next turn, a chump block is usually the best course. Early versions of this deck used [Groot](/card/16047) instead of [Daredevil](/card/31014) and [Drax](/card/18019) instead of [Starhawk](/card/16012). * [Groot](/card/16047) with [Hangar Bay](/card/36035) is AWESOME but I'd often toss him because he was too expensive for the turn. Daredevil is just easier to get into play and can ping off low-ATK minions. * [Drax](/card/18019) with [Med Team](/card/09018) healing is a villain slayer, but he can't attack minions! Starhawk is easier to play and is more versatile and strategic. __

Skilled Tactician

__ Gamora's ability to splash ___Attack___ and ___Thwart___ events from outside her aspect is a fun deckbuilding option. This is why Gamora and Spider-Woman are two of my favorite heroes. * [Clear the Area](/card/04049): This did a lot of work and is "free" with a single [Keen Instincts](/card/18009) because it (nearly always) replaces itself. In scenarios with several schemes [Multitasking](/card/15013) would be a good replacement. * [Precision Strike](/card/35018): It doesn't always heal, but it's a cheap 2 damage (+1 to any enemy with [Gamora's Sword](/card/18010) in play) event, made cheaper with [Keen Instincts](/card/18009). I tested [Clobber](/card/18012) in this slot, but I'll take inconsistent healing over no healing. __

Record:

__ __

Core

__ * __Rhino (Standard):__ Many wins, 0 losses * __Rhino (Expert):__ Many wins, 2 losses * __Klaw (Standard):__ Many plays, roughly 60/40 win ratio. I really like this fight because it's challenging * __Ultron (Standard):__ 1-4. I thought this deck would beat Ultron pretty easily, but once it got behind in Drones it was tough to recover. Made Stage II in all five games. __

The Galaxy's Most Wanted Campaign (Standard)

__ * __Drang:__ 1-0 but it was a long game * __Collector I:__ 1-0 with no player cards in the collection at the end * __Collector II:__ 1-0 but I didn't get any Galactic Artifacts (which actually made Nebula easier) * __Nebula:__ 1-2 and I got _really_ lucky with the encounter deck in my win * __Ronan:__ 0-5 and I never got him to Stage II (down to 3 health in Stage I once though) __

Standalone Ronan: 0-2

__ Standalone Ronan is far easier than Campaign Ronan, but I still couldn't win. I got him to Stage II both times and down to 8 health once. The only change I made was trading one each of [Momentum Shift](/card/09016), [Precision Strike](/card/35018), and [What Doesn't Kill Me](/card/27016) for three [Tackle](/card/05015) which helped quite a bit (but obviously not enough). You have to get rid of [Universal Weapon](/card/16109) before you can stun him, at the cost of health and ANOTHER encounter card!

name: MCM Core Set Multiplayer Captain Marvel Leadership
description_md:
This deck was crafted along with 3 other decks from one core set of **Marvel Champions** cards as a part of the MCM 2023 New Player's Month content. The idea here was to make 4-Multiplayer decks with one coreset that are slight tweaks.

You can view the live deckbuild of these four decks on youtube here:
https://youtu.be/NjtB3zmKVMo

When building these decks we picked a theme or combo:

- Here we wanted to show off [Captain Marvel](/card/01010a) insane economy by spamming allies and doing what allies do best. You can play [Lead from the Front](/card/01070) on [She-Hulk](/card/01019a) to help her [One-Two Punch](/card/01024) and [Inspired](/card/01074) [Spider-Man](/card/01001a)'s Black Cat. Lead the team through the core set!

We included a basic suite of staples:

 - [Nick Fury](/card/01084), [Mockingbird](/card/01083), [Energy](/card/01088), [Genius](/card/01089), [Strength](/card/01090). Note we have two copies of [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091) and [Helicarrier](/card/01092) here because you are the player most likely to be able to play them

And flavored to taste.

**Strategy Notes**

- Use [Get Ready](/card/01069) to put allies at 1 hit point and then throw them in front of villain attacks. Bring them back from discard with [Make the Call](/card/01071), mulligan hard for [Nick Fury](/card/01084) or [Maria Hill](/card/01067) and always go first :p

**Deck Upgrades**

- To upgrade this deck pickup the [Captain America](/card/03001a) pack to add [Squirrel Girl](/card/03013), [Wonder Man](/card/03014) and [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) to see some truly insane economy. Also feel free to swap Captain Marvel for [Black Panther](/card/01040a) to see the entire core!

Happy Gaming!

name: MCM Core Set Multiplayer She-Hulk Aggression
description_md:
This deck was crafted along with 3 other decks from one core set of **Marvel Champions** cards as a part of the MCM 2023 New Player's Month content. The idea here was to make 4-Multiplayer decks with one coreset that are slight tweaks.

You can view the live deckbuild of these four decks on youtube here:
https://youtu.be/NjtB3zmKVMo

When building these decks we picked a theme or combo:

- Here we wanted to show off [She-Hulk](/card/01019a)'s ability to [One-Two Punch](/card/01024) with [Combat Training](/card/01057) and maybe some help from fellow A-Force member [Captain Marvel](/card/01010a) and [Lead from the Front](/card/01070).

We included a basic suite of staples:

 - [Nick Fury](/card/01084), [Mockingbird](/card/01083), [Energy](/card/01088), [Genius](/card/01089), [Strength](/card/01090). Note we didn't include [Helicarrier](/card/01092) even in multiplayer we need to keep out low hand size heroes cost curve as cheap as we can.

And flavored to taste.

**Strategy Notes**

- Remember to mulligan deep with She-Hulk and take advantage of your [Jennifer Walters](/card/01019b) hand size.
- Search for [Combat Training](/card/01057) and setup [Tenacity](/card/01093) only as a last resort because other burst is almost always better.

**Deck Upgrades**

- To upgrade this deck pickup the [Red Skull](/card/04125) expansion for [Spider-Girl](/card/04040) and [Earth's Mightiest Heroes](/card/04022)
Happy gaming! Dropping [Tenacity](/card/01093) and 2 copies of [Chase Them Down](/card/01052).

Happy Gaming!

name: MCM Core Set Multiplayer Spider-Man Protection
description_md:
This deck was crafted along with 3 other decks from one core set of **Marvel Champions** cards as a part of the MCM 2023 New Player's Month content. The idea here was to make 4-Multiplayer decks with one coreset that are slight tweaks.

You can view the live deckbuild of these four decks on youtube here:
https://youtu.be/NjtB3zmKVMo

When building these decks we picked a theme or combo:

- Here we wanted to show off [Spider-Man](/card/01001a)'s ability to maintain hero form using [Armored Vest](/card/01081), [Backflip](/card/01003), and [Indomitable](/card/01082) to table defend as much as possible.

We included a basic suite of staples:

 - [Nick Fury](/card/01084), [Mockingbird](/card/01083), [Energy](/card/01088), [Genius](/card/01089), [Strength](/card/01090), [Helicarrier](/card/01092)

And flavored to taste.

**Strategy Notes**

- Remember to mulligan deep with Spidey - you are typically only flipping down infrequently to make good use of those Scientist abilities while you can.
- [First Aid](/card/01086) is here to help you maintain hero form in a pinch or to help keep another player afloat.
- You'll want to dig for that armored vest as fast as possible.
- Be on the lookout for [Combat Training](/card/01057) from She-Hulk to power up your [Counter-Punch](/card/01077) and for [Inspired](/card/01074) from Captain Marvel on your favorite cool [Black Cat](/card/01002).

**Deck Upgrades**

- To upgrade this deck pickup the [Vision](/card/26001a) hero pack for [Defiance](/card/26018), you may also consider [Doctor Strange](/card/09001a) for [Unflappable](/card/09020) or [Quicksilver](/card/14001a) for [Never Back Down](/card/14014)

Happy gaming!

name: MCM Core Set Multiplayer Iron Man Justice
description_md:
This deck was crafted along with 3 other decks from one core set of **Marvel Champions** cards as a part of the MCM 2023 New Player's Month content. The idea here was to make 4-Multiplayer decks with one coreset that are slight tweaks.

You can view the live deckbuild of these four decks on youtube here:
https://youtu.be/NjtB3zmKVMo

When building these decks we picked a theme or combo:

- Here we wanted to optimized [Iron Man](/card/01029a)'s [Arc Reactor](/card/01035) with [Heroic Intuition](/card/01065) and to stuff his deck with [Energy](/card/01088) resources for [Repulsor Blast](/card/01031).

We included a basic suite of staples:

 - [Nick Fury](/card/01084), [Mockingbird](/card/01083), [Energy](/card/01088), [Genius](/card/01089), [Strength](/card/01090), [Helicarrier](/card/01092)

And flavored to taste.

**Strategy Notes**

- Remember to mulligan deep with Iron Man and try to get 3-4 tech pieces out before flipping. 
- [Emergency](/card/01085) and [Haymaker](/card/01087) are mainly here as resource filtering for [Repulsor Blast](/card/01031)
- Be sure to hold off on playing one pair of [Rocket Boots](/card/01039) so that you can fuel your aerial when needed.

**Deck Upgrades**

- To upgrade this deck pickup the [Venom](/card/20001a) hero pack and you can drop 2 [Heroic Intuition](/card/01065) for 2 [Sonic Rifle](/card/20015)
- Another upgrade to consider is dropping [For Justice!](/card/01060) for some cheap allies [Eros](/card/22011) and [Wraith](/card/22012) make great choices from the [Nebula](/card/22001a) hero pack and this also gives you access to [One Way or Another](/card/22015).

Happy gaming!

name: Warlock's Ultimate Wolverine
description_md: Adam Warlock seeks to create the ultimate hero, a force of karmic balance. He locates just the man for the job: [Wolverine](/card/32041). He begins by performing a [Summoning Spell](/card/21055) to bring the man directly to him. Or, perhaps he merely happens upon Logan during a [Chance Encounter](/card/26034). Either way, Wolverine agrees to allow Warlock to empower him far beyond human limitations. Thus, the relentless trials begin. Warlock arms him with an arsenal of weapons and tools: a [Comms Implant](/card/18030), [Reinforced Suit](/card/12018), and [Energy Spear](/card/22032). [Inspired](/card/01074) and [Ready for Action](/card/04017), Wolverine barrels through 4 different types of training specifically tailored to him. During the training, he sustains heavy injuries, which leave him [Enraged](/card/03031). Fortunately, Warlock had planned for this eventuality and had prepared a [Med Team](/card/01080) and [The Night Nurse](/card/09019). With their aid, Warlock believes his companion can [Shake it Off](/card/20028). Thankfully, he's right. Nothing can [Impede](/card/18016) the beastman's [Audacity](/card/21046). So, with [Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029), Wolverine and [The Sorcerer Supreme](/card/09026) travel the galaxy together, thwarting all evil-doers. [For Justice!](/card/01060)

name: Captain Marvel and Beast have a Clarity of Purpose
description_md:
[Beast](/card/33011) and [Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029) make an already strong [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) build even stronger, and Captain Marvel in particular for two reasons:
* Beast's ability to fetch [Energy Absorption](/card/01014) (even one just used to pay for him) is fantastic. Funneling the fetched triple-energy into [Energy Channel](/card/01018) is ideal, but I had several turns where I'd use it to play [Spider-Woman](/card/01011), with or without [Make the Call](/card/01071).
* I saw it confirmed on Hall of Heroes that between [Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029) and Captain Marvel's Rechannel ability you can just exhaust Clarity of Purpose - even if she's at full health - to draw a card, making it a cheap [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091) for her! Item 79.5 on July 27, 2022 at this link: [https://hallofheroeslcg.com/latest-ffg-rulings/](https://hallofheroeslcg.com/latest-ffg-rulings/)

Both make it even easier to find Energy Channel and charge it for the push-kill!

Record:

Rhino: 3-0

Crossbones: 3-0

Absorbing Man: 3-0

Taskmaster: 3-0

Zola: 2-1 (I had him down to 1 health on that loss)

Red Skull: 3-0

name: Miles-o-Minute
description_md:
Solo Champions League deck
Season 13, Round 4

Round Rules:
VILLAIN + MODULE
SANDMAN + SINISTER ASSAULT + CITY IN CHAOS

DIFFICULTY
EXPERT

HERO
SPIDER-MAN [MILES MORALES]

ASPECT
AGGRESSION, JUSTICE, LEADERSHIP, PROTECTION OR ALL BASIC

Initially I was very apprehensive about this round because I knew Miles was next up and I have so very few games logged with him. In fact, I had only played his precon prior to this round. (That I can recall; mainly because Nova, Ironheart, & SP//dr caught so much of my attention during the Spider Wave).

So, not really understanding how his kit worked, this is how I approached it…

I set up a couple of games, using all the parameters of the round. Except, I only included  the 15 card Miles hero kit and the 3 basic resource cards in my deck. Oh Man! Oh Man!

Had no idea how powerful this Spider-Man is! I quickly dispatched Sandman without any resistance. At that point I knew 2 things:
1. The 25 “filler” cards need to feature plenty of Energy and Mental recourses.
2. I need to fast forward to his Hero cards as quickly as possible and fuel as many of them as I can on each turn.

Enter Justice.
The fastest draw engine I enjoy so far in this game features OWOA, Nick, and the Dinosaur Taxi. With clear the area, skilled investigator, etc. only question would be are there enough practical targets for OWOA? Answer: yep

So here is my early prototype 

As alway, see anything I could improve, please feel free to share any thoughts.

name: The best hulk. Period.
description_md:
I've been playing hulk a long time, and he is still my favorite hero.

There are several ways this deck can really shine and usually you will hit one of them pretty hard.

There are a LOT of readies in this deck, and even swinging for three three times is pretty dang good but this can easily be buffed to 5 with symbiote and boundless rage.

Defense can get to 5 easily with vest and suit meaning against most enemies you won't be taking damage and are able to trigger unflappable easily.

That's one game plan.

Another is to get your lab and ingenuity out allowing you to trigger any 2 of your allies abilities indefinitely. Have a little minion attacking you? Great, have warlock take the hit and then heal him every turn. Depending on the minion, sometimes it's nice to remove the minion from the game essentially. Or throw a sidearm on him letting him attack twice and heal up.

There are plenty of fist icons in your deck that I have almost never not qualified for hulk smash or other cards.

name: Miles Morales Symbiote
description_md:
Here you have an angry Miles going full on with the [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191). The deck brings three copies of [Spider-Tingle](/card/31020) to compensate for the Hazard icon in the [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191). 

Mulligan aggressively for [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023) and use your web-warrior allies at will. When in alter-ego, you can use them as well to trigger [Spider-Tingle](/card/31020), and if you kill the ally by doing so, you will also draw a card :)

Play as often as you can [Spider-Man](/card/27049). Use the event [Across the Spider-Verse](/card/27018) to bring him back from the discard pile by exhausting [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023). Once you have [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) and [Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029) you will be dealing a lot of damage thanks to [Spider-Man](/card/27049). Have extra fun by pairing those turns with cards like [Defense Mechanism](/card/27038), [Power Within](/card/27037) and [Arachnobatics](/card/27031).

Enjoy and by tidy with your webs!

name: Spider-Ham Just Lovely-Cartoonvley
description_md:
*"Or everyone’s gonna die. That is what they always say. But there’s always a little bit of time before everybody dies, and that’s when I do my best work." Spider-Ham: Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse*

Spider-Ham is just one of those heroes whom you can simply play and enjoy in any aspect. I decided to make myself a *Protection* deck to enjoy. The deck allows you to play in any way you fancy. I like to play it as *Spider-Ham, Leader of the Web-Warriors!* 

**Allies**

Each ally has an amazing ability to help you throughout each phase and thanks to [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023) and [Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029) gives you an extra *+1 ATK* and a card draw when they leave play. What more can you ask for? Oh... Yes, you can also play any of the expensive *Web-Warriors* for cheap by playing [Across the Spider-Verse](/card/27018), because they are not strong enough already...

**Events**

All the events are very cheap (with the exception of [Swinging Web Pig](/card/30007)) and versatile. You can damage, remove threat, heal, self-harm (if you are into that kind of stuff). You name it...

**Where are the resource cards?**

*Who cares?* We are in the *Cartoon* world now. Normal rules and necessities are overrated!

**Supports**

All [Spider-Ham](/card/30001a) cards have the *Cartoon* trait. All the allies have the *Web-Warrior* trait. 3x [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024), 1x [Helicarrier](/card/01092), [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091), [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023) all the *Toon* counters you want... Oh, there are my resources. So, I can play any card I want 8-)

**Upgrades**

[Down Time](/card/05033)and [Endurance](/card/05023) are there just to boost the *Recovery* as it is beneficial not just for health regen... *Cartoon Power* is *Cartoon Power*... *"No one ain't stoppin' it"*.

And [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) is a **MUST** in this deck. The card provides a massive boost and the deck has so many ways to mitigate the extra encounter card... The deck has ["I Don't Think So!"](/card/30005), [Cartoon Physics](/card/30009), [Spider-Tingle](/card/31020). Just Lovely-Cartoonvley.

*“That’s all folks!”*

name: Beauty and the Beast
description_md:
__

Beauty and the Beast

__ This is just a slight variation of GrootForPresident's "Captain Marvel and Beast have a Clarity of Purpose" deck. __

How our decks are the same:

__ We had a very similar deck, which abuses [Beast](/card/33011) with [Make the Call](/card/01071) and [Rapid Response](/card/08031) to get extra uses of [Energy Absorption](/card/01014): * Use Energy Absorption and any other card (or [Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029)) to pay for Beast... * Get Energy Absorption back and use it again to: * Pay for a 3-cost ally __OR__ * Pay for [Photonic Blast](/card/01013) (which will replace itself) __OR__ * Charge up your [Energy Channel](/card/01018) * Then get a [Rapid Response](/card/08031) on the board and get the Energy Absorption back _again_ when Beast is defeated and comes back into play. __

How our decks differ:

__ * My deck originally had [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) and theirs uses [Command Team](/card/23016), which is the far better option IMO (to be honest I didn't read [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) fully and didn't realize it was a Hero action, so I can't use it in Alter-Ego to help pay for her SHIELD cards, which GrootforPresident pointed out to me). * I run [Teamwork](/card/06032) instead of [Lead from the Front](/card/01070) mainly for the 0-cost and to keep my 2HP allies around a bit longer, but Lead from the Front can make for huge turns! * I use [Adam Warlock](/card/17011) instead of [White Tiger](/card/21013), who does a LOT of work and isn't as chaotic as I assumed when I first read him: * Play out anything you don't want to lose to the discard and "setup" the resource you'll be discarding. [Command Team](/card/23016) is great here here: if you have two resources and either is fine (and the the timing of which happens first doesn't matter) you can do both. * This deck draws just enough cards that you frequently have one of two left over that you might just discard for a fresh draw, and Adam lets you use them effectively. * Anything discarded with his __Response__ is helpful, but the ability helps keep Captain Marvel alive!

name: ULTIMATE HAWKEYE!
description_md:
Amazing deck of Hawkeye fully perfected and tested in expert mode with very good results and without any trouble.

The big problem of Hawkeye is his short life, so we must ensure that in each turn we can have allies to block the villain attacks while he uses his arrows. Therefore, we have used allies with very cheap cost in order to have enough resources to draw allies and to play arrows. In addition, key cards such as "Make the Call", "Regroup" and "Rapid Response" are added to have allies available each turn.

A very important card is also "Earth's Mightiest Heroes" because, as the allies have basic stats, they will allow us to exhaust them all being all avengers and prepare our hero to make an attack equal to 3 or to use the bow again. In addition, this card match perfectly with the rapid response because several allies when they enter again to the game remaining 1 life of dying so to avoid being a turn without doing anything they can be used to prepare our hero for a cost of 0.

Finally, the number of cards is 42 but, as we will have the bow from the beginning, at the end it is a deck of 41 cards. Keep in mind that Nick Fury drawing 3 cards allows you to cycle the deck faster, so 42 cards seems to me an ideal number for this game philosophy.

Enjoy!

name: ULTIMATE ANTMAN!
description_md:
Amazing Antman deck.

The goal is to use allies and events to keep "tough" states to block the villain's attacks, or stun to prevent attacks from being started.

Once this is done, we will have Antman continuously changing identity to control the plan and to destroy the villain with strong attacks. 

There are several cards that are only activated when changing identity so for most of the heroes in the game they are useless. With Antman, They are very worthy because he is continuously changing his identity almost every turn. These cards only cost 1 and are "Perseverance" and "Ready to Rumble". ONLY WITH A COST OF 1 CAN WE'LL PUT TOUGH CARD OR GET READY TO PLAY WITH ANTMAN AGAIN. It's insane!

Enjoy!

The goal is to use allies and events to keep "tough" states to block the villain's attacks, or stun to prevent attacks from being started.

Once this is done, we will have Antman continuously changing identity to control the plan and to destroy the villain with strong attacks. 

There are several cards that are only activated when changing identity so for most of the heroes in the game they are useless. With Antman, They are very worthy because he is continuously changing his identity almost every turn. These cards only cost 1 and are "Perseverance" and "Ready to Rumble". ONLY WITH A COST OF 1 CAN WE'LL PUT TOUGH CARD OR GET READY TO PLAY WITH ANTMAN AGAIN. It's insane!

Enjoy!

name: Wasp - A “Genius In Real Life” Justice Edition
description_md:
# WASP - NADIA VAN DYNE

   Nadia has this great ability called G.I.R.L. This deck plays into that. She has three forms tiny, giant, and her AE. 

## How does it work?
  
   So to use her AE ability you need to be able to go AE. Enter [Professor X](/card/32019), and [Sonic Rifle](/card/20015). These allow her to confuse the villain and go into AE safely. Then she can use her ability to put either one or any other card with mental resource back into her deck. She can play like Miles in this way. 

[Ironheart](/card/13018), [Moon Girl](/card/28018), [Clear the Area](/card/04049), [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047) all provide the card draw to allow her to do whatever is needed be it damage or threat control. 

Have a great time with this deck, and watch for the [Aggression Edition](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25521/wasp-a-genius-in-real-life-aggression-edition-1.0) as well!

name: Wasp - A “Genius In Real Life” Aggression Edition
description_md:
WASP - NADIA VAN DYNE

Nadia has this great ability called G.I.R.L. This deck plays into that. She has three forms tiny, giant, and her AE.

## How does it work?

So to be able to go Alter Ego safely you really want that confuse condition on the villain. To do it we use [Psylocke](/card/35013), and [Professor X](/card/32019), both of which can provide good thwart along with [Brawn](/card/10011) who can attack and remove one threat in one go! to top it off, THEY’RE ALL MENTAL RESOURCES! That means they can all be recycled into the deck with her AE ability. 

For card draw we have [Moon Girl](/card/28018) and [Ironheart](/card/13018). For sweet damage increasing shenanigans we are running
[Warrior Skill](/card/35016), and [Honed Technique](/card/28017). 

Have a ton of fun taking on the enemy with Wasp!

Checkout This [Justice version](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25520/wasp-a-genius-in-real-life-justice-edition-1.0) for more fun!

name: Spider-Man SCL Season 13/4  concept
description_md:
I'll have to play this one to see how it turns out. 

The concept is to get out cards that can absorb Sandman's indirect damage without requiring Miles to exhaust, leaving him free to do damage.

[Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) and [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) can soak damage and then, once they are reduced to 1 hp, be discarded using [Repurpose](/card/31016) to boost Miles' stats.[Protector](/card/26014) can have one damage assigned to her anytime you have a mental or wild resource to use to negate it. [Polaris](/card/32012) can negate one entire hit. 

Tag Teaming [Spider-Tingle](/card/31020) and [Spider-Man Noir](/card/31015) can eliminate treachery cards and power up Noir, who, along with [Protector](/card/26014), [Polaris](/card/32012), and Peter Parker, all can be exhausted to remove sand counters effectively. 

[Pinpoint](/card/29035) can keep funneling your allies and upgrades back into your deck to use again. 

[Everyday Hero](/card/28019) cards are including for the odd bit of healing but mainly to be a wild resource to help power cards with specific resource requirements. 

My worries with this deck is how it will fare against the significant number of minions in this scenario. I will have to play and how well I can shunt them off to focus on bringing down Sandman.

name: Iron Giant
description_md:
Defense Iron Man? Better than you might think.

This deck is not only fun and thematic (Iron man with energy sheilds, etc) but is almost entirely feeds into his repulser blast. So defend. Arc reactor/other = untap. Repulsive blast. Or play one of the many upgrades if you don't have the blast. It's worth noting a number of those upgrades are twch upgrades and will increase your hero hand size by themselves!

Lots of fun when wanting to play Defense or a thematic deck.

May alter slightly to increase either card draw or some science resources to help with tech combos, but happy for now.

name: Drax Justice for All
description_md: Drax has awesome damage out put and great staying power. The only area he lacks in is thwarting. This deck takes his weakness and focus on making him good all the way around. He gets most of his thwarting power from events like [For Justice!](/card/01060) and [Impede](/card/18016). He can also dose this with his base thwart as well with upgrades like [Heroic Intuition](/card/01065) and [Civic Duty](/card/14023). Pare these up with Drax's ability to ready a lot with cards like ["Fight Me, Coward!"](/card/19003) and [Limitless Stamina](/card/31023) and boy can you do a lot. His small hand size it's bad  since most of his cards are cheap and he draws a ton of cards too. This is one of my favorite Decks and is well balanced. I hope you like it.

name: “I Hate Stories Where Everybody Lives” -Drax
description_md:
What sets [Drax](/card/19001a) apart from other heroes is that what he needs to 'gear up' and get powerful is already on his character card. His main ability of gaining ATK and drawing cards just by being hit is incredibly helpful. Some people would put him with Protection to best keep him in the game, which may be a better approach. Others however, would go full steam ahead and try not to die, dealing absurd amounts of damage in the process.

General Idea:
Exploit his ability to draw cards by attacking and by being attacked, and also overcome small hand size through low-cost deck.

    Early Game Objectives:
Get [Drax's Knife](/card/19008) and [DWI Theet Mastery](/card/19010) out as soon as possible. Possibly Mulligan for them. Everything rests on those cards. Also [Combat Training](/card/01057) would be nice, but not as crucial.
3rd-4th Round Objectives:
Get [Mantis](/card/19002) out to start healing up each round. If a [First Aid](/card/01086) pops up, grab it and use it on [Mantis](/card/19002) .

    General Playstyle:
Begin player phase by attacking via base attack (Draw a card thanks to [DWI Theet Mastery](/card/19010) ) and hit for roughly six base ATK ([Drax](/card/19001a)) & 3 Vengeance counters + [Combat Training](/card/01057) + [Combat Knife](/card/04148)), depending on how many vengeance counters you have. (Probably three by 2nd round) To increase the base attack further, use cards like [Skilled Strike](/card/09037), [Mean Swing](/card/06015), [Hand Cannon](/card/16046), and/or [Knife Leap](/card/19005). In later rounds, use [Moment of Triumph](/card/12030) to heal from excess damage dealt. (which means lots of much-needed healing) 
After attacking the enemy, there's a few cards you could use to have the enemy attack you, being ["Fight Me, Coward!"](/card/19003) or [Toe to Toe](/card/10015). Not only do you draw a card due to [Drax](/card/19001a)'s ability, but these cards each open up more response to being attacked: For instance, try [Parry](/card/19006) and [Payback](/card/19007) as a combo to evade the attack, and then deal damage equal to your ATK. If you don't evade, and instead take damage from the attack, try using ["You'll Pay for That!"](/card/10016) or [Counterattack](/card/08030) to thwart or attack for equal to the amount of damage you took.
By drawing cards every time he attacks or is attacked, [Drax](/card/19001a) can overcome his somewhat restricting hand size of 4. 


Problems with this deck (It is a work in progress):
1. Massive deck size of 45 cards, needs to be trimmed down.
2. He definitely needs more healing, maybe more thwart. 
3. Also, I've been thinking about adding some cards that could ready [Drax](/card/19001a) for more basic attacks. 
4. Not many allies. 
5. Hasn't been updated with newer cards in a while. (About a year-ish)
