name: Captain Marvel
description_md:
After some attempts to build a justice deck for hulk, I noticed that one of them will be really better with Captain Marvel. I post it here to have all sorts of opinion, so fell free to comment, even (or especially) if it is to criticize it.

The Idea was to use the powerful triple ressources and the power of alter ego from captain marvel. Also, I wanted to set up a big machine to remove threat one by one for free.

So I put three beat cop, that will stay in place forever and three surveillance team + monica chang so my surveillance team can stay in place forever. Once everything is in place, you get 6x1 remove threat per turn for free wich is really powerfull.

To use the strong draw power of alter ego, you'll have to flip to alter ego each turn you can. This will allow you to use alpha flight for yourself and your commander action for anyone who needs it. Sonic rifle and professor X will be useful to confuse the vilain so he won't scheme (professor X will also chump block for one of your friends if needed).

Global strategy : Using your mutliples ressources, install a maximum of upgrade/support each of your turn. While in hero form, clean some minion so they won't scheme when you flip to AE form. Never defend against the vilain attack so you can use your healing power to draw a card (with quincarrier generating free resource). Use your ally to chump block for your friends when they need it. While in AE form, draw a lot of cards with Alpha station and your commander power, heal yourself with crew quarters and keep installing supports of every type. If the timing is good, when you flip to hero form, thro a small lay down the law using your sense of justice.

Once everything is in place, you can throw some photonic blast with your triple resources, destroy one surveillance team when you have monica chang in hand, and then resurect it immediatly.

Mulligan priorities : Avengers Mansion, quincarrier, helicarrier, beat cops.

This deck works better in multiplayer, specially 3 or 4 players, but works fine with two players also. In solo, maybe it will be too slow to set up. The goal is to be praised by all the table ;o)

You can add some skilled investigator for your friends if you want.

Hope you'll try the deck, let me know how it works for you and if you encounter any problems with it !

name: Ant-Man vs. Hela Solo Champions League Season 12 Round 4
description_md:
This is the deck I used in Season 12, Round 4 of the Solo Champions League.   

Game 1 - Clean win.  14 Rounds.  16 HP left between Ant-Man and allies

Game 2 - Clean win. 18 Rounds.   16 HP left between Ant-Man and allies

Game 3 - Clean win.  20 Rounds.    14 HP left between Ant-Man and allies

The games were all really long.   

I prioritized Wrist Gauntlets to have access to stun and confuse and also tried to get Ant-Man's Helmet out early too to get extra card draw and healing.  Snowguard was great for getting rid of 9 threat total.  The Army of Ants were ideal for deaing with tough (which shows up a lot).  A key strategy was letting Hela get her upgrades on her and then flipping her to get rid of all of them at once whenever I could.  Honestly, the one card I think I never used was Repurpose.  It was there just in case of an emergency and more often than not I used them to pitch to Wrist Gauntlets to confuse Hela at various times.  Maybe First Aids would have been more helpful in the deck than Repurpose since they could help keep Snow-Guard around longer and also get more use out of Odin, but those Energy resources were clutch with Wrist Gauntlets.

name: I AM GRROOOOOTTT
description_md: I made this for the solo champions league vs Standard Ronan. Essentially the idea is to pump up groots base stats and ready him when you can with his upgrade+ CITT to get a few swings in. His base stat + Godslayer + Hand Canon/mean swing + skilled strike + Vine spike + Combat training is an 11-12 damage swat, and then ready up and swing again, maybe twice if you have Lashing vines down, can get you another 3-6 damage. Also have a few events in the event you're exhausted from a defense or thwarting. Also have allies to chip in, thwart a bit and handle hits so I can use growth counters as much as I can. Went 3-0, though a few rounds got scary with the side schemes!

name: Ironheart’s Secondment
description_md:
Riri was asked to learn more about, from, and with The Guardians. As a fly on the wall…you might not even notice she is there.

If there is something she can learn from Flash Thompson, it is about always having options as soon as they jump into the fray (not featured in this deck).

Cancel, stun, and confuse opportunities come and go. With a calm head, control of the board, and sparing use of his health, Venom is using protection to build up to what he does best… use his kit!  

Once resources, weapons, and card draw are in place, it is time to show off his own own suit to Ironheart. Slam on the symbiote suit late to become unstoppable…or get it on early and have a ton of fun keeping track of every trigger, card, and timing!

Would love other’s thoughts, insights, and rhymes or reasons regarding other cards to include.

name: Dual Wield Shield
description_md:
This is a good multiplayer build, but it's an enabling one. Your damage per round ends up being decent, but the main thing that you do is let the other players stay on their heroic identity as long as they want.

Main Mid-Game Combo: Block 3 attacks, deal 6 in thorns-style damage, and take none every turn. If your villain is doing 3 damage attacks (you can block higher though,) that's 9 wounds ignored. That brings you to a total of 15 net wounds. Every. Turn.

End Game is more like net 21+ wounds.

The main goal is to use a basic defense as often as possible. Readying your hero 2-4 times a turn is very achievable. The main ways to do this is Desperate Defense, Indomitable, and Cap's "I Could Do This All Day" trait.

However, you can also intercept attacks with Shield Block (say if a ton of boost cards piled up) or Side Step without defending.

Early Game - 
* Drop your shield turn one (If you get it in hand, mulligan since you get it from Cap's card.)
* Try to get your Super Soldier Serum and main upgrades as early as you can (Electrostatic Armor, Unflappable, and Armored Vest)
* Burn cards if you have to; It's rare not to get ANY good def cards in your pre-villain draw, but at minimum, you can defend twice a turn with Cap's trait.

Mid-Game -
* By Mid-game, your basic engine should be online. You're defending 3-4 times a round and hitting back harder.
* Eventually, you want to get Flow Like Water out, but it's not critical since your job isn't to really do damage.
* This is the point where you get more flexible.

---- Indirect Damage getting you low? Use "What Doesn't Kill Me", "Night Nurse", and "Steve's Apartment" to heal up in a turn.

---- Problems with nasty treachery cards? Save a Never Back Down or drop Black Widow. (The Quincarrier is a nice-to-have, but it's really for Black Widow to guarantee you have the correct resource.

---- Lots of Minions? Burn a Shield Toss (Though be careful as not having your shield as Cap is dangerous.)

---- Thwarting? Fearless Determination with readying yourself using "What Doesn't Kill Me"

name: X-Man Xing
description_md:
Cyclops uses the power of [Mutant Protectors](/card/32017) to have a revolving door of X-Men allies protect and aid him while he uses tactical prowess to battle the villain! 

You'll want to pretty much exclusively play the higher-cost allies using [Mutant Protectors](/card/32017), which can give them to you at a considerable discount while (in many cases) not killing them immediately. [Defensive Training](/card/22034) helps make sure you have a steady supply of this vital event card.

[Colossus](/card/32048), [Polaris](/card/32012), and [Rockslide](/card/33013) can enter play, easily soak a hit, then get ready to help again using [Hangar Bay](/card/36035). [Professor X](/card/32019) may not survive the attack, but he'll confuse the villain on the way down. [Forge](/card/36022) and [Pixie](/card/36017) help you find the cards you need, while providing backup protection, thwarting, or attack. And [Nightcrawler](/card/32011) can help any of his friends survive long enough to use [Hangar Bay](/card/36035), or do his own thing.

Gonna need multiple defenses? No problem, just defend the first attack with Cyclops' basic defense, then use [Utopia](/card/33020) to ready him when you have an ally come out and defend the second attack. If the villain doesn't cooperate with attacking when you want, use [Bait and Switch](/card/15030) to force the matter.

And, of course, Cyclops' tactic upgrades help bolster both his own optic blasts and allies' attacks in order to actually kill the villain. Have fun!

name: Spider-Woman-UK is in the Hangar Bay
description_md:
# LCG Discord Card Spotlight


## Goal is to build a deck that features the current spotlit card: [Hangar Bay](/card/36035)

If you're part of Solo Champions League or listen to Road to Knowhere Podcast for the Season 13 Round 2 of SCL, then you may be familiar with one of the Protection Ghost-Spider decks (By Gondo) featuring [Hangar Bay](/card/36035) + [Spider-UK](/card/27012) as a means to machine gun down the minions in that scenario.  Because [Spider-UK's](/card/27012) ability is an Interrupt, it takes place before the Enemy gets it's attack.  For minions below his damage threshold that guarantees a kill with no damage to [Spider-UK](/card/27012).

### What about the Villain though?  
[Spider-UK](/card/27012) has a decent amount of Hit Points at 5 but a lot Villains will kill him after the attack is done.  Enter [Ready for Action](/card/04017), [Muster Courage](/card/12032), and [Make the Call](/card/01071).  [Ready for Action](/card/04017)/[Muster Courage](/card/12032) means that I can defend the Villain with [Spider-UK](/card/27012) without losing [Spider-UK](/card/27012) to damage.  [Make the Call](/card/01071) I can just replay [Spider-UK](/card/27012) after he eats a Villain attack.

### So now we need to enable [Spider-UK](/card/27012) to maximize damage with a Web-Warriors build.  
Thankfully while [Spider-Woman](/card/04031a)
isn't a Web-Warrior we have many ways enable Web-Warriors:
- She has Spider in her title, allowing us to play [Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029).  
- In Protection, none of the Protection Web-Warriors require us to be a Web-Warrior to play them.
- In Leadership, [Make the Call](/card/01071) ignores the play restrictions of the Basic Web-Warriors
- [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024) helps pay for [Spider-Man](/card/27049)
- [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023) gives us Web-Warrior.

### The perfect Combo scenario - 
You have the Villain in play with 1 Minion.  You have [Spider-UK](/card/27012) and [Hangar Bay](/card/36035) in play.  Play [Ready for Action](/card/04017) to give [Spider-UK](/card/27012) Tough.  Villain Phase you defend the Villain with [Spider-UK](/card/27012) dealing it 6 Damage.  Villain damage is taken up by the Tough on [Spider-UK](/card/27012).  Ready [Spider-UK](/card/27012) with [Hangar Bay](/card/36035).  Minion attacks and you defend with [Spider-UK](/card/27012), dealing it 6 Damage.  Hopefully you kill the minion with the damage as most minions top out at 6 Health.  Even still, [Spider-UK](/card/27012) has 5 Hit Points and should survive at least one minion attack from most minions.  Repeat.

### Is this a [Hangar Bay](/card/36035) deck or a [Spider-UK](/card/27012) deck?  
You don't really need [Hangar Bay](/card/36035) for this deck to be good.    In fact this is probably more a [Spider-UK](/card/27012) deck than a [Hangar Bay](/card/36035) deck.  I would say that this is a deck where [Hangar Bay](/card/36035) shines more than a deck focused on it.
- Even if it is in play with [Spider-UK](/card/27012) and there are no minions, it does get extra use in a Villain phase if the encounter deck triggers an extra attack.  Up to12 Damage in a single Villian phase is sweet.
- If you don't have [Spider-UK](/card/27012), you can still put a Tough status on an Ally to defend, not take damage, AND get an activation out of that ally on the player turn.  Remember, this is still a Web-Warriors deck and we want to activate our allies.
- You can combine the above scenarios too where a non-[Spider-UK](/card/27012) ally has a tough to eat the Villain attack and then defends an encounter attack.

### Mulligans:
- Priority 1 [Spider-UK](/card/27012), he enables Web-Warriors and is your primary combo piece. 
- Priority 2 If you didn't get [Spider-UK](/card/27012), a different way to enable Web-Warriors

### Discussion around Card Choice:

- [Across the Spider-Verse](/card/27018) and [Warrior of the Great Web](/card/30029) were considered to increase the ease of enabling Web-Warriors but I felt they weren't necessary.
- [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024)x2 mentioned earlier with [Spider-Man](/card/27049) but  [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/30023) isn't guaranteed to be free and the Basic Web-Warriors can't be played with [Finesse](/card/04033).  Possible two is too much but with [Make the Call](/card/01071) in the deck, I like it in there.
- [The Power of Protection](/card/01079)x2 could probably be cut down to a 1 of for this deck.  I stuck with 2 because we really want to have the best chance to get down a Protection Web-Warrior down additionally it works with [Contaminant Immunity](/card/04037)/[Muster Courage](/card/12032).  However I could see this cut for a different protection card.

name: Adam Warlock - Hanger Bay Shenanigans
description_md:
This is a deck that is attempting to make use of the new card [Hangar Bay](/card/36035) for the LCG discord deck factory challenge! (Discord: https://discord.gg/kKUmMhP2Rp)

This is going to be a pretty slow deck where the focus is to get out [Groot](/card/16047), [Charlie-27](/card/21059), [Rockslide](/card/33013), and [Victor Mancha](/card/26015) to tank hits from minions. Groot is the best choice here for a minion defense then triggering Hanger Bay for a second defend. 

After that depending on how many minions you have you can defend with the others and utilize their retaliate abilities to start knocking them down. 

Ideally you can collect a ton of minions, use ["Bring It!"](/card/19030) and [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) to draw into the sweet sweet Warlock cards which will deal the damage to take out the villains.

If you ever get too overrun by minions [Thor](/card/25013) is in there to help clear the field so you can start again! 

For villain attacks - Main targets will be [Pip the Troll](/card/21032) and [Throg](/card/25014) or any ally with tough. If those are not available to you - you have a significant amount of allies in the deck so if you lose some of the main defenders you can easily replace them and then go grab them again with Chance Encounter/Quantum Magic.

Hope to try this one out soon! If you get a chance let me know how it goes!

name: Scarlet Witch Turbo Draw MS
description_md:
Another turbo draw deck.

Wanda can get off to the races right away without any build up.  [Molecular Decay](/card/15005) is an amazing attack card and [Hex Bolt](/card/15004) offers all the utility you need (chipping damage, thwarting, drawing and defending via status cards).

The intention for this deck is to flip down often to make use of [Agatha Harkness](/card/15007) and [Meditation](/card/26036).  Agatha allows you to potentially draw a strong card or a double resource into hand while not even wasting the other 2 cards (they'll be redrawn shortly from the bottom the deck, which you'll get to quickly!).  In order to allow you to flip down, there's a lot of confuse in the deck via [Hex Bolt](/card/15004) results, [Professor X](/card/32019), and [Concussive Blow](/card/05031).

The allies chosen all perform some purpose besides just being a chump blocker.  [Eros](/card/22011) has 2 Thwart to assist should your Hex Bolts choose not to cooperate when you want additional thwart, [Ironheart](/card/13018) offer a card draw, [Mockingbird](/card/01083) is to Stun, [Nick Fury](/card/01084) is for card draw, [Professor X](/card/32019) is for Confuse.

For events, [One Way or Another](/card/22015) is amazing for card draw.  Often you can thwart away the side scheme almost immediately using a couple of hex bolts or Nick Fury/Professor X. 
 I prefer not to run [Zone of Silence](/card/21050) because if you use it, you're potentially discarding important cards but I could see why some may want to slot it in.  [Meditation](/card/26036) can be used in Alter Ego to get free/cheap allies, [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091), [Helicarrier](/card/01092) or anything else that doesn't require Hero/Avengers traits.  [Spiritual Meditation](/card/15019) is a great card for extra cycling.  It doesn't actually net you an additional resource but often will get you a more useful card right away.  You don't have to choose to discard one of the cards you just drew from Spiritual Meditation either.  You can discard ANY card in your hand.

[Deft Focus](/card/16024) is a useful resource generator for your [Hex Bolt](/card/15004) and [Warp Reality](/card/15006).  I put in [Chance Encounter](/card/26034) to help a bit with ally recursion.  [Overwatch](/card/30019) is good if you already have a side scheme in play but still want to play [One Way or Another](/card/30017).

Overall, Wanda is a very quick starter and really only wants a couple of upgrades along the way.  [The Sorcerer Supreme](/card/09026), [Agatha Harkness](/card/15007) and [Scarlet Witch's Crest](/card/15009) are the only things she really wants.  If you can use [Meditation](/card/26036) to get out [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091) or a [Helicarrier](/card/01092) you're laughing.

It should be noted that although I love to flip down and leverage [Agatha Harkness](/card/15007) and [Meditation](/card/26036), you don't have to.  She's perfectly comfortable remaining in Hero form the entire game, especially if you already have [The Sorcerer Supreme](/card/09026) out.

name: Interfacing with the Triforce
description_md:
The crux of this deck is using the **Triforce of Power** to overcome obstacles, choosing how to spend a plethora of resources wisely with the **Triforce of Wisdom**, and tanking damage using the **Triforce of Courage**. Once mastery of these principles is demonstrated, the **Master Sword** will reward its wielder with victory! *Take note of SP//dr in other colors:* *Aggression by dr00* *Justice by mikepelf* *Leadership by Schmendrix* ## **Triforce of Power** ## - **[Ven#m](/card/31003)** turns every medical counter into 10 power! Don't be afraid to drop her early at "only" 3/3 or 4/4 stats though. She can help smooth things over until a future turn where she can drop for 5/5 and stay out all game. Three straight turns of instant minion/side scheme defeat or clearing an entire villain stage on her own is empowering. - **[Spider-Man](/card/27049)** is the next best use of a medical counter, turning each one into 8 power! (He swings for 2 and readies Sp//dr Suit to swing for 2 for each hp). The main way to get him into play is with [Across the Spider-Verse](/card/27018), but Sp//dr's **interface** is another great way to afford him. - **[Spider-Man Noir](/card/31015)** rounds out the Triforce of Power, converting a medical counter into 6 power! An oft overlooked ally, until you're healing him up with 3/3 stats every other turn! It isn't uncommon for me to get him to 3/3 in two turns, but you can also start using him at 2/2 where he is still very good. By the time he reaches 3, you can heal him with a medical counter. If I'm already resolving the treacheries anyways, I may as well get some mitigation for them. Just don't play him before [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023) is out and while still flipping often; Peni does not have the **Web-Warrior** trait, so his response will not work in alter-ego without another WW card out. Some tricks to fill him up quickly: - Don't wait for the "perfect" treachery, put literally anything under him. - Play him right before you deck out and/or in conjunction with [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) to increase the odds of pulling treacheries. - Play on expert where treacheries and surge are rampant (if Exhaustion/Under Fire/Master Plan or scenario specific threats are still coming up, I'm definitely playing him since odds are that he can reach 2/2 on the first turn or he'll hit 1/1 and pull a side scheme/minion that [Ven#m](/card/31003) or Sp//dr can clear in a single hit) **[Med Team](/card/01080)** is a key card here in the mid-game. But we only need one copy. Each of the power allies only needs healing every other turn. With all three out, you can spend a counter on each, for a total of 24 power. Most common is to have 2/3 out, alternating healing between the 2 (e.g. Ven#m-Peter-Ven#m is 28 value out of just 4ER from [Med Team](/card/01080)). However, [Med Team](/card/01080) isn't something we want to see early game (before it's even worth playing [Ven#m](/card/31003)) and by the time it's playable in the mid-game the deck is thin enough that we can cycle the single copy quickly. The ideal is spend the three counters->shuffle->get it back in 1-2 turns while the allies still have 1-2 hp remaining. *They do not need to survive longer than the villain*, so we don't need to overdo it on the healing. If you don't want to play around a single copy and aren't a [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) fan, you can easily swap in another.
## **Triforce of Wisdom** ## Pre-release I was a huge Sp//dr doubter....but now she is one of my favorite heroes! What has set her apart is the amount of choice she presents to the player: use **interfaces** as resources or abilities, what to do with [SP//dr Command](/card/31009), exhaust Suit/Peni in hero form or use them for alter-ego abilities/heal, use *Sync Ratio* on events/Ven#m or not, trigger [Aunt May & Uncle Ben](/card/31007) in hero or alter-ego. Everything is a choice and the decision tree (Great Deku Tree?) of her turns is rich. She is the ***chosen one***. The amount of card draw she has is really sneaky for 3 hand size...On top of the 5 interfaces (remember that Peni herself is an **interface**) Sp//dr can have some bonkers 20+ resource turns! For example: - Start in hero with **[Symbiote Suit](/card/27191)** for 4 cards - In the villain phase, perfect defend once for **[Unflappable](/card/09020)** to go to 5 - Chump **[Ghost-Spider](/card/27048)** with [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023) out to get to 7 - **[Avengers Mansion](/card/01091)** for 8 - **[SP//dr Command](/card/31009)** for 9 (ish, converts a resource into a card) - Play **[Spider-Man](/card/31022)** with an **interface** and **[Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024)**, readying the same **interface** for 12 resources total so far (counting TBE, readying an **interface** as the same as getting a resource, and the draw as +3) - Attack with [Spider-Man](/card/31022) for another draw off **[Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023)** for 13 total - Spend the remaining 4 **interfaces** for 17 (one was used on [SP//dr Command](/card/31009)) - Use **[All Systems Go!](/card/31004)** to ready all 5 **interfaces**, getting us to 22 resources on the turn, spend all 5 - Flip and exhaust with *Maintenance* to go up to 24 (having readied with Peter or Host Spider prior to flipping) - Use **[Aunt May & Uncle Ben](/card/31007)** to draw 1-3 more cards to potentially hit 27 resources this turn - If the prior turn had any **[Assess the Situation](/card/12033)** plays, this could be up to a 30 resource turn! If she manages to play every copy of [All Systems Go!](/card/31004), that is a 40 resource turn! Sp//dr Suit is low-key a money hero in the same vein as Captain Marvel, Black Panther, and Nova! ~~Money~~ Rupee heroes love card draw to turn their resources into cards, so we are chock full of card draw and plenty of cards like allies/upgrades/supports that are good resource sinks in alter-ego or hero. **Ok, so why include the Basic Double Resources?** On the surface, it seems the doubles can be foregone, only three cards in her kit are really good with them and they're all upgrades, albeit important ones. - As you've now seen, this deck has absurd card draw, meaning we can always find an outlet for our doubles by just digging a little with [SP//dr Command](/card/31009) or *Maintenance* - The doubles really shine in conjunction with [Across the Spider-Verse](/card/27018), repeating its ability by spending a double and an **interface** to get out 2 WW allies (just remember to exhaust two WW cards, [Spider-Man Noir](/card/31015) makes a great exhaust while he's still building and [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023) is the standard freebie). Theoretically it can keep repeating this ability until out of resources or ally spots (and in the latter case could keep going, overriding allies for [Web of Life and Destiny](/card/27023), though there is not much point in that) - At worst a double can be discarded for [SP//dr Command](/card/31009) to ready [Host Spider](/card/31010), to play an early [Ven#m](/card/31003) at 3/3 stats, or play [Rapid Deployment](/card/31005) as a 2 for 3 or [Web-Trap](/card/31006) as a 2 for 5 Wisdom is her wealth of resources and the knowledge to choose how to wield them best
## **Triforce of Courage** ## Sp//dr is pretty tanky with 14 hp and 2 DEF. On top of this, no other hero can get to 5 DEF with just [Armored Vest](/card/01081) and a single upgrade from their kit. (Spider-Woman can get close on some turns and Venom can do it with both of his pistols, but only SP//dr reaches 5 DEF this easily). Using **[Speed-Metal Alloy](/card/31012) + [Armored Vest](/card/01081)**, SP//dr hits this breakpoint, meaning any 2 ATK villains cannot break through her under normal circumstances. Even just hitting 4 with [Speed-Metal Alloy](/card/31012) alone gets her on par with every 3 DEF w/Vest which is pretty incredible when you think about it. Add in [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) and she starts defending for 6! This SP//dr will be doing an above average amount of defending to avoid chumping to preserve the Triforce of Power, triggering **[Unflappable](/card/09020)** to mitigate her hand size in the process. **[Energy Barrier](/card/05017)** is here to help hit [Unflappable](/card/09020), to face tank hits when not defending, and to ping off toughs since most of the damage here is in giant chunks. With a couple [Energy Barrier](/card/05017)s out, she can even trigger [Unflappable](/card/09020) without exhausting [Speed-Metal Alloy](/card/31012). Aside from all of this, we want to cover one of SP//dr's only weaknesses, the rare slow start. In 90% of games, we will have a turn 1 **interface** play, but in the other 10%, we won't. The fortunate thing is that for these "rough" starts, SP//dr is incredibly durable. She's able to stay up and eat villain attacks for 2-3 straight turns with no worry, even with a minion(s) in play. Getting an [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) or [Unflappable](/card/09020) down really extends that. Then, by the time she has a couple interfaces out, she can unleash an absolutely explosive turn either with [All Systems Go!](/card/31004), [Ven#m](/card/31003), or [Host Spider](/card/31010), taking back control of the board state, flipping down, and recovering all in the same turn. The durability here is aided by her unique ability to perform a basic action in hero form, while still being able to basic REC in alter-ego in the same turn, due to her split identity card. [Web-Trap](/card/31006), [Spider-Man](/card/27011), and [Ejection Protocol](/card/31008) provide her with a status buffer. **[Ejection Protocol](/card/31008)** is perfect to pop when she is low on health, gaining a tough and a free flip (insane value for a 0-cost). It discards, so you can potentially play it again! The tough is useful either to gain tempo or to guarantee [Unflappable](/card/09020). Just make sure to spend all **interfaces** before popping it and potentially don't use it while exhausted, to take advantage of *Maintenance* while in alter-ego. Unfortunately, she won't be able to REC that turn, but 6 hp + tough + 5 DEF w/[Energy Barrier](/card/05017) is more than enough of a cushion. A follow-up [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) after ejecting is often better than a recovery, though [Ejection Protocol](/card/31008) is just Caught off Guard fodder for the rest of the game since the additional hp cushion takes her out of ideal ejection range. **Ok, let's address the symbiote in the room.** Is it a risk? Does general consensus consider it a trap? Let's take a look: - In conjunction with her **interfaces**, turns her into a 5/5/5 hero with 24 hp, 4/5 hand size, and 5 REC (yes, REC is a basic power boosted by suit!) - Access to 3 reliable basic actions each turn with Peter and [Host Spider](/card/31010) means she will be taking advantage of the boosted stats regularly; potentially more when accounting for [SP//dr Command](/card/31009) and [All Systems Go!](/card/31004) being able to ready [Host Spider](/card/31010) - Extra hand size means extra options for her copious resources - Instant heart container! Extra hp helps her face tank the villain better, gaining tempo - SP//dr literally "dgaf" about anything the encounter deck could dish her from the hazard icon. She eats villain attacks with ease, minions and side schemes crumble to a 5 value action from [Ven#m](/card/31003) or SP//dr, her nemesis and obligation are no threat, and the dreaded Advance just gives her a use for [Psychic Link](/card/31011) that turn Do you have the courage to play with **[Symbiote Suit](/card/27191)**??
## **NPCs of Hyrule** ## Getting all 3 of the Triforce of Power out at once isn't very common, so there is typically a rotating third ally, often with [Across the Spider-Verse](/card/27018) "boomerang-ing" them in and out. With the number of allies, resources, readies, and boosted stats, this deck plays much more like a Leadership deck! - **[Silk](/card/27010)** is a play from hand that let's you discard [Under Fire](/card/01193) or [Advance](/card/01186), just be careful playing around [Spider-Man Noir](/card/31015) - **[Spider-Man](/card/27011)** is another play from hand, but dishes out a stun and a confuse if you have a Triforce of Web-Warriors out. I'll often chump or override him before his hp is up, just to get him back in the shuffle - **[Spider-Man](/card/27017)** has great thwart and discards a Triforce of encounter cards for free damage - **[Spider-UK](/card/27012)** can get up to 5 damage from his interrupt, making him a great minion answer. Just be careful if he is the rotating third with [Ven#m](/card/31003), since she is not a Web-Warrior for his ability
## **Wielding the Master Sword** ## I see a lot of players confused about SP//dr, and I was among them when we were just analyzing her cards by sight, pre-release. I hope I've shared enough above to enlighten anyone to her strengths, but this section is going to be a catch-all for SP//dr tips and strategies: - With a max **4 card mulligan**, be ruthless in the pursuit of **interfaces** or [All Systems Go!](/card/31004). Early game, ASG is basically a copy of any **interface**. So with that in mind, we have a **90% chance of starting with an additional turn 1 **interface**,** and a 70% chance that its [Host Spider](/card/31010). Drax and Quicksilver would love those odds! - With *Maintenance* and her Peni **interface** , SP//dr starts the game with 7 resources, meaning she can drop two big cards turn 1. In the 90% of games she opens with a second **interface**, that's an **8 resource starting turn**, something that not many heroes have - [Aunt May & Uncle Ben](/card/31007), [Ghost-Spider](/card/27048), and [SP//dr Command](/card/31009) are early drops that accelerate her setup - [SP//dr Command](/card/31009) is a key card. The sequencing might seem complicated at first between all of the readies and draws, but try to identify which **interface** is least useful for the current board state, like [Web-Fluid Compressor](/card/31013) with no minions out, and convert it into a card. Use dead cards to ready [Host Spider](/card/31010) or ready SP//dr Pilot so she can REC after a flip - SP//dr's **power floor** once [Host Spider](/card/31010) is out is 4 THW, 4 ATK, or 2 THW+2 ATK, in addition to and independent of any card plays. With all her **interfaces**, the floor becomes 6 THW, 6 ATK, or 4 THW+4 ATK before cards are taken into account. This is actually an incredible floor, being able to answer most threats with just basic actions alone - ~~Unfortunately, [Spider-Man](/card/31022) cannot ready [Host Spider](/card/31010)~~ (he can, just doesn’t get the draw for it!), but readying [Psychic Link](/card/31011) or [Web-Fluid Compressor](/card/31013) can lead to some powerful double attacks/thwarts - [All Systems Go!](/card/31004) with 3-5 **interfaces** out basically reads **"take another turn"**. Ideally, spend the last **interface** to play it before readying all of them. At worst, she can have a second round of the "floor" turn above, and at best means she's dropping a full-strength [Ven#m](/card/31003) or [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091) or a fleet of allies. If she pulls off a double or triple [All Systems Go!](/card/31004) things can get crazy and I hope your multiplayer group doesn't mind that you're taking a 15 minute turn. Since this deck thins very well and [Ghost-Spider](/card/27048) can pull a copy, double ASG turns are not uncommon! - With [Across the Spider-Verse](/card/27018) in hand, apply [Aunt May & Uncle Ben](/card/31007) liberally, hopefully dumping some WWs while drawing some cards - Don't be afraid to **keep playing on from a seemingly losing position**, SP//dr is durable and has some really spiky turns - Take advantage of the ability to clear immediate threats with a basic power, ready, flip, REC, and draw 2 - Be sure to spend the 4 **interface** upgrades with no alter-ego utility before flipping down. Conversely, not being able to spend them in alter-ego makes for some awkward turns when hit by alter-ego attachments/obligations such as from Enchantress or Kang - We are not running [Limitless Stamina](/card/31023) because SP//dr has diminishing returns on readies once her **interfaces** are used up. Peter and [Host Spider](/card/31010) provider her all the readies she wants without needing to draw them. 2 ER for 2 is not as good as our Triforce of Power swinging for 3/4/5. [Unshakable](/card/31024) is in a similar boat, where SP//dr doesn't mind status very much, since she can use a ready to clear it and spend her **interfaces** elsewhere instead I was worried about her before release for a number of reasons. Ironheart had just come out, and while she was fun to play, was so kit-focused that building for her was pretty boring. SP//dr looked the same, but with more shortcomings. However, I'm happy to say that she is a worthy Wielder of the Triforce! She has solo'd the likes of Venom Goblin for me and I hope this belated write-up gives her her due! *She is from an alternate timeline after all*

name: Thor God of Thunder 2.0
description_md: Let's start with that, that Thor is my **favourite** hero in the MCU, by far. I'm still fairly new to the game, and still a beginner in deckbuilding, yet I'm seeing some sparks already and am connecting the dots. I was really sad to see that Thor was so mutilated with a hand size of 5/4 (alter-ego/hero), yet I really wanted to make him work. Let's start by his basic abilities: in **alter-ego** he can summon his beloved hammer [Mjolnir](/card/06009)(which you should immediately see as an additional resource) every round, in **hero** form when he engages a minion, he draws 2 cards with a limit once per phase. Let that sink in, once **per phase**... I've immediately observed that if he can engage a minion in hero phase he basically has a hand size of 6 (not including [Asgard](/card/06007)), if you get lucky in the Villain phase you make that 8 - whopping 8 cards at the start of the round, that's sick! So with the staple cards he should have - [Angela](/card/25015), [Looking for Trouble](/card/16043), and his kit's [Defender of the Nine Realms](/card/06003) you make sure you engage that minion almost every turn and have an **ater-ego** form hand size in **hero form**. **Once we have that down, I'll explain the inclusions:** - [Angela](/card/18011) - In my opinion it's a staple, I'd say it could even be in his kit as one of the 1/15 hero cards, I believe they made it an aggression card only to also work with Valyrie hero. - [Throg](/card/25014) - it's basically a 2 cost minions that almost always has the tough status, as we want to be engaged with a minion at the start of every hero phase. - [Spider-Girl](/card/04040) - I would also consider it a staple (the only thing it lacks to be a **perfect** card would be that **ASGARD** trait). Letting you stun & confuse that 6+ health minion feels great. - [Professor X](/card/32019) - The only problem I have with this card is that it's not really thematic with our God of Thunder, however for the time being I find it best in slot. Confusing the villain, letting you swap to [Odinson](/card/06001b), heal, call the hammer into your hand and use that higher hand size feels like a solid plan. - [Hall of Heroes](/card/06017) - I could basically copy above card's explanation, when hero's kit is based on defeating minions and we have a card that let's us draw 3 cards in **alter-ego** every 3 defeated minions - that's a staple, works perfectly with Thor's kit. - [Looking for Trouble](/card/16043) - Those are basically 2 more copies of [Defender of the Nine Realms](/card/06003), as the only thing that Thor struggles with is threat mitigation, we have to fight it as well as we can, additionally it works with Thor's kit perfectly, on top of that it has a symbol - it's perfect for other cards from this deck - [Deft Focus](/card/16024) - I was really sceptical at first when adding this card, however after some testing and few additions to the deck (mainly [Limitless Stamina](/card/31023), [Unshakable](/card/31024)) it proved very useful and reduced significant amount of card costs. It also makes [Hammer Throw](/card/06005)'s cost in fine range, sometimes letting you even play it twice in the same turn. It has 9 targets in this deck, so it's a fine card, however keep an eye on it if it is really that useful in your case. - [Pitchback](/card/28012) - after getting Nova I've seen an opportunity to replace [Mean Swing](/card/06015), even though it costs 1 more, in my opinion it's a more versatile card - it can be used to hit a different target and does not rely on exhausting a weapon (which would result in using MS with [Mjolnir](/card/06009) only once per turn (also blocking that sweet 8 damage from [Hammer Throw](/card/06005)) - [Moment of Triumph](/card/12030) - the only two problems I've occured with [Thor](/card/06001a) were losing due to threat and health (even though he has 14 starting HP), this card helps us mitigate the second one very well, allowing up to 6 health heals with [Hammer Throw](/card/06005). - ["Bring It!"](/card/19030) - basically a card perfect for Thor, you mostly (but not always) will have 1-2 minions engaged with you, letting you at least cycle this card (and make the deck 37 cards, which is great) or even drawing more cards (I've had turns I've drawn even 4 cards, then just cleaned everything up with [Lightning Strike](/card/06006)). - [Limitless Stamina](/card/31023) - a better version of [Battle Fury](/card/06018) - it's a card without the restriction of killing a minion and losing 1 health (did I mention it's a **SUPERPOWER** for the [Deft Focus](/card/16024)?) - [Unshakable](/card/31024) - great for modular sets containing many stun boost card effects (which there are some and I've started to enjoy, so not much to explain) - probably a card to cut when playing vs a not-stunning villain + modular sets combo. - [Godslayer](/card/18018) - In theory, that's a good card target for [Mean Swing](/card/06015), not blocking the use of [Hammer Throw](/card/06005), however I have not tested that combo, for me it it's a consistent resource-less [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019) against villain and some unique minions (nemesis and such). - [Endurance](/card/05023) and [Down Time](/card/05033) - I've included those cards basically because of exactly the same reason - problem with Thor's health - he likes to face-tank stuff, so that basically adds us more time before we flip to Odinson, and when we do, it increases our recovery, both things we want in that strategy. **Cards to consider:** - [Get Over Here!](/card/06014) - great card in multiplayer, makes sure you have another 3 cards to get 2 cards drawn in that hero form (however you have to have [Mjolnir](/card/06009) equipped). - [Gatekeeper](/card/32044) - If you would have any problem with threat, you could consider playing this card, for 0 cost and +2 health to a minion (2 health minions still can be one-shotted with [Mjolnir](/card/06009) and [Combat Training](/card/01057)) it takes care of that 4 threat. However, I would not run that card too often. - [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019) - Up to few games before I've auto-included this card for over 30+ plays. However, now I've opened up for some testing and swapped that with [Godslayer](/card/18018) and some other cards, but bear in mind it's a very solid card for Thor. - [Looking for Trouble](/card/16043) - Might consider putting in a 3rd copy if I have a problem finding those minions and having trouble with threat. - [Skilled Strike](/card/09037) - Stable +2 ATK to a basic activation and a resource for [Jarnbjorn](/card/06019) if you choose to use it, nothing more, nothing less. - [The Bifrost](/card/25023) - I'm considering swapping that card for one copy of [Looking for Trouble](/card/16043) or [Moment of Triumph](/card/12030). It's basically another option of always getting [Angela](/card/18011) on the board (from the deck, not discard unfortunately). It also let's you draw [Throg](/card/25014), [Valkyrie](/card/06012) and [Lady Sif](/card/06002). **What to mulligan for**: _This section is comming soon._ **This is a 2.0 version of my God of thunder deck - https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25122/thor-god-of-thunder-1.0.**

Honorary avenger is used to give Martyr or Daredevil the avenger trait. Since both allies are attempting to stay on the board, they can then be targets for Earth's Mightiest Heroes. Repurpose and Earth Mightiest Heroes are used here to help Hawkeye swing for big turns.

name: Tech and Nature Together
description_md:
A pretty simple [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) + [Repurpose](/card/31016) build. Both [Groot](/card/16001a)'s forced interrupt and Forcefield Generator have the same timing, so you get to choose which one to take damage on to lose counters with. The goal being to get your Forcefield Generator as low as possible without getting to 0, that way you get max value before dumping it with Repurpose.

Then for some more Repurpose fuel, a couple of the otherwise lame [Plasma Pistol](/card/20022) you ideally use two of the charge counters from first for some low damage, maybe to clear tough status cards that can otherwise be annoying before your large hits if your little allies can't deal with them. This way you can get huge stats and multiple readies in one turn. Assuming you have [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) on yourself at this point with a Forcefield Generator and a Plasma Pistol, two Repurposes will get you to 8 THW or 9 ATK, and that's after you already got to first do a basic THW or ATK for 2 or 3, then a basic THW or ATK for 5 or 6. Now you just use [C.I.T.T.](/card/17021) for another ready, and he's got his own built in ready with [Lashing Vines](/card/16009), [Flora and Fauna](/card/16020) is another ready if you draw it, and then dominate the board for either giant damage or giant thwarting based on what you need at the time. Just keep in mind with Repurpose that you have to choose either THW or ATK, so you're going all in on one or the other once you start boosting your stats.

Ideally the Forcefield Generators help you keep your growth counters high so your events can hit for 10ish damage or thwart pretty consistently, your allies pick up slack where you need it, and can chump block when needed for big hits, or thwart enough to let you flip and get more counters. It might depend on player count and scenario, but when you have a 10 thwart event like ["I am Groot"](/card/16003) it can be good to let threat build a bit on the main scheme so flipping down to alter ego every other round is probably fine in most cases. If you can pull off a ["We Are Groot"](/card/16006) when you have a few allies on the board, you'll have chump blockers for days.

I've had pretty good success with this deck, and find it quite fun to play as well. I hope you enjoy it too! No more Groot at the bottom of tier lists!

name: Nadia Van Dyne | G.I.R.L. Power (Get Up and Game!)
description_md:
My favorite way to play Wasp! Just stay in alter ego as much as possible using Professor X for Confuses. Then play all your card draw allies, recycle them with GIRL, and use the allies to control the board while staying in alter ego. 

Of course you can go to hero form if you want to to play Wasp’s awesome attack events. 

Get some Command Team’s on the board, and then when you’re ready to win just start playing Goliath and triggering his ability to attack for 5, ready with Command Team, shuffle him back in and repeat as necessary!

name: Doctor Prestidigitador
description_md:
Equipa a Cosmo y a Wong con Vengador honorario y aeromoto para ciclar siempre el mazo de hechizos de Doctor Strange y jugar la carta que quieras repetidas veces con maestro de las artes mísiticas. La gracia del mazo es hacer este combo para poder jugar 2 veces el evento especial de Strange: Vientos de Watoomb con el evento Maestros de las artes místicas, una vez más agotando a nuestro héroe y poder ciclar Vientos de Watoomb una vez más para jugarlo gracias a que con la Capa de levitación nos preparamos y podemos agotarnos de nuevo para robar 3 cartas más.

Si TODO sale bien, solo con Vientos de Watoomb podemos robar en un solo turno un total de 12 cartas. Podemos sumarle más robo a este combo de manera muy sencilla gracias a Hacer la llamada para jugar a María Hill, Tigre Blanco e incluso a Nick Furia (Aunque este último pueda ser usado para otras opciones, robar suele ser lo más adecuado para encontrar los eventos de Stephen para poder pegar e intervenir sin problema en un mismo turno)

Tigre Blanco está pensada para los enfrentamientos en experto, si vas a jugar un enfrentamiento en normal, recomiendo que juegues con Ojo de Halcón si es para un enfrentamiento con una notable presencia de esbirros o incluso Ironheart para robar de 1 carta en la fase 1 del villano gastando menos recursos que con Tigre Blanco.

name: Ultimate Justice Ready Gwen
description_md: This is the deck I used to play through the entire Sinister Motives campaign with Miles as my friend. I really enjoyed using the response keyword on multiple cards during the hero phase and the villain phase. So, the problem with the deck at first was I kept getting exhausted by Sandman via the [Now or Never](/card/27130), so I wanted to add ways to ready [Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a). This is mainly because if she isn't ready during the hero phase she can't play her main hero cards that all require her to use a basic activation like [Ghost Kick](/card/27002) and [Phantom Flip](/card/27004), and those cards are beneficial and the resource cost is well balanced. That is why I chose to include [Justice Served](/card/22014) and [Tenacity](/card/01093). A good combo to get early for set up is [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024) and [Tenacity](/card/01093), [Nick Fury](/card/01084), or [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091). That with any combination of the double resource cards will be a great set up or even [Web-Bracelet](/card/27009). Also, using her [Ticket to the Multiverse](/card/27008) as many times as possible is something you should be doing from the get go. I love that this deck solves the threat problem, while also playing into [Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a) wanting to defend (and ready) during the villain phase. I included [Warning](/card/09021) for this purpose, although you should probably play any of her hero kit cards when you defend instead because they will be more efficient than warning (plus warning won't always trigger because of her high defense.) This deck also only uses [Nick Fury](/card/01084) because [Ghost-Spider](/card/27001a) just doesn't need help defending at all. I think the most exciting thing about this deck is the ability to ready 2 to 3 times per hero phase with [Justice Served](/card/22014), her ability, and [Tenacity](/card/01093), and drawing two cards while only usually paying for one because of [Sense of Justice](/card/14030) and if you defeated a side scheme you can use [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047) to draw another card! Plus you can flip pretty easily because you are managing the threat really well. (Don't forget to use [Crew Quarters](/card/20029)) Oh, also, don't forget you can pay for [Tenacity](/card/01093) with [Enhanced Physique](/card/06034). I seriously love this deck and hope you get a chance to try it out. If you feel like it needs more cards you can add: 1x [Tenacity](/card/01093) 1x [Turn the Tide](/card/15015) 2x [Lay Down the Law](/card/12031) 1x [Interrogation Room](/card/01063)

name: Cosmic Commander: Burst Damage BOOM!
description_md:
<hr>
We all know that Star-Lord and [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015) go together like Dr Strange and [The Sorcerer Supreme](/card/09026). But what if I told you that new cards [Beast](/card/33011) and [Professor X](/card/32019) also go ridiculously well with Star-Lord? And that [Command Team](/card/23016) goes extraordinarily well with [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015)?

Give everyone +2 with [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015), then ready them with [Command Team](/card/23016) to use that +2 again. And again!

[Goliath](/card/04013) or [Miles Morales](/card/13019) alone with Blaze of Glory+Command Teams is enough to defeat a villain stage when solo, reliably hitting 14-21 damage - and that's before you factor in other allies, Star-Lord, and your events. When you do factor them in? You can play a strong stable game and then, out of nowhere, deal incredible damage with a **_consistent_** combo!

Then, as usual (if the villain even survives), flip to alter-ego so both you and your allies lose the Guardian trait (it's only given by Star-Lord's hero form). Now you avoid the damage at the end of the phase from [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015)!

Even outside of big [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015) turns, there are synergies everywhere. For example? [Professor X](/card/32019) + [Leader of the Guardians](/card/17009) + [Command Team](/card/23016) means 8 threat removed, a confuse, and a block! And you can [Make the Call](/card/01071) to do this repeatedly.

<hr>
**If you like this deck, feel free to give it a ❤ ! Thank you!**
<hr>
<hr>
#### **General Strategy**: 
<hr>
Your mulligan priorities are [Helicarrier](/card/01092) and [Knowhere](/card/17022). I recommend playing a stable game to begin with, controlling the board while slowly building up allies/supports/upgrades until you ideally have at least 2 [Command Team](/card/23016)s in play and at least 1-2 allies as well. 

(While the optimal situation is to have all 3 [Command Team](/card/23016)s in play and a line-up of 4 allies thanks to [Knowhere](/card/17022), this is both unrealistic and unnecessary!)

After playing 2 [Command Team](/card/23016)s and 1-2 allies? Then it's time to pull the trigger - play [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015) and annihilate the villain!

This is the beauty of the combo. Aside from [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015), the key pieces are all allies/supports - meaning you can build up each piece across multiple turns, and those combo pieces can help you even before the combo starts.

Don't be afraid to burn a few [Command Team](/card/23016) charges here and there outside of the combo to keep control of the game! And, with 3x [Make the Call](/card/01071) and multiple key allies, you can happily use any ally you need without fear of not having them available at the right time.

(As good as it is to build up a huge board of allies, don't forget to block with them too! You can't win with 0 hp!)

In 2+ player games, this combo is less likely to end games outright so you may want to split your crazy output on [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015) turns between controlling the board and hitting the big bad. In solo games, you'll often just outright win off a turn like this!

<hr>
#### **Key Allies**: 
<hr>
[Blaze of Glory](/card/17015) works best when you have one of your two key allies, [Goliath](/card/04013) or [Spider-Man](/card/13019). While [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015) works great with any allies, usually - especially against tougher villains - it's worth fishing for a situation where you can have one of these two available alongside [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015).

[Spider-Man](/card/13019) has to be played from hand and, furthermore, can only gain his bonus on the turn you play him - but he's great even outside the Blaze of Glory combo, and makes excellent use of [Command Team](/card/23016) without a Blaze of Glory even active.

[Goliath](/card/04013) however, can be played at an earlier point and kept on the board - or you can [Make the Call](/card/01071) for him when [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015) is in hand. You don't have to worry about drawing into him at the perfect moment, making him your go-to game-ender.

With [Team Training](/card/04016), Goliath can attack 3 times while Spider-Man can attack 3 times and still live to defend you later if the villain is left standing. Or, in the rare case you have all 3 [Command Team](/card/23016)s in play, Spidey can attack 4 times in one turn!

Alternatively, if you can only manage to have out one [Command Team](/card/23016)? You can still get decent damage.

The rough maths for these two that you want to aim for (depending on how many [Command Team](/card/23016)s you have out and [Team Training](/card/04016)), looks like this:

1x Command Team + Blaze of Glory:
- [Goliath](/card/04013) + Blaze of Glory = 14 damage

2x Command Team + Blaze of Glory:
- [Spider-Man](/card/13019) = 18 damage
- [Goliath](/card/04013) + [Team Training](/card/04016) = 21 damage

Factor in 1-2 more allies, Star-Lord, and at least one [Element Gun](/card/17007), and you should be hitting around 30 damage _minimum_ per [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015) combo! (3-4+ damage per other ally, 4 damage from Star-Lord, 3 damage from an Element Gun.)

And even this can get even higher with regular Star-Lord shenanigans like [Sliding Shot](/card/17005) and [Daring Escape](/card/17003). With potential draw coming from [Knowhere](/card/17022), [Star-Lord's Helmet](/card/17010), and [Gamora](/card/19020), [White Tiger](/card/21013) and [Kaluu](/card/21014)? It's easy to put these pieces together for insane damage!

<hr>
#### **Other Allies**:
<hr>
...Speaking of [Gamora](/card/19020), she's also a great ally to ready with [Command Team](/card/23016) and [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015). She can potentially grab [Daring Escape](/card/17003) and/or [Sliding Shot](/card/17005) for absolutely massive damage! (She is also the only ally in the deck that cannot dodge [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015)'s damage when you go alter-ego, so it's recommended you use up her last hp on such turns through consequential damage in situations where the villain survives.)

Power Man can hit 6 ATK with [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015)! The problem is he takes 2 consequential damage while only having 3 hp. This excludes him from being such a key ally as Goliath or Spider-Man, but still makes him an excellent candidate to end the game with. In short, Power Man is the back-up target for [Command Team](/card/23016) - notably when you have [Goliath](/card/04013) and two [Command Team](/card/23016)s in play but no [Team Training](/card/04016).

[Kaluu](/card/21014) is a poor target for [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015), but he is excellent at helping you find it or another high damage event ([Sliding Shot](/card/17005) or [Daring Escape](/card/17003)) to increase the power of your combos! And, while setting up your board, you can simply use the event he gets as a resource to make him a cheap 1-2 THW + a block.

[Beast](/card/33011) is an ideal candidate for Star-Lord's "What could go wrong?" -3 cost ability. Playing him for cheap and getting a double resource back makes it easy to play him and another ally or two all at once in the same turn, getting your board ready for the combo with ease.

<hr>
#### **Further Reading**:
<hr>
You can start a turn with 5 cards in hand, play [Beast](/card/33011) with "What could go wrong?", trigger Knowhere from playing him, then play [Kaluu](/card/21014) (or [Make the Call](/card/01071) for him), and still have 4 cards left in hand with two allies now ready on the board. This kind of combination is a great way to set up big [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015) turns.

You can also do similar with [White Tiger](/card/21013). You can play her with "What could go wrong?", then trigger [Knowhere](/card/17022) on her, then [Make the Call](/card/01071) for Beast and/or Kaluu to end up with multiple new allies and still have cards left over in hand.

(Just keep in mind that [Make the Call](/card/01071) does NOT trigger [Knowhere](/card/17022). "Put into play" does not mean you took the action of "playing" the ally, it means you've bypassed "playing" the ally. So, ideally, you want to play at least one ally from hand every turn when [Knowhere](/card/17022) is in play if possible.)

[Professor X](/card/32019) should, of course, be played whenever possible while building toward the combo. With [Leader of the Guardians](/card/17009) and one use of [Command Team](/card/23016)? That's potentially 8 threat removed alongside a confuse status for the villain and a block against an attack! You might not often need so much threat removal, but its a powerful option and one of the best uses of [Command Team](/card/23016) outside the combo. And the confuse he deals is the perfect way to unleash a mid-game [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015) and dodge its damage in alter-ego.

And lastly, as in any Star-Lord deck, careful use of his hero ability is key. It becomes less punishing in multiplayer (it's easier for 4 people to deal with 5 encounter cards than it is for 1 person to deal with 2), but I would still advise against using "What could go wrong?" every turn. However, in addition to playing particularly valuable allies, consider using it whenever you find a [Command Team](/card/23016) as it's so important to this deck - you can then use that Command Team on the following turn to help deal with whatever the extra encounter card is.
<hr>
**Good luck and have fun!**
<hr>

name: Nova - aggressive skills!
description_md: Journeyman2 inspired me to try and re-visit some heroes during the drought. (check this one out: https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25597/interfacing-with-the-triforce-1.0). Nova is a hero that didn't speak to me much, so I tried building something from the ground up. The basic idea is to POWER UP attack events using [Honed Technique](/card/28017), [Warrior Skill](/card/35016) and [Aggressive Energy](/card/32047). What does that mean? - [Pot Shot](/card/28005) can reach 6 damage, paid by a sole [Aggressive Energy](/card/32047) (no [Honed Technique](/card/28017) for this one sadly... thx @journeyman for pointing it out!) - POWER UP [Dive Bomb](/card/17028) to 13 damage / 7 damage to each other. - POWER UP [Melee](/card/05030) to 8 DMG to two targets. I soloed this deck, which is the reason I included [Drop Kick](/card/10014) (easy to trigger to the fullest to draw and stun). [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024) is used to pay for allies, [Champions Mobile Bunker](/card/28020), ["Go for Champions!"](/card/29025) (or serves as an extra which Nova digs). There are lots of cards, makes it easy to pay for your [Supernova Helmet](/card/28009) right off the bat, or make the most out of [Pot Shot](/card/28005), [Lightspeed Flight](/card/28004) or [Forcefield Projection](/card/28003). Also, draw, draw and draw ([Drop Kick](/card/10014), [Ironheart](/card/13018), [Moon Girl](/card/28018), [Champions Mobile Bunker](/card/28020)). ENJOY!!!

name: Captain America: Justice is Served
description_md:
I know this deck doesn't have [Justice Served](/card/22014), but [Captain America](/card/03001a) has built in ready with "I Can Do This All Day!" which is cheaper than [Justice Served](/card/22014). I wanted to play around with [Chance Encounter](/card/26034).

This deck is designed around clearing threat and getting something for it (but mainly more cards). With its survivability, it's not expecting to flip down often once it gets going.

## Key Cards

### THW Boosting

* [Heroic Intuition](/card/01065) - permanent +1 THW
* [Fearless Determination](/card/03003) - card cycling and +1 THW for the round
* [Making an Entrance](/card/20013) - +2 THW for the thwart

### Card Draw

Every hero loves card draw, but Cap extra loves it for discarding to ready with "I Can Do This All Day!" and [Shield Toss](/card/03006).

* [One Way or Another](/card/22015)
* [Nick Fury](/card/01084)
* [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091)
* [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047)
* [Fearless Determination](/card/03003)
* [Ironheart](/card/13018)

## Play

[One Way or Another](/card/22015) really helps accelerate all of the Supports and Upgrades you want on the table. In solo, with at least one THW Boosting card, you should be able to clear that side scheme on the opening turn.

### Surviving

With a number of allies for chumping, I find I don't need to be spending [Heroic Strike](/card/03004) until the mid game. Also, [Shield Block](/card/03005) can help when drawn for a block. If you need to flip down, [Professor X](/card/32019) is included to provide a confuse as a reprieve. Use [Steve's Apartment](/card/03007) for that heal and extra draw.

### Minion Management

This is probably the weakest part of the decke

* [Shield Toss](/card/03006) is probably your best bet.
* [Turn the Tide](/card/15015) is also able to deal some extra damage while doing the thing you're great at.
* [Snowguard](/card/29023) is expensive but flexible. She can turn into a 3 ATK with overkill.
* In a pinch or combo'd with either of these cards, you can just do a basic 2 ATK.

### Cycling Nick Fury

A cornerstone of this deck is to pull out a side scheme with [One Way or Another](/card/22015) to draw 3 cards and be able to clear it the same turn. If you're able to get [Chance Encounter](/card/26034) (maybe in the 3 cards you just drew!), you can play on the side scheme you just pulled out. Once that side scheme is cleared fetch [Nick Fury](/card/01084) from your deck OR discard. With 2x [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024), [Super-Soldier Serum](/card/03010), [Quincarrier](/card/08023), [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047) you should have a good chance of being able play Nick to draw 3 more cards! Once I've thinned my deck, it's common every few turns to pull this off as long there are side schemes in the encounter deck where I'm draw at least 8 cards:

* [One Way or Another](/card/22015): +3
* [Chance Encounter](/card/26034) -> [Nick Fury](/card/01084): +3
* [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047): +1
* [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091): +1

The nice thing, every card draw can draw you into a combo piece/answer that you're looking for whether it's extra THW needed to clear the side scheme ([Fearless Determination](/card/03003) is great for cycling into other cards and a THW boost), damage from [Turn the Tide](/card/15015), or allies to play!

name: Captain America: Problem Solving Expert Venom Goblin
description_md:
This deck is derived from [Captain America: Justice is Served](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25646/captain-america-justice-is-served-2.0) but tweaked specifically for Expert Venom Goblin. Venom Goblin at the time of this writing is probably in the top 3 most difficult villains IMO. He has a few things to take into account that make him extra challenging:

* Status Effects: At [Stage 2](/card/27114) he's steady and at [Stage 3](/card/27115) stalwart. This makes sense since it shuts down the main scheme glider mechanic, but it does mean status heavy decks aren't very effective here.
* 3 Main Schemes: This has 3x the amount of acceleration happening compared to most scenarios, which means any team will need to be able to do some decent thwarting. [Lower Manhattan](/card/27117b) and [Symbiotic Thrall](/card/27123) boost effects don't help.
* Potentially multiple attacks a turn: The big one people remember is [Advanced Glider](/card/27136). If you're unlucky and have Advanced Glider, [Remote Navigation](/card/27141) can trigger an activation against you. Luckily, if you really hate this card it's part of Goblin Gear which is the optional modular set. Symbiotic Strength is required though and it comes with two copies of [Swinging Assault](/card/27168) which can attack you regardless which side you're on. Of course, there's still [Assault](/card/01187) in the standard encounter set.

## Solving Venom Goblin

### Why Cap?

Cap is a versatile (and super strong) hero and brings a lot of tools to dealing with the 3 problems. I was originally considering [Doctor Strange](/card/09001a), but actually found Cap to better positioned for the things I cared about.

* [Fearless Determination](/card/03003) helps and "I Can Do This All Day!" can really help manage threat.
* [Shield Block](/card/03005) helps with surviving extra attacks.
* [Captain America's Shield](/card/03009) gets Cap to a respectable 3 DEF which can be used in a pinch.
* [Shield Toss](/card/03006) the most common minions are 4x [Symbiotic Thrall](/card/27123) (4 hp) and 3x [Enraged Symbiote](/card/20025) (2 hp).

Sadly, [Heroic Strike](/card/03004) is a bit overcosted at 6 damage with Stun, with Steady and Stalwart.

### Problem Solving with Justice

#### So Much Threat

With threat being so impressive and a scenario with 3 main schemes out, I thought this was the perfect opportunity to showcase a card I don't see often [Problem Solvers](/card/25033). This can remove threat from each scheme! It does require having both *Guardian* and *Avenger* characters. Cap is already an avenger can has the ability to get his THW to 2-5 depending. In Justice, we have access to some decent Guardian allies, but [Eros](/card/22011) is the star for this card. I'll often play him and not chump with him if possible. This means problem solvers when played will hit for minimum 4, but usually I'm able to get it to 5 PER scheme. This means without any side schemes you're removing 15 most of the time which really helps manage. It is expensive at 4 cost, so I only run copy of this card. If you're lucky you'll have [One Way or Another](/card/22015). In Venom Goblin's default setup, there are two static 5 threat side schemes: [Festering Mass](/card/27124) and [Limitless Supply](/card/27140).

#### Survivability

Beyond shield block, you'll still need access to a decent selection of allies. With [Chance Encounter](/card/26034) we're able to recur some of our crucial allies back without waiting for our deck to cycle. I'm looking at you [Nick Fury](/card/01084)!

Cap isn't the best at innate healing, but [Making an Entrance](/card/20013) can help get you some extra needed healing.

#### Ramp

Being able to get setup quickly is also key. Justice feels like one of the fastest aspects because of access to [One Way or Another](/card/22015). This coupled with [Chance Encounter](/card/26034) -> [Nick Fury](/card/01084) means it's possible to draw an extra +6 cards a turn.

### Card Changes

* -1 [Professor X](/card/32019) - With status effects significantly less effective, this was an easy cut.
* -1 [Turn the Tide](/card/15015) - Great card, but seemed less essential to getting the deck going compared to other cards at 3 of.
* -1 [Lockjaw](/card/05018) - I love this card with [The Power in All of Us](/card/13024) and is a super easy decision making card, but again needed some space for some *Guardian* allies.
* -1 [Snowguard](/card/29023) - Versatile, but expensive.
* +1 [Problem Solvers](/card/25033)
* +1 [Eros](/card/22011)
* +1 [Quasar](/card/21047)
* +1 [Cosmo](/card/17020)

You can see it in action on the [OSCS Streamed Channel](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NJfMKfVR_Xc)!

name: Scarlet Witch Spying with S.H.I.E.L.D.
description_md:
Scarlet Witch has 2 pillar cards to her signature set that care about the encounter deck:

* [Hex Bolt](/card/15004)
* [Molecular Decay](/card/15005)

The ***S.H.I.E.L.D.*** archtype, brings something special which one of the few ways to scry any deck we want (but probably the encounter deck) with [Global Logistics](/card/27043). The ***S.H.I.E.L.D.*** Justice package comes with a ton of cards coupled with Scarlet Witch being a ***Mystic*** means we're going to have to make some hard cuts compared to the typical ***S.H.I.E.L.D.*** deck.

### Recurring Nick out of the Sky-Destoyer

I've also been wanting to find a good way to recur [Nick Fury](/card/01084) while also being able to trigger [Sky-Destroyer](/card/27055). Draw 3 cards and deal 2 damage? Yes please. [Chance Encounter](/card/26034) allows us to fetch Nick out of either our deck or discard, but we need a pesky side scheme to put it on. [One Way or Another](/card/22015) is our way to do that and can help us draw into [Chance Encounter](/card/26034). Scarlet Witch also has access to [Chaos Magic](/card/15003) and can will Nick into existence. With all the extra card draw/cycling from Justice and ***Mystic*** there's a decent chance to help pull off this combo: [One Way or Another](/card/22015) or [Spiritual Meditation](/card/15019).

### Directing from the Command Center

Thematically, I picture someone directing the ***S.H.I.E.L.D.*** forces to go forth and do things. Luckily, ***S.H.I.E.L.D.*** also lends itself to a lot of thwarting from allies, which means [Command Center](/card/35032) can help us eek out more damage each turn on those side schemes we're pulling out with [One Way or Another](/card/22015). [Surveillance Team](/card/01064), [Hex Bolt](/card/15004), Scarlet Witch's Basic Thwart can help get threat down, so our allies can get the finishing...thwart!

With allies being the focus of threat removal, I've dropped [Homeland Intervention](/card/27042).

name: She-Hulk: "Come At Me Bro!"
description_md:
With the release of the Mutant Genesis wave, there's two cards that I think will be almost auto-includes in any aggression deck:

* [Professor X](/card/32019)
* [Psylocke](/card/35013)

These two allies give us access to confuse, which leans into making She-Hulk a much more fun hero to play since we can now flip more reliably. If you're able to get 3 confuses per deck cycle.

## Health is a Resource

She-Hulk has one of the highest native hit point pools, so let's take advantage of that and treat it as a resource.

* [Focused Rage](/card/01027) allows us to trade health for card draw, which gets around of her biggest weaknesses: a 4 card hero hand size.
* ["You'll Pay for That!"](/card/10016) this is a great card for her. Thwarting is another one of her weaknesses and being able to trade damage into (max 5) threat removal on ANY scheme.
* [Counterattack](/card/08030) we can also trade health for straight up damage. With it being an upgrade means it doesn't clog up our hand like ["You'll Pay for That!"](/card/10016).

She'll need a way to recover all that damage we're taking.

* 5 REC: She already has a super high REC.  If you feel like you need even more healing, you can also use [Down Time](/card/05033) for that +2 REC.
* [Crew Quarters](/card/20029) this nets +2 HP across two turns for most flip downs (minus the obligation, but we at least get 1!)
* [Endurance](/card/05023) why settle for 15 max HP, when we can have 18! This also makes safer to hit higher damage numbers for [Gamma Slam](/card/01021).
* [Limitless Stamina](/card/31023) in order to take advantage of the basic recover, we need a way to ready.
* [One-Two Punch](/card/01024) while not as versatile as [Limitless Stamina](/card/31023), it can still be used to ***attack***, ready, flip down, and recover.

## Ramp

With such a small hero hand size, she wants to be flipping down every other turn to average a 5 card hand size. I've also included 3 copies of [Meditation](/card/26036). This should help with getting some of her expensive cards out like [Focused Rage](/card/01027), [Helicarrier](/card/01092), [Psylocke](/card/35013),  [Professor X](/card/32019), or [Hellcat](/card/01020) (which we can pull back into our hand to replay).

name: Tiny Wasp | Small AND Mighty (Get Up and Game!)
description_md:
This deck focuses on Wasp in Tiny form where her attack events are more potent. Of course this is still Wasp so you want to be getting to alter ego as often as possible to recycle Professor X, Nick Fury and Moon Girl in the early game. Once you feel like you’re well set up with a couple resource generators on the board start recycling Wasp Stings and Pinpoint Strikes instead so you can swiftly bring the game to its conclusion. 

Use One Way or Another to help get set up, as well as provide targets for Small But Mighty. Manage the board as needed but this deck is designed to bring the pain so prioritize quick efficient damage where ever possible!

name: SCL 1304 Spider-Miles (L) vs Expert Sandman + Sinister Assau
description_md:
My official deck for Solo Champions League Season 13, Round 4. In the end, it was not a great deck. [Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029) clashed with the tough status and I never used [Lead from the Front](/card/01070). However, [Last Stand](/card/15029) proved to be great.

* Round 4 - Sandman + Sinister Assault + City in Chaos (01/08/23-01/21/23)
* Difficulty: Expert
* Hero: Spider-Man [Miles Morales]
* Aspect: Aggression, Justice, Leadership, Protection, or All Basic

* **Game 1:** 6 turns, clean. Never quite had the timing work out great, but I managed to have a spectacular 17 damage final turn thanks in part to hitting [Maria Hill](/card/01067) with a double [Last Stand](/card/15029). [Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029) can be a bit annoying on Spider-Miles because you often are sitting on a tough.
* **Game 2:** 5 turns, clean. I ended up staying in Alter-Ego at the end of turn 1 due to a lack of status tokens on Sandman, but I had 3 allies out and was able to ride that to a fairly easy victory. Again, had another 17 damage final turn, with double [Web-Shot](/card/27034) providing most of the damage this time
* **Game 3:** 7 turns, clean. Got tied up by Rhino and then Hobgoblin on turns 5 and 6 when I wanted to be pushing to end the game.

name: Hobie Slammin His Ax

You can search for him using [Across the Spider-Verse](/card/27018) then get down your [Command Team](/card/23016) and [Make the Call](/card/01071) or [Regroup](/card/19032) cards and start having fun bouncing him in and out triggering his crazy ability. 

Then there is [Spider-Man](/card/27049) with his [Reinforced Suit](/card/12018) + [Command Team](/card/23016) to combo with your hero.

This deck gets stronger in solo, with the ability to get stun and confuse onto the villain and take advantage of [Arachnobatics](/card/27031) and the low villain health pool.

I just started making my own decks and having a blast (had been using decks posted here before this). So maybe try the deck out and let me know what could be improved. 

Thanks!
