name: Ms. Marvel Passive 'Aggression' Stun-Lock with 14 DMG
description_md: *"Fabulous. Now I'm in trouble, too. This has to have happened for a reason. I saved one life. Does it stop there or do I go on? Maybe this is what I've been waiting for. Maybe I'm finally part of something... bigger." - Kamala Khan: Ms. Marvel Vol 3 #2* The name of the deck says it all. [Ms. Marvel](/card/05001a) does not do a lot by herself in sense of *Basic* powers for *Thwarting*, *Attacking*, or *Defense*. She will just sit there, and slap the *villain* with an *Event* card. Then she will take the *Event* card back and slap the *villain* again, just to make sure that the *villain* has got the message clear. Also, she will gladly discard her stuff in search of a way to make the villain more miserable (*Teen Spirit*). Teens... what can we do about it... Like most *Aggression* decks, this deck is also focused on punching the life out of the *villain*. When it comes to *Thwart*ing though, on top of the 3 events and 1 upgrade you have to help you, you also have *allies* to do some of the *thwart*ing for you, although, those *allies* are there to mainly deal damage, and [Boot Camp](/card/13016) will help with this. **The Allies** [Brawn](/card/10011) will help you thwart every time he attacks. [Ironheart](/card/13018) will give you an extra card. [Red Dagger](/card/05002)'s ability can be proven useful in certain situations and she has good stats. [Spider-Man](/card/13019)'s ability is great as you can use him in any situation to turn the tides. [The Locust](/card/28010) will essentially add another card to your hand. And on top of their abilities, each *Ally* will deal damage, thwart, and block for you. **Events** ["Go for Champions!"](/card/29025) is great in this deck as you can use it during the *Villain* phase (*Hero Action*) when you need it. The card is just broken... If I draw it, I simply keep it in my hand until I need it unless I desperately need the resource to pay for [Drop Kick](/card/10014). ***-Best Combo in the deck-*** [Clobber](/card/18012) compliments *Ms. Marvel*'s *Morphogenetics* ability, and works in great synergy with [Drop Kick](/card/10014). Use [Clobber](/card/18012) in combination with [Embiggen!](/card/05010) (5 dmg), return *Clobber* to your hand. Use [Drop Kick](/card/10014) (4 dmg plus stun, plus card draw), return *Drop kick* to your hand using *Ms. Marvel*'s *Morphogenetics* ability. For *Clobber* you have to spend 2 resources of any kind. For *Drop kick* you are using combination of [Helicarrier](/card/01092), [Biokinetic Polymer Suit](/card/05009) and [Martial Prowess](/card/10018). Add one [Honed Technique](/card/28017) for each attack. You can repeat this combo every turn and permanently **stun-lock** the *villain*, deal 14 damage and draw an extra card every turn. If you play against a *villain* with **STALWART**, this is still 14 damage every hero phase, plus an extra card. **Supports and Upgrades** Having 3 *Hero Specific* support cards which require *Alter-Ego* action means that you will always benefit when you flip to *Alter-Ego*. I have added, [Hall of Heroes](/card/06017) to this count which will occasionally allow you to play with a bigger hand, and [Crew Quarters](/card/20029) so you can take the maximum benefit possible from your time in *Alter-Ego*. Throw into this mix [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091), [Champions Mobile Bunker](/card/28020) and [Deft Focus](/card/16024), and the deck becomes unstoppable with a lot of draw-power and allows you to play multiple events every phase.

name: Ghost-Spider - Aprendiz de justiciera
description_md:
Es un mazo aún en pruebas, pero las dos partidas que he realizado con ella han ido bastante bien.

La idea es ir dependiendo de los Aliados **Guerreros araña** sin dudar e ir robando cartas gracias a **La red de la vida y el destino**.
Y tampoco dudar en defender con Gwen para que los aliados sigan interviniendo o atacando, siempre y cuando tengas a **Peter Parker** para poder prepararla luego o el evento **Piruetas y puñetazos**.

Sabemos todes que Ghost-Spider es perfecta para Protección y en este caso, que es Justicia, en los turnos de defensa no se aprovecha con tanta efectividad, pero me ha parecido un buen mazo para darle un toque fresco a un@ de mis personajes favorit@s.

Alternativa si no te gusta alguna de las cartas:
- Quitar las cartas que no te acaben de convencer y añadir **Deber cívico** y **Más vale maña que fuerza**.

name: Hide the Pain - Protection
description_md:
Wouldn't it be nice if the minions could just [cool down](/card/36005) a bit? How about they just have a [nice hug](/card/33034) instead?

I have been working on a few X-Men decks for 2-player that can use strategies you wouldn't be able to in single player. This deck focuses on setting minions attack powers to zero, so that the other Storm deck can gain huge draws from ["Bring It!"](/card/19030). You can find the Storm aggression deck [here](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25699/hide-the-pain-aggression-1.0). 

The idea is to leave minions in play and use a combination of [Pinned Down](/card/33034), [Practiced Defense](/card/33006) and [Blizzard](/card/36005) from the Storm deck to keep their attacks at 0. Cyclops is ideal for using [Pinned Down](/card/33034) as his alter-ego ability and [Tactical Brillance](/card/33010) can search for it when required.

You want to leave minions with 1-3 attack in play and use the appropriate upgrades to reduce their attack. Minions with only 1 attack can be dealt with by [Blizzard](/card/36005) alone, allowing you to keep several on the field at once. Watch out for any with nasty effects and the patrol or guard keywords though. If there are any you need to remove, you can always attach a [Priority Target](/card/33007) too.

The other part of this strategy uses [Mutant Protectors](/card/32017) to provide defence and keep threat down while you set up. You can either use [Mutant Protectors](/card/32017) on the villain attack with an ally that can survive, such as [Colossus](/card/32001a), or use it on a 0-attack minion if you want to put the ally into play for cheap. Of course when doing this [Hangar Bay](/card/36035) becomes useful. 

This deck also fills a support role. It is able to flip into alter-ego often to trigger the X-Men support cards and the Constant Training ability. As the Storm deck does not want to flip into alter-ego, you can also provide some healing with [Med Team](/card/01080). 

One thing to note is that this deck will end up going first every player round once you have [Field Commander](/card/33004) out. In that case you can ask the Storm player to play an action on your turn, so they can use [Looking for Trouble](/card/16043). This will allow you to attach [Pinned Down](/card/33034) or [Practiced Defense](/card/33006) straight away. 

I have tested these and they work well on scenarios that have at least some suitable minions. It has bad matchups against any with very few minions or ones with many patrol and guard keywords. This does unfortunately mean they are not good against the Master Mold and Magneto scenarios from Mutant Genesis, but most other ones should be fine!

Hope you find this fun!

name: Hide the Pain - Aggression
description_md:
Wouldn't it be nice if the minions could just [cool down](/card/36005) a bit? How about they just have a [nice hug](/card/33034) instead?

I have been working on a few X-Men decks for 2-player that can use strategies you wouldn't be able to in single player. This first pair brings out minions then sets their attack down to zero, allowing this Storm build to draw via ["Bring It!"](/card/19030). Find the other Cyclops deck [here](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25698/hide-the-pain-protection-1.0).

You want to get minions into play using [Angela](/card/18011) and [Looking for Trouble](/card/16043), then leave them there. The Cyclops deck can set their attacks to 0 permanently, with a bit of help from [Blizzard](/card/36005). Once you have a few minions in play ["Bring It!"](/card/19030) becomes great value. 

The weather can be switched as needed, but you want to end your turn with [Blizzard](/card/36005) most of the time. If you have a copy of [Weather Goddess](/card/36009) you can switch to [Thunderstorm](/card/36004) at the start of your turn and then back to [Blizzard](/card/36005) before the villain phase. Be careful leaving [Hurricane](/card/36003) in play for long as that will eventually kill the minions.

The other part of this strategy is to use aggression allies with [Attack Training](/card/32043), it's just an efficient way of dealing damage. [Boot Camp](/card/13016) can counter-act the -1 attack from [Blizzard](/card/36005) if you have to leave it in play. 

This deck should avoid flipping to alter-ego, as the minions will still be able to plan! You may be able to confuse enough of them with [Banshee](/card/34014) from the Cyclops deck to allow this occasionally though. Between the two decks there should be enough allies to avoid taking too much damage on Storm. 

Lastly, a few points about specific cards. [Get Over Here!](/card/06014) is included to grab suitable minions that end up engaged with Cyclops, so you want to make sure to play [Storm's Cape](/card/36007). As ["Bring It!"](/card/19030) is once per turn, I like to save a copy for the next turn if I draw a second one. Also, [Flash Freeze](/card/36012) is useful as it can fill in for times when minions do not have the upgrades on them yet. Later on in the game with a lot of minions in play you have so many draws that you can end with a [Flash Freeze](/card/36012) in hand most turns.

I have tested these and they work well on scenarios that have at least some suitable minions. It has bad matchups against any with very few minions or ones with many patrol and guard keywords. This does unfortunately mean they are not good against the Master Mold and Magneto scenarios from Mutant Genesis, but most other ones should be fine! 

I played these against Drang and ended up with 7 minions out that were not doing anything. Having 11 cards each turn was fun.

name: Fan the Flames
description_md: After trying a few different builds and aspects for Phoenix in solo play, I realised she was a great fit for Aggression. Many aggression decks struggle in single player due to threat build up or with extra side schemes at the start of the game, which are very typical in expert mode. Starting with 3 thwart helps to cover this weakness, allowing you to set up without losing control. I tend to not rush into Unleashed and get a few supports out first. The other advantage of Phoenix in Aggression is that she has access to so much stun and confuse. With confuse in particular this gives plenty of opportunity to switch to alter-ego and make the most of all the X-Men support cards. Some of the new supports from the Rogue and Gambit packs could be useful too once they are released. As Phoenix has the psionic trait [Cerebro](/card/34022) with the chosen allies gives you a nice little toolbox to pick the ally you need. [Sunfire](/card/35014) is a really efficient way to deal with nasty villain upgrades, [Cyclops](/card/34003) can manage your power counters, [Magik](/card/32042) can deal with minions, and if you need to confuse you have [Psylocke](/card/35013). Defence mostly comes from allies, but Phoenix has a couple of nice tools with [Telekinetic Shield](/card/34007) and [Rise from the Ashes](/card/34006). [Mind Control](/card/34009) is actually great if you find a decent minion to use it on, although I don't find [Mental Paralysis](/card/34008) very useful here. There are not that many for [Drop Kick](/card/10014), but there are wild resources from [The X-Jet](/card/32020), [Martial Prowess](/card/10018) and the Psionic Bond ability. I tested this against a few scenarios and it works well. It is quite a nice balance of attack and thwart, so should be able to deal with most villains. I managed to beat expert Magneto, even though there is the Steady keyword you have enough stuns and confuses to get through it. I did build this for solo play in mind, but it would be good in 2-player as well.

name: Core Set Gamora Protection - I'll punch you back!
description_md:
As Gamora is my first expansion pack, I wanted to create a deck that makes her assume a more active role during the villain phase, using only core box and her expansion. The idea is to make the most out of her passive being available once per phase (not round). So, she can defend against most attacks and then trigger attack and thwart events as a follow-up to make full use of her passive. 

It should be a fun deck for those that have just started out and are lacking the packs to build decks out of many hero / campaign packs. I will definitely test it in the next few days, but I would be happy to hear about your thoughts or any flaws of mine, as this is the first deck that I chose to share.

name: Spider-Man Aggression Solo Champions League S13 R 4 - Sandma
description_md:
So this is the deck I ultimately ended up playing in Season 13 Round 4 of the Solo Champions League vs. Sandman with Sinister Assault.  

I had been messing around with Leadership all week and just felt like it was taking forever (probably a combination of poor piloting and sub-optimal deck builds on my end) in order try to get clean wins.  So when Innsmouth Bear reminded us it was the last day to get games in for this round, I scrapped the Leadership build, threw together this Aggression build hoping it might be faster and just played my 3 games without even trying the deck first.   I managed to get clean wins in all 3 games although all the games (especially game 1) were still a bit slower than I would have hoped due to some big minions popping out along the way that I wanted to clear to try to get clean wins.  I never felt in danger of losing in any of the games and I'm sure my deck was still nowhere near optimal, but I figured I'd share it anyway.

Nothing real fancy hear. Losts of allies.  Clobber is great when you can time it right and Drop Kick helped me get extra stuns.   I put in Spider-Girl for theme and because there are some big minions that popped out with Sinsiter Assault.  Hulk was basically a blocker and sand counter remover.   Psylocke was great for getting more access to confuse.  Mockingbird added the extra stun.   I think one of the reasons my games might have been slower than what others seemed to be posting is that I still tried to control the sand counters a bit, mainly to avoid going through the encounter deck and having to take unnecesary damage from the acceleration going on the main.  But, I tend to play pretty conservatively, especially in solo, because I've been burned by Advances too many times. :) 

Game 1 - Clean win in 10 Rounds.  13 Health left between Miles and allies

Game 2 - Clean win in 7 Rounds.  15 health left between Miles and allies

Game 3 - Clean win in 7 rounds.  11 health left between Miles and allies.

name: War Machine Meditation and S.H.I.E.L.D. Deck
description_md:
This deck is solid with early threat management and does significant late game damage. 

The main goal of this deck is to use [Meditation](/card/26036) in alter-ego to get high cost upgrades and supports on the board.  You want to be switching to alter-ego to add ammo counters onto [Munitions Bunker](/card/23003) and doubling this up with [Agent 13](/card/03002) in play. Combining the justice shield build allows [Homeland Intervention](/card/27042) to remove threat in alter-ego.  With constant flipping to hero mode, [Lay Down the Law](/card/12031) has a lot of value. 

You can easily manage early game threat while building up and having major damage turns in the late game. 

Hope you give this a try. War Machine was a hero that I didn’t play much because of the high cost curve. This deck is very satisfying when you get it going.

name: Giant Wasp | Spreading the Love (Get Up and Game!)
description_md:
This deck leverages Giant Wasp’s ability to spread around her basic attack and Wasp Sting damage. Use those to set enemies up to be defeated by Precision Strike for healing, One By One for extra damage, and Relentless Assault for more overkill. Aggressive Energy also help increase the impact!

If you can get her Helmet out then you’ll be thwarting for 3 which can also be spread around, helping to manage the board while your impressive damage output keeps the game moving towards its conclusion. 

This is still Wasp though so try to get to alter ego when you can using Professor X and Psylocke for Confuse. 

PYM Particles in Giant form will heal for 2, helping you stay alive but hopefully you can make good use of your recyclable allies for defense. 

Recycle your useful allies in the early game with GIRL, and then late game put the big damage cards back in the deck for the final push!

name: S01E03 - Ms. Marvel
description_md:
**Powolne ogrywanie S01E03 - Ms. Marvel - #preconnasterydach#2 (karty do Ms. Marvel)**

Cześć, jestem casualowym graczem, który lubi sobie dość wolno ogrywać wszystko testując (nawet troszkę na siłę) mając "w poważaniu" tempo wydawania dodatków przez FFG ;) Standardowo testuje na solo na 5 scenariuszach z kampanii grając jednak jako standalone na expercie z losowymi modular setami.

Juhu, otwieramy nowy pakiecik. Tym razem przyszła kolej na [Ms. Marvel](/card/05001a) która przyszła do nas... z protekcją. Niestety twórcy sobie trochę z nas zakpili i jest to jeden z nielicznych preconnów, gdzie karty aspektowe pasują do bohaterki jak pięść do nosa. Kamalka to przede wszystkim jej zdolność Hero pozwalająca na cofanie kart wydarzeń na rękę, oraz 2 karciochy [Embiggen!](/card/05010) oraz [Shrink](/card/05011) - mówiąc krótki chcemy mieć sporą liczbę Atk i Thw eventów. Nie muszę chyba wspominać że w Atk eventach specjalizuje się Agresja, a w Thw eventach justice prawda? Tymczasem dostajemy protekcje specjalizującą się w Defense eventach... których na tę chwilę do wyboru mamy 2. Słownie: dwa.

W praktyce nie jest aaaaż tak źle, bo bazowo mamy 3 wydarzenia od ataku 3 od zbijania zgrożenia, a dodatkowo możemy jeszcze je cofać na rękę ze zdolność, szukać ich z zdolności Alter Ego, kitrać [Bruno Carrelli](/card/05007), grać, dorzucać do decku z [Aamir Khan](/card/05006). Trochę opcji jest. Z drugiej strony, większość z tego wymaga zmiany na Alter Ego, a tam protekcja nie czuje się najlepiej... z Kamalką jest to o tyle dziwne, że jak mamy [Sneak By](/card/05004) z [Shrink](/card/05011) na stole to nas to totalnie nie boli, ale jak tego nie mamy to leżymy. 

- Jedyną właściwie kartą z synergią z prawdziwą synergią z Marvelką jest [Tackle](/card/05015). Piąstke mamy zawsze z [Biokinetic Polymer Suit](/card/05009), z [Embiggen!](/card/05010) to już razem 5 obrażeń, więc wychodzi nam z tego trochę mniejszy [Heroic Strike](/card/03004).

- 2gi "pakietem" jaki dostaliśmy w talii to karty pod [Nova](/card/05012). Nova sam w sobie jest kosmicznie dobry, tylko w graniu pod True solo jest jeden problem - negatywna synergia z wspomnianym wcześniej [Tackle](/card/05015). Jak chcemy trzymać złola na stunie to nie wykorzystamy w pełni potencjału Novy. Więc się robi już tu taka mało optymalna hybryda wszystkiego. Dodatkowo mamy w decku amunicje pod Novę w postaci [Enhanced Reflexes](/card/05024), w dodatku twórcy zadbali (albo to czysty przypadek) by w kartach aspektowych też piorunków nie brakowało. Nie licząc samego Novy aż 13 na 24 kart to właśnie karty z błyskawicą jako zasób. Thor płacze jak to widzi.

- Całość jest uzupełniona po prostu standardowymi kartami protekcji i basicami.
 - Znane z CSa [Get Behind Me!](/card/01078) dalej nie lubi na solo. Za mało jest kart treachery które są aż tak groźne, by grać to w decku.

 - [Preemptive Strike](/card/05014) jest świetny jak trafimy 3 boost ikonki, ok jak mamy usunąć 2 ikonki, słaby jak mamy 1 ikonkę, jak mamy 0 to wiadomo. W większości przypadków raczej tyłka nie urywa. Pasuje ok do Novy, ale znowu ma negatywną synergię z stunami. Raczej częściej nam zaśmieca rękę.

 - [Energy Barrier](/card/05017) - znowu karta która pasuje bardziej do pakietu Novy. Ograniczamy obrażenia jednocześnie zadajemy obrażenia. Znowu mniej pasuje do stunów, bo wtedy staramy się nie dostawać obrażeń, więc nie ma co negować.

- [Lockjaw](/card/05018) to cichy MVP tego pakietu. Co prawda później wraz z powiększaniem się naszej kolekcji staje się coraz mniej potrzebny, jako że aspekty stają się też mocno uniwersalne, ale na chwile obecną jest świetny. Niech was nie zmyli jego koszt, tak naprawdę kosztuje 3, jako że zagrywamy go z discardu, więc musimy łącznie wydać 4 zasoby, tak jak w przypadku sojusznika za 3 (3 zasoby + zagrany sojusznik sam w sobie jest zasobem). Z jego mechaniką, jak się umiejętnie kontroluje to właściwie cały czas ma się dostęp do niego. Poprawia ciężką sytuacje jeśli chodzi o THW w przypadku protekcji i agresji. I potrafi go ściągnąć naprawdę sporo. W 1wszej turze po zagraniu go zbijamy 2 zagrożenia, w następnej turze znowu zbijamy 2 zagrożenia, w tym momencie piesio ginie, spada od razu na discard, a my możemy go ponownie przywołać i zbić kolejne 2 zagrożenia. Fajnie? No fajnie. Oczywiście trochę to kosztuje, ale biorąc pod uwagę że to słaby punkt na solo w przypadku wcześniej wspomnianych aspektów - naprawdę nie ma co narzekać.

- [Endurance](/card/05023) jest bardzo fajne, ale nie konieczne w 3 sztukach. Pamiętajmy jak działają tego typu karty w Marvelu, zagrywając ją nie tylko nam się zwiększa max hp, ale też dostajemy od razu 3 hp ALE tracąc Endurance również tracimy zarówno max hp jak i aktualne 3 hp. Z Kamalką o tyle się fajnie combi, że ma potwornie dużą wartość recovery. Większe hp pomaga lepiej zarządzać życiem. Przy 10 hp mamy sytuacje gdzie mamy 6-7 hp i tak się trochę o żyćkko obawiamy, więc mamy do wyboru albo zaryzykować albo użyć nieoptymalnie naszego 5 Rec. Z 13 hp nie ma problemu.

- Przy [Enhanced Reflexes](/card/05024) znowu się kłania ekonomia Marvelowska - płacimy 2 zasobę + kartę, która też jest zasobem za 3 zasoby do wykorzystania na 3 tury. Karty tego typu są dość słabe, bo są wolne - płacimy od razu 3 zasoby, by dostać 3 zasoby w 3 tury, o ile nasz build nie jest sfocusowany na konkretnych ikonkach. Mówiąc krótko - to bank amunicji dla Novy, który wykorzystuje piorunki do ataku. 

Ok, dobrnęliśmy do końca to przerabiamy. Idziemy drogą [Tackle](/card/05015). Mamy mniej kart aspektowych w pakiecie powiązanych z naszym uderzeniem z bańki, ale za to więcej synergii z samą Kamalką. Novę jako takiego sobie możemy zostawić, w aktualnej puli kart nie jest taki zły sam w sobie, ale nie będziemy się koncentrować w okół niego i wiele kart wspomagającego Novę wyleci. Usuwamy [Get Behind Me!](/card/01078), [Preemptive Strike](/card/05014), 2 kopie [Energy Barrier](/card/05017), 2 kopie [Endurance](/card/05023) oraz [Enhanced Reflexes](/card/05024). Łącznie 12 kart. 

I teraz mamy mały problem... czym te braki uzupełnić przy obecnej puli kart. Większość obecnych kart protekcji skupia się na obronie i benefitach przy obronie, a cała zabawa w stunowanie polega na tym, że my chcemy doprowadzić do sytuacji, że nie mamy się przed czym bronić.

Jedyną sensowną opcją wydają się sojusznicy. Mamy oczywiście [Nick Fury](/card/01084), mamy pomagająca nam w strategii trzymania złola na stanie, mamy potrafiącego sporo przytankować, ale niestety dość drogiego [Luke Cage](/card/01076). Mamy broniącą nas przed [Advance](/card/01186) [Black Widow](/card/01075) oraz wspomnianych wcześniej [Nova](/card/05012) i [Lockjaw](/card/05018). Do pakietu z sojusznikami mamy również [Med Team](/card/01080) którym głównie leczymy Nove, żeby mieć jego odpowiedź zawsze pod ręką a w między czasie dalej używać go po prostu do ataku, oraz [Red Dagger](/card/05002) jako że to jedyne nasze w miarę stabilne źródło thwarta.

Z pozostałych kart mamy: 
- [Haymaker](/card/01087) - karta, która jest strasznie droga w stosunku do tego co robi, ale u Ms. Marvel nabiera sensu - chodzi o to, by nie mieć pustych tur na [Embiggen!](/card/05010). 5 dmg za 2 zasoby to już sporo. Dodatkowo ma piorunek więc zawsze może posłużyć jako amunicja pod Novę.

- [Helicarrier](/card/01092) - nasze [Tackle](/card/05015) jest straszniezasobożerne więc takie karty są mocno w cenie.

- ostatnią kartą jest [Down Time](/card/05033). Generalnie zarówno down time jak i [Endurance](/card/05023) są strasznie uniwersalnymi kartami. Przez długi czas trafiały u mnie prawie do każdego decku. 7 recovery i 13 hp i nawet [Ultron](/card/01136) z swoim 4 atk może się schować.

I tak wygląda nasz deck. Taktyka zależy, jak to zwykle bywa od sytuacji, a w szczególności od przeciwnika. Na początku musimy grać kontrolnie i trochę się dozbroić. Potrzebujemy nasze [Embiggen!](/card/05010), [Shrink](/card/05011), trochę ekonomii, w szczególności [Biokinetic Polymer Suit](/card/05009). Uważamy z kolei na nasze persony jak [Bruno Carrelli](/card/05007), [Nakia Bahadir](/card/05008) czy [Aamir Khan](/card/05006). Działają tylko w Alter-ego a jako protekcja nie chcemy się flipować tak często. Jak już się troszkę zbudowaliśmy to zaczynamy zabawę i tu już mocno zależy. Jak gramy na kogoś z upierdliwym atakiem jak [Ultron](/card/01135) możemy grać na maxa pod stun, tzn. zagrywać [Tackle](/card/05015), cofać go na rękę ze zdolności bohatera i trzymać na kolejną turę. Jeśli się mniej boimy to możemy po prostu grać bardziej ofensywnie i starać się jak najszybciej zakończyć grę.

I to by było na tyle.

name: Kiss - War Machine
description_md: “Better watch out” War Machine is a powerhouse in the damage department once he gets going and a top tier minion clearer. However, on release he felt pretty much locked him into Justice for solo, but after the X-Men release, he can go full aggro. This deck is a damage for days build that can OTK villains in solo and scales well into the higher player counts. “Set the demons free and watch ‘em fly” [Precision Strike](/card/35018) and [One by One](/card/28014) kickers are all but guaranteed with War Machine’s kit with a minion out. It’s even easier with a [Honed Technique](/card/28017) down. “Take the reigns of power and seize them” [Agent 13](/card/29022) effectively doubles your ammo counters from the bunker, or lets you add counters, flip up, and then give you that ammo if you are trying to just close it out. She also makes [Helicarrier](/card/01092) make everything so cheap. “Draw the power lines” [Gauntlet Gun](/card/23005) is a great target for [Fusillade](/card/20026) if you don’t have a War Machine Event to play. Otherwise you should play it as the last part of [Shoulder Cannon](/card/23007), as you can’t make it go brr after exhausting that way. Unloading your base ammo counters with [Fusillade](/card/20026) gives you an easy 10 damage turn on its own for 3er. With [Honed Technique](/card/28017) it’s close to [Full Auto](/card/23011) by itself, but could be better depending on where you’re at in setting up and your ammo. Of course best case is just do both for a cool 16 (1 from Shoulder + Fusillade with Honed + Full Auto). “Armageddon’s just a matter of time” War Machine’s game plan of gearing up towards a massive turn is still here, but with the shear amount of damage it’s more like multiple big damage turns culminating in a devastating assault. “Your freedom’s just a state of mind” The two Psionic X-Men ensure safe swaps down, and even against stalwart villains they offer decent thwart. “Let the Arrows Fly” This deck also does great with Hawkeye, although [Battle Fury](/card/06018) may be something to consider swapping in to ready Clint and give him more shots. [Agent 13](/card/29022) isn’t as good for him so [Nick Fury](/card/01084) could be an option. “Tear down the voice of reason” Deck pros: - That’s a lot daaamage - Multiple avenues for said damage makes piloting it very straightforward. - Very easy to OTK in solo and even easier to manage minions while chipping away at the villain at higher player counts. - did I mention the damage? Cons: - threat, like most agg decks, is a big issue. Less of an issue in MP, but [Looking for Trouble](/card/16043) may need to be included if you find yourself losing to threat in solo. In threat heavy scenarios it is tough to find time to put down [Honed Technique](/card/28017) so you may want to swap it out. - with any WM deck, having your upgrades at the bottom of the deck feels really rough. Tony does what he can, but in my experience [Two Against the World](/card/23024) only shows up when Tony is off the board ——————————————————————— Thanks for checking this out!

name: Rocket Raccoon - Layer Cake
description_md:
Rocket Raccoon - Layer Cake

Since I bought GMW I wanted to play Rocket. But his pre-built Deck didn't work for me. First I was disrupted by Drang, later I thought Minions should work out and was stomped into the ground by Ultron. Even Rhino gave me a hard time.
So Rocket went back into the box and I tinkered with some other hero's decks. 
Then I stumbeled about a deck around using Rocket for tinkering around Iron man. And i loved the Idea, but it was not enough to bring me back playing Rocket. 
A little while later I found inspiration in my first Blaze of Glory Deck and was overwhelmed by the potential Damage it could do. 
As a fan of Guardians of the Galaxy (the movies) I then decided to re-engage Rocket. I had an Idea of combining these two mechanics, and that is the moment this deck arose. I decided to call it Layer Cake, because there are multiple layers of mechanics packed in the deck.

1st Layer: Preparation

First you will try to survive to get out all your upgrades and things rolling. Try not to do too much damage in that phase, as you must not flip the Villain to stage two. First objective is to have a blocker (ideally [Groot](/card/16001b)), but Star Lord or Goliath is also eligible. Play out your Guns whenever possible. The other Rocket-Upgrades are also high priority. 

To get your Card draw machine going, Iron Man is essential and should get a [Honorary Guardian](/card/22035) asap. [Guardians of the Galaxy](/card/22033) will then let you draw cards whenever you play an ally or upgrade (very often!). Remember that playing an upgrade on iron man is for free due to his ability (given the Upgrades I use in that deck)! Whenever you need card or have to turn to AE use "Tinkering" to salvage Upgrades from Iron Man or yourself. So this gives you an imense card draw.

2nd Layer: Getting things going

In the second step your personal Upgrades should be set, Groot blocks attacks (perhaps having a 1 Dmg Minion to heal him) an having [Rapid Response](/card/08031) in the backhand to bring him back, if he is defeated. Try now to get your Iron Man (if he is not allready on the battlefield) and Goliath and pimp them with Upgrades. For maximal effect Goliath should have every Upgrade availible, while Iron Man should have [Sky Cycle](/card/04015), [Laser Blaster](/card/17019), [Inspired](/card/01074). Remember that both allies must have [Honorary Guardian](/card/22035) for the effect of [Guardians of the Galaxy](/card/22033) to happen. At the end of this phase try to have two versions of [Rocket's Pistol](/card/16038) and [Particle Cannon](/card/16036) in play, both with at least two charges.

3rd Layer: Finishing move!

The last step consists of only one turn, where you unleash insane damage over the villain and perhaps even left-over minions. Play [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015) to get +2 dmg for every guardian character (so you and your Allies, thanks to [Honorary Guardian](/card/22035)). Attack with Iron Man, refresh him with the [Sky Cycle](/card/04015) and attack again. Attack with either Groot or Star Lord for 4 dmg. Attack with Rocket for further 4 dmg. Fire all Guns you have, perhaps play [Reload](/card/16031) and repeat as often as you can.

Last Layer: The Cherry on the cake

The cherry on my layer cake is Goliath. Using his Ability, he gets a further +4 Attack. So he can hit for 9 dmg, refresh ([Sky Cycle](/card/04015)) and attack again, so he nets 18 dmg. 

Be aware that you should just start the finishing move, when you are quite sure that you can defeat the villains last step, as you will potentially be out of allies after using [Blaze of Glory](/card/17015). Furthermore think about consequential damage and be sure your avenger-allies will survive one Attack.
And be sure that timing is not easy in this deck (many effects just happen or work best, if any ally and you are Guardians). So this is definitely no beginners deck. 

I hope you enjoy the deck, which can under optimal circumstances produce more than 60 damage in one round!

Final thoughts (as I said timing is essential for the really big combos):

One possible move would be (starting in AE) to tinker a tech upgrade from Iron Man (drawing two cards), switch to hero form, play an upgrade to Goliath with [Salvage](/card/16033), put the tinkered tech upgrade on the card draw pile, draw one card (the tech upgrade you put on the draw pile, because you played an upgrade to an ally), put the tech upgrade back on iron man (zero cost due to his ability), and finally drawing a card, because you just played an upgrade.

If you prefer playing 40 cards only, I suggest you drop [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) and [Flora and Fauna](/card/16020).

name: Venom Leads From The Front
description_md:
A Venom Leadership Deck that uses ["Welcome Aboard"](/card/20027) to help pay for Allies, [The Triskelion](/card/01073) to increase the number of allies in play, and [Make the Call](/card/01071) and [Rapid Response](/card/08031) to get Allies back into play. The Allies included in this deck have different uses like [Nick Fury](/card/01084) and [Maria Hill](/card/01067) for card draw and [Maria Hill](/card/01067) draws cards for everyone in a multiplayer game. [Hawkeye](/card/01066) and [Squirrel Girl](/card/03013) are to help with minions, and [Squirrel Girl](/card/03013) along with [Multi-Gun](/card/20008) can easily deal with the [Enraged Symbiote](/card/20025) from [Shadow of the Past](/card/01190) \. [Professor X](/card/32019) and [Falcon](/card/03011) can help deal with threat and [Professor X](/card/32019) can confuse the villain to safely flip to Alter-Ego. [Black Knight](/card/04012) is to deal with tough status cards and [U.S. Agent](/card/04014) is to help block incoming attacks and use his retaliate to deal damage to enemies, [Ready for Action](/card/04017) can make this strategy more efficient.

In Multiplayer This deck can pair nicely with [Captain America](/card/03001a) Living Legend ability and using ["Welcome Aboard"](/card/20027) to bring in 3 cost Allies like [Professor X](/card/32019) or [Agent 13](/card/03002) for free.

name: Worldmind connection goes from Dial-Up to Fiber-Optics
description_md: The strongest card in Nova's deck is not Unleash Nova Force, it's Connection to the Worldmind. Unleash is very strong, but very situational. Connection gives you an extra card in hand every time it appears, and it costs nothing. It is card draw without having to pay. So, contrary to popular belief, Nova does not want tons of card draw in his deck, he wants a larger hand size. The strength of Connection comes through when it is drawn in a new hand, and in fact loses quite a bit of strength when drawn during your turn. This is why you see no Champions Mobile Bunker, no Avengers Mansion. Instead, 3 copies of Assess the Situation, which Nova plays better than any other hero. This card gives Nova the potential for 2 extra cards in his next hand, and is often easy to play given Nova's abundance of resources. So here's the idea- draw big hands, play big events, chunk down the villain and keep the main scheme in check. Keeping the main scheme in check, rather than focusing on keeping it clear allows Nova to focus damage and earn himself flip-downs without having to pay for confuses. This is assisted by the underrated Agile Flight, and the phenomenal Under Surveillance. Stealth Strike is expensive, but can easily earn the finishing blow on minions with the small pings from Nova and several allies' 1 attack stats, and even the occasional 2 threat removal that it provides makes it more valuable in this deck than even most aggression attack events given how easily Nova can afford it. The massive card draw from Moongirl and Nick Fury is enough to offset the risk of drawing Connection, while Wraith and Venom apply big chunks of damage. Machine Man is an easy play at 2 cost, and he gets great value for Nova either as a cheap 1/1 blocker, or as something to dump excess resources into for big activations. Expert 2 Mysterio, Expert Mojo, Heroic Sandman, Expert Magneto, no problem. Nova has the resources, the hand size, the blockers, the efficiency, the flip-downs, the damage, the thwarting to take care of just about anything. There aren't many upgrades and supports in the deck, but they are all incredibly easy to play and provide great support for what the deck is designed to do. Get Jesse Alexander and Under Surveillance on the table, and you'll feel like the Worldmind is always right there with you.

name: The Blackbird (As pictured in Hangar Bay)
description_md:
Made for the Deck Factory Discord Challenge. Find it over here if you are looking for more Champions community in your life >>> https://discord.gg/JfnaKrPB

Well, well, well....[Hangar Bay](/card/36035). You aren't really my favorite card, maybe against some Ultron Drones you can be handy....but I usually like risking my allies against something meatier.

Who's got some game to help bump you up a little bit, and who has got something to park inside. Maybe someone that has some cars, an animal of a frenemy that needs somewhere to rest his hog, can lead a band of allies from any aspect, some kind of plane that acts as a resource generator? Oh wait, why not someone that uses [The X-Jet](/card/32020) (also known as The Blackbird) in the artwork!?! Hello one of my least played heroes....meet one of my least played cards...but one of my favorite aspects.

Scott Summers, Hangar Bay, Protection.

This deck revolves around the mighty fine leader that is Scott Summers....just not in leadership....because the point is to use Hangar Bay. It also doesn't feel very potection-y...it is just X-Many.

Here are the nuts and bolts of play, what the intent was when constructing, and what gets ignored until late game (clue....it's Scott's cards unless strategically helpful).

No.1 The Main Idea: [Hangar Bay](/card/36035) is the reason why we built the deck. Get a pumped up or tough ally to block a villain and then a minion, or those pesky second activations!

No.2 Finding those allies. [Cerebro](/card/34022) works best when [Phoenix](/card/34001a) is in play, allowing you to search your entire deck for one of the 8 allies you have, or with [Professor X](/card/32019) when he's briefly in town.

[Polaris](/card/32012) is the natural born queen of Hangar Bay. She's either placing tough on someone else for some extra uses, or can throw it on herself for a double block right away. Combined with [Mutant Protectors](/card/32017), you aren't even paying to bring her in. Same goes for [Beast](/card/33011) with the extra resource draw or any of the expensive allies (which X-Men do not suffer for).

[Wolverine](/card/32041) just keeps healing, [Rockslide](/card/33013) can swing and retaliate in one neat geological package, and [Colossus](/card/32001a) pulls a Polaris....just always on himself. The outlier here is [Nightcrawler](/card/32011), but his utility should be self explanatory.

Once [Utopia](/card/33020) is in play you can ready the twice exhausted Hangar Bay using ally during your turn for another swing....probably making space for the next ally to come in. You'll also have an extra ally slot at this point to park another card...or they can be an extra resource if it is later in the game.

No.3 [Protective Training](/card/32013) adds 3 HP to each attached ally and [Game Time](/card/33022) lets us ready and heal them during play. Rockslide, with a tough from Polaris, and Protective Training is now at 9 Health, with tough - or at 8 Health with tough, and cost 1 resource plus Mutant Protectors if a puny 1 ATK minion was used to bring him in. During some villain phases he could probably take an attack, Hangar Bay ready, and also take an [Assault](/card/01187) into another Villain attack - pretty fun.

No.4 Get that deck thinned! Once the deck is thinned to pretty much resources, hero cards, and allies.....it is go time. My biggest frustration with Scott is never seeming to have the upgrade I need to get around his pitiful ATK 1 with Optic Blast. If you make it...half of the deck will be on the table, with Utopia providing a resource in the form of an unused ally. Just in case, get yourself down to alter ego via the professor or 4 Allie’s worth of thwarting, [Weapon X](/card/35022) and Constant Training to find two more of his hero cards.

If you didn't notice, I tried to keep things thematic with the team. Soooo many other allies would be great - but I wanted to keep things within the X-Mansion. Enjoy, or don't, but let me know so that I can improve the deck!

name: 3 Player Heroic Series - Core Campaign - Spider-Man
description_md:
My group and I recently decided to try completing all the campaigns on heroic. We just finished the core campaign and I thought it would be cool to share the heroes and decks we used to complete each campaign. This is the start of that journey so when we finish each Campaign I will post more decks.

_[Spider-Man (Leadership) Deck](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25726/3-player-heroic-campaign-series-core-campaign-spider-man-1.0)_

_[Doctor Strange (Protection) Deck](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25727/3-player-heroic-campaign-series-core-campaign-doctor-str-1.0)_

_[Quicksilver (Aggression) Deck](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25728/3-player-heroic-campaign-series-core-campaign-quicksilve-1.0)_

The general game plan was to have the villain stunned and confused every round, blocking an attack and the Scheme activation on Miles. Miles can get massive reward from starting the turn in alter-ego while Doctor Strange and Quicksilver stay in hero to keep threat level down. With Venom Blast, Spider Camouflage and the Invocation Deck you should have no problem getting at least a stun on the villain each round. That being said, the team doesn't have a specific "heavy thwarter" because for most the game the villain won't be scheming, however, all three heroes can do some good burst thwarting if they need to.

OVERVIEW

As Miles, you're trying to patch the holes of the other two decks. Whether that be a thwarting a side scheme, blocking an attack, placing status cards, or killing a minion. Work with your teammates to find out what your most effective turn will be. Most likely you are going to want to get the massive reward Miles gets from flipping to alter-ego. Not only can you change forms twice in one turn using Double Life, Ganke gives you an extra card, Jefferson Davis can do an extra thwart, and you are able to shuffle Defense Mechanism, Power Within, or any Spider-Man event you might need back into your deck. When Pinpoint is in play use her ability on Rapid Response, Defense Mechanism, Power Within, or Web-Shooter to get them back into your deck. You'll want to be alter-ego while the villain is confused as much as possible but your allies or tough cards can block the villain attacks on you.

KEY CARDS

This deck isn't perfected yet and is sometimes chaotic. There are some changes I would make but if I play Miles again I may make a new page for the new Campaign.

Generally, you'll want to start on hero (if you can prevent damage) or alter-ego (if the villain is confused) and have used [Ghost-Spider](/card/27048) to pull [Double Life](/card/27032) and putting [Ghost-Spider](/card/27048) back into play with a [Rapid Response](/card/08031). This allows you to flip to your other hero form, grab the benefits (Attacking/Thwarting or Alter-Ego Actions), and then flip back. [Double Life](/card/27032) (alter-ego ability) and [Rapid Response](/card/08031) (from [Pinpoint](/card/29035)) both go back into your deck.

[Deft Focus](/card/16024). I thought it would be more useful then it was but it can still get you [Power Within](/card/27037) and [Defense Mechanism](/card/27038) if you are shuffling them in your deck a lot.

[Make the Call](/card/01071). Use it to play [Ghost-Spider](/card/27048), [Pinpoint](/card/29035) or even [Scarlet Witch](/card/15001a) when you need an ally (Or [Squirrel Girl](/card/03013) because I also added her to the Ultron scenario for Drones.)

The ally upgrades go on [Iron Man](/card/09039) except one copy of [Sky Cycle](/card/04015) goes to [Pinpoint](/card/29035).

[Leadership Skill](/card/36019). This card is a cheap way to make Iron Man do more per round. If you have extra resources this card gives you extra 3 THW/ATK when you need it.

[Rapid Response](/card/08031). Use this card to bring back any ally you want and use their ability again. Bringing back [Ghost-Spider](/card/27048) to grab an event card is usually the most useful. Pinpoint should shuffle this back into your deck as a top priority when need it.

[Pinpoint](/card/29035). Using [Make the Call](/card/01071) you play Pinpoint from Strange's discard pile. Pinpoint allows any player to shuffle a card they would discard back into their deck. Quicksilver can play [Honorary Avenger](/card/03025) on Pinpoint allowing her get Sky Cycle and activate her ability twice. Doctor Strange can also use Pinpoint for [Magical Enhancements](/card/09010) or any damage prevention cards.

name: 3 Player Heroic Series - Core Campaign - Doctor Strange
description_md:
My group and I recently decided to try completing all the campaigns on heroic. We just finished the core campaign and I thought it would be cool to share the heroes and decks we used to complete each campaign. This is the start of that journey so when we finish each Campaign I will post more decks.

_[Spider-Man (Leadership) Deck](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25726/3-player-heroic-campaign-series-core-campaign-spider-man-1.0)_

_[Doctor Strange (Protection) Deck](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25727/3-player-heroic-campaign-series-core-campaign-doctor-str-1.0)_

_[Quicksilver (Aggression) Deck](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25728/3-player-heroic-campaign-series-core-campaign-quicksilve-1.0)_

The general game plan was to have the villain stunned and confused every round, blocking an attack and the Scheme activation on Miles. Miles can get massive reward from starting the turn in alter-ego while Doctor Strange and Quicksilver stay in hero to keep threat level down. With Venom Blast, Spider Camouflage and the Invocation Deck you should have no problem getting at least a stun on the villain each round. That being said, the team doesn't have a specific "heavy thwarter" because for most the game the villain won't be scheming, however, all three heroes can do some good burst thwarting if they need to.

OVERVIEW

As Doctor Strange, your main focus is blocking out as many attacks as possible and hopefully be readied for the player phase. As with most Doctor Strange decks, your invocation cards are your best friends. More than likely you will be able to play 2 invocation cards per round and will be negating the damage of at least 3 attacks. You should try to have the villain stunned during another player's turn and use your damage prevention ([Subdue](/card/19018),[Defensive Stance](/card/08032), [Energy Barrier](/card/05017), [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019) to stop damage for you. When Pinpoint is in play use it to get any non-events you need back into your deck.

KEY CARDS

You are going to want to play for [Wong](/card/09002), [Cloak of Levitation](/card/09009), and [The Sorcerer Supreme](/card/09026) with your resource generators coming in behind that. Resources on this deck can be tight sometimes so playing these cards will always be worth it in the long run.

[Spiritual Meditation](/card/15019). 2 for 2 card trade. Including this card is player preference.

[Unflappable](/card/09020). If you need to defend your another hero unflappable lessens the cost of the exhaust by giving you a card.

[Defensive Stance](/card/08032), [Energy Barrier](/card/05017), [Forcefield Generator](/card/31019). These cards are the best way to stay alive during the villain's activation while not exhausting your hero. If your hero is attacked your goal is to have a way to prevent all or most of the damage coming to you. (Keep in mind that Energy Barrier's damage does not have to go directly back to the attacker.)

[The Night Nurse](/card/09019). Prevents Quicksilver from being stunned and ruining his turn.

[Subdue](/card/19018). You can use this while the villain attacks you or your friends and it won't count as a defense.

[Clea](/card/09013). 2 Cost block (+ 2 damage) for a hero if you need it and can appear multiple times in your deck. Triggers [Unflappable](/card/09020)

[Cloak of Levitation](/card/09009). Another very important card. Gives you aerial to use Ever Vigilant and readies strange every turn.

[Magical Enhancements](/card/09010). Play this card on Quicksilver if you have the chance. With his deck and ability to ready himself, the boost will go a long way.

[Astral Projection](/card/09003). If your team needs extra thwart these cards can be very good for the 2 resource price.

[Master of the Mystic Arts](/card/09005). Buying an Invocation for a loss of 2 cards isn't usually worth it but don't immediately disregard this card. If you see that your team needs the invocation card or you are exhausted then it can be very worth it.

[Protective Ward](/card/09007). Canceling bad treacheries in heroic mode is essential. Stopping extra attack/schemes or canceling minions or side schemes from being pulled can save your scenario.

[Crimson Bands of Cyttorak](/card/09032)n. Stun to stop attack activation to lower the need for defending. Damage is a plus.

[Images of Ikonn](/card/09033). Confuse to stop scheme activation so miles can be alter-ego at the end of the round.

[Seven Rings of Raggadorr](/card/09034). Stops 3 villain attacks. With 3 tough cards, a stunned villain, and Damage prevention, Doctor Strange can stop 5 or 6 attacks single-handedly.

[Vapors of Valtorr](/card/09035). Can changed a stunned or confused to tough making it better than The Night Nurse but isn't always useful.

[Pinpoint](/card/29035). After Miles plays Pinpoint with Make The Call, he might not need the ability every turn and you can use it on your protection upgrades or Magical Enhancements to boost Quicksilver more often.

name: 3 Player Heroic Series - Core Campaign - Quicksilver
description_md:
My group and I recently decided to try completing all the campaigns on heroic. We just finished the core campaign and I thought it would be cool to share the heroes and decks we used to complete each campaign. This is the start of that journey so when we finish each Campaign I will post more decks.

_[Spider-Man (Leadership) Deck](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25726/3-player-heroic-campaign-series-core-campaign-spider-man-1.0)_

_[Doctor Strange (Protection) Deck](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25727/3-player-heroic-campaign-series-core-campaign-doctor-str-1.0)_

_[Quicksilver (Aggression) Deck](https://marvelcdb.com/decklist/view/25728/3-player-heroic-campaign-series-core-campaign-quicksilve-1.0)_

The general game plan was to have the villain stunned and confused every round, blocking an attack and the Scheme activation on Miles. Miles can get massive reward from starting the turn in alter-ego while Doctor Strange and Quicksilver stay in hero to keep threat level down. With Venom Blast, Spider Camouflage and the Invocation Deck you should have no problem getting at least a stun on the villain each round. That being said, the team doesn't have a specific "heavy thwarter" because for most the game the villain won't be scheming, however, all three heroes can do some good burst thwarting if they need to.

OVERVIEW

As Quicksilver, your goal is to do damage. Wow, crazy. You are going to want to kill any minions in play and keep your team advancing to the victory. Buff your attack, hit as much as you can, and use Overkill and [Moment of Triumph](/card/12030) when you need them. [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) is pretty risky for most characters but the buffs it gives Quicksilver are very much worth it. During the Villain Phase, your free defense can be useful in certain situations but Doctor Strange will have it covered most of the time.

KEY CARDS

[Helicarrier](/card/01092), [Deft Focus](/card/16024), and [Friction Resistance](/card/14009) all should be played early to start getting buffs and readies without losing other cards.

[Blade](/card/21019) is the cheapest avenger in the game and he doesn't take consequential damage from attacking or thwarting. Use him to exhaust for [Earth's Mightiest Heroes](/card/04022) or you can use his basic power if you have an extra in your hand.

[Battle Fury](/card/06018), [Always Be Running](/card/14003), [Earth's Mightiest Heroes](/card/04022). These are your "ready" cards. Most of the time, more lower-damage basic attacks is will be better then less high-damage basic attacks.

[Moment of Triumph](/card/12030). Use [Marked](/card/33032) or [Hand Cannon](/card/16046) to get the most out of your excess damage and then heal from it with [Moment of Triumph](/card/12030).

[First Aid](/card/01086)should be used on you or Miles' [Iron Man](/card/09039).

[Warrior Skill](/card/35016). I'm under the impression this works for Basic attacks so if you need extra damage on specific attacks this card is there. (Although 3 copies is probably too many).

[Symbiote Suit](/card/27191), [Combat Training](/card/01057), [Accelerated Reflex](/card/14008), [Hyper Perception](/card/14010), [Reinforced Sinew](/card/14011). You should play Combat Training and Symbiote Suit as early as possible but for most scenarios you will want to play all of these.

[Honorary Avenger](/card/03025) should be played on [Pinpoint](/card/29035) so she can get [Sky Cycle](/card/04015). For Quicksilver shuffling Hand Canon or Battle Fury are the best options to shuffle into your deck.

name: Venom and Guardians
description_md:
*"I'm poisoned. You're right. There's no getting it out. The wound is sealed shut. Their hatred will always run through our veins, Flash. But if we make different choices...who knows? - Venom: Venom Vol 2 #22"* *Venom Leadership* has never been an aspect I enjoy playing. And this is not because there are no good *Guardian Leadership* cards. With [Knowhere](/card/17022) and [Guardians of the Galaxy](/card/22033) any person would say that a *Guardian Leadership* deck would be just broken, but I do not find the necessary synergy between *Venom* and this aspect. This is why I built a wonky/crazy 50 cards deck, which turns out to work just fine and it's plenty of fun to execute. Let's break it down; **7 Allies** - majority of guardian allies are from *Basic* aspect, in fact, only 2 *Guardian* allies in the whole game are from the *Leadership* aspect. Let's start with these; - [Major Victory](/card/21053) provides a lot of value-for-money. Cost only two and when is defeated he will ready another guardian character. Works great in a combination of [Locked and Loaded](/card/20004) and [Venom's Pistol](/card/20010). - [Yondu](/card/17013) is the only ally in the game who takes no consequential damage when he attacks. This means, once *Yondu* makes it on the board, he will deal a lot of damage over time. Attacking to him 1 copy of [Inspired](/card/01074), [Laser Blaster](/card/17019) and [Sidearm](/card/23035) will make *Yondu* hit for 4 damage each turn with no consequential damage and ignoring any *retaliate* the *Villain* might have. - [Drax](/card/18019) is a *Villain* damage dealer - [Gamora](/card/19020) will get force the draw of an event card every time she attacks or thwarts (use this ability wisely). - [Groot](/card/16047) is a damage blocker, especially for minions. His ability to heal after he defends, means more often than not *Groot* will heal to full HP after he defends against a minion. - [Martinex](/card/21065) is cheap to play, so easy to get on the board. - [Rocket Raccoon](/card/16019) will clean up minions or thwart when needed. **Events** - all events are from the core *Venom* deck. After long consideration, I have decided that there is not need to include any other events in this deck. *Venom* can already do a bit of everything, and the *Guardian allies* will take care of whatever else is needed in each phase. **Supports** - the deck has 10 permanent support cards - [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091) is simply a card draw. - [Crew Quarters](/card/20029) is great as going to *Alter-Ego* is essential to heal and to use [Project Rebirth 2.0](/card/20007). - [Guardians of the Galaxy](/card/22033) is the reason why there are so many upgrades in this deck. This way each hand will be fully utilised as even if you draw loads of upgrades, *Guardians of the Galaxy* will allow drawing a card for each upgrade played for an *Ally*. - [Knowhere](/card/17022) is another card draw per phase. - [Team-Building Exercise](/card/12024) is coming with 3 copies as this will be the main way to play all the allies so no extra resources are needed (All allies with the exception of *Yondu* cost 2 or 3 resources). - [Helicarrier](/card/01092) will help with playing events each phase. - [The Triskelion](/card/01073), when combined with *Knowhere*, will make the ally limit 5. **Upgrades** - in this deck I play a lot of permanent and a lot of recyclable upgrades. - Permanent:
    - [Clarity of Purpose](/card/31029) is to be attached to [Venom](/card/20001a), combined with *Symbiotic Bond* those are two resources generated each turn (hence why going to *Alter-Ego* is so essential). - [Down Time](/card/05033) and [Endurance](/card/05023) are both essential as high *Recovery* and high HP is a **MUST** when your hero self-harms for two every turn. - One copy of each [Inspired](/card/01074), [Laser Blaster](/card/17019) and [Sidearm](/card/23035) to be attached to *Yondu*. - [Symbiote Suit](/card/27191) is a ***MUST*** as c'mon... It's *Venom*... And the card is a perfect fit not just thematically. Extra hand size plus higher basic stats means even better use of [Run and Gun](/card/20005) and [Venom's Pistol](/card/20010).
- Recyclable:
    - Three copies of [Comms Implant](/card/18030), two copies of [Inspired](/card/01074), [Laser Blaster](/card/17019) and [Sidearm](/card/23035). Those nine *"recyclable"* upgrades will boost the power of the allies and will force the draw of a card every time any of them is attached to an ally.
--- Ain't gonna lie, the deck turned out to be really fun to play, way more than I ever expected.
