name: My deck is sooo Smol (Easy way 4 win) 5.0
description_md:
Empecemos con el mazo, se basa en eliminar todas las mejoras, apoyos y aliados de nuestro deck, quedándonos así solo con las 14 cartas de eventos y recursos.
Todo va orientado a poder jugar cartas de manera rápida, los apoyos son en su mayoría para abaratar costes además de permitirnos tener 6 aliados nada menos.
Nuestras mejoras nos ayudaran a reducir aun mas el mazo, y concretamente el casco se convertirá en nuestro motor de supervivencia y robo.
Las 3 cartas de mejora de generación de recurso son intercambiables, pero prefiero llevar una de cada por si sale algún encuentro molesto que me pida recursos específicos para deshacerme de el.
Los aliados son 4 avengers baratos + https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12014 , que nos permite tener junto a nuestro aliado de héroe https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12002 los 6 aliados necesarios para el mazo.

Hablemos de juego, nuestra supervivencia se basara en https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12008 + https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12010 , ya que mientras con el casco ganamos 2 de vida cada vez que somos GIGANTES, podremos meter stuns o confusión a nuestro rival con el brazalete (Por eso llevo solo 2 recursos de los 3 básicos, no me interesa genio, ya que los 2 recursos de ciencia no son útiles para el guantelete).
Intentaremos quedarnos siempre pequeños aunque nos transformemos en GIGANTE(hay que abusar de https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12005 ), para tener un mayor tamaño de mano, aunque podremos recurrir a la forma de alter-ego si no contamos con 2 energías físicas, pero si 2 rayos (Esto es sencillo, para no arriesgarnos a las múltiples cartas de "El villano planifica" que existen en mayor cantidad cuando eres alter-ego).
A la hora de quitar amenazas contaremos con https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12007 para eliminar a los minions molestos, aunque gracias a https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12009 también podremos deshacernos de alguno algo mas grande.
Para la amenaza no suele haber problema, ya que como no recurrimos al alter-ego no sube mucho y ant-man al volverse pequeño quita amenaza, si surge algún plan secundario muy molesto podremos intervenir, e incluso si fuese necesario usar https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12004 (la uso en 1 de cada 5 partidas o menos incluso, y solo 1 vez)

Y llegados a este punto os preguntareis, y todo este rollo, para que nos servirá? Por que queremos 26 cartas en mesa, muchas de ellas poco útiles?(aunque ya os digo que todas son muy útiles) Bueno, cuando nuestro deck+ mano se aproxime a las 14 cartas, alguna mas podemos permitirnos (Creo que llegue a hacerlo con 17) solo tendremos que abusar de https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12005 + https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12020 + https://es.marvelcdb.com/card/12006 para cambiar de forma infinitamente mientras hacemos daño, quitamos amenaza y aumentamos nuestro daño, además de preparar a nuestro HEROE múltiples veces. con lo que conseguiremos potencial de DAÑO ILIMITADO ganando así a cualquier villano.
Solo debemos de tener cuidado de no dejar nuestra pila de descartes y nuestro mazo vacíos de forma simultanea.

name: SHIELD-Hulk
description_md:
Played around with She-Hulk Justice all weekend. This one had repeated success in true solo against Mutagen Formula.

Use Government Liaisons to help pay for SHIELD allies or vehicles. Exhaust SHIELD cards of all kinds with Homeland Intervention to keep the threat down. Plenty of energy cards and resource generation to mitigate the small hero hand size. Ready repeatedly and pummel the villain with both Limitless Stamina and One-Two Punch. Play the cheap Unshakable when it shows up to become steady.

Considering replacing one government liaison with another limitless stamina.

name: Ms. Marvel Even the Odds
description_md: # LCG Discord Card Spotlight ## Goal to build a deck that features the current spotlit card: [Even the Odds](/card/30014) Oh it hit's multiple side schemes... Oh [Shrink](/card/05011) pumps [Even the Odds](/card/30014)... Oh [Ms. Marvel](/card/05001a) can recur it to hand every turn if needed. This is NOT a solo deck. You will depend on teammates to maintain the board while you build up to the combo turn. ## GAME PLAN: ### [One Way or Another](/card/22015) We recur this as much as we are comfortable to build up a big board of Side Schemes, while using the draw to get out [Overwatch](/card/30019), [Followed](/card/03032), [Sense of Justice](/card/14030), [Biokinetic Polymer Suit](/card/05009), & most importantly [Shrink](/card/05011) ### [Even the Odds](/card/30014) and to a lesser extent [Multitasking](/card/15013) to soften up the side schemes. Use [Passion for Justice](/card/34020) & [Shrink](/card/05011) to make big Thwarts. Trigger a bunch of upgrades. ### When to go off? I'd wait for 3 side schemes and to have [Followed](/card/03032) and [Overwatch](/card/30019) on all three. You will trigger for 3 x 4 damage ([Followed](/card/03032)) and 3 damage ([Even the Odds](/card/30014)). Overwatch is variable but these will help you get the Main Scheme down if you had any issues due to Patrol or Crisis Icons. You can certainly go off with more than 3 but, I would want to keep Side Schemes in for rebuilding to do it again. RULES NOTE: Sadly [Embiggen!](/card/05010) doesn't work with [Even the Odds](/card/30014). ### Allies [Wasp](/card/29034) is the the mainly there because of Crisis Icons that are likely to be on Side Schemes. [Jessica Jones](/card/01059) is there to keep the main under control with buffs from the side schemes we're leaving out. [Quake](/card/08012) is cheap and an . [Quasar](/card/21047) can help you set-up for the big turn. ### FLEXIBLE SPOTS: [One Way or Another](/card/22015) #3 - With [Ms. Marvel](/card/05001a) being above to recur the event, you should only ever need one. However, you want to get the 1st as soon as possible. ### ALTERNATE CONSIDERATIONS: [Spider-Man](/card/04045) - We aren't looking to clear side schemes early but there are some scenarios with huge side schemes where I'd consider him. He also costs 5 in a deck that only has the basic resources to assist in paying for him [Eros](/card/22011) - Is cheap with a decent THW. If you need to defend more then this is good for that. [Wraith](/card/22012) - I love Wraith as tech against annoying boosts. Doesn't fit the theme but worth a consider. [Even the Odds](/card/30014) #3 - You really don't need a full 3 of this card with all of the card draw off of [One Way or Another](/card/22015) and the potential to stash them with [Bruno Carrelli](/card/05007). [Skilled Investigator](/card/04047) - It is not quite the engine it is in other decks since we want to clear multiple schemes in one turn instead of 1 per turn. More [Operative Skill](/card/37013) - May be worth running more but you can only have 1 in play at a time and you should get to it when you're running [One Way or Another](/card/22015) every turn.

name: Theoretically Infinite
description_md:
One of my friends and I love to theory craft and we got to thinking about if or how it is possible to have an infinite turn in marvel champions. Here is one of them. I'd like to note that none of these decks are practical. At the very least, the villain is very likely going to be defeated before you get to the point where you have everything set up to have an infinite turn. Anyway, here's how to go infinite with [Doctor Strange](/card/09001a):

1. Get EVERY "permanent" into play. "Permanent" as in all allies, supports, and upgrades.

2. Draw 6 cards for your turn.

3. Draw another with [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091).

4. Play [Master of the Mystic Arts](/card/09005) with [Helicarrier](/card/01092) on [Winds of Watoomb](/card/09036) to draw 3.

5. Repeat step 4 with [Quincarrier](/card/08023).

6. Use Dr. Strange's hero ability to draw another 3. 

7. So at this point we have 6 + 1 + 3 + 3 + 3 = 16 cards in our hand out of 16 cards in our deck (13 events and 3 resources). At this point (and there are other ways to get here too, like using [Cosmo](/card/17020)/[Wong](/card/09002) + [Sky Cycle](/card/04015) draw more) you can infinitely spam [Spiritual Meditation](/card/15019). In this example, having an infinite turn doesn't actually produce and damage or threat removal BUT it is an infinite turn nonetheless.

name: Infinite Turn with Spectrum
description_md:
A not-at-all practical but nonetheless possible way to have an infinite turn with [Spectrum](/card/21001a): 

1. Get every single ally, support, and upgrade on the field.

2. Draw 6 for alter-ego hand size. (6/17 cards in hand)

3. Draw 1 using [Avengers Mansion](/card/01091). (7/17 cards in hand)

4. Draw 6 using [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017). (12/17 cards in hand)

5. Activate 3x [Sky Cycle](/card/04015) to [Strength In Numbers](/card/03017) again for 3. (14/17 cards in hand. At this point, you can infinitely cycle [Speed of Light](/card/21010) to generate 1 damage/threat/heal indefinitely.

Edit: Technically, you need a teammate to let you draw another card but for solo, just remove a resource card and add another permanent.
